name: Gravity Gammon
description:
A backgammon-like gravity game. The board has a few shortcuts.
You can win either by getting your pieces home first, or by your opponent tilting the board.

—user summary

name: How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World
description:
How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World is a racing game for 2-4 players, based on Dreamworks 3th movie 'How to Train Your Dragon - The hidden world".

Goal of the game is to bring your own 3 characters to the finish first. You do so by drawing an action card on your turn. According to the action on the card you are then moving your characters, have to pause, ore move the dragon ring to ban other characters.

—user summary

The players go on an adventurous journey with the popular dragon riders Hiccup, Astrid, Fishlegs and Snotlout and try to draw their three figures in front of the other players to the finish. With the help of the beautifully designed number cards, players are making fast progress on the board. But beware: A bad dragon has the game heroes in his sights and tries to cast a spell over them! With a dragon ring the game pieces are captured and prevented from progressing. But with luck and some tactical skill, players can escape the dragon's spell and reach the target first.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Super Patrol
description:
Here comes of little city patrol. They were patrolling the beautiful cities every day. What happened to them? Maybe they can help to catch the thief who stole the bicycle, or to help the old lady find the lost kitten, or to help the child to pick up the balloon which was blown away by the wind. Behind all the work they did, makes this city become safer and more peaceful, day after day, little patrols have solved one problem after another. They have gained the admiration and love of the citizens while making the city more beautiful. All citizens call them Super Patrol!

The game starts with the player who saw a police car on the street most recently. Players take turns in a clockwise order. The police car is moved to the next pedestrian crossing and stops to assist the person who needs help.

Move the police car to next pedestrian crossing. Draw an event card and ﬂip the sand timer over at the same time, look for items or suspects on the game board. Cover the items or suspects that have been found with the locate tools.
If the task is completed when time runs out, players win the badges as instructed on the card. They are ﬁlled in on the honor list starting at the bottom.
Collect all locate tools on game board , and get ready for the next round!


Draw one event card.
Green Card——Lost item
Try to look for as many lost items listed on the card as you can. Cover each item found with a locate tool. When time runs out, you get the matching badges.
Game End
When the police car reaches the “END”, the patrol job is done. You win the corresponding rank according to the badges you have earned. The highest level that your badges reach is your rank.

—user summary

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Battletome – Dominion of Chaos
description:
This 80-page hardback Battletome is designed to help you get the most out of your Warhammer Age of Sigmar scenery, and the Realm of Battle: Shattered Dominion gameboard. Inside it, you’ll find Warscrolls for six awesome scenery pieces – the Numinous Occulum, Dragonfate Dais, Baleful Realmgate, Arcanabulum, Fell Chasm and Ophidian Archway – and four Warscroll Battalions, powerful combinations of arcane scenery with their own special rules.

As well as this, there are four Battleplans – awesome scenarios any army can use, based around combinations of scenery, that put you right in the heart of the Realmgate Wars.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Kaidanzz
description:
Kaidanzz (カイダンズ) is a game about forcing yourself into a corner. Most of the cards in the deck are number cards that go from 1 to 19. Starting with a hand of three cards, each turn you play a card, and based on the orientation you play it in the next player has to play either a higher or lower number. If you play two consecutive numbers you can decide which orientation the next player has to use. If it's your turn and you can't play a card you get one point, and at two points you win the game.

There are also three "Stair Lover" cards with special powers. Each player gets one randomly at the start of the game. The Dark Stairs can always be played, which means you can't win while you're holding them, but the Ghost Story Teller card allows you to give the Dark Stairs to your opponent. The Glico Man lets you swap the most recently played stairs with the first ones played in the round. Finally, the Old Person card lets you ignore the effects of a pair of consecutive cards if one of them is a "slope" card with a red border.

Can you outwit your opponent on the stairs?

The game also includes a Stair Encyclopedia with details of the stairs photographed for the game.

—user summary

name: あいわな (TRAP OF LOVE)
description:
あいわな (Aiwana) TRAP OF LOVE is themed on love traps and incorporates a system that is somewhat like mahjong and poker combined. The deck has cards numbered 1-8. There is one, 1, two 2 and so forth until you get to eight 8.

On your turn, draw a card from the deck, add it to your hand, and then reveal and place a card from your hand in front of you. You can place up to 3 cards face up in front of you and you cannot put them back into your hand.

Form melds using a total of 6 cards comprised of the cards in your hand and the cards placed in front of you. The winner is determined by comparing the melds, but you may be able to win by bluffing even without forming melds.

あいわなは「愛の罠」をテーマに麻雀とポーカーを混ぜたようなシステムのゲームです。
カードは１～８で１は１枚、２は2枚、、８は８枚という構成になってます。
手番では山札から１枚引き手札に入れ、その後、捨て札を１枚、自分の場に１枚出します。
自分の場に出せるのは３枚までで、自分の場のカードは交換できません。
残っている手札と自分の場の計６枚で役を作り勝負します。
役の強さで勝敗が決まりますが、役が出来て無くてもブラフで勝てるかもしれません。
publisher summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Galleon
description:
Galleon is a set of wargame rules designed for a quick and easy wargame for naval battles in and around the Spanish Armada period.

—description from the publisher

No ready-made ship stats are provided; instead, players are expected to derive game stats from the characteristics of historical ships, using simple formulae given in the rules.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Jet Combat
description:
Jet Combat is a set of table-top wargame rules designed for a three dimensional, close in, up close and personal jet fighter versus jet fighter combat game.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Gassy Eruption Special Play Promo Card
description:
Event Promo - Warhammer World Exclusive

'Gassy Eruption' is a promo special play card for Blood Bowl from the Bugman’s Full Beard Cup 2017 held at Warhammer World on August 5th-6th, 2017.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Sergei ISU-203/Evgenyi ISU-350
description:
Since 1943 the ISU format, a heavy self-propelled gun mounted on a tank chassis, has become a staple of the SSU armored forces. Easy and cheap to build, efficient and deadly, these vehicles are now found everywhere on the planet where the SSU fights. The Sergei mounts a very heavy antitank gun, capable of knocking out any enemy armored target. The Evgeny is armed with the largest assault howitzer ever mounted on a ground vehicle.
This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the SSU Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Maestro!
description:
The Maestros of Europe are missing! Your mission is to find them and return them to their hometowns.

The 12 composer pawns are randomly, and secretly, placed at certain spots on the board, which is a map of Europe. Each player is then given 4-6 info cards that states the composer's name, hometown, and some interesting facts about him. Players roll dice to move around the board to secretly look at the composer pawns to see which Maestro is hiding there. If it matches one of their cards, the player can then try to get the composer home. Using the info on the cards, the player then has to roll and move to the composer's hometown. The first person to get all their maestros home is the winner!

From the back of the box--

While you play, you will:
-Learn about twelve of history's master composers.
-Discover interesting facts about their careers, families, and travels.
-Navigate Europe to discover each composer's hometown, a significant city in their lives.
-Explore the map in the race to find and return your missing composers home.
-Apply strategy and memory skills to win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: Huddersfield
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
MONOPOLY, the great property trading board game, finds its home in the historical town of Huddersfield: from award-winning Victorian architecture to Iron Age monuments. Journey around the gameboard with Huddersfield Cabs and explore landmarks including: Lindley Clock Tower, the Town Hall and Huddersfield Golf Club. Don't forget to stop off for some refreshments en route at Dixons Milk Ices or Beaumont Park. You can further relax while watching the Huddersfield Giants play rugby, or take in some culture at the Choral Society. Take a spin around this beautiful market town and perhaps you'll own your favourite location, or discover a hidden gem in "God's Own County"!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Tower Of Pisa
description:
A stick stacking game. If you knock down the stack when placing a stick then you lose.

From the boxtop:

Each player takes one color and places a piece on the pile. When you topple the pile you are out. A game of coordination. 1 to 4 can play.


The base looks sort of like the Washington Monument with a little platform at the top. The sticks look shaped like matchsticks, perhaps a bit larger.

name: Six Gun Showdown: Single Shot
description:
The air was still and dry, she could feel it pulling the sweat from her brow. She stood in the street facing down the Cowboy, his eyes fixed upon her. She focused on him. "5 inches down from his throat" she thought, "that's the sweet spot". He hurled yet another insult at her. Some foul word to distract her.

She flinched.

He went for his guns.

She drew too.....

About The Game
Six-Gun Showdown : Single Shot is a quick two player card and dice game of wild west duels. "Single shot" is our fully playable early promo version, an "amuse bouche", of the final game.

It consists of 16 cards and a dice, is fully compatible with the final game (due to be launched later in 2019) and it's two unique sets of character cards are not found in the final game - therefore no duplicates if you like this and want to back the final game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Card Game, Memory, Real-time

name: Unicorn Party
description:
Unicorn Party is a print and play card game that is designed to reinforce single digit addition skills in primary grade students.

In Unicorn Party, players work together to host a party! Each guest needs a certain amount of cupcakes and juice to stay happy. By adding the cupcake and juice cards together, the player can feed their guests. The closer the player can match the sum of food requested by the guest, the better! Once the food runs out, the party is over – hopefully all guests have been fed!

—description from the designer

name: Billionaire Sergeant: 1974
description:
In Billionaire Sergeant 1974, a whole new department Independent Commission Against Corruption, ICAC was finally established. The government granted you a great power against corruption. Will you commit to fighting corruption to keep Hong Kong fair, just, stable, and prosperous? Or will you be a vigilante to achieve your goals no matter it costs?

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Memory, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragony Hall
description:
The city of Glimmergate has evicted its king, in favour of democracy. Humans, Elves, Dwarves, and Gnomes of various professions will be selecting the new Mayor, and you want their votes!

Each of the players is a candidate in Glimmergate’s Mayoral election, and will attempt to win the most votes. They will be working to influence the citizens of Glimmergate, and seeking endorsements from its community leaders.

The citizens of Glimmergate come from many races and professions:

Elves are adept at Magic (Alchemists, Enchanters, and Healers), and Mercantile professions (Bankers, Innkeepers, and Stablekeepers), but do not typically become Metalworkers (Miners, Smiths, and Armourers).
Dwarves are excellent Metalworkers and Merchants, but cannot perform Magic.
Gnomes are Metalworkers, and perform Magic, but are not generally found working as Merchants.
Humans, however, participate in all professions.


Before the election, there will be two interim polls, each for a single group of professions (one group will not get polled). Winning a poll can be helpful, but only winning the final election really matters!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Political, Print & Play

name: Medieval Pong: Les Sorts-Bocks
description:
The Sorts-Bocks are a set of 3 coasters. They represent 3 new special events.
During game set up, place the Sorts-Bocks next to each other on the table. Use as many as you want.
The gameplay remains unchanged with the exeptions of the following rule:
When a tower is distroyed and placed on the box, its owner check if this action starts a new floor. If it does not, nothing happens. But if it does, before activating the caracter power, the player can choose one or more of the available Sorts-Block and put it/them in play.
The 3 coasters are:

. The pit: cancel the throw
. The wall: forces a player to place it vertically between two of his towers
. The bridge: forces a player to place it horizontally between two of his towers

French edition found in Plato Magazine 118
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval

name: Mogadishu 1977: Operation Feuerzauber
description:
"Mogadishu 1977: Operation Feuerzauber" is a solitaire wargame depicting the action performed by GSG 9, one of the first West German Special Forces, in the airport of Mogadishu, Somalia, where a group of terrorists, who had hijacked a Lufthansa Boing, were keeping as prisoners the crew and the passengers. A daring operation, far from the home bases several flight hours, which was a success with the liberation of the hostages and the elimination of the terrorists, who were linked to the RAF, the "Rot Armèe Fraktion".

An A3 map, 57 counters and English rules... you just need two d6.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Smurfarna: Det stora kalaset!
description:
The Smurfs are gathering cakes for a party but have to watch out for Gargamel and his evil cat Azarel!
The players have to choose if they will fetch only a few cakes or load alot of cakes but at the risk of easier beeing spoted by Gargamel or his cat.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Trolls eat Moles
description:
Trolls eat Moles uses the ‘Rock-Paper-Scissors’ concept and made it into a board game. Three people play this game. It is a game that requires strategy, diplomatic maneuvering, and luck.

Object of the game: To be the last of three players with pieces on the board.

Pieces: There are 3 sets of pieces, each set having: 6 Trolls, 6 Moles, 6 Holes and 1 Skull.

Trolls: Trolls eat Moles and can ONLY capture Moles. Each player has 6 Trolls.

Moles: Moles dig Holes and can ONLY capture Holes. Each player has 6 Moles.

Holes: Holes bury Trolls and can ONLY capture Trolls. Each player has 6 Holes.

Skulls: Skulls go boom and eliminate ALL pieces whose squares shares an adjacent side with the Skull square. The Skull is also removed. Each player has one Skull each.

Set up: Players take all their pieces and place them face down to mix them up. The red player selects 14 of their red pieces and slides 5 pieces to the side, not to be looked at. The green player selects 16 of their green pieces and slides 3 pieces to the side, not to be looked at. The blue player selects 18 of their blue pieces and slides 1 piece to the side, not to be looked at. Players take turns placing one piece at a time face down on the board starting with red, then green, then blue until all the pieces are placed. Figure 1 gives an example of what the board would look like when setting up the pieces. The pieces are flipped over after all the squares are filled up.. Any pieces sharing an adjacent side with a Skull is removed along with the Skull. Players then start moving, starting with red, then green, then blue, and continuing in that order.

Moving: Players move one space at a time in any direction; horizontally, vertically, or diagonally, either onto an empty space, or an occupied space that will allow a capture. Pieces can move multiple spaces in one turn if they are capturing.

Capturing: Pieces can only move onto an occupied square if it can be captured by the incoming piece. Trolls can move onto squares occupied by Moles, Moles can move onto squares occupied by Holes and Holes can move onto squares occupied by Trolls. A piece can capture as many pieces in one turn if they are joined together either vertically, horizontally or diagonally. Captured pieces are placed under the captor to form a stack.

Rounds: A round is when pieces have to be shuffled and placed on the board. This can happen if there are remaining pieces on the board from two or more players that cannot be captured. The player with the most pieces combined in their stacks after a round will have the advantage in the next round. That player will be the first player to move after all the pieces are set up and their pieces will be immune to any Skulls. The remaining players take all of their pieces that have not been captured and reshuffle them. Players then place their pieces any where on the board where there is not an occupied piece starting with the one who had the most pieces in their stacks.Players take turns filling the squares until either the spaces are all filled up, or there are no more pieces to place on the board. There is no limit to the number of rounds, though it would be rare to go more than three rounds.

Winning: Winning happens when there is only one player left with pieces on the board.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Bi-Ba-Boxenstopp
description:
3, 2, 1 – pedal to the metal! But beware, only the teams who are fast at the pitstops are contenders for the championship. During the race, players have to pit regularly and put down their pitstop tiles. The dice decide how long each pitstop lasts. The first driver to complete all the pitstops wins the race.

—description from the publisher

name: Music Défi
description:
Music Défi is a French quiz about music. You pick a card, you roll the die, and you answer the question!

—description from the publisher

name: Cyberpunk 2077: Afterlife – The Card Game
description:
Cyberpunk 2077: Afterlife: The Card Game thrusts players into the dark alleyways of Night City where ruthless gangs clash with corporations in an endless war for money, power, and control.

In the game, you become fixers — databrokers and masterminds of Night City. Your job is to recruit cyberpunks, equip them with gear, and send them out on missions. Each successful mission raises your street cred, with mission survivors becoming veterans, imparting their knowledge and experience to newer recruits. In this chrome-infused world, street cred is the only currency that matters.

Nothing comes cheap in Night City. You need to balance between what you want and what you can actually afford. Using an innovative drafting mechanism and special dashboard, you must decide which cards you want to buy and which to sacrifice for funds in order to purchase new ones.

—description from the publisher

name: SPAXX! & friends
description:
All cards are distributed. Now it's about getting rid of the cards as fast as possible. You can only place cards if you have a higher combination than the predecessor. From the second round, cards are exchanged according to the placement.

—user summary

name: Pictionary Team Relay
description:
The irresistible game of drawing and guessing just got even more exciting! Pictionary Team Relay game brings everyone together as your team tries to draw and guess 4 CLUES in 1 MINUTE! Multiple teammates draw on every turn as you pass the Disc Holder from one player to another in a race to beat the clock. Strong teamwork and communication is key – but sharing laughs together is the reward!

—description from the publisher

name: Mein Tier zu mir
description:
This is a game for very small children (18 months and above).
It guides the child from free play to a first understanding of rules and taking turns.

Each player selects an animal and the corresponding game board. The 16 small plates are mixed and turned upside down. Taking turns, the players turn over one plate and may take the plate if it matches their game board. If not, they have to return the plate to the original place they took it from (players should try to memorize the location).
Whoever manages to collect all their four animal plates wins.

These are other variations the game offers (progression in difficulty):

Talking about the animals and what they are doing in the pictures
Puzzle in the cardboard animals
Hide the cardboard animals and find them again
Imitate the movements of the animals on the cards (and then you will be allowed to add the plate to your game board)

name: Never Have I Ever: Girls Edition
description:
Never Have I Ever: Girls Edition is a party game. Everyone gets 10 Play Cards and takes a turn reading a Rule Card. During each round players have a chance to admit whether they're 'guilty' or 'not guilty' of a Play Card. If you're guilty, you get to keep it. First person to collect 10 Play Cards wins.

The game has 224 cards specially curated for girls. It also have 8 custom paddles, and a spinner.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: The Ninth World: A Skillbuilding Game for Numenera – Skull Detonator & Seek the Jade Colossus Promo Cards
description:
Contains 2 promo cards for use with The Ninth World: A Skillbuilding Game for Numenera:


Skull Detonator: Cypher: Galvanic Blast - At the start of the Tinker Phase, shuffle this into the wilderness deck to discard 1 wilderness card.
Seek the Jade Colossus: Quest - Multiphase: To complete the tiers, first discard 1 cypher, then claim 1 creature, then advance your Tinker skill.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order
publishers: Lone Shark Games, Monte Cook Games

name: Octopus Shootout
description:
1…2…3…Octopus Shootout! In this frantic, flailing, fun game of tabletop octopus hockey, kids use a spinning octopus paddle to shoot marbles at their opponent’s goal to score!

Choose an octopus and load your marbles into the slot on the side of the game board. To begin the game, each player presses their marble release button to launch their first marbles. Slide your octopus paddle side-to-side to make the octopus tentacles spin to shoot at your opponent’s goal and block shots against your goal!

Once both marbles land in the goals, players continue to release their marbles until they’re all in the goals. At the end of the round, tally up the score – the player with the most points wins the round! Use the scoring track to easily keep track of your wins.

The first player to win eight rounds is the winner! For an even crazier game, release several marbles at once for an outrageous Octopus Shootout!

—description from the publisher

name: 4 Bilder 1 Wort: Neue Herausforderungen
description:
Four pictures have one word in common - which one is it? Since 4 Bilder 1 Wort – Das Kartenspiel, players can puzzle not only in the app of the same name, but also together at the gaming table. With 4 Bilder 1 Wort - Neue Herausforderungen 140 new puzzles come into play - for even more fun!

4 Bilder 1 Wort - Neue Herausforderungen provides owners of 4 Bilder 1 Wort – Das Kartenspiel as well as newcomers new long-lasting gaming fun.

name: Pop! Pop! Piñata
description:
It's not a party without a pinata! In this exciting and colorful Pop! Pop! Pinata game, players take turns hitting the button on the base to send the disk spinning upward toward the donkey pinata. A gentle hit releases a few prizes for the player to collect. But here's the catch! A hard hit will pop open the pinata releasing all of the prizes, but that also means that all players can race to collect the prizes. The player with the most prizes wins!

The Pop! Pop! Pinata game comes with over 30 colorful plastic prizes. It's easy to load them by lifting the donkey's saddle and pouring the prizes inside. Players take turns hitting the party button on the base, sending the spinning disc up to the bottom of the pinata. If a player hits the disc gently, a few prizes will pop out and the player whose turn it is can add those to their cup. When a player hits the pinata harder, it will pop open! That means more prizes, but it also means that now everyone gets to race to put the prizes into their cups! Who will end up with the most prizes once the pinata is empty?

—description from the publisher

name: Fish Feud
description: Race your opponent as you attempt to catapult all the squishy fish through the center of the game board. But you better work fast… the first player to launch all fish to their opponent’s side wins. It will require speed, accuracy and concentration if you want to be the king of the ocean.

name: DubbleKross
description:
DubbleKross is played in two phases: the first is the ELIMINATION PHASE where certain cards will be eliminated and their pegs placed in the PENALTY ZONE by the players rolling the dice; the second is the GAME PHASE where the remaining game pegs (representing all remaining eligible cards) are involved in a frantic race toward the WIN ZONE, also with players rolling the dice.

The objective of DubbleKross is to move one of the eligible game pegs from the "start zone" up through the "game zone" into the "win zone." Players holding the 4 cards corresponding to the winning peg collect a percentage of the pot depending upon how many of the four "win" cards each is holding. (one card gets 1/4, two cards-1/2, etc.)

—user summary

name: Bounce-Off Rock A'Round
description:
Watch where you bounce these balls! Shifting weight and a tilting board add difficulty as you try to make your design. As soon as the new, larger board rocks away from you, it can rock back! Place the Game Tray on the playing surface between players. Each player tries to tries bounce their balls into the tray to match the design on the card. Players keep bouncing until somebody matches the design, and then that player takes the card! Bounce Off Rock A'Round offers tons of action-packed fun that tests your skills and coordination. The game's four larger channels and round shape bring even more fresh twists to this family favorite. Win the game and declare yourself Master of the Universe. And don't forget the trash talking!

—description from the publisher

name: Sell Yourself Short
description:
Sell Yourself Short is the hilarious adult party game where it pays to lowball! To play, you'll underbid your friends to do ridiculous challenges. Bid to score points or to drive your opponent's price down -- whatever your strategy, leave your dignity at the door and get ready to commit some random acts of nonsense! Pull a challenge card and read it to the group, then start the bidding war. You can bid zero to 10 points on each dare, but whoever bids the lowest performs the challenge -- and gets the points! Before you perform your challenge, spin the spinner -- depending on where it lands, you could earn extra points or force another player to do the dare. Whether you're the one performing the dare or the one watching, the results are seriously funny. The first player to reach 10 points wins. So, how low will you go to reach the top? Bring laugh-out-loud fun to game nights and get-togethers with this party game for adults and teens.

—description from the publisher

name: Guess It, Get It, Gumballs
description:
"A Game of Faces and Feelings"

This memory game helps kids learn about feelings. Spin the spinner and use the gumball-grabbing mirror to choose a matching color gumball. Look in the mirror and make the face you think you grabbed. Is it a happy face? A mad face? A silly face? If you guessed right, add the gumball to the scoreboard. If not, put it back in the machine for you to remember. For everyone to win, work together to collect a rainbow of gumballs before you find the stink faces!

—description from the back of the box

name: Battle for Earth
description:
Battle for Earth is the first cross-game expansion for Dropfleet Commander and Dropzone Commander. It takes the ongoing narrative and puts it into overdrive as the Reconquest faces its bloodiest conflicts yet, both in space and on the ground.

Written by David J Lewis and Lewis Clarke, this book contains a huge amount of material! With a massive new chapter in the story, be prepared to learn about brand new parts of the universe, including the biggest battles ever fought.

Dropfleet Commander fans will find rules for all sorts of new ships, including the massive Dreadnoughts and much-anticipated Monitors, as well as full rules for Resistance fleets - the newest players in this intergalactic game.

Dropzone Commander players will find a full new version of the rules. This set of rules has been developed over several years, and is the one that the fans have been waiting for. Some rules have been tweaked, but there are many brand new surprises. The book also includes rules for using Behemoths in your games - colossal war engines that can turn the tide of an entire battle!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Bounce-Off Bullseye
description:
​It's Bounce-Off...with an added challenge. Players still need a steady hand to bounce their way to matching the design on the cards, but now they must finish by landing a bullseye! Instructions offer a number of other ways to play as well, but all involve the competitive "Bullseye" bounce-off.​

—description from the publisher

name: ReACTion
description:
ReACTion is a party game in which you try to obey all currently active rules. On your turn you must play a card from your hand which alter the currently active rules. This leads to crazy and funny behavior rules like every male needs to whisper while talking or everyone who is wearing glasses must salute before playing a card. If you are caught not following the rules you will lose some progress while the player who caught you will progress. The player who reaches the end of the track first wins the game.
—user summary

Erwischt! „ReACTion“ straft die Regelbrecher - Jeder, der Jeans trägt, darf grundsätzlich nur flüsternd sprechen. Und die Tischnachbarin darf nur eine Karte ausspielen, wenn sie vorher den anderen eine lange Nase gezeigt hat.

Verrückte und kuriose Verhaltensregeln müssen bei „ReACTtion“, dem neuen Kommunikations- und Partyspiel, befolgt werden. Wer sich als Regelbrecher erwischen lässt, wird mit einem kräftigen Schlag auf den Buzzer bestraft und auf dem Spielbrett um ein Feld zurückbeordert.

Doch darüber kann sich keiner ärgern, denn die Action, die „ReACTion“ auslöst, garantiert fröhliche Spielrunden.

—description from the publisher

name: Dino Crash 3D
description:
Let the children turn into huge dinosaurs for a while. All they need is special figures and a beautifully illustrated plan of Dino Crash. Players must escape with their character as soon as possible and in the shortest way to safety from the roaring volcano. In addition to speed, it is necessary to involve caution, along the route lurking treacherous Tyrannosaurus Rex!
While children run away from the pitfalls of prehistoric times, they will practice playfully combining and tactical skills. The set was made in the Czech Republic.

name: Imagination: Disney
description:
Imagination: Disney is a fun word game featuring beloved characters from the Disney and Pixar animated movies: The Jungle Book, Moana, Toy Story, Coco, and others.
Each round, you will have 1 minute to explain words from a card by telling a story, drawing a picture or throwing a performance. The Disney edition is a perfect fit for the whole family and all tasks there are easily comprehended by children. Plunge into the world of your favorite cartoons and have Disney fun guessing words together!
Based on the hit kids game Imagination: Junior.
—description from the publisher

«Воображарий: Disney» — специальная версия детского настольного хита «Воображарий: Junior». Здесь вас ждут любимые герои анимационных фильмов Disney и Pixar — от «Книги джунглей» до «Моаны», от «Истории игрушек» до «Тайны Коко».
Объясните другим игрокам слова при помощи рассказа, рисунка или яркого представления. На выполнение задания с карточки у вас есть всего 1 минута! Издание Disney рассчитано на всю семью и содержит задания, понятные и доступные детям. Разгадывайте слова всей семьёй и погрузитесь в атмосферу любимых мультфильмов!

—description from the publisher (Russian)
categories: Children's Game, Humor, Party Game, Racing, Real-time, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Acchiappa la polpetta
description: It is a dexterity game for very little children's. Some balls are placed in a bowl and then suddenly they come out. Each player has a dog-shaped glass and has to collect meatballs. At the start of the round, a draw done between different cards to decide the rule. you can get more meatballs, collect meatball sets or bet on in certain colors.

name: Darbak Khadar
description:
Darbak Khadar is a race to reach the final green square on the canvas. It can be played as individuals or as competing teams of two.

You toss the colored ball, and the color you get determnes the square you need to move to. If you get a green color you move to the next green box on the canvas and play again. If you land on an elevator squares you toss the ball again to figure out whether you go down, up or forward depending on the color you get.

name: Build Me: The Architect Game
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to build a 16-floor building. At the same time, players will attempt to prevent their opponents from reaching their 16th floor. The first player to build their 16th floor and also hold the "Finished Building" card will be the winner.

Apart from the tiles used for the buildings, there are also cards which are used to defend against other players. Attacks are also played through cards, including snowstorms, worker strikes, and lack of concrete, among other problems.

—user summary

name: Rugby Champion
description:
Rugby Champion is a Fast-paced tactical card game based on the Rugby theme. This game was designed to be enjoyed with the whole family. It is a simple, tactical and very dynamic game. It will immerse you in a rugby match as if you were there. An essential card game, designed for those oval ball passionate fans as well as for beginners that you should own by the end of the year.
The game offers 3 different play modes for 1 to 4 players, with short rounds.

The game is divided by rounds called "challenges ". These challenges represent the phases of a classic rugby match. Each player therefore tries to win these challenges to be able to score tries, by playing the action cards based either on the power (Physical game), on the dexterity (Hand game), or on the technicality (foot game). But beware, the strongest cards are also the most risky and in case of a risky play the referee can intervene at any time and whistle to mark penalties! And that way, we chain actions and challenges. The player with the most points after 2 halves is declared the winner!

The game takes the form of a series of challenges:

Physical and powerful challenge: simulates actions like rucks, scrums, etc.
Hand Challenge: simulates skilful actions such as passes, interceptions, etc.
Foot challenge: simulates tactical actions such as kicks, penalties, etc.


Despite the small size of our game, the dozens of card and tactical game combinations in 3 game modes (Solo, Duel or Conquest for 4 players) offer very good replay ability. In addition, because the game is played very fast, it is particularly suitable to play small tournaments or championships in less than one hour.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Howrse: The Race of Prestige
description:
Howrse incorporates various aspects of the mobile/online game into a competitive board game. Each player receives a play mat on which to build and staff an equestrian facility. The players breed and train horses, compete in events, and acquire power-ups from the black market.
—user summary

Fun to share with family and friends

For 5 years now, millions of internet users across the globe have shared the howrse experience with us. For this reason, Owlient has created for you a board game based on the online game. For the first time you can now play horwse, the board game, with family and friends. Competition between equestrian centers is tough. Be the most efficient, know how to make the right decisions, hold back your opponents and watch out for risks! The prestige of your Equestrian Centre depends on it!
—description from the box

name: Krümelmonster
description:
Math Game for children to learn counting and calculating up to 13.

The Game consists of 2x 36 cards with 1-13 Monsters or Numbers on it. Every Player plays one card and tries to reach a total of 13 monsters which is rewarded by one point. If you cannot play a card because you would get over 13 you need to take one card from the pile. Winner is the firat player to get 13 points.

There are also 3 rule variants included:

You can use Monster and Number cards
You try to get pairs of Monster and Number cards with the same value
You try to get triples of same cards, either all Monsters are all Numbers


—user summary

name: Kamuzol! (vagy nem?)
description:
Everybody lies. This is especially true of your camouflage! (or not?) board game, where you have to choose from the statements you read, the Kam, ie the fake. Someone is always dumb, roles are constantly changing, where you have to guess and where to lie. Get your poker face up, build your inner lie detector, start the game! Uncover most liars and victory is yours! The statements on the cards are based on your knowledge, but the way the game is read is greatly influenced by the gameplay. Be alert, lie wisely, read between the lines!

Everyone used to lie sometimes, and this is also true for this game. Because of the statements you have to make, you have to decide what is true and what is not. Someone will always lie, and sometime you have to lie and then guess. Try to stay calm so your teammates won't notice when you're lying and when you're not. Be smart and be careful you never know and when you lie !!

name: PEBLS: the Sea Glass hunting game
description:
Pebls is a game of competitive hunting for sea glass on Seaham Beach in England, one of the finest sea glass locations in the world. Players must search the beach, turning over driftwood to search the shingle below in the hopes of finding sea glass beads. They may also find rubbish which, as good citizens, they also collect. Players choose a direction of travel and can only change that direction when they reach the sea, or cliffs, or if they roll a starfish symbol on the custom dice. Play ends when all possible glass is collected or an agreed time period has elapsed. Sea Glass finds are totalled, and the value of the rubbish is assessed by one last roll of the starfish dice. The highest score wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Coverage, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Call the Midwife
description:
Be part of the popular drama Call the Midwife, by helping Women all over Poplar as they go into labour! The Midwives of Nonnatus House have never been so busy, delivering babies in all sorts of locations! Will you get to your next delivery on time or will you be required to divert to the Surgery to assist Dr Turner? Try not to get a bicycle puncture or forget your delivery pack as you might be delivering twins or even triplets! Using easy to learn gameplay, roll the dice, collect cards and delivers babies!! The Midwife to deliver the most babies wins the game! The Call the Midwife Boardgame has been developed by Rachel Lowe and faithfully follows the drama of the award winning TV Show.

—description from the designer

name: Man Bites Dog: Deluxe Edition
description:
The deluxe version of the hilarious headline card game! Players compete to create attention grabbing and often crazy headlines. This version includes a game board, dry-erase marker, and rewriteable cards. Who will earn the most points and earn the biggest laughs. To start shuffle the red cards and put the pile face down next to the board. Each player is dealt a hand of 5 blue cards with words on them, each with a point value. At the beginning of a round turn over the top three red cards and place them on the corresponding spaces on the board. When it's your turn, a player may dicard up to 3 cards form their hand and replace them with cards from the blue deck. The goal is to construct a headline using the cards in your hand and up to 2 of the face up red cards from the board. Cards played earn the printed point value on the card and are played to the 7 headline spots on the board. If you can not make a headline you must pass and may discard and replace any number of cards. At the end of your turn add up the value of the played cards and move your scoring token. The first player to get to 500 points wins.

The deluxe version adds 3 new types of Exclusive cards which can give your story a boost and add extra points or options.

name: The Stack Family
description:
On a sunny spring morning the Stack family wants to play outside with their balloon and kite. Could it be that the toy box was not closed properly? It seems the wind blew all our toys high into the tree. Help the parents and children climb on each others shoulders and reach everything before the sun sets.

The Stack Family is a game for the whole family. It is easy to learn, but not always easy to win! Together you think of how to get all the items out of the tree in time.
Players take turns in spinning the wheel to see which family member they may move. By moving the family members and stacking them, the family can reach high enough to grab their toys from the tree. If no one can be moved by following the rules, then the sun continues it orbit and when the sun sets, the family loses.

Through the special and playful design the game is also suited for free play.

name: Kamionem po Česku a Slovensku
description:
Did you travel with your truck all around Europe? It's time to thoroughly get to know Czech and Slovak trade cities.

Travel through our homeland and our eastern neighbors and earn the most money transporting goods. The richest truck driver wins.

Kamionem po Česku a Slovensku is a re-implementation of Auf Achse that takes place in Czech and Slovak Republic. It can be played on it's own with two players or used as an expansion to Auf Achse.

—user summary
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spiel der Rekorde
description: Guessing game with 1100 world records.

name: Château de Cartes
description:
This game is a cousin of Mille Bornes. Each player attempts to build a castle that consists of seven cards in a specified configuration. On his turn, a player draws a card and then either adds a card to his castle or plays an attack card on an opponent, who cannot continue constructing his castle until he can play the corresponding defense card to nullify the attack. For example, an archer nullifies the dragon. The first player to finish his castle wins.

—user summary

name: Project Icarus
description:
The solar system is erupting into chaos. The dying sun is releasing intense bursts of solar radiation that’s destroying the planets around it, making it an invitation for death for anyone who enters the system. However due to the extreme solar activity, brand new elements are being formed and are worth billions of units. You’re one of a few brave mercenaries trying to make your way through the system gathering as many resources as you can before the sun goes supernova. You’ll find higher valued resources as you get closer to the sun, but it’ll be hard on your shields. Will you get the resources you need to set yourself up for life, or will you fly too close to the sun and be destroyed?

Built into the game is the Supernova tracker. This keeps track of how close the sun is to going supernova. The tracker advances after each round (after each player takes their turn) and whenever a supernova event card is drawn from the drill deck. The amount of supernova event cards put into the deck depends on how many players are in the game.

In Project Icarus, players take turns moving around the board, drilling resources off of planets, and visit space station to repair and upgrade their ship. Players need to manage their resource space, engine power, drill integrity, and shield levels in order to survive and win the game. Each player is working on getting the resources shown on the selected goal card and be the first to return to their hyperspace vector before their shield runs out and before the sun goes supernova.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Market, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Sudden Death Ending, Turn Order: Time Track

name: WARMACHINE Mk III Two Player Battle Box (Second Edition)
description:
The WARMACHINE Two-Player Battlebox is designed to be a complete WARMACHINE experience for two players right out of the box. Inside, you'll find two full battlegroups and two full units, along with a core rules digest, in-depth tutorial guide, dice, ruler, battle map, and a special narrative scenario—everything two players need to jump right into the game.

WARMACHINE is a fast-paced and aggressive 30 mm tabletop miniatures battle game set in the steam-powered fantasy world of the Iron Kingdoms. Take control of an elite soldier-sorcerer called a warcaster and his mighty warjacks–massive steam-powered combat automatons–as you battle to destroy the enemy warcaster.

CONTAINS EVERYTHING YOU NEED FOR A TWO-PLAYER GAME.
WARMACHINE: Prime Digest Rulebook, Basic Training Tutorial Guide, Battle Map, 4 dice, 18" ruler, 20 focus tokens, 6 spell tokens, and 28 plastic WARMACHINE models with corresponding color stat cards.

CRYX
Cryx Introductory Guide
Warcaster Bane Witch Agathia
Slayer Heavy Warjack
Reaper Heavy Warjack
Deathripper light warjack
Bane Warrior Unit (10 models)

CYGNAR
Cygnar Introductory Guide
Warcaster Major Beth Maddox
Ironclad Heavy Warjack
Lancer Light Warjack
Firefly Light Warjack
Stormguard Unit (10 models)

name: Buliszerviz: A partibeindító
description:
Start a party with the Party Service board game, create fun until dawn, and fall apart!

Throw in, go for beer bottles, draw funny or spicy cards, and complete the quests to collect the 21 Party Dollars needed to win! Anyone who succeeded will recite the victory verse of the board game.

name: Chop Chop Ninja Junior
description:
Chop Chop Ninja Junior is a spin on the classical card battle game with graphics from the Chop Chop Ninja TV Series.

Each player turn its card. The highest wins the hand. If its a tie, a battle begins. The goal of the game is to get all the cards.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: JOUST!
description: JOUST! is a set of rules for a simple multi-player table-top medieval jousting game. It can be played with or without miniatures. If using miniatures, then any scale of miniatures can be used. You, as a player, take on the role of a knight. You can only control one knight during the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jungle Speed: Mini-extension inédite
description:
Additional 40-cards expansion for Jungle Speed that was sold along the game in 2009.

It features:

A new set of symbols.
A fifth colour and extra cards in that colour.
A new sort of special card.

name: Dough NAB
description:
We won't sugarcoat it, this game's a hole lot of fun!

In this bakery blitz, you'll need to keep a keen eye on the cards the race to grab a doughnut if you see a match. But watch out for action cards and the Magic doughnuts that shake up play!

Win the game to be crowned the Head Baker!

Each player has a pile of cards, and on your turn you flip the top card and depending on certain cards showing, you may need to grab for one or more of the doughnuts, with the winner giving their cards to the other players. But take care not to grab at the wrong time! Your aim is to be the first to get rid of all your cards by successfully grabbing doughnuts.

name: Israel: Reise durch das Land der Wunder
description:
A game to discover Israel, traveling from city to city.
Each player plays the roll of a traveler trying to find the right path to collect the most points.
Be careful, the other players try to throw obstacles in your way.
Only if you arrive with the most point your destination, you will be victorious.
mechanics: Moving Multiple Units, Point to Point Movement

name: Einsteins Einmaleins
description:
Einsteins Einmaleins lives up to its name — "Einstein's Multiplication Table" — as the game challenges players to create interlocking horizontal and vertical mathematical equations quickly.

The game has four difficulty levels, with 1-digit or 2-digit numbers, and with 18 or 25 tiles. You can also play against the clock to train your skills...

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): The NAF Fun Police Promo Card
description: This promo card was included in the December 2019 issue of White Dwarf Magazine along with promos for 3 other games. It is a "Dirty Trick" special play.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Variable Player Powers

name: iKNOW: in America
description:
Challenge yourself and your friends with fascinating questions about all things American!

You can have as much help as you want and guess how your friends will fare. Just remember that guessing it wrong will cost you valuable points.

—description from the publisher

name: Six dwarves
description:
Be the first to discover all the numbers from 1 to 6 that the dwarves hide.

The goal of the game is to be the first with all your 6 cards open and without any special cards among them.

name: Ready, Steady, Sculpt!
description: A fast-paced family party game of modelling charades where players pick a card and model a sculpture in Plasticine that their teammates need to recognise and guess correctly within the given time limit.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Brain Elixir -- After-Dinner Riddles
description:
Stimulate your brain with fun lateral thinking riddles in Brain Elixir After-Dinner Riddles by Clarendon Games! Includes 80 fun riddle cards.

Fun games to cure boredom!
Great for stocking stuffers and impulse
Small travel sized card games
Mixes humour and trivia

—description from the publisher

name: Mini-MIG 2
description:
A new release in 2010 of the previous Mini-M.I.G. from 2006. This version adds the M.I.G.-die from the original M.I.G.

Travel version of M.I.G. with 380 questions in five categories (Present & Past, Entertainment & Culture, Near & Far, Sports & Other, Nature & Science).

Two dice are rolled, one to decide category and one to decide if you have a 'M.I.G-chance'. If the player didn't roll a 'M.I.G-chance' they have to answer the question correct to have another roll of the dice. If the player has a 'M.I.G-chance' they have the opportunity to score, either way it's the next players turn.

The first player to correctly answer a 'M.I.G-chance' in each category is the winner.

name: All Things Zombie: High Rise to Hell
description:
A supplement for All Things Zombie - Final Fade Out and contains the following:

A complete, occupied nine story high rise to explore and adventure in

Smart Vampires

Vampires

Werewolves

Magic Casters
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction, Wargame, Zombies

name: Lotería de Valores Mexicanos
description:
"Sometimes you win and always ... you learn with the LOTTERY OF MEXICAN VALUES", in addition each purchase has a very cool purpose.

The laughs are welcome, they are tested, they are guaranteed AND NOW ALSO THEY ARE IMPREGATED OF VALUES, AS WE ASSIGN EACH CARD TO A VALUE, ACCOMPANIED BY A VERSE; TO SING IT LIKE IN THOSE WONDERFUL YEARS OF GRANDMOTHER, YOUR GRANDMOTHER (AND MINE ALSO). Mexico is a great country, full of extraordinary people, rich in resources, in culture, but above all rich in human quality; That is why we give voice through the game to many of the values ​​that our beloved and beloved Mexico needs, so as not to let go of our hands, because from now ...

WE ARE UNITED MEXICAN, also for success.

We retain 30 of the most emblematic figures, and we return to the lottery 3 figures that once existed and have a high cultural value, such as “El Ojo”, “El Tecolote” and “El Águila” (sacred icons in many ancestral cultures and the last, part of our national symbol). We propose 4 new cards: "La Diversidad" (respect), "Las Hormigas" (teamwork), "Los Brigadistas" (help) and "La Perrita Frida" (Loyalty).
Perrita Frida” (Lealtad).

Loteria is a traditional Mexican game combining cards and Bingo, and it has been played as a game of chance, as a pastime and for educational purposes.

Cards are drawn and the illustrations matched to Bingo-like grid cards, each showing 16 of the 54 possible cards. Like Bingo, one may win by matching all of the fields on the grid-card, or by matching a horizontal, vertical or diagonal line.

—description from the publisher (translation)

name: Battle of the Somme: Component Set
description:
Battle of the Somme Component Set contains all the components published in the book, but as separate components.


Included is 8.5" x 11" map,
Reference Card, and
all game markers and
all counters included in the book, including Advanced counters.
In addition, we've included an Advanced Game Rules folder, containing all the rules necessary to play the advanced version of the game.


This means that if you have Poor Bloody Infantry: Somme, and wish to upgrade to Battle of the Somme, you can purchase this set an receive the Advanced version of the game as well.

This means you can Upgrade to the new edition (with new counters, Advanced rules, advanced counters) by ordering this set, if you already own PBI: Somme.
However... While upgrading may be good for some, we definitely believe the new book version contains enough new material (two new scenarios, a few new optional rules, and several sections of historical commentary, maps, and designer's notes), that we feel you would be well served to buy the new edition, which is the definitive edition of this game system.

What's included in the Battle of the Somme Component Set:

One map*,
one Reference Card**,
Counter sheet 1*,
Counter sheet 2*,
Counter sheet 3*,
Counter sheet 4**,
Advanced Counter sheet 5**,
four-page Advanced Rules folder**.


*=components from PBI: Somme **=new components in this edition

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Who is the Biggest Slut?
description:
The game that begs the question, "Are you willing to admit what a whore you are?"

Over 400 Sexually Outrageous Questions!!!

Who is the Biggest Slut? is the adult party game where players answer questions about slutty things they have done in order to determine which one of them is the Biggest Slut!

Who is the Biggest Slut? can also be played as a drinking game where players roll to ask questions to the group and everyone who has done the slutty action, drinks.

Game Includes: 2 "Who is the Biggest Slut?" books with 216 questions each and 3 dice.

—description from the publisher

name: Ostfront: Wehrmacht Army List
description:
Wehrmacht Army List for Ostfront

This book covers the vehicles and forces of the Wehrmacht in World War 2. From the basic infantry platoon to the mighty Tiger II, from the Puma armored car, to the Brummbär assault howitzer

The Wehrmacht Army List covers the 3 main period of the war; early, mid and late, and covers the evolution of the units over that time. It covers artillery, air support and defense, various light vehicles, 3 types of infantry, and the many tanks available to the Wehrmacht during the war.

This book has a detailed description of each unit, describing their abilities and special rules, as well as quick reference tables at the back, covering the various weapons and units available at a glance, and perfect for building army lists from, or for checking stats during play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Ostfront: Soviet Army List
description:
Soviet Army List

This book covers the vehicles and forces of the Soviet Army in World War 2. From the humble conscript, to the Mighty IS-2, from the propeller-driven NKL Aerosani assault sled, to the multi-turreted T-28C. Every unit a Soviet commander could want is covered, allowing for a wide range of forces to be built.

The Soviet Army List covers the 3 main period of the war; early, mid and late, and covers the evolution of the units over that time. It covers artillery, air support and defense, various light vehicles, 3 types of infantry, and the many tanks available to the Soviet Union during the war.

This Book has a detailed description of each unit, describing their abilities and special rules, as well as quick reference tables at the back, covering the various weapons and units available at a glance, and perfect for building army lists from, or for checking stats during play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Skirmish Afrika: Fantasy Afrika for Skirmish Sangin
description:
Skirmish AFRIKA

AFRIKA is an imaginary continent set in the modern world. This book contains 9 scenarios and all the background information players need to create forces (ORBATS) for each of the 14 countries and UN Peacekeepers, Private Military Contractors and Guerrillas.

This book contains detailed background on 14 new and original Afrikaan Countries. Within this continent, its countries have a diverse range of problems that includes everything from war-like aggressive neighbours to internal dissent and terrorism. At the same time these countries deal with the spectre of modern colonialism. This takes many forms including aid dependency, unscrupulous trade deals and arms supplies from countries as diverse as China, India, Europe and the USA.

This is not a standalone rulebook, players will need a copy of Skirmish Sangin to use this supplement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Eternal  Samsara
description:
China's first original trading card game.

In the Eternal Samsara game, you will summon aggressive war spirits, using powerful magic and vehicles. Compete with your opponents in time and space in the samsara of Eternity.
Each player should create a deck of 50 cards,include war spirits, magic and vehicles.The goal of this game is to make your opponent's lifepoint from 30 to 0. Each card in your hand can be place upside down as a magic stone so you will not be lack of magic.

—user summary

name: Off Track! by SGAG
description:
A strategy card game where you build MRT tracks to reach your destination, while disrupting others and throwing them off track!

Every player starts off with one of the three randomly selected characters from a team; Office Lady, School Boy or the Disruptor. Office Ladies and School Boys have to work with their team to build an interrupted track route to their specific Destination. The first team to get to their Destination wins. The Disruptors have to stop both teams from reaching their Destinations.

How to play:
All players pick a Character Card at random and start by taking 5 cards from the Draw Pile.Place Destination Cards face down at random at the center of the Map. Place Home Cards face up at the 4 corners of the Map The player who took the MRT last starts the game.

On your turn, take one of the following actions:

Place 1 Track card on the map.
Play 1 Action card on other players.
Play 1 Action card on yourself.
Play 1 Action card on the Map.
Discard up to 2 cards face down and take back the same number of cards that you discarded.


If you played a card, draw back 1 card from the Draw Pile at the end of your turn.
At the end of your turn, you must have 5 cards in hand.

Components:
1 cloth map (67cm x 67 cm)
132 cards (9 character cards, 4 destination cards, 4 home cards, 48 action cards, 67 track cards)
1 instruction sheet
mechanics: Hand Management, Map Addition, Network and Route Building, Take That, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: いやいやコーギーと、あるきたい！ (No, No, I Want to Walk With Corgi!)
description:
いやいやコーギーと、あるきたい！ (pronounced roughly "Iyaiya Corgi to Arukitai!") is a Japanese game, the title of which means "I want to take a walk with a corgi who is not willing to". The game can be played solitaire.

On a 5x5 grid, players take turns controlling a single corgi by playing an action card such as "advance one space" and "turn left". First, players should co-operate to make the corgi meet four friends who are at the four corners of the board. Each time the corgi meets a friend or clears a hazard in the town, the active player increases their hand capacity.

After meeting all the friends, the players must return the corgi home at the center of the town. When the corgi is returned home, the active player wins.

•••

カードを出して、コーギーを動かし、友だちコーギーに会ってから家に戻る「お散歩ゲーム」です。
「ＧＯ」ならまっすぐ進み、「ＴＵＲＮ ＬＥＦＴ」で右を向く・・・というようにコマンドでコーギーを動かします。
まずはみんなで協力して、４頭の友だちコーギーに会いにいきましょう。
友だちコーギーに会ったり、途中のハプニングをクリアしたりすると、持ち札が増えていきます。
友だちコーギーに会った後はバトル開始！
最初にコーギーと家に帰った人が勝ちの「勝ち決め」のゲームです。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Programmed Movement

name: Lords & Servants: The Burgundian Wars
description:
Lords & Servants supplement dedicated to the Burgundian Wars.

Lists for:

Burgundian Ordonnance,
French Ordonnance,
Swiss Confederacy,
Low Countries,
German Empire.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Time's Up!: Football
description:
With Time’s Up!, guess football-related words in 3 rounds, first by describing them then with a single word and finally by mime. Hurry up, give the best clues so that your team finds a maximum of answers before the end of the hourglass.

If you're a team player, Time’s Up! Football is the game for you! Have fun discovering with family or friends the 40 new object cards evoking football.

Hum and make noise to guess as many cards as possible! Be Soccer with Time’s Up! Football.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Memory, Team-Based Game

name: Superhéroes Marvel: Juego de cartas no coleccionable
description:
Superhéroes Marvel is a game of non-collectible cards you intend emulate the fighting between heroes and comic villains, made by and for fans that combines cards and dices.

You must get the cost in points of each location where the heroes fight. They can cost 7,8,9 or 10 points according to their importance in the Marvel universe. Whoever earns more of these points is the final winner.

In addition to Heroes and locations there are Events, which allow you to alter some rules or game mechanics.

name: Chevauchee: A Medieval Skirmish Wargame
description:
Chevauchee. A Medieval Skirmish Wargame

Swords, mud and blood.

Medieval man to man fighting was brutal and unpleasant but there's no reason your game rules should be.

Chevauchee takes the familiar, fast-moving engine from FiveCore and adapts it to medieval skirmish warfare.

Features include:

Warband level gameplay where you can get to know each member of your army.
Simple D6-based combat mechanics that combine morale and injury into a single roll.
Systems to build almost any medieval (or fantasy) weapon you can think of.
Full detailed campaign rules letting you follow a warband across multiple encounters and random events.
Random character creation providing you with a strong roleplaying element.
Character skills, letting each individual be a unique contributor to your noble crusade... or petty thievery.
The "Fief" campaign, letting you run your own petty domain. Hope the peasants aren't too revolting!
Written by the incredibly talented Tom Mecredy, utilizing the FiveCore skirmish rules as a base.


Chevauchee is suitable for games of 6-12 figures per side, using any individually based figures.

While utilizing the base FiveCore system, every mechanic has been tweaked to fit the subject matter.

Scenario generator and campaign rules are included. No need to buy extra books just to play a long adventure.

—description from the publisher

name: 18Iran
description:
18Iran is an 18xx genre style game set in the early days of the Iranian railway expansion.

It is a small, short playing 18xx that features town growth and a unique 2 city railway that runs completely separately to the main board but requires regular maintenance costs.

Among other features is a bonus for delivering to certain cities and a unique hex tile for bypassing the main city.

The privates are a mix of delivery bonuses and revenue only

all privates companies and railroads are historically accurate as is the map/route building aspect.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Market, Network and Route Building, Ownership, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Dungeon Academy: Punchboard
description:
A punchboard with 10 character and standee and rules.

At the beginning of the game, you receive a standee with your character. Place the professor standee next to a chosen side of the dungeon.

Each round, the professor will move clockwise to the next side of the dungeon. If you exit the dungeon where the professor is standing, you get one coin.

—user summary

name: Baltic Arena: Scenarios for WWII Naval Warfare in the Baltic Theater (2012 Standard)
description:
In Baltic Arena, lead author Christoph Kluxen weaves together 13 scenarios and 11 articles that cover the forgotten naval theater of World War II.

Baltic Arena 's well-researched scenarios have something for everyone, covering the compete range of operations from submarine attacks to full convoy actions.

Eleven articles examine topics such as the Finnish naval and air forces, a chronology of Soviet submarine actions, and also include primary material, such as a German recognition poster of Soviet warships.

New rules for mine warfare round out the offering, which has data annexes with all the specifications needed to play the scenarios.

Baltic Arena 2012 Standard is consistent with the Fleet series of supplements for Command at Sea, 4th edition.

—description from publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Fear Naught: Quick Naval Wargaming
description:
The waters round Great Britain and Ireland, including the English Channel, are hereby proclaimed a war region. On and after February 18th every enemy merchant vessel found in this region will be destroyed, without its always being possible to warn the crews or passengers of the dangers threatening.
— Admiral Von Pohl, Chief of Marine Staff, Berlin, 4 February 1915

Fear Naught takes players to the high seas during the war to end all wars, in command of a squadron of warships bristling with guns and torpedoes.
The game is incredibly simple to learn and quick to play, with an average battle taking about an hour and a half

This version contains the beta rules and 3 quick-play scenarios.

It can be played with any scale of miniatures on all sizes of table. The author has found that a 4x6 table works best.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Tune into ... Initial sounds
description:
With beautiful illustrations and humorous alphabet tongue twisters, the enjoyable and flexible games in this pack offer ideal opportunities to develop auditory discrimination. There are games at a variety of levels that can be played with individuals or small groups.

The players turn over the picture cards when they hear the corresponding tongue twister played on the CD. The winner is the first player to turn over all their cards. The various levels uses different ranges of pictures and tracks on the CD.

name: Langland Domino
description:
The Animals from Langland meet again in Langland Domino, a classic game with the Langland twist: no numbers, but cute animals. In the game 2 to 4 players aged 4 an up try to get rid of all their animal tiles first. To do so, they have to continue or complete animals on the table. If they complete an animal, they get to lie another tile immediately. The special corner pieces not only have the ever-growing line of animals stay on the table, but also grant an extra turn. As soon as a player got rid of all tiles or cannot lay out any of their tiles anymore, the game ends and the player with the least tiles left, wins.

As all games in the Langland line of games, Langland Domino takes a classic and makes it accessible fun for kids. An appealing display of long animals, and simple tactical decisions are the highlights of this visit to Langland.

—description from the publisher

name: Oscar Sierra Charlie OSC: Part 1 Skirmish
description:
OSC | Oscar Sierra Charlie

Welcome to a game that has been through over 20 years of evolution, and has been refined over the last 2 years. The outcome is a more player friendly product. Blood sweat and tears have gone into the making of it and its’ expansions, and on the battle field your forces will fight blood sweat and tears in grasping a victory.

OSC is not just a modern war game, this is a system for you (the player) to have fun with.

Part one is to get you into action on a skirmish level and learn the nuts and bolts of the basic game.

OSC is designed for friendly rather than competitive play.

With OSC you can experience some fun games with, what feels like realistic forces, using the points to balance out the numbers.

If players wish to form killer forces to win games, then they have missed the main point of this game. The challenge in this game is making the right choices on what actions you take, in what order and how you do them.

OSC is a game of cunning tactics, for those still wanting to create a competitive scene.

Oscar Sierra Charlie puts you straight in the front line of gripping battles.
This is combat at the cutting edge; individual and squad-level action, desperate missions to capture key objectives, with victory going to best tactical mind.

OSC’s mechanics are deliberately streamlined for fast-paced tactical play.
Straightforward stat lines are augmented by a plethora of skills, options and tactics.
At its heart a player-driven rules system, no two games of OSC will be the same. Your troops will stand and fight at your command – their fate and that of the mission is wholly in your hands!

The game world of Oscar Sierra Charlie is one of gritty modern warfare at its core. But it is also far more.

—description from the publisher

name: Micro Ancients: Expansion I – Chariot Era & Far East
description:
Micro Warfare Series: Micro Ancient Expansion I - Chariot Era & Far East

An expansion to the popular Micro Ancient game, this title introduces three additional beligerants to enhance play:

Assyrian,
Chinese and
Egyptian.


The section for each army includes counters for use in the game; applicable rule amendments as well as some brief information about the country at the time (source: Wikipedia)

PLEASE NOTE: You must have a copy of Micro Warfare: Micro Ancients to make use of this title.

The Micro Warfare series was originally published by Tabletop Games in the 1970s with this title being published in 1976. Each game in the series aims to recreate the feel of tabletop wargaming with large numbers of miniatures but using printed counters and terrain so that games can be played in a small space and are very cost-effective.

In these Hurlbat Publishing editions we have kept the rules and most of the illustrations unchanged but have modernised the layout and counter designs to refresh the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Black Stories Junior: Fußball Stories
description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: Fußball Stories are riddles for young soccer fans. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

name: Doggohome Cards
description:
Players are now caretakers in a One Stop Dog Care Center called DOGGOHOME! It’s a busy day, so the boss would reward the caretaker who could attend to the most number of dogs with a special bonus!

As a caretaker, you have to satisfy the different needs of various dogs with the respective “service” cards. You can work together with your friends and family or compete against each other to see who can take care of the most number of doggo!

Features:
Suitable for young children (with basic rules) and adults (with advanced rules)
Contains cute and colourful card illustrations of different breeds of dogs
Is a fun and interactive way for people to learn more about caring for dogs through gameplay

—description from the publisher

name: Misfortunes
description:
Bad luck can be fun! Misfortunes The game where you can escape bad luck - by inflicting it on someone else.

The fun starts when each player chooses a character - Nigel Nightmare, Melissa Mishap, Dorothy Disaster or Harold Hapless and the race is on to collect the winning tokens.

But beware! Misfortunes lurk around every corner. To keep in front you may have to risk all and take a gamble. Or you can avoid misfortune by inflicting it on another player. So good luck and good fortune - you'll need it!

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Ice Cream Social
description:
Stack up the ice cream cones and toppings to complete your sweets in this fun matching game. Gather the most ice cream cards to win the game. The goal of the game is to stack and create as many ice cream cones as you can. The taller the ice cream, the more points.

—description from the publisher

name: Micro Ancients: Expansion II – Classical Era
description:
Micro Warfare Series: Micro Ancient Expansion II – Classical Era

An expansion to the popular Micro Ancient game, this title introduces three additional beligerants to enhance play: four additional belligerents to enhance play: Indian, Macedonian, Persian and Seleucid. The section for each army includes counters for use in the game; applicable rule amendments as well as some brief information about the country at the time (source: Wikipedia)

The Micro Warfare series was originally published by Tabletop Games in the 1970s with this title being published in 1976. Each game in the series aims to recreate the feel of tabletop wargaming with large numbers of miniatures but using printed counters and terrain so that games can be played in a small space and are very cost-effective

In these new editions we have kept the rules and most of the illustrations unchanged but have modernised the layout and counter designs to refresh the game. Please look out for more games and expansions from this series being released over the next few months.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Rebellion: the First Scottish War of Independence
description:
Rebellion: the First Scottish War of Independence

28mm Wargame rules for Medieval Warfare.

Set in the period of the First Scottish War of Independence, the Rebellion led initially by William Wallace and ending with Robert the Bruce's Victory at Bannockburn, Rebellion is a set of wargaming rules designed to be used with 28mm miniatures.

These rules are designed to be enjoyable and quick to play, with games being completed in one to two hours. The core rules are covered in the first 30 pages and are not difficult to learn.
This book also includes army lists and warrior and hero profiles as well as suggested scenarios including historical battles such as Stirling and Bannockburn.

—description from the publisher

name: Cruel Seas: Run Silent, Run Deep
description:
In Cruel Seas we intentionally wanted submarines to work as a normal surface vessel. After all, powerful diesel engines propel them as fast, if not faster, than many escort ships in a convoy when surfaced.

The bonus for a submarine is, of course, being able to vanish by diving, hiding from escorts to ambush the merchantmen at will.
