The disadvantage of being submerged is the slow speed and the fact you are often blind to what is going on at the surface, that’s when the game of cat and mouse begins!

Run Silent, Run Deep is an unofficial expansion to Cruel Seas that expands upon the submarine rules presented in the core book. Track the depth and position of your submarine with a series of easy to read markers. Send your opponent off on a wild goose chase, haring after shadows and transients while your submarine slips through his defensive line to attack lumbering merchantmen.

While games on the surface are a breakneck affair with chattering cannons and exploding shells, Run Silent, Run Deep is a game of stealth and patience - building to a nail-biting finale when escort and submarine clash one-on-one.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Banco Imobiliário Express
description: A super dynamic card game to raise - literally - a lot of money. That's because it works with the dynamics of stealing lots, but with the cards of the properties of the Banco Imobiliário. The goal, of course, is to get as many cards as possible for you.

name: Detetive de Bolso
description: I think we have a Sherlock Holmes here! Use your observation and agility to recognize traces of an almost perfect crime. Here's a clue: it's a game, minimum of two players, and the goal is to find symbols in common between the board card and the hand card. Prepare the magnifying glass, call your team of investigators and start the searches.

name: Pakjesavond
description:
The Dutch game association Ducosim publishes the game magazine Spel!. With this magazine they will publish several 'Spel!enkaarten' (gamecards). These are games which fit on a A5 card. #0025 is Pakjesavond. This is a variant of Omatako.

The game is played on a 3x3 field. Each player has 8 pieces valued from 2 to 6. On a turn, a player must move a piece exactly as many steps (horizontal, vertical or up/down) as the number on it - entering from the player’s side of the board, or from wherever an uncovered piece is on the board. One wins if one controls two towers of equal height of 4 or more.

—user summary

name: Monopoly: Unicorns and Llamas
description:
Monopoly Unicorns vs. Llamas Game
Inspired by the lively rivalry between llamas and the mythical unicorn, the Monopoly Unicorns vs. Llamas game can be a fun game for animal lovers everywhere. This edition of the Monopoly board game is designed to be played in teams. Join Team Unicorn or Team Llama and move around the board to claim titles such Most Colorful, Twinkliest Eyes, Most Charming, and Sweetest. The game ends when all titles have been claimed and the team with the most titles wins. The winners can say that their adorable beast is the best!

—description from the publisher

name: New Girl: A Quirky Game of Trivia and A Whole Lot More
description:
In this New Girl board game, players answer trivia questions, fill in the blanks in a funny sing-along and play rounds where they learn about each other. This promotes critical thinking and serves as a tool for socializing. Play your feeling stick card to your advantage along the way as you race around the game board trying to get back to your apartment. The player who gets home fastest wins!

Contents: game board, 85 trivia cards, 75 shenanigans cards, 35 crazy cards, 6 feeling stick cards, 6 movers, 6 mover stands, round marker, and rules.

name: Wild West Chronicles: New Scenarios & New Squads
description:
New Squads at your disposal:

Pinkertons,
7th Cavalry,
US Army Fort Detachment,
Apaches,
Comanches,
Comancheros,
Reservation Renegades


And two new scenarios:

Gunfight at the Ok Corral (with the full list of the Earps and Cowboys) and
Gunfight at Down


—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Pieter Konijn: Het Avontuur in het Bos
description:
Play together with your family and friends in the world of Peter Rabbit. Play as your favorite character from the series and search through the forest to find all the hidden items. But watch out! Samuel Whiskers and the other bad guys are lurking close by and will try to stop you.

Arrange the map tiles in any way you like to create your own map. Players roll a dice to determine if they can move on the board or if the bad guys can move. A player can move on the map based on the result they rolled, collecting items along the way. But if the bad guys get to move, they might end up on the same tile as a player. If this happens the player has to give up one of their collected items.

The first person to collect the 5 different items, wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pieces as Map, Tile Placement

name: Youandi
description: In Youandi players are collecting hearts that can then be exchanged for points. When it's your turn, you can play a card if a heart on the card has the same color as any heart on the table. As a reward you get a heart-token. If you have three hearts of the same color, you can play them to get three heart-tokens. When you have collected 3 identical heart-tokens in front of you you can exchange them for 1 point. But you may instead save them until you have 2 sets of 3 hearts or 6 hearts of the same color. They give you 3 points and everyone else must throw all of their heart-tokens. If you ever have more than 10 heart-tokens, you have to throw them all away without getting any points. Whoever first collects 9 points wins!

name: Operation B.G. 4
description:
It is the night of September 20th 1941 in the Gibraltar Bay; the Italian submarine Scirè has just deployed three SLC (Siluri a Lenta Corsa), manned by six Gamma subs.

Their aim is to force the Gibraltar Harbour and sink British vessels!

Will you manage after six Action Card to reach the British ships and check which one you will able to sink? Would be an Ark Royal Class carrier or an interned Italian merchant ship?

Will you avoid to raise the Alarm Level?

18 cards ready to let you taste the flavour of the success in this SOLITAIRE game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: The Game of Life: Cardgame
description:
Shuffle Game of Life Card Game
The aim of the game is to get 100 life points, the first player to play all of their cards onto the table wins. To play cards on the table players must build sets and runs of cards, rummy style.
—user summary

The Shuffle Game of Life is an exciting card game version of the popular board game, perfect for travelling and a quicker game! The game play lasts for approximately 20 minutes and is suitable for ages 7+ with 2-4 players
The aim of the game is to be the first person to get 100 life points by getting rid of all the cards in your hand by playing them onto the table. To play cards onto the table you must be able to make sets and runs or add to other players sets and runs. How to play – Each card is worth a certain number of points which accumulate as you play them onto the table. At the start of your turn take a card from the draw pile or discard pile (your choice), if you can make a set or runs then play them onto the table in front of you.
A set is three or four cards showing the same career or house but in different colours. A run is three or more consecutively numbered cards of the same colour. If you can add cards to another players set or run on the table during your turn.
You need to play all the cards from you hand as quickly as possible to score life points, that’s why it is worth adding to other players sets and runs. The game also includes wild spinner cards these can be any number to complete a set. At the end of your turn you must always discard a card onto the discard pile.

—description from the publisher

name: Martial Art: Divorce Simulator Promo
description: A new legend for use with Martial Art which was included as a promo for Divorce Simulator. Like the other legends,

name: Don't Touch My Nuts!
description:
Don't Touch My Nuts! is a card game about squirrels and acorns. Players take turns drawing cards and using them to destroy other players nuts, while also defending their own. Acorn cards are stored in a 'Nut Sack' which serves to hide a players acorn count. Once a player loses all of their nuts, they are out of the game!

—description from the designer

name: OMV Resourcefulness Challenge
description:
OMV's Resourcefulness Challenge is an exciting strategy game developed especially by OMV employees for OMV employees. It is also great fun for your friends and family with an interest in Resourcefulness. It playfully illustrates how business decisions, combined with a sense of responsibility and sustainability, are the key to commercial success along OMV's entire value chain.

Apply your own investment strategy to achieve long-term win-win situations that are beneficial to society, the environment and OMV. Be aware, because you will have to deal with plenty of unforseen challenges but will also force opportunities along the way.

—description from the box
mechanics: Events, Income, Investment, Network and Route Building

name: Sneak Peek
description:
The sharp eyed memory and reaction game!

Only a quick mind, eagle eyes and fast fingers can help you win the Sneak Peek game!

Flip the cards and find 3 cards that match by colour, symbol or both. Find a match to keep the cards.

The winner is the player who has the most cards.

Two fun and fast ways to play!

—description from the publisher

name: シェリフ (Sheriff)
description:
In the trick-taking game シェリフ (Sheriff), designed for exactly 3 players, one player takes on the role of the Sheriff, another the Robber, and the last the Mayor.

Each role will score points differently. The Sheriff scores 1 point for each King taken in a trick. The Robber scores 1 point for each 10 taken in a trick. The Mayor, who decides on the trump suit, receives 1 point for each Queen and Jack collected; loses 1 point for each King the Sheriff does not win; and loses 1 point for each 10 the Robber does collect.

Play continues over several rounds until one player has earned 8 points. The player with the highest score wins.

name: Lody!
description:
Easy fact game for kinds and parents.
Easy game where you have to create your ice cream cone by drafting ice cream scoops of different flavour (required colours) and with decorations (different point value).

name: Machete: The Game
description:
Machete The Game was born from an idea of the histrionic artist Immanuel Casto who involved Machete Productions to create an irreverent and satirical card game about the music world, played by those who live in it every day as its protagonist. The game includes almost 100 cards designed by Diego Flower Boscolo. Each player impersonates one of the rappers of the Machete crew: SALMO, NITRO, DJ SLAIT, JACK THE SMOKER, RASTY KILO, KILL MAURI and HELL RATON. Between albums to produce, scandals and hits, build the Pyramid of the Machete Empire, block the climbs of your opponents and become the King of the music world. Your goal in the game is to become a successful rapper, expanding your empire. The first to complete his Empire pyramid, placing the tenth card on top of the pyramid, wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

RULES

Setup:

Create a draw deck shuffling together the Empire and Performance cards.
Every player chooses/gets a member of the Machete crew and collect the respective starting money and resources.
Every player as starting hand draws 4 cards (the order does not matter)


Round 4-phases:

Every player draws a cards from the draw deck.
Everyone chooses a card to reveal at the same time, then players can take their turn in order, based on the card's initiative value. The player can sell the card (discard it and get money) or play it. When the player plays the card, he/she pays the money cost and/or check its resource requirements, then if it's an Empire card he/she adds it to his/her pyramid tableau, while if it's a Performance card it just get discarded after applying its effect. If a player doesn't have all the resources required to play a card, he/she can ask another player for help and pay money in exchange for the favor.
Every player picks a card to pass face down to the player on his/her left.
Players choose what to discard to get their hand to a max of 7 cards.


Winning condition:
The first player to complete his/her pyramid tableau, placing the 10th card (base of 4 cards + second level with 3 + third with 2 + 1 last card on the top), immediately wins the game.

—user summary

name: Terminal Dispute
description:
Emergency sirens blare throughout the starship and you race to the escape pods. Take a moment to fully activate the escape systems and you stand a much better chance of survival. Of course, the Navigation Matrix is vital, but so is the USB Phone Charger — you wouldn’t want to be floating in space without access to your games!

In this roll and write game, players are interfacing with an escape pod terminal. Over twelve turns, they will use dice to put numbers into the Navigation Matrix and power up the Phone Charger. At the end of the game, the player who has most efficiently completed these tasks is the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Basic Impetus Fantasy
description:
Unofficial fantasy add on for Basic Impetus and Impetus.

Includes few lists.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Ivion: Promo Paradise Promo Card
description:
This promo came from the "Promo Paradise" Kickstarter brought to you by The Board Game Spotlight and Board Game Exposure.

This card is a Winterborn Ultimate FEAT card with a Second Wind value of 36. When you are reduced to 36 HP or less for the first time in the game you can use your second wind. Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, pick 2 to put in your hand and the other 3 go to the bottom of your deck in the order of your choice.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Rolling Alnite
description:
Unabashedly inspired by Jamey Stegmaier’s Rolling Realms game, we have developed a simple Roll & Write game featuring the Haus Alnite drag king/queen personalities.

The theme is to fill out as many of the sections as possible (earning a geometric shape) to flesh out a drag persona on the figure at the bottom of the sheet. Your score improves the more shapes you have that match each other.

Any number of players can play this game simultaneously. Each player needs 4 standard dice (6-sided) and a printed copy of the sheet to fill out. You can download the image of the sheet and load it into Google’s JamBoard, any photo-editing app or graphic design software where you can mark it up as needed.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Zoccer Finger Soccer Game
description:
A dexterity game for two to eight players.

The game comes with a 33" x 44" green playing mat that has soccer lines drawn on it. There are two plastic goals and a vinyl fence to go around the "field."

Each player is given a pair of "shorts" that goes on the index and middle fingers as well as two molded pieces that represent socks and cleats that also go on those fingers. The game comes with these for two players. With more sets the game will hold up to four players on each team.

The players use their fingers as legs kicking a Zoccer ball across the field trying to score in the other team's goal. The game ends when either 15 minutes has elapsed or one team scores 10 goals.

There are rules covering situations like offside, fouls and misconducts, zone violations, penalty kicks, throw ins, and goal kicks.

name: 大江戸地引網 (Edo Dragnet)
description:
In 大江戸地引網 (Edo Dragnet) the players represent fishers and are laying communal nets to catch 5 varieties of fish. Players will score +1 point each fish in the variety(s) they've collected the most of; 0 points for the fish(es) they've collected the least of; and -1 point for each additional fish.

On their turn, a player has 3 action points to spend from among laying nets; moving their boat; or moving a fisher. Fish are collected once an area has been enclosed, and afterwards, those net pieces are removed.

name: The Elder Scrolls: Call To Arms – Escape From Helgen
description:
Welcome to Tamriel – a realm of adventure and wonder. Where danger lies around every corner and where fame and fortune await the bold. It is a realm you can enter today, if you have the courage to answer the Call to Arms!

The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms is a tabletop wargame set against the epic, sprawling backdrop of Tamriel. From the teeming cities of Cyrodiil to the towering mountains of Skyrim, across the ash-plains of Morrowind, and through the steaming swamps of Black Marsh, you must lead your Party of bold warriors on the path to glory. In this game, you must select a mighty champion to lead your Party, surrounding them with heroes and staunch followers. Players can take on quests, unearth magical artifacts, and fight roaming monsters as they do battle against their opponent, using a combination of strength, stealth and magic to win the day. Call to Arms is a simple game to learn, but a challenge to master; your Party can be assembled in an almost endless variety of ways, each unlocking new tactics and abilities with which to test your skill as a commander and challenge your enemies.

Whether exploring trap-filled dungeons, or battling in some windswept wilderness, Tamriel is yours to explore – or exploit – as you see fit, building your forces to take on all comers. This rich setting gives players the opportunity for a vast array of different game types and play styles, as well as collecting and modeling highly detailed, characterful miniatures from The Elder Scrolls universe.

This FREE PDF contains basic tutorials for those who are new to tabletop wargames. The Rulebook contains the full rules, while the Quest Book contains scenarios that structure your gaming experience. This booklet leaves out the full tactical complexity of the game in order to ease you into the adventure, one mail-shod step at a time.

Experienced tabletop wargamers may prefer to dive straight into the Rulebook, whereas brand new players are encouraged to start here, learning the game step-by-
step. At each stage, once you feel you’ve got the idea, feel free to move on to the next tutorial.

The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms is played by moving and exploring with the models under your control, and attacking and defending against the enemy. As you play, you’ll be looking to complete Quests and claim battlefield Objectives in order to score points and assure victory.

—description from the publisher

name: Knights and Dragons
description:
Collect the Knights but watch out for the dragon in this fun matching game.

How many noble knights will you make?

Match and collect as many as you can but watch out for the dragon as he might scare your knights away!

Kids game where each turn you flip the top tile of the stack and hope to match the top half of a knight to the bottom half of a knight in your display with the goal to have the most completed knights by the end of the game. This is determined by 6 castle pieces being drawn from the stack. When the last one is drawn the game ends.

Dragons can be good or bad. An awake dragon takes one of your complete knights away. Whereas if you draw a sleepy dragon then you can claim all the knights that have been taken away previously.

name: Pirate's Mark: Parrghty Mode
description:
Parrghty Mode is an expansion pack that allows you to play with up to 15 players! Parrghty Mode increases the number of cards that are on the table to 168! (14x12 Grid instead of 13x10). Inside Parrghty Mode will be several exclusive and exciting new luck and curse cards.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Grid Movement, Push Your Luck

name: ΠΕΤΡΟΠΗΓΗ
description:
Monopoly style board game.

Buy oil-producing countries, build oil rigs and platforms and be the richest oil producer of the world.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Word Slap
description:
In Word Slap, players compete in a quick, play-anywhere word game of strategy and speed. Players contribute nouns to a collective pool and take turns giving clues as to a noun they chose. However, being silly and strange in clue-giving is a must, because the clue-giver gets points for each person who doesn't choose their clue. However, if nobody chooses their clue, they get nothing! If you are not the clue-giver, move fast; the first person to get the noun right also gets a point. Remove that noun and then change the clue-giver. Who will have the most points after a few rounds?

Word Slap is a free-to-play printable game designed during the COVID-19 crisis, and will remain available here and through the publisher's website forever, with continued support.

—description from the designer
categories: Party Game, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Splattosaurus
description:
Race through the prehistoric jungle to get to your dinosaurs home. Be careful - your opponent will try to SPLAT your dinosaurs.

In Splattosaurus, players draw a card from the draw deck and either move their dinosaur to the next matching color OR number on the path. If they draw a SPLAT card, then they will splat an opponent's dinosaur already on the path and draw a second card.

Splattosaurus plays similarly to Candy Land for movement with a take-that element added to it.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Pantone: The Game – Booster Pack 1
description:
Pantone: The Game - Booster Pack 1 adds 42 cards to the base game of guessing the fictional character based on the arrangement of color swatches; expanding the possibilities for new combinations. It also contains 6 blank cards so that you can add your own characters or other categories to the game.

Adds new Character Cards including pop culture icons like Beetlejuice, Yoda, Ariel, Bowser, Dalek, and Tyrion Lannister.

name: Kiki va sortir les poubelles
description:
The game where you have to come up with the most stupid excuses!
Players are flatmates and they have to decide who will take the bins out. To avoid the chore, everyone makes up an excuse with 1 action and 1 object to combine in one areas of the flat.
Do you have the worst excuse? The bin is for you!

name: Civil War Map Game
description:
An educational game where the player will master names, locations, important information and characteristics of cities, historical events, and geographical areas surrounding the United States civil war.

The game utilizes the following:
letter scramble
word search
data sheets with historical summaries
map (serves as the board)
cards

name: Welcome to Dinoworld: Dice Tower Duo Promo
description:
A duo promo set for Welcome to Dinoworld!

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Explorers Pack.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil

name: The Wizard of Oz
description:
Join Dorothy, The Tinman, The Scarecrow and The Cowardly Lion as they follow the Yellow Brick Road in search of the Emerald City.

Players travel from Munchkinland searching for 12 hidden treasures: the witches hat, the hour glass, the magic wand, the ruby slippers, and more.
Can you remember where each and every one is hidden? When the mighty Wizard of Oz requests a treasure, the players race to be the first to find and deliver it to the Emerald City.

The first player to locate and deliver 3 treasures to Oz is the winner

—description from the back of the box (English edition)

This game is very close to Enchanted Forest. The differences are: It is only for up to four players. There are only 12 items to be searched. There are no trees but square card board tiles. The German rules text is mostly identical word by word to the original. However, no designers are mentioned.
The German edition was published as a special commemorative edition on the occasion of a theater performance of "Der Zauberer von Oos".

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tactoo
description:
Every year in the Kingdom of Ludus there is a festival dedicated to fairy tales. But this year, during the night, some strange elements entered the stories, completely changing their meaning. Can you find these items? To do this, players will have to rely on their sense of touch, find the intruder and put the fairy tales in the correct order.

Tactoo encourages tactile, manual and attention skills.

name: in the mood
description:
in the mood is the second game from Stefan Breuer (head of youth welfare in Dorsten/Germany) which is offered for free download to the people during corona-pandemic.
The city of Dorsten wants to bring some fun for youth and families. The game can be played pnp and in videomeetings and so on.

in the mood is a partygame about music and emotions. What do you think about "Highway to hell" during a candle-light-dinner? Fits perfect, is okay oder never ever?!?
Can the other players imagine what you do feel?

—description from the designer

in the mood ist das zweite Spiel von Stefan Breuer (Jugendamtsleiter Dorsten), das umsonst zum Download den Menschen während der Corona-Pandemie geschenkt wird. Die Stad Dorsten will den Jugendlichen und Familien etwas Spaß vermitteln. Das Spiel kann als pnp zu Hause gespielt werden, aber auch in Videomeetings.
in the mood ist ein Partyspiel über Musik und Emotionen. Was denkst du über "Highway to hell" beim Candlelight-Dinner? Passt perfekt, ist okay oder geht gar nicht?!?
Werden die anderen Spieler erraten können, was du fühlst?

—description from the designer (German)

name: Ferien-Rallye
description:
Each player moves his car by roll of a die on a map of the Weserbergland, a region in Northern Germany. Each player starts at Hannover and draws 3 destination cards. When a player arrives at one of his destinations, he must stop, discards his card and draws an event card. The player who first stopped at all 3 destinations and returned to Hannover wins the game.
This game is part of a serie concerning several regions.

—user summary
mechanics: Action/Event, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: SkirmishCampaigns: Russia '41 – Ghosts at Smolensk
description:
SkirmishCampaigns:Russia 41-Ghosts at Smolensk is a complete book recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the German 7th Panzer "Ghost" Division and its titanic struggle around Smolensk in July 1941. This book is a partner to the previous release "France '40-The Ghost Division" as it features the same unit and is also the third book in a trilogy of books focused on the German invasion of Russia in 1941.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the German drive to Smolensk in July 1941.

Includes:

10 Scenarios,
4 Campaigns


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: SkirmishCampaigns: Russia '41 – Into the Ukraine
description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Russia '41-Into the Ukraine is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the armored clashes between German Panzer Divisions and Soviet Mechanized Corps in the invasion of the Ukraine in June-July 1941.

The book includes ten action-packed scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of three campaigns.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the Russian Campaign of 1941.

Includes:

10 Scenarios,
3 Campaigns


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Verkaufshit
description: The memo game for language lovers and wordsmiths. For 2 and more players. Playing time approx. 20 min. In the new memo game for language and pun lovers, pairs like "Bär" and "Tiger" result in the noun "BÄRTIGER". "Tang" and "Ente" become "TANGENTE", the nouns "Mode" and "Rat" form the German adjective "MODERAT". This game is full of surprises and trains the exact viewing of words. Each of the 36 pairs has its own background colour, which may be used as confirmation when searching for the correct word pairs. Only language grouches rely solely on the colours when searching for the pun pairs.

name: Diadochi Naval Rules
description:
Diadochi Naval Rules is a simple set of naval miniatures rules for fleet battles in the Diadochi (Alexandrian Successors) period.

Each side in the battle should consist of squadrons of 8 or more ships.
Ideally, an individual player should command each squadron.
A flagship is designated for each squadron.
Players secretly plot their initial locations on a sketch of the battle area, indicating formation, spacing and locations of flagships.

Scale:
40mm = 1 cable (607.56 ft), or 1:4630.
Designed for 1:1200 miniatures.

TURN SEQUENCE
1. First side command roll(s)
2. First side movement phase
3. First side missile fire
4. First side combat phase
5. Second side command roll(s)
6. Second side movement phase
7. Second side missile fire
8. Second side combat phase

—description from the designer + rules

name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass – Star Princess Candy
description:
Star Princess Candy is a Limited Edition Masterclass Miniature that can be used in your games of Super Dungeon and Rail Raiders Infinite!

CONTENTS:
1x Star Princess Candy Masterclass Miniature
1x Star Princess Candy Hero Card
1x Star Princess Candy Rail Raiders Infinite Card
1x 25mm Black Base

Take your Super Dungeon hobby to the next level with Super Dungeon: Masterclass! This premium line of resin models is specifically designed for hobby enthusiasts and gamers alike! Featuring Heroes and monsters from throughout the realms of Crystalia, these finely detailed miniatures bring the world of Super Dungeon to life as never before. Each Masterclass miniature includes cards that allow it to be used in your games of Super Dungeon!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Lift Off
description:
In this game, players make sets of not-matching cards.
Four cards are placed on the table. The rest of the cards are distributed between the players.

The cards are double-sided. Each side is either blue, green, or orange, and shows one, two or three objects (astronauts, moons, and rockets).

Everybody will simultaneously try to make (and then complete) sets of cards. To make a set of two cards, they have to have different objects, different numbers of objects, and different background colours. To complete the set, the third card has to be added (being different from both other cards in all aspects). Once you've completed a set, you collect it as a trick and get to play a new card to the table.
The game ends when someone plays their last card, or when no more plays can be made. The player with the most tricks wins.

—user summary

name: Warhammer Age Of Sigmar (Second Edition): Chaos Battletome – Maggotkin of Nurgle
description:
Nurgle is the Chaos God of plagues, whose power waxes strong when disease and despair ravage the Mortal Realms. Though he is a source of fear and revulsion to his enemies, Nurgle is a perversely paternal god, generous with his foul gifts and proud of his worshippers’ every disgusting achievement. His armies, both mortal and daemon, bulge with virulent boons. The twisted and disfigured, the spiteful and forsaken, the hopelessly insane – these Maggotkin spread the joyous filth and bountiful contagions, hoping to turn the whole of the Mortal Realms into a single garden of beautiful putrescence.

In the 104-page hardback Battletome: Maggotkin of Nurgle, you’ll find:

- Grandfather Nurgle: disturbingly cheerful background information on the most plaguesome of Chaos Gods, delving into his fraught relationship with the other gods, his hideous and bloated physical form and his obsession with the lush, inexhaustible cornucopia of Ghyran;
- The Garden of Nurgle: a horribly detailed description of Nurgle’s domain within the Realm of Chaos;
- Details of the Daemons of Nurgle, from Plaguebearers to Great Unclean Ones, describing their foul methods of war, along with descriptions of Nurgle’s vast armies of mortal followers;
- Armies of the Plague God: the organisation and structure of Nurgle’s armies – the Plague Legions and the Rotbringer Contagiums;
- Warbands of the Plague God: descriptions, sigils and colour schemes for 6 specific Nurgle warbands – The Munificent Wanderers, The Befouling Host, The Droning Guard, The Blessed Sons, The Drowned Men and the Filthbringers;
- Annals of Entropy: a timeline of significant battles and events in the history of Nurgle’s forces;
- Detailed background on the forces available to Nurgle, including mortals and daemons;
- A showcase of beautifully-painted Citadel miniatures, with an example Maggotkin army.

Rules

All the rules you need in order to get your Maggotkin army ready for the gaming table are here:

- 24 Warscrolls, covering mortal and daemon followers alike;
- Allegiance Abilities representing the foul gifts that Nurgle’s patronage bestows – including the Cycle of Corruption, a table of filthy boons that will prove advantageous; the Garden of Nurgle, featuring rules for Feculent Gnarlmaws; and rules for summoning daemons using accrued Contagion Points;
- Command Traits for Rotbringers, daemon and mortal followers – 6 each;
- Artefacts of Power for Rotbringers, daemon and mortal followers – 6 each;
- The Lores of Nurgle: spells for daemon and mortal Nurgle wizards, including Foul Regenesis, a spell known by all Nurgle wizards; Lore of Malignance – 3 spells available to any Rotbringer wizard; Lore of Virulence – 3 spells available to any Nurgle daemon Wizard; and Lore of Foulness – 3 spells available to any Nurgle mortal wizard;
- Rules for creating a Nurgle warband to use in a Path to Glory campaign, including Followers Rewards Table, Champion Rewards Table and Patronage of Nurgle Tables (featuring lesser, greater and exalted rewards);
- A specific Battleplan – Seeds of Corruption – for use with Maggotkin armies;
- 8 Warscroll Battalions conferring advantages for fielding certain combinations of models;
- Pitched Battle Profiles for all units featured in this Battletome, including unit sizes, points values and battlefield roles.
categories: Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Pillow Fort
description:
You are a child building a pillow fort in your house.

The objective of each Night is to make it to sunrise (6am) without letting your fear get out of control. There may or may not be a real Grue out there, so it’s best to shore up your defences and keep it at bay. A true tale of childhood and cowardice, presented as a dice-rolling geometric puzzle with various scenarios.

A pen/pencil and four six-sided dice are required. This solo game is played on one printed-out page that presents an 11x11 grid and trackers for Fear, Flashlight, Time, Structures, and Re-Rolls.

Each hour of the Night represents one round where you will take two build actions. The four dice are rolled and separated strategically to target co-ordinates between (2,2) and (12,12). By putting up blankets, cushions, cords and clothespins between the furniture, you try to protect yourself from winds arriving from different directions each round. If the chill wind has any path to reach your character, it creeps up your spine and raises your fear level. If you make it to 6am without letting your fear build up, you have outwitted the Grue and can tally your score.

You are encouraged to play each scenario and aim to achieve the highest medal scores. There are 5 Nights that take place in different rooms. Some rooms have special rules such as the flashlight batteries hidden in the office or the collapsing old furniture in the basement.
categories: Dice, Number, Print & Play, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Re-rolling and Locking, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Dicing with Death: Tabletop Wargame Rules for Gladiatorial Combat
description:
Dicing with Death is a set of quick play gladiatorial rules, written by experienced wargamer Derek Henderson. Played on an off set square grid (you can use hexes if you prefer) the game has an original combat system that uses both luck, skill and bluff. Players each have a set of 5 dice, and the innovative combat system uses concealed dice rolls as the players attempt to outscore their opponents using holds and re-rolls based on the gladiator’s skill level. The game covers all the known gladiator types who fought each other from the simple secutor with a shield to gladiators with whips and lassos. Record keeping is simple and kept to a minimum. The rules include a straight forward career progression system for both individual gladiators or training schools. Ideal for a quick game in an evening or a prolonged campaign over several meetings. As with all "Wargaming for Grown Ups" rules they include a comprehensive Quick Reference Sheet on the back cover.

Includes full list of gladiator types and details, player records sheets and proforma arena grids.

—description from publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Kreigspeil: A Mimic Battle With Miniature Soldiers
description:
Kreigspeil (sic) is a game played with miniatures, but not using a standard type of miniatures rules. It is played on a board with a square grid; a board layout is provided (which needs to be replicated on a 3'x5' surface), but others could be devised. There are always two sides; with more than two players each side is controlled by a team.

Players choose their forces using a points system and set up in secret. After that players alternate turns; on a turn a player may move all of their units according to their movement allowances and then may play a bonus card for additional movement. Firing is conducted afterwards. Players have five minutes to complete each turn.

Bonus cards are drawn from a standard 52-card deck; players start with a hand of these, get a new one each turn, and get more for things such as having remaining time on their turns, capturing certain regions, etc. Most of the cards are used for additional movement but aces are used for additional cannon shots.

Combat is conducted using dice.

Victory is assessed by points: points are awarded for capturing sectors of the board (the 6x6 squares) and specific board features, with additional points awarded for killed enemy units.

Optional rules are provided for hospitals and corpsmen, and a set of "Junior Battle" rules is provided for younger players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Knot Tying Game: Boater's Challenge
description:
Practice tying dozens of boating-related knots in this game for 2-4 players. One card is turned face-up, and players race to be the first to tie the knot shown on that card, with the provided ropes and tying bars. The first player to complete that knot wins the number of points shown on that card. Once all the cards have been played, the winner is the player with the highest total points.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Nautical, Real-time

name: UnberechenBER Das verrückte Flughafenspiel
description:
Now it is finally here: The modern airport construction simulation!

Build an international airport and bring it online! Burn as many taxpayer dollars as possible: money doesn't matter!

Prove your expertise in eight sub-projects. Complete the largest infrastructure project since time immemorial. Take responsibility now!

But be careful!
It's not as simple as it sounds. Your resources are limited and unpredictable events always cause setbacks: managing directors come and go, the supervisory wheel is turned, escalators are suddenly too short and the fire smoke simply does not want to move through the basement. Sometimes you have to compromise to get there!

-- translation of publisher's description

This game is inspired by actual incidents in the construction of the Berlin Brandenburg airport.

name: Pingüi Land
description:
All of us have to make sure that Pingüi reaches the iceberg before the snow monster in order to escape the island and not get caught in the avalanche.
Cooperation game, to win the game, we should bring the penguin to the Iceberg before the avalanche catch us or before the Snow Monster arrives to the Iceberg before the penguin.

name: Flugten til Rødovre
description:
It is the 1980s and the Cold War has turned hot. As civil authorities can you facilitate the evacuation of Copenhagen prior to an expected nuclear attack.

Cooperative game about the evacuation of 90,000 people from Copenhagen before the bombs begin to fall.

—user summary

name: Tommy's wereldspel
description:
In this game you have to deliver packages around the world. You start with only a small van which can only hold one package, later on in the game you can buy a truck, which holds three packages, and a plane with room for two, but which can travel a lot further. Each turn you throw two dies to determine what you are allowed to do this turn: drive (this includes flying), get a new deliverance order, get a quality card, or choose one of the above. The world map is divided in squares, each square costs hunderd euros to travel over. Each deliverance order costs you a starting fee, but once you delivered the goods, you get paid.
The first person who maken 50.000 euros wind the game.

Content: game board - play money - 40 shipments - 12 game pieces - 12 transport tokens - 4 depots - 4 petrol stations - 4 player cards - 54 quality cards - 56 shipment cards - 2 dice - game rules.

name: Dad Joke Face-Off 2nd Ed
description:
Get ready for the 2nd edition of the popular game with the best worst jokes you've ever heard! Inspired by the hit internet sensation, this hysterical party game will test your ability to make others laugh or stop yourself from doing so. We've all groaned or rolled our eyes after hearing ""dad jokes"" before, but, when the pressure is on, can you stop yourself from laughing or even cracking a smile?

In Dad Joke Face-Off, two players sit face to face and take turns telling jokes. Read a Dad Joke off of your card and do so WITHOUT SMILING OR LAUGHING, while trying to get your opponent to crack. Sounds pretty simple? Don't take our word for it, get your friend and family together and see who laughs... or doesn't laugh the most!

When a player smiles or laughs, their opponent gives them a ""Made you laugh"" card. The player with the least Made you laugh cards wins the round. Continue to Face Off with other opponents to see who has the best (or worst) sense of humor with the game you can't help but laugh at!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Killer Party: Kiss of Death
description:
Who murdered the reality show bride? Compete against your friends to solve this celebrity crime in Killer Party’s Kiss of Death! Six to twelve amateur sleuths can play this whodunit party game. To crack the case, collect Clue Cards and use your deductive skills to piece together the events of the crime. But there’s one catch: the only way to get a Clue Card is by performing a crazy stunt! What will you do to get a clue? You and your fellow detectives work your way through three envelopes, until someone solves the case! Sure to get increasingly wacky and hilarious, Killer Party is equal parts fun and challenging! You must use your deductive reasoning and strategic thinking in order to score points and find the bride’s killer! At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins! In the event of a tie, you’ll have to take on another mystery – like Killer Party’s Fangs for the Memories! Will you be the one to crack the case? Test your sleuthing skills with Killer Party’s Kiss of Death: the social mystery party game!

—description from the publisher

name: All or Nothing card game
description:
A 12-slice pizza has been ordered. Everyone is hungry and wants to eat the entire pizza on their own. The game captures the tussle that follows. The winner of each round gets to eat the whole pizza.

> Party scene


There is a 12-slice pizza on the table. All the players want the entire pizza to themselves.
Each player can add or subtract slices by playing a card.
The player to complete 12 slices gets the whole pizza.


> Type of cards


Green cards: can be used to add slices.
Red cards: can be used to subtract slices. By playing a red


card you remove slices from the pizza.

Black cards: can be used to add or subtract as you wish, you have to speak out while playing the card.
Double-order card: If a player plays the double-order card, it means the players have to complete 24 slices to win the round.
On the house card: If a player plays this card, it means they have a special coupon for that round. If they can complete the pizza they will get double points of the number of cards there are in the center. In case another player completes the pizza, this card expires and becomes useless for the player who played it.


—description from the publisher

name: COVID Survivor
description:
A deadly virus is seeping throughout the entire globe and is about to infect YOU! How will you protect yourself? Will you play your cards right? The coronavirus is highly contagious and your only chance of survival is how you play the game!

Will you handle social distancing activities seriously? Have you stocked up on toilet paper and hand sanitizer? Are you wearing PPE? Let's hope so because your COVID survival can go from minor to fatal in just a few plays!

On their turn, each player rolls a die to see if they become infected or their health worsens. Then, play action cards to mitigate the chances of infection, or increase other players' chances of infection. Use PPE cards to protect yourself, and collect sets of Social Distancing cards to take special actions. If you reach the bottom of the track, you have died. The last player left alive wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That

name: Hey, Emily!
description:
Emily and Karl went for a hike in the mountains. Emily isn't really an outdoor girl, but she loves him and didn't want to argue again.
The trail is long, they are geared Karl said. It was all fun until they got lost.

Karl is still missing, it’s been 3 days now.
Hey, Emily! Listen up! He said...I’m going to
find a shelter or a way out, we’ll be fine...

I’m alone! He said he’d never leave me!
I’m scared... I want to go home.
I’ve gotta move now. God help me.

Hey, Emily! is a small 1 solo game you'll play with a couple of dice, paper and pencil.
You need to help Emily to stay alive and safe from threats.
And possibly you need to help Emily to reach back to the cabin where it all started, a 6 days walk from her current position.

Using 2 dice, you'll roll on various tables. Gain, loose or spend resources, try your luck while helping Emily on her way back home. Every day is composed by 3 day actions and 3 night actions. If you survive, mark one day and try the next one.

Arrive alive at the morning of the 7th day, and you're safe.

—description from the designer

name: かぐや姫を笑わせて (Kaguya hime wo warawasete)
description:
かぐや姫を笑わせて (Kaguya hime wo warawasete), meaning 'Make Princess Kaguya Laugh', is a Japanese word game.

Kaguya-hime (Princess Kaguya) has lost her smile, due to the rush of courting men who would ask her favor. Her grandfather decides to hold an entertainment party to let her laugh.

The players play the role of entertainers who join the party and must present the themes that are thrown out by the old man, and the demands from the unhappy princess. Who will win the smile from the princess?

殺到する求愛者たちのストレスから笑わなくなったかぐや姫。爺は自慢の姫に笑ってもらおうと余興会を催します。プレイヤーたちは参加芸人となり、爺からのお題とちょっと病んだ姫から出されるお願いに応えねばなりませゆ。誰がかぐや姫の笑いを勝ち取るのでしょうか。
user summary

name: SLAPZI: SNAPZI
description:
With numerous small thumbnails or "snapshots" of full-sized pictures on a card, try to find matches from your game cards faster than the other players. Be the first player to play all of your cards to win. The various "snapshots" are taken from the original "SLAPZI" game's full-size photos. It's a new take on the fast-moving original game, which you'll need in order to play this expansion.

INCLUDES: 60 double-sided snapshot cards that contain 18 different images snapped from the regular SLAPZI picture cards and instructions.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time

name: Oxford Opoly
description:
A fun game celebrating the home of Miami University.

The game includes:

Tokens: shoe, heart, smile, hand, dog, pretzel.

Locations: Ghost of Fisher Hall, The Water Tower, High Street, Temple Barber Shop, Bikewise, Farmer's Market, Oxford Coffee Company, Wild Berry, Oxford Lanes, Bagel & Deli, Bruno's Pizza, Mac & Joe's, Indian Ridge Golf Course, Aquatic Center, Talawanda High School, Pefer Park, The Goggin, Oxford Country Club.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Where Humans Don't Belong
description:
Where Humans Don't Belong is a deep space exploration game in which you are trying to escape the unknown galaxy into which your damaged starship has been thrust. Explore uncharted space, board derelict freighters, land on ringworlds and other amazing locations — all while being hunted by an alien dreadnought intent on your destruction. The fate of your ship and her crew lies in your hands!

At the start of the game, you name your ship, choose its loadout, and pick the bridge crew. They will encounter awesome galactic horrors and fight battles in space as well as on the surfaces of strange alien planets. The game features a negotiation system so that you can attempt to talk your way out of sticky situations using translator tech, rather than always relying on your fusion pistol sidearm, although it's nice to have a backup plan.

The game includes more than thirty maps of derelict starships, ringworlds, and exoplanet surfaces, and while primarily a solitaire game, Where Humans Don't Belong also provides rules for a two-player co-operative experience.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Horror, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Map Addition, Move Through Deck, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Sudden Death Ending

name: Partition
description:
An abstract roll-and-write game for one or more where players group like numbers together across two grids. Originally designed for the 2017 GenCan't Roll-and-Write contest.

Each turn, 3 six-sided dice are rolled. All players simultaneously split those dice into two groups - one pair and one single die. The pair is placed on the larger grid where adjacent spaces must match at least one number. The single die is placed on the smaller grid, where players are trying to form areas of identical numbers to score points. After 30 rolls, the game ends. Connections on the larger grid that do not have adjacent matching numbers are "blocks" and lose points. Areas of identical numbers on the smaller grid gain points. Highest score wins.

Components
3 six-sided dice
1 score sheet per player
1 pencil per player

-description from designer

name: Komojo
description: In Komojo you have 45 seconds to have your team guess the words on your cards (ex: "fail your parallel parking" ; "non-alcoholic cocktail"). Depending on the current phase, you can only talk or mime or draw. And to make things even harder and fun, you'll need to follow various restrictions drawn randomly (ex: "talk with your tongue out" ; "talk only by whispering").
mechanics: Action Drafting, Communication Limits, Real-Time, Team-Based Game

name: Crossroads
description:
If you want to improve your guitar, go to the crossroads just before midnight and play the guitar by yourself.

Quick playing hand management game - draw a card, then play a card... hold the card.. or pass to another player. Will you be the one to release the best selling album in one of seven genres of music - or will you be left with a bunch of unreleased recordings in your hand at games end?

name: Tha-Ga-Kaffee-Spiel: Abenteuerliche Reise einer Kaffeebohne
description:
The players travel from Space 1 to space 100. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zemo's Journey
description:
Zemo's Journey is a roll-and-write game introduced in the 2020 4th Roll-and-Write competition. In this game, the player helms the Tritus and sails across a treacherous ocean to find treasure, combat fearsome monsters of the deep, and protect (or plunder!) towns that dot the seascape. With multiple maps and starting conditions, each game offers a unique adventuring experience. And to play again, simply erase the board (or print out a new one) and start sailing!

In each turn, the player rolls dice and, using a unique movement mechanic, plots a course across the map. When that course encounters a monster, island, or another ship, the player resolves a combat, discovers treasure, or perhaps repairs damage. The captain's log allows the player to track resources and encounters as well as the current level of Danger. By carefully managing damage to the ship and keeping the cannons fully stocked, the player just may survive until the end of the game.

After the final turn, the player scores victory points based on both the resolved encounters but also on the Motivation chosen at the start of the game. Each Motivation scores encounters differently and also offers a unique bonus. As an Adventurer, Protector, or Plunderer, the total score will determine whether Zemo gains the glory he quests for. Or will he end up in a forgotten watery grave?

-description from designer

name: Black Stories: Nightmare on Christmas
description: How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party. This version of the black stories includes 50 cards with riddles about deadly Christmas.

name: Tyr's Treasure
description:
A gambling game created to be used inside of fantasy role playing games as a plot hook, but it can also be played as a stand alone game. Players roll custom metal dice with special symbols replacing the 1's. Depending on the roll, they might pay into the pot, take from the pot, or be eliminated entirely. The last player in the game takes the entire pot.

From the rulebook:

Tyr's Treasure is a game of chance for use with any Role-Playing System. The rules are designed for 1-6 players. The game is played with two handmade brass six-sided dice that are cast across your favorite tavern table.

Some like knuckle bones, Troll's Teeth, or Dragon Scales, and the Coastal folk prefer Golem's Gambit, but warriors abroad love the chance and excitement of Tyr's Treasure.

name: Golem's Gambit
description:
A gambling game created to be used inside of fantasy role playing games as a plot hook, but it can also be played as a stand alone game.

The game uses six custom metal four-sided dice, each showing two blanks, one x, and one double x. Players roll all the dice, re-rolling single x's until all dice are blank or double x. Then the blanks are discarded, and the player makes one final roll with the remaining dice to find out of they multiply their winnings or lose it all.

The game is weighted in favor of the player.

name: Black Stories: Tödliche Weihnachten
description:
How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party.

"Black stories: Tödliche Weihnachten" is a very special advent calendar. There are 24 riddles to shorten the time until Christmas.

name: Sverige frågespel: Resespel
description:
Answer questions about Sweden in these topics: History, Culture, Nature, Geography, Sports and Mixed.

Subject for question is indicated by a roll of the dice and if you answer correctly, you can cross over the corresponding color on your form. The first player to complete a row with five crosses wins.

The questions are written by Dan Glimne, a well-known Swedish game designer.

name: The Precursors (Fan Expansion for Magic: The Gathering)
description:
Magic: The Gathering - The Precursors is a cooperative board game and card variant of the classic, competitive card game that has players work together in an epic campaign that can span several gaming sessions. It utilizes a slightly altered Commander (EDH) format of MTG.

Similar to Dungeons & Dragons, a Dungeon Master — or a Game Master (GM), in this case — guides up to four other players on a series of six quests, each of which takes about two to three hours to complete.

The players start in one of the zones. If it’s the Red zone, they’ll be facing a Red or Multicoloured commander; the Blue zone, they’ll be facing a Blue or Multicoloured commander; etc. Each quest features a new enemy deck, so no two quests are ever the same.

The GM is given certain card and life advantages over the Precursor heroes, and it is the goal of the Precursors to defeat the GM while working together. Also of note is that the game allows the GM to also play as one of the heroes if they’re up to it. This means that the game supports up to five players.

The game is quite affordable as it allows cards from every single MTG set. The players make their decks with whatever cards they want to use, a single commander (Legendary Creature) overseeing the army of cards.

The board game consists of five different phases, two of which are almost identical to traditional duels. The game’s pretty simple to learn for veteran Magic players, and not much more difficult than the card game itself for new Magic players.

NOTE: This game is unofficial, of course.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking, Role Playing

name: Bricks & Brutes
description:
Players race to complete their castle wall to their unique wall plan - the first one to complete their wall wins.

A players turn has three parts - first the player moves bricks from their unused brick pile up onto their castle wall. If the player has one Mason, they can move one brick. Two Masons - move two bricks.

The second part of a turn is when the player can use gold they have collected to buy more bricks for their unused pile, and hire more Masons (to help them build faster) and Brutes (to defend the unused brick pile and the player's Masons from the dragon).

The final part of the players turn is rolling a 1d10 - the DieOfFate. The die can get the player more gold and bricks, as well as three other possibilities: "Brute" - where (if you have Brutes) you can steal from another players unused brick pile, "Dragon" - where you send the dragon to eat another player's Brutes (or their Mason if they have no Brutes), and "Queen" - where everyone hands their unique castle wall plan to the player to their right - this means you could be one turn from winning with the final brick suddenly you need to reorganize the bricks on the top two levels of your wall.

The game goes fast and the twists and turns of the DieOfFate makes the game "self-leveling", everyone ends the game only a few turns from winning - nobody is completely and catastrophically behind when the game ends.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Take That, Tile Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Ridley's Ding it
description:
Players sit in a circle and place the game bell in the center and decide on the length of the game (i.e. how many cards to claim). Short games are 3-4 cards while longer games consist of 6-7 card totals.

Players are contestants that answer ten rapid fire yes or no questions without hesitation to claim (win) the card. The trick is that contestants are not allowed to simply say "yes" or "no" nor repeat any of their previous answers from the round. When answering the question, a player needs to think of an answer that goes beyond a simple yes or no. For example, a contestant may be asked "Do you like ice hockey?" An appropriate response could be "More than baseball". When rules are broken, other players ding the bell and steal the card. The contestant with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Cretaceous: A Dinosaur Hunting Adventure
description:
Take on the role of mercenaries sent back in time to capture dinosaurs. Explore the map by revealing tiles that get more dangerous the further you go from your base. Will you push your luck only to run into a pack of hungry raptors? Or will you bring back the biggest prize in 65 million years?

Cretaceous is a 2-4 player game where players take turns exploring the map, capturing dinosaurs, and returning them back to the present. During the game you will gather items and allies to help you as well as encounter dangerous events.

When exploring the map players draw tiles of a threat level based on how far they have traveled from the base. The tile revealed will then either have the player draw and resolve an event card, or draw a dinosaur from a threat level bag of the same level.

Five dice are then rolled to determine successes at events and capture attempts. Different colors are needed for different rolls, like capturing a carnivore or a herbivore. But be careful, if you are knocked out before returning to the gate base tile your dinosaurs will escape! How far will you press your luck when the other players can sabotage you or even cause carnivores to attack?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Modular Board, Pieces as Map, Tile Placement

name: Slime Time
description:
These dungeon slime are sick and tired of being treated as second-tier enemies defeated only for experience. Their plan? Combine to form the biggest slime boss! The player with the biggest slime boss wins! This take that card game for 2-5 players is fun for the whole family and comes with 54 cards (1 rule card).
The objective of the game is simple: have the most point values in your slime deck. Each turn, players can perform 3 total actions. The actions are: Place a slime in your slime deck, or play the effect of a card. If a card's effect is played, follow the effect and send it to the discard (if applicable). The game ends when the deck runs out of cards.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Take That
publishers: Meet Me At The Table Games

name: The Final Word
description:
The Final Word is an expandable collection of cool, clever, and challenging games for all who love word play in a single deck of 120 cards. Games combine puzzle-solving, word creation skills, and quick thinking. There are games of solitaire and games for the whole family. As with a traditional card deck, The Final Word is a bevy of games in one take-it-anywhere deck.

Games ranging from easy to expert can be learned in two minutes without a laborious list of rules. There are a handful of key principles that apply to all games and a group of five groovy moves in combinations specific to each game iteration. Games vary in length and space needed to play from sitting side-by-side at the bar to covering the entire dining room table.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Set Collection, Spelling

name: Relicers
description:
Let’s Dig!

Buried in the earth, the relics of an ancient civilization are the riches of the Steam Factory.

Let’s dig more!

Those working in the factories above do not know the joys of venturing underground.

Dig, collect, share, take it back, make it, dig it again.

Yes, we are Relicers!


The game of Relicers takes place over a series of five rounds consisting of the following four phases:

Excavation: tear three pieces from your digging sheet and fold them up into hidden excavation pieces

Distribution: Draft three excavation pieces, one at a time in clockwise order.

Development: Use the relics from the excavation pieces to develop new technology to help with future rounds.

Cash: Gain the gold found and earned through the round. Gold is the points in the game.

The player with the most gold at the end of five rounds is the winner!

name: Flagment Dig Rayn
description:
Flagment Dig Rayn is a doujin trading card game designed by doujin group Eternity Satellite.
In this game, playes fight with the opponent using a deck of cards and a leader card out of the deck. The goal of the game is to defeat the opponent's leader.
Unlike most trading card games, this game has a board with 19 hexagons, in which characters can move, and each character has a attack range.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Apocalypse II
description:
Imperial Armour - Apocalypse II is a supplement for the Warhammer 40,000 expansion Apocalypse. It provides updated rules for numerous Forge World miniatures and a few missions to play.

Five different missions for use in Apocalypse games:
The Killing Ground
The Bloody Last Stand
Line Breaker
Rolling Thunder
A Clash of Titans

name: Corruptopolis
description:
In Corruptopolis you will put your knowledge to the test and learn about the main cases of political corruption in Spain. Different and ironic tests will take you to Villa Corrupta, where you must show how attentive you have been to the present news.

Objective:

Arrive at Villa Corrupta and correctly answer a question in each case, first going through the Basic Guide to the Corrupted and the National Attractions that consist of different types of tests where the teams must give free rein to their imagination to try to deceive the other team or fulfill other goals, depending on the test.

—description from the designer (translated)


Corruptopolis es un juego de mesa en el que comprobarás tus conocimientos y podrás aprender sobre los principales casos de corrupción política en España. Diferentes e irónicas pruebas te llevarán a Villa Corrupta, donde deberás demostrar lo atenta o atento que has estado a la actualidad.

Objetivo:

Llegar a Villa Corrupta y responder correctamente una pregunta de cada caso, pasando antes por la Guía Básica del Corrupto y los Atractivos Nacionales que constan de diferentes tipos de pruebas donde los equipos deberán dar rienda suelta a su imaginación para intentar engañar al otro equipo o conseguir otros fines, dependiendo de la prueba.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Command Cards, Lose a Turn, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: AIEOU
description:
Can you spell faster than your opponents by grabbing the correct vowel piece? Can you lay down correct vowel cards or spot matching vowels faster than your opponents? Or maybe the only way to win is by yelling…AIEOU! (pronounced as AY-YO)

AIEOU is an educational spelling game that incorporates multisensory elements. Playable in 4 different ways, AIEOU offers 4 different games catered to children from as young as 7 years of age to adults. Each game stimulates different faculties such as hand & eye coordination, mental & physical reflexes, analytics and memory. The 4 games are as listed below:

i) Grab It!
It’s helter-skelter in Grab It! Players rush to be the first to grab a specific missing vowel in the word of a played card. But beware! If that missing vowel matches the top vowel card on the deck, yell AIEOU (pronounced as AY-YO) instead! Player with the most cards wins. Grab It! sharpens a player’s eye, hand and mental coordination as it combines picture-word recognition and spelling with logic deduction and motor reflexes.

ii) Speed Spells
Picture playing musical chairs…but through spelling! In Speed Spells, players race to lay down correct vowel cards to spell out the word of a played card before grabbing any vowel piece for themselves. However, the last player to do this is left without a vowel piece to grab and is penalised with the card instead. Player with the least cards wins. Speed Spells combines picture-word recognition and spelling with fast physical reflexes in an exciting and fun manner.

iii) Match’em!
What do you get when you combine the classic game of Snap with spelling? Out comes Match’em! In this game, players try to identify matching vowels in played out cards. When a match occurs, players rush to grab a centre vowel piece. The player who manages this wins the pile of cards that have the matching sets of cards on top of them. Player with the most cards wins. Match’em! stimulates players to quickly observe and analyse played out words.

iv) Memory Buzz
Can your mind stop buzzing around and focus on memorising? In Memory Buzz, players attempt to memorise not only the objects of the played cards, but also the number and sequence of each object. A player can be challenged by shouting out AIEOU if he or she is caught recalling objects wrongly. Player with the least cards wins. This game trains players to focus and memorise in a fun-filled way!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Real-time
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching, Spelling

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fourth Edition): Codex – Black Templars
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Tactical Hack
description:
Bring you tabletop into the modern age!

Tactical Hack is an operational level supplement to add cyber warfare to modern, contemporary, and future/scifi conflicts.
You bring your favorite tabletop game, and we'll bring the cyber domain to it.

Players carry out one draw and play action during their opponent's turn to provision then later launch cyber attacks in the game.
The effects of the offensive cyber operations are written to be compatible with most game systems (after 3 years of playtesting, we haven't found one where they don't work).

The base game plays easy and light and there are variants to build just the right cyber environment for your tabletop battles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Burakito
description:
Burakito is the gateway to the world of Buraco.
It consists of three different levels so that the little ones learn to play gradually until they can have a game of Buraco with their parents and friends.

The game consists of placing tiles on the game board to form sets of neighboring animals, both of the same number and in consecutive numbers.

Every time a player forms a set, she obtains a victory point. If during her move she forms two sets at the same time, she obtains one point for each set.

When all the tiles have been placed on the board, the player who has obtained the most victory points throughout the game wins.

There is a variant to play with special tiles that allow actions such as stealing from an opponent, playing twice in a row or skipping an opponent.

name: Tanks: Mechanics Kit
description:
Before a tank is ready to go to war it must be assembled by a team of skilled mechanics, using only the best tools. Having a mechanic on your crew is even more useful! They know their tanks inside and out and can get them back up and running after almost any hit.

The Mechanics Kit includes an exclusive TANKS crew card. The Skilled Mechanic crew card will only be available in this Kit.

This pack contains:
1x Plastic Glue
1x Clippers
1x File
1x Skilled Mechanic Crew Card - Text says: This tank passes Repair Damage rolls on a result of 3, 4, 5, or 6.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Paw Patrol Ultimate Rescue: Save the Forest
description: Help Marshall save the forest! In this fun preschool game, kids collaborate to put out fires with their favorite pup. Play solo or with up to four players and take turns spinning the arrow on the board. If the arrow lands on a flame, place a flame-piece on the forest cards. If the arrow lands on a water drop, remove a flame piece. Once all the flames have been removed from a forest card, you've saved The forest! If all the flame spaces on a forest card are filled, this forest burns up. But don't forget – you've got your trusty Pup pal to help out! If the dial lands on Marshall, move the Marshall figure (included) to the forest card. If Marshall is on a forest card, It can never have flames added to it. Once all four forest cards have been saved or lost, calculate your score to see how you and Marshall did. A great way to encourage teamwork, This fun game lets kids embark on an exciting mission with their favorite pup. Help Marshall on an ultimate rescue with the save the forest board game!

name: Star Travelers: The Game
description:
Players begin the game preparing for their journey by finding and training crew, upgrading their ship, and gathering supplies. Once all players have had a chance to get ready, you each set out into space, revealing tiles by using your ship's radar to discover planets, face aliens, and encounter random events along the way. Throughout the game, your actions will earn you rank marks that will determine the winner. Played on a modular board that is built as you play, Star Travelers combines classic mechanics with modern, modular components to keep game play fresh every time you play. Based on the sci-fi book series by author K. E. Knights.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Resource to Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: The Advertising Game
description:
This is a rare game of advertising that was apparently released by an advertising agency.
Each player represents an ad agency of which there are 3 types (market oriented, heavy service and creative). The type can impact the ability to get certain types of accounts.

The board is a layout of Manhattan with players starting at Grand Central Station. Each city block is a square (actually a rectangle as it represents the short and long blocks in Manhattan from 42nd to 56th and from York to 5th Ave). The blocks contain the name of prospective advertising accounts with an entrance on one street or a Fluke. Movement is in any direction but must follow the one way streets.

When landing on Fluke you draw a card. When landing on an account you may solicit the account by drawing a card based on whether the account already has an ad agency. The odds of getting the account are 50/50 if it has no agency and 1/3 of stealing an account. You can protect your accounts from being stolen by adding a "creative team" (Spend more money when winning the account and make less when getting commission since you have to pay the team).

Accounts have names based on real companies such as Croke, Hineykins Beer, Sunka Coffee and you can never have 2 accounts for similar products at the same time.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Investment, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Green, Chems & Steel
description:
As an agent for hire you’re tasked with expiring a number of Synthetic beings known to be operating in the City.

During the game you will visit locations and perform tasks in the optimum order to bring in the most Synthetics before the other agents.

Green, Chems & Steel is played over a number of rounds until one player has expired the majority of the synthetics.

On your turn you draw 1 location card, plus the number of location bonuses on your player card. You also collect 1 resource of your choice, plus the number of resource bonuses on your player card. You then spend resources to complete the locations cards in the order of your choice.

Some locations will cause you to deactivate your player bonuses, others will set traps for other players. Any locations you cannot complete may provide bonuses for the other player(s).

At the end of your turn you discard all resources down to 1 plus any discard bonuses on your player card. All the completed locations are discarded and the next player takes their turn.

The game ends instantly if a player has expired the majority of synthetics.

name: Kuzushi Hugs & Kisses
description:
Kuzushi (coo-zoo-she) "Hugs & Kisses" is easy to learn and challenging to master. It's a portable game of balance and control that keeps you on your toes. You and your opponent place "Hugs & Kisses" (X & O cards) to build and control a 6x6 board. Bases influence adjacent squares and flags show who has the most bases nearby. Win by filling the board with more cards of your color or be the first to play your last card.

-description from publisher's website

name: Deplorables The Game
description:
Whether you’re Democrat, Republican or somewhere in the middle, Deplorables The Game is a bipartisan election game we can all play together. To win, players will have to buy Democrat, Republican and Bipartisan political cards to accumulate 270 electoral votes. But beware, this game is fraught with dangers like Drain The Swamp and FBI Investigations!

Here's how the game works:
