•Players start the game choosing either a Democrat or Republican candidate with a matching Endorsement Card and $1,200 to fund their campaign.

•The first political twist comes in the player’s choice to purchase Obamacare or not, which affects game play down the road, because players that opt out can be penalized. Players must then roll dice, land on a space, and buy the matching political card worth 20 electoral votes. The bipartisan spaces, like the CIA or Women’s March space, are worth more electoral votes – so try to buy those first!


•The spinner allows players to move the voter token around the wheel in the center of the board for extra goodies. Players can get cash, bonus points or are empowered to “Drain The Swamp,” stealing two political cards from an opponent.

•Players can also receive Kremlin Cash to help fund their campaign, but might find themselves the subject of an FBI investigation down the road, losing $500 and two political cards.

•The October Surprise Win: The final stage of the game is the October Surprise. This occurs when all the political spaces are owned, and there is nothing left to buy. Whenever a "Super Tuesday" is triggered on the board, the two players with the least number of electoral votes are forced to roll off against each. The player with the lowest roll is eliminated from in the game. This continues until one player has enough votes to win or is the last player standing.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Catch the Leader, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Finale Ending, Income, Loans, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Trading, Voting

name: Match 'Em Up
description:
Players work to match a community deck and their own deck to the grid of cards in the center of the board. A 9x9 grid is laid out for players to take a minute (literally, it's in the rules) to memorize the location of all similar icons.

A community rainbow deck is then drawn one by one for players to lay the drawn card in front of the row they recall that icon being in. This community deck also has switch cards allowing players to manipulate the location of cards in the grid.

After the community deck is depleted, players have a personal deck they use to play the drawn card directly on top of the card int he grid they believe shares the same icon.

At the end of the game, players will earn points for their correct placements and can lose points for incorrect placements. The player with the most points is the winner.

-description from publisher

name: The Skurge
description:
OFFICER: “Captain! What’s that?”
CAPTAIN: “Dear God! Something’s torn that
planet in half!”
OFFICER: “We’re taking damage from the
debris.”
CAPTAIN: “Take evasive manoeuvres!”
OFFICER: “I’m picking up multiple life forms
spawning from the epicentre.”
CAPTAIN: “That’s the Skurge! A self replicating
biological nightmare destined to consume
every other living entity! We need to get to
Earth and warn them. There’s a jump gate 5
systems away; set a course!”
OFFICER: “What about the outer colonies?”
CAPTAIN: “We’ll have to save what we can.
Let’s GO! GO! GO!”

An entity of pure evil, known as the Skurge, has been released and now it's played job to reach the jump gate at the end of the map.

In the game, each turn you race across the map, collecting resources and spending resources to gain better items. At the end of the game, the player with the most valuable items wins.

You start the game at the planet where the Skurge appear. On your turn you will move to the next planet. Sometimes you have a choice of which planet to move to. If the planet has not been visited you will only see partial information about what resources you may need at that planet.

Once at the planet you will execute one of the three action tracks available to you. These actions will sometimes give you resources, or you may need to spend resources to obtain more valuable items or repair your ship.

After the actions have been performed, the Skurge advance. If the Skurge reach a player's location, they are eliminated and the game ends.

So it's imperative that you both make it to the jump gate before the Skurge get you!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Events, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up

name: Phoenix Command: Mechanized Light Vehicles
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


This Suplement to the Phoenix Command: Mechanized Combat System that covers primary Light Fighting Vehicles.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Phoenix Command: Mechanized Combat System
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


The Phoenix Command: Mechanized combines a detailed, accurate simulation of modern tank combat with quick, simple game mechanics to create a system that gives the player a fast playing game of unbeatable realism.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Phoenix Command: Mechanized Pak Front – World War II Anti-Tank Guns
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


This supplement to the Phoenix Command Mechanized Combat System provides the Weapon Data for the primary Anti-Tank Guns of World War II.Included are the 24 most prominent Anti-Tank Guns of the war, from the German 37mm Pak 36 to the devastating 88mm Pak 43, and from the British 2 Pounder to the US M5 3 Inch Gun and the Soviet 100mm D-10. Full descriptions of each Gun are also given, as are the special rules for using World War II Anti-Tank Guns.

-from the back of the book
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Phoenix Command: Mechanized Panzer – World War II Medium Tanks
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


This supplement to the Phoenix Command Mechanized Combat System provides the Status Sheets for the primary Medium Tanks of World War II. Included are versions of the German Pz IV, including the short-barreled Pz IV-F1, the long-barreled Pz IV-F2, and the high-velocity Pz IV-H; two models of the powerful Pz V Panther; the Soviet T34 and the T34 / 85; and the US M4A3 Sherman with both 75mm gun and high-velocity 76mm gun.In addition, special rules for Vehicle Systems specific to World War II Tanks and Second Shot Accuracy are presented, along with full Vehicle Descriptions.

-from the back of the book
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Rise of the Democracy
description:
Rise of the Democracy is set in the Bot War universe immediately after the first Atlantican War. The game is designed primarily around themed and narrative play. It is a stand-alone game but is also ideal for complimenting narrative campaigns alongside Bot War. Rise of the Democracy is a 2-player game, although you can also play the game in teams if you wish.

The game is scenario based with some scenarios presenting asymmetrical objectives to both sides.

Both players choose a force up to a pre-determined points cost

The focus is on squad combat with 'Hero' models adding flavor to the squads.

name: Censored: The Hilarious Explanation Game
description:
This laugh out loud game asks players to describe words to their team without mentioning forbidden words. The number of forbidden words increases each round, making the game more and more challenging!

If you mention a forbidden word you must wear a censored mouthpiece for the rest of the game!

Complete the most challenges without mentioning forbidden words to win the game!

name: Pippi Langstrumpf: Socken suchen
description:
Who is the fastest in searching for socks?
The children are rolling 3 die and try to find the sock with the correct combination of colours. The fastest child gets the sock and the ones with the most socks at the end of the game wins.

name: Gæt
description: The participants are tested in their knowledge of toys, children's songs, cartoon characters, superheroes, fairy tale characters and animals. The game consists of a series of cards in 6 different categories, where each card has five clues and an answer. For the individual participant, it is important to guess the correct answer with as few clues as possible. The fewer clues you use, the more fields you can move. For each correct answer, you can either move your own piece forward on the game board, or perhaps choose to move your opponent back. The one who gets around the record the fastest has won.

name: SINS: The Deck-builder
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.





SINS is a fantasy card deck-builder with a quick setup and gameplay, filled with a plethora of combos and tough choices throughout the game, in a small package.

To win, gain power, give despair and resolve your dominance.

Components
70 x SINS cards.
20 x Kosmos (starter) cards.
2 x Dominance cards.
5 x rules cards.
3 x misc. cards.

Setup
Each box supports 2 players. Use multiple boxes when playing with more than 2 players.

Deal 10 Kosmos (starter) cards to each player. This is their draw pile, placed in their play area.

Give each player a Dominance card and place it with the Cortadoo logo facing up.

Shuffle all Sins cards together face-down, from the box sets of your choice. Place the cards in the center of the table to form the Realm.

Each player draws a card from the top of the Realm. The highest card-number is the active player (repeat if there is a tie). Destroy these cards. Destroyed cards are placed back in the box.

Then, draw 5 cards from the top of the Realm, into the center of the table, face-up.

All players draw 5 starting cards into their hand from their draw pile (this is their hand limit).

The active player starts the game and takes their first turn.
How to win
When a player reaches two dominance, that player wins the game and the game ends immediately.

You get dominance by resolving opposing despair in the Status phase, and you give despair by attacking your opponents in the Attack phase.

The Dominance card in front of each player has numbers from zero to three. If you’d like to play a longer game, you can optionally play until a player reaches three dominance. For a short (coffee break) game, play for one dominance.
mechanics: Action/Event, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That

name: Taxi! Board Game: England Rugby
description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. Sound Off topics allow for players to gain more money by mouthing off on a subject to match key words for a minute. But watch out for the diversion! You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.

name: Taxi! Board Game: Scotland Rugby (SRU)
description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. Sound Off topics allow for players to gain more money by mouthing off on a subject to match key words for a minute. But watch out for the diversion! You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.

name: Taxi! Board Game: Celtic FC
description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. Sound Off topics allow for players to gain more money by mouthing off on a subject to match key words for a minute. But watch out for the diversion! You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.

name: Escape Box: Mystère au Louvre
description:
Mystery in the largest museum in the world!

Your class won a competition and you won a private tour of the Louvre for 45 minutes.
However, the curator of the Egyptian archeology department who was to accompany you disappeared along with a mysterious sarcophagus ...

It's up to you to search the 7 departments of the museum to try to find them!

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Elemies
description:
The Elemies Card Game is the first manifestation of the Elemies World. It’s a game of character, strategy, adaptability, and teamwork. It is played by four players split into two teams. Get rid of your cards first, win the battles, and collect treasure points for your team. Be ready to lead and to follow; attack and hold your ground. The world of Elemies demands balance.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Advantage Token, Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Memory, Team-Based Game, Trading, Trick-taking

name: Twist Up
description:
A TEAM LANGUAGE GAME
OBJECT: good communication and listening skills are a must to beat the other teams and successfully replicate the challenge card.
In each team, one player is the speaker and one is the doer. Each doer takes a set of 9 “colour” cards and 9 see-through “animal” cards. The speakers each draw a “challenge” card, which they keep hidden. Then each speaker has to explain to their doer – just using words – how to place the “colour” and “animal” cards to replicate the picture shown on the “challenge” card. Both teams play at the same time, and the quickest to complete the challenge wins the card. The first team to win 5 challenges wins the game!

+++ Good communication is the key to success!

—description from the publisher

name: Guzzle
description:
GAME OF TACTICS
OBJECT: a frantic race to put together a perfect octopus.
Who will be the fastest to build their octopus? Each octopus will of course have to have 1 head and 8 tentacles, all of which must be properly connected to its head with the puzzle pieces. A multitude of possibilities, but only one winner! Be careful not to get your tentacles in a twist in the rush! Fancy making the game harder? Before you begin, choose a larger number of required pieces to fit into your octopus. Fastest player wins!

+++ A very simple assembly system for a task that is not as easy as it seems!

—description from the publisher

name: Warhammer Underworlds: A Crushing Terror
description:
Solo game scenario for Warhammer Underworlds that allows a single player to pit their warband against a rampaging Fomoroid Crusher. The player wins the game by defeating the monster before it can escape off the board - or take all of their fighters out of action.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Open Drafting

name: Embrace Your Happiness
description:
Embrace Your Happiness is a board game that helps you explore the happiness of yourself and others through a game.
When you know when you’re happy and how you feel when you’re happy, you won’t just wait for it, but you would actively pursue your happiness.
I invite you to this wonderful experience of discovering the happiness of you and others through Embrace your happiness.

Components are all Cards, 50 "Happiness plug" cards, 40 "Happiness on" cards, 12 "you and me" cards, 6 "you're the one" cards, 6 "help me" cards, 20 "Happiness phrase" cards, and 100 sheets.

There are two types of gameplay. The first one is the deduction game. It's a game that players guess when other players feel happy by asking questions.
Drafting "Happiness plug" cards should be three in each player's hand and all "Happiness on" cards should be open and placed on the table can see. Each player put one of their "Happiness plug" cards on the table and choose the one "Happiness on" card. After choosing the "Happiness on" card, shuffle the "Happiness plug" cards that on the table and flip all cards, and placed like a Dixit.
All players can ask the other players with their "Happiness on" card. The question should be yes or no. Only have one opportunity to ask a question. After this conversation, all players start to guess and write the name and "Happiness plug" card with matching. For every correct guess a player made, get 3 points. After 3 rounds, the game is finished. The player who got the highest point will be a winner.

The second gameplay is storytelling. It's a game that players suggest to other players the best way for them to regain the happiness they've been missing recently.
All player chooses two of the "Happiness on" cards and places the front of the player. Make a pile of "Happiness plug" cards and open the top 8 cards on the table. The start player begins to talk about their bad feeling situation with one of the "Happiness on" card. After finish the talk, the others start to give a solution with one of the "Happiness plug" cards. After all players' suggestions finished, the start player chooses the best suggestion and gives the "help me" card to the player who gives the best solution and that card is going to be 3 points. When every player gives the "help me" card to another player, the game is done. The player who has the highest score will be a winner.

name: Erklär's mir, als wäre ich 5
description:
Children ask a thousand questions. We as adults are afraid to ask - because we are supposed to have understood it already. In the bestseller "Erklärs mir, als wäre ich 5" basic and extraordinary questions shall be answered easily. The card game will make your head smoke by giving you answers where you first have to find the right questions - answers that aren't necessarily correct, but sound plausible. For all lateral thinkers, inquisitive people and know-it-alls, that like to be fooled with from time to time...

-Loosely translated from the box
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Sebasto
description:
Similar to 3’s, but with special dice labeled 0-4 and a special symbol for the 6th value.

Players roll all 6 dice saving at least one die and rerolling the remaining dice until they are satisfied or all 6 rolls are finished. If the special symbol gets rolled and saved, the value of the dice get multiplied by two for every special symbol rolled. Players who accumulate 101 points are eliminated. Rolling a six of a kind wins the game. Whoever has the lowest score after 10 rounds is the winner of the game.

Game Includes: 6 Sebasto Dice, Score Pad, Pencil and Game Rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Tezamen
description: Tezamen is a special two-player strategy game in which luck also plays a role. However, as with life in general, you also need to be able to live with luck. The successful player constantly adapts to the situations that arise and thus tries to make the best decisions. In the throne room, the bodyguards protecting the king and the rebels face each other. The former want to evacuate the ruler, while the latter aim to capture him.

name: Corporate Coffin
description:
Poor life choices have lead you to a design career within a corporate setting. Now you must survive an entire work day! Make it to your desk, complete a task & get back out the door with as little aggravation as possible.

Game-play is a modern twist on classic race games. Players take turns rolling a die and moving the indicated number of space through the office. The first player to make it to their desk and back out of the office wins.

Throughout their day (game-play) players gain and complete "Shituation" cards. The hilariously soul crushing Shituation cards may compel a player to visit HR, complete a project in the video department, or simply hide out in the snack room. Drawing a Shituaton car is activated by landing on specific map spaces on your journey. Shituations may help or hinder your progress getting in and out of the office.

Corporate Coffin is real, raw and hilariously accurate in its mockery of corporate culture. Think Office Space meets Candyland. Play until someone wins or everyone else quits.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Race

name: Memories
description:
Are you ready for a nostalgic evening of reminiscing? Travel through time with your fellow players and discover how much you still know about the decade in which you grew up.

What events are in
your memory and what do you have to dig deep for? Maybe you know more than your parents, your grandfather, your neighbor or your best friend.

Amaze yourself and everyone
by answering a variety of questions about the 80's, 90's, 00's and 10's in six categories: music, television, sports, world news, movies and miscellaneous.

—description from the publisher

name: My First La Cucaracha
description:
Unlike the original Kakerlakak game, Mein erstes Kakerlakak is aimed at very young players. The mama cockroach — that is, a HEXBUG — runs through a path that loops on the game board. At the start of a round, each player places one of their "food balls" (a colored marble) in the starting location, then you start mama on the path, with her ideally knocking your food through the holes in the path to feed the baby cockroaches that live in the floor. Whoever first has all their food delivered to the babies wins!

Mein erstes Kakerlakak includes a variant for slightly older children in which players try to collect an assortment of food colors to fill their basket first.

name: Domino Cards
description: Volume II in one of the Russell little books card game sets. It features a deck of cards depicting dual numbered dominoes and rules to play a number of basic domino games such as traditional dominoes, domino pairs, and Mexican Train.

name: Banned Books: Tango
description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from And Tango Makes Three by Justin Richardson & Peter Parnell, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Clu December 2018 package.

Tango:
(3) Warmth: Use any or all of the face up action cards in any order that you would like. Do not flip or re-order them after using them.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Potz-Tausend
description:
Potz-Tauseng consists of a small score block and a die inside a matchbox.

Each player gets a score sheet that can hold the player name, 9 digits and the final score. In turn order everyone rolls once and writes the number in one of the fields. After 9 rounds players add their entries as three-digit numbers. Your score is the difference of your sum to 1000. You can compensate minus points by having a full diagonal of the same number.

—user summary

name: Track Agency
description:
Incorporates the Track Agency and tries to stop the fugitive criminals!
Agent(s), get your tracking device and listen to the crime date. Search the newspaper to find it.
Identify the three locations listed in the newspaper articles. Find them on the map and connect them using your private area.
Point the tracker at the center of the confidential area and listen to the 3 witnesses on site who saw the guilty!
Find the guilty one of the suspects and stop him by pointing the tracker!
So, will you succeed in identifying the culprit?


Can be played solo or in cooperative mode.

Content:
- A sound tracker
- A 60-page newspaper
- A map with places in A2 format
- A triangle
- A poster with suspects in A2 format
- A rule book

Requires: 2 batteries 1.5V - AAA- LR03
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Willi Wackel: Der tanzende Tausendfüßler
description: All children try to put as many balls as they can in the hands of Willi Wackel who is constantly dancing.

name: Sevilla Futbol Club
description:
A Trivia game about the centenary of the Spanish football team Sevilla FC.
Contains a die, pawns, a board and cards with about 1000 questions and answers in 5 categories.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Cindr: Saxophone Serenader Promo Card
description:
A single promotional card for Cindr from the Game Boy Geek 2020 Kickstarter funding campaign.

Five stars.

Meet up: Elvish Ales
Next step: Serenades
Next level: Enchanted Evening

Upgrade any die by one here.

Bonus: Roll a spark on your last roll of a successful date, and add 1 Love point to your total.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Plan'it Board Game
description:
Plan'it is a competitive and strategic card game for 2 to 4 players, in which you should be the first traveller who explores the six continents. For achieve you goal, you must live three kind of experiences: adventure, nature and cultural trips. However, you are not the only passionated traveller in the game, other characters are trying to visit the whole world before you.

The carddeck is really artistic and original, because the cards have a key color in their back part. Thus, other players could suposse your strategy, and they will try to sabbotagge it, but only you are the one who knows which country is the next in your plan. You have to "plan it" properly, because you must manage your budget for your trips, but also the weather conditions and you must combinate the three experiences (adventure, nature and culture).

Are you ready to live the adventure of exploring the world from your table?
mechanics: Alliances, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deduction, Hand Management, Pieces as Map

name: Killing Cards: Aliens
description:
You wake up in a cryogenic chamber at the same time as the other players. As soon as you come to your senses, a voice announces: "Welcome to our game. You are aboard the Spartacus ship, which sails not far from the planet Pandora."

Your goal is to be a player to stay alive. You take turns opening a door to the ship. Behind each door you will find either a bloodthirsty monster or equipment that can help you survive. The last survivor will be released.

Each player chooses one of the characters, receives a flamethrower and six cards.

Each player in turn draws a card (it is the opening of the door) look at it and places it in front of him face down.

On his turn a player can play as many cards from his hand (or none), then he must open his door (the card face down in front of him).

If the player draws an Alien or Arachnid card when he opens his door, the player must show it to the other players.

If he has a flamethrower, he discards it and draws a new door and his turn is over (if he doesn't have a flamethrower, he dies).

If the player does not draw a monster, this card enters their hand.

Finally, the player replaces his door with a new one.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Keyword
description:
Keyword is a game where a player has to communicate a word to the rest of their team, describing it in terms of a secret "keyword" which only that team knows. A second team eavesdrops on the conversation, trying to work out what they're talking about.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Communication Limits, Targeted Clues, Team-Based Game

name: Bits & Bytes
description:
The goal of Bits & Bytes is for each player to guide their character (program) to their home by issuing instructions (turn right, turn left, move forward, turn around). At the same time they have to avoid walls, bugs and the dreaded Seepeeu (pronounced CPU).

Sounds simple, right? But that’s the point.

Children are playing a card game, but at the same time they are creating computer concepts, like algorithms and the sequencing of instructions, and they are learning the invaluable skill of problem solving. And by doing so they are developing a logical mind-set, which is required for coding/programming. By playing Bits & Bytes, children are developing the logical foundations for programming computers, thus when they start to learn actual coding later in life they already have the required mindset. After all, actual coding (programming) is little more than issuing a few instructions to a computer.

name: La Missione Impossibile di Giorgio il Drago
description:
It is a card game. You have to collect a set of cards to win.
At your turn you can use some cards to block your opponents and obviously play some cards that free yourself if you are previously blocked.

The game is based on the novel of Geoffreoy de Pennart.

name: Rainbow Yatzy
description: Roll the dice inside the rainbow box and try to match the colours in order to collect cards. The more cards you collect, the higher your score will be. Be careful though, because sometimes your efforts may end up helping out the next player...

name: Maratón Ligero
description:
Maratón Ligero ("Light Marathon"), is one of versions of Maratón, a Mexican trivia game created by Sergio Schaar Chabat. In this case, the questions, according to the text in the back of the box, are specialized in pop music, movie hits, sports and TV shows, contrary to the original one, who was more into general culture.

To play, a player rolls the dice and a judge reads a numered question in the front of the card, according to the dice points. After the player ansewers, the judge checks the back of the card to confirm. If the player was right, his token advances, if not, another player can doit. Is nobody knows it, then a black token called Ignorancia (Ignorance), advances.

The winner is the first player to reach the end line. If the Ignorance token does first, everybody loses.
publishers: Grupo Editorial Maratón S.A. de C.V.

name: Fato Fake
description:
Fato Fake is a knowledge contest. Do you think you know enough? So prepare your memory and let's get started.

Start of the game: Each player chooses a color among the available pins and the oldest player shuffles the cards and places them stacked in the indicated place on the board, with the back side facing up.

With all the pins in the “start” box.
The first must advance one space on the board, remove the first card from the pile and, without looking, hand it over to the player on your right. Then, you must turn the roulette wheel. If the pointer stops at of the colored boxes, the player with the card reads the question with the corresponding color on the card and, at the end of the statement read, asks: “Fact or fake? ”.

If the player gets it right, he gets the card. If he misses, the card goes to a lot of discard.

Attention: If the pointer stops over the “CHALLENGE” box, the player must point any player, according to his strategy, to respond.
If the chosen player gets it right, he keeps the card; if he misses, the player who challenged him stays with her.
But wait! Do you think it's easy? If the roulette stops on the “AZAR” box, the player must answer 2 questions to keep the card. For example: If he hits the first and misses the second, he will be forced to hit the third to keep the card. If you miss 2 questions, the letter goes to lot of disposal.

The next one on the left removes a card from the pile on the board, advances one square and repeats the process.

The game ends when the first player reaches the final square. At that point, all players count their cards. Win that one that got it right and, consequently, has more cards.

name: Woord Bluf
description:
The creative word game.
Challenge your friends and family in this tactical word game. Grab a pen and create the longest words to earn the most points. All players have the same letters at their disposal, so play smart and beat your opponents. If you can’t form a word, you can choose to bluff. But when caught bluffing, you will receive penalty points. Be creative with the letters or bluff your way through the rounds and crown yourself as the ‘Word King’ with Word Bluff!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Dice, Word Game
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Spelling

name: Max geheugentrainer
description:
PLAY THE FAMOUS SHOPPING GAME NOW AS A CARD GAME AND TEST YOUR MEMORY!
Which player remembers best what is on his shopping list? Use your memory and fill your shopping cart with the products you saw on your list at the start of the game. But beware: the other players put things in your cart that you don't need at all! Who knows to remember their shopping list until the end and comes home with the right products?

—description from the publisher

name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Additional Counter Set
description:
In Battlestar Galactica – Starship Battles, players take control of Colonial and Cylon spaceships and face each other in furious dogfights and daring missions. The innovative game system features easy to learn rules, a unique set of maneuver cards for each spaceship, and two exclusive devices — the control panel and the rotating miniature base (included in each Spaceship Pack).

You will be able to relive the exciting combat sequences from the TV series on your tabletop, just a few minutes after opening the box!

This set, Battlestar Galactica – Additional Counter Set Expansion Pack, includes four punchboards with the full set of damage counters, special counters and markers as FTL markers, special templates as Asteroid Fields, Planetoid and Spaceship base templates, and all the cardboard accessories from the Battlestar Galactica Starship Battles Starter Set.

Increase the number of spaceships you can play with, and the variety of scenarios you can play, with this Additional Counter Set.

—description from the publisher

On december 29, 2020, Ares games announced that due to end of licensing, this product would only be released as a free PDF.

—from the web site of the producer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Big 4 Football
description:
Board and strategy game in the colors of your favorite team (out of 4) which takes you to the heart of football league 1, with the four flagship clubs of the French football championship.

Select your players, dribble, tackle, score goals with your favorite team.

The cards of the 22 players and the coaches of the four teams (PSG, OM, ASSE, LOSC) are included in each game box.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Grand Battery:  Guide and Rules for Napoleonic Wargames
description:
How would you have fared as one Napoleon's marshals, or in command of a division of redoutable British redcoats under Wellington? Grand Battery offers you the chance to find out. This book includes all the rules you need to play miniature wargames set in the Napoleonic Wars, plus plenty of useful background information you need to get started.

There is a concise historical overview of the events and battles of the period, as well as sections on the weapons and tactics of the various armies. The buyer's guide gives an up-to-date survey of the wealth of ranges of miniatures available and advice on which are compatible with which. Organizational tables give a breakdown of typical formations for all the major combatants and most of the minor ones (any one for a Wurttemburg infantry division?), allowing you to structure your collection and also to organize hypothetical games quickly with 'off the peg' orders of battle. Three historical scenarios are also included, each with their own specific orders of battle, maps, objectives and victory conditions.

The rules themselves, which utilize an innovative card-driven turn sequence to simulate the unpredictable ebb and flow of battle, are designed for playability, while still giving 'realistic' results and rewarding sound tactics. Though designed primarily for division level games with 25 or 15mm figures, the command and control sysyem takes account of corps or even the largest army level games and they are easily adaptable to any figure scale.

Get ready to march to the sound of the guns!

—description from the publisher

name: Fészekfoglaló
description:
An exciting strategy and educational card game in which you should play your birds to different habitats, deal with special events, and score points to win the game.

In each turn, the players must choose two bird cards from their hands to play them onto the table facedown. You can choose between four different habitats (plain, forest, lake or city) to place your birds. After that, the players flip their cards to count the eggs on the bird cards. The player with more eggs wins the chosen habitat and score the points.

The game ends when one of the players scores every habitat three times. The player with the most points win the game!

—user summary

name: The 1879 Anglo Zulu War: A Potted History & Wargames Rules
description:
The Zulu War presents an opportunity for a highly colourful wargame between two very contrasting opponents.
The battles that were fought show that whilst there was a certain sense of an inevitable British victory to the war, the Zulu army was certainly capable of inflicting a punishing defeat upon the British given an opportunity to unleash a co-ordinated attack using the classical fighting bull buffalo tactics.

This book comes in two parts.
The first is a potted history of the Zulu War of 1879.
The second is a set of wargame rules best suited to 25mm or 28mm figures.

—description from the publisher

name: 北斗の拳 世紀末断末魔遊戯 (Fist of the North Star End of the Century Deathrattle Game)
description: 北斗の拳 世紀末断末魔遊戯 (Fist of the North Star) is a real-time party game that contains two game modes.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Real-time

name: 曇天／斬合 Legend (Donten no Kiriai Legend)
description:
曇天／斬合 Legend (Donten no Kiriai Legend) is a Japanese card game for one or two players. It was originally published as 曇天／斬合 (Donten no Kiriai) in 2017. The designer then spun off a simpler game, 曇天／斬合 Tactics (Donten no Kiriai Tactics) to make it easier to learn the game, and republished this edition as 曇天／斬合 Legends for intermediate and experienced players. It is available free as a Print 'n' Play game to download.

Two Samurais duel, using basic movement cards and two special attacks each round. The duel continues, round after round, until one of the Samurai succumbs to their wounds.

The players take a basic deck of six cards, and two special cards from a set of five. Players set up the duelling positions, with the Samurai initially being two steps apart, and then each secretly chooses a hand card face-down. When they are ready, the cards are turned up.

The basic cards involve the Samurai advancing or retreating, and adopting different stances. If the Samurai move close enough together, and onto the same spot, then a strike might happen. But the Samurai switch between being in a Standing stance, and a Ready stance. So an attack can only be made when the Samurai is Ready, otherwise the player falls back to Standing.

Basic attacks can be made repeatedly, the card goes back to the player's hand when used. But the Special card attacks are used only once a round, and then discarded.

A round ends when a successful strike is made, and damage is shown on the attacking card. The player struck loses hit points. The decks are re-sorted and the players gain two Special cards again.

The first player to lose all their health loses the duel.
user summary
mechanics: Action/Event, Simultaneous Action Selection, Single Loser Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Snowball Hostilities
description:
In Snowball Hostilities players lead a team of kids against opponents in a series of wintry battles that take place in their backyard. Players can have their kids create, maintain, and transport a supply of snowballs and snow bricks as well as build snow walls for defense and snowmen that come to life and wreak havoc. Santa randomly appears in the game to drop presents that players can utilize such as snowmobiles, catapults, sleds, and a remote control airplane. To win players must sweep the other teams from the map or force them into resignation.

SEQUENCE OF PLAY
Each turn each kid, represented by a pawn, receives a number of action points. These can be used to move across the map, attack other players' kids, attempt to recruit new kids, or conduct other actions such as making, gathering, or transporting items. After players make their moves NPCs such as Santa, the elf, snowmen, and the dog will move randomly by roll of dice if they are on the map.

—description from the designer

name: Letterbound
description:
A word game that can be played alone or with friends.

Players work together for a high score by forming tough words, but they cannot communicate during their turns. On each player's turn they will say a word outloud that includes at least 2 different letters that are currently shown on the board (and not covered).

Then they'll choose one of the letters in that word and place a penny on it, heads side up. If the word includes 3 different letters fromm the board, then the penny is placed tails side up.

The game ends immediately when one letter remains or a player cannot say a word that uses two letters. The last word cannot include a red letter.

SCORE: The blue outside spaces are worth one point and the purple inside spaces are worth two points. Any spaces with tails are worth one extra point.
categories: Party Game, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Trolling for Trouble: Goblin Raider
description:
Single monster expansion for Trolling for Trouble, featuring the Goblin Raider monster.


Released in the August 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Negotiation

name: World War 1 Wargames Rules
description:
Tabletop minatures wargames rules.

Scales:
1mm : 1 yard
1 turn : 1 minute

Variable figure scales according to size of figures/vehicles used:
6mm figures : 1 figure = 1 man
15mm figures : 1 figure = 10 man
25mm figures : 1 figure = 25 man

Units of 100 men/50 cavalry/4-6 vehicles or guns

Overall battle scale is approximately brigade (multiple battalions)

name: オフトゥンからの脱出: 拡張01 猫のいる生活 (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu: Exp 01 Neko no iru Seikatsu)
description:
オフトゥンからの脱出: 拡張01 猫のいる生活 (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu: Exp 01 Neko no iru Seikatsu) is the first expansion set for オフトゥンからの脱出 (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu). This expansion (Life With A Cat) adds 20 new lesson cards and extends the round to 8 rounds instead of 4.

The students have passed their exams and enter a new year of school. Things are going okay, but the midterm exam is looming. And now, a new friend enters their life...

When the players begin the game, they use the sides of the futon cards without a cat, and then flip it when they acquire their first cat. The more cats they have, the more points they can score in the game.
user summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: オフトゥンからの脱出拡張02～転入生は蟹高専生!?～ (Ofuto~un kara no dasshutsu Exp 02 ~ ten'nyūsei wa kani kōsen-sei!?~)
description:
オフトゥンからの脱出拡張02～転入生は蟹高専生!?～ (Ofuto~un kara no dasshutsu Exp 02 ~ ten'nyūsei wa kani kōsen-sei!?~) is the second expansion to オフトゥンからの脱出 (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu). The expansion comes in a larger box, made to fit both the original game box and the two expansion decks. The second expansion adds 41 cards, of which 29 are new lesson cards. The new cards enable a sixth player.

In this expansion (~Transfer students are crab college students?~), the students are still struggling to complete their coursework and get enough sleep. There are new arrivals, transfer students from Crab College, who work together to make crab cans, which the students take home for their cats.
user summary

name: Migong
description:
Migong is a two-player territory game played on the 126 brown spaces (cells) of the initially empty hexagonal board shown above.

The two players are called Blue and Yellow. Each player has access to 63 cell-sized hexagonal pieces made of six equilateral triangles each. Each player's set of pieces includes all combinations of at least one triangle of their color and at most five triangles of the opponent's color. Pieces have a fixed orientation and are never rotated or flipped during play. Any pattern of triangles that would result from rotating or flipping a piece is represented by another piece.



DefinitionsA wedge is one of the six triangular portions of a piece.

A group is a wedge along with all other wedges one could reach from it through a series of steps between like-colored wedges sharing an edge with one another. Thus, all wedges in a group are the same color, and a group may include wedges from different pieces.

A group's extent is the number of pieces that contribute wedges to it.



PlayBlue plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, if possible, place a piece from your set on an empty cell. Wedges from different pieces sharing an edge must be the same color. Likewise, a wedge must be the same color as any board edge sharing an edge with it, including the cell-like border in the center.

If you have no moves available, you must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed.

The game ends when both players pass in succession. The player with the higher score in the final position wins. Your score is the biggest group extent in which you have the greater number of groups. If there is no such size, your score is zero. If both players are tied at zero points, whoever made the last move loses.



Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means Yellow will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Drei Haselnüsse für Aschenbrödel: Das Spiel
description:
Everyone knows the story of Aschenbrödel. Help Aschenbrödel to get the prince.
Based up on the Christmas movie Drei Haselnüsse für Aschenbrödel.

name: Loto Fever
description: "An exciting, fast-moving game for gamblers and all those who thrive on challenge." A card based take on traditional lottery/keno with players vying for the most cash and avoiding going bankrupt. Players ante each round for a number match card trying to match the six numbers on their lottery card to win the pot. Special instruction cards are thrown in to change things up when drawn. When a player or players complete their lottery card, all players that matched at least three of their six numbers get a trivia challenge card to try to win bonus cash. Those successful at the trivia challenge get the option do double their bonus winnings using the "match deck" paying for cards up to a certain amount trying to match their bonus number.
publishers: abdulREHMAN Enterprises, Ltd., Rehman Enterprises Limited

name: King's Archer
description: A card game in which you swiftly assemble the three hallmarks of a great archer...the bow, the arrow and the heart! Players build three numerical sequences from their hand - the archer’s bow, archer’s arrow and archer’s heart - laying them down on the table as they are achieved. Sequences of all one color or without wild cards are more valuable. Players can disrupt one another’s sequences with thieves - stealing cards right out from underneath their opponents. Players need good judgement to weigh the odds, strategic cunning to go for speed or purity, and bit of luck to see them through. Each successive round gets more tense as points are accumulated to determine the winner.

name: Malpractice
description:
"You and other players are all doctors of questionable skills and ethics. Score points when your patients survive, and when they don't. Will you be a hero, a monster, or both?"

You have two dice patients you are caring for... Roll their values and you can improve their health. Doubles and triples allow even more health improvement. Those you can't tend to have their health erode. If the patient die rises above six the patient scores for you and a new patient die comes in. If a die's health erodes below 1, they die and likewise get replaced.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: Leftovers
description:
"Compete for points each round, but the player with the lower total for the round gets to keep the leftovers as a bonus. Outwit your opponent and finish with the top score!"

This is a 2 player game...

A set of dice are rolled and put in plain view. Then each player rolls a dice and sets an additional one to match a value of one of the center dice keeping it secret as well.

Repeat play until someone gets 50 or more.

They reveal their dice and then figure out what to remove. This then creates a set of left overs.

The set die + the rolled dice for each player are summed and scored based on whether they odd or even they will score differently. Whoever got a lower score so far gets the left over center die.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Wantotrip: Le Tour Du Monde
description:
The game was created by a Tunisian travel start-up to fight the pandemic.

The players start with the same amount of money and travel the world, rolling dice.
When they arrive in a new country they have to pay for their stay (based on the average cost for each country), then they can continue travel, or decide to work there.
They just don't have enough cash to go around without stopping by and working in some of these locations (answering trivia questions).
They can also play special cards (Cruella) to delay their opponents.

The winner is the the first player to complete the World tour.
The goal of the game is also to teach tricks to players for their future travels.

There is an expansion for kids (optional but not sold separately !)

name: The Offensive Band Name Generator: Album Cover Expansion
description:
This is an expansion for the party game The Offensive Band Name Generator. It includes 50 Album Cover cards, 2 brand new Theme Lists and a rules sheet.

With this expansion, players will draw album cover cards and work to make band names and album names that best fit the images drawn.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Judge, Set Collection, Voting

name: Wissen & Quizzen: Die Musikinstrumente
description:
A tiptoi quiz card game about music and instruments.

The four assistants "Käpt'n Quizzo" (KQ), "Jonny Joker" (JJ), „Wilma Weg“ (WW), and "Robert Ross" (RR) guide through the game.

Knowledge: Learn about music and Instruments as depicted on 27 different cards.

Trivia game: Players answer KQs questions and score victory points. KQ announces the winner at the end of the game.

Electronic: You need an electronic Tiptoi pen for the game.

name: Escargots go!
description:
Race with your tape measure snail and be the first to collect all the flower petals.

At every turn, the player roll a dice and can unroll his measure tape snail to go to his color petals. The first player who collect all his petals and go back to the start point win the game.
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: 脱走名人 (Escape Master)
description:
脱走名人 (Dasso Meijin) is a game from Japan about escaping pet lizards. Each player is a different pet lizard which has got free from its tank in the game designer's home (the game title means 'escape master'). They run around the rooms and try to catch insects. The first lizard to get a set of insects is the winner.

The game designer (who breeds pet lizards) describes the game as a mix of roll & move and Old Maid, in that the lizards follow paths around, and steal cards off each other akin to Old Maid.

However, the game does not use dice. Instead, players choose a numbered card from their hand in secret, reveal it and advance as far as they wish up to the number. The lowest numbers go first.

Players follow paths around the different rooms in the home, and try to catch insects in the rooms or collect useful objects (by drawing cards). If a player gets into a room with another lizard, they can steal a card from the other player's hand. But some cards are also traps.

The pet owner is also moving about, and if a player ends up in the same room, they cannot move or they will be caught. So being able to predict the movements of the other players and the owner matters.

The first lizard to secure a hand of four cards of one type of insect is the winner.
user summary
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Turn Order: Role Order
publishers: ぶれけけゲームズ (Burekeke Games)

name: The Ninth World: A Skillbuilding Game for Numenera – The Beyond Pack
description:
A set of 55 regions cards from beyond the Steadfast. This set features the regions in these kingdoms: The Black Riage, The Caecilian Jungle, The Plains of Kataru, Seshar, The Frozen South, The Cloudcrystal Skyfields, Lostrei the Spiritlands, Vralk the Red Kingdom, Corao, The Lands of the Dawn, and The Rayskel Cays. This set was made available only to Kickstarter backers.

-description from designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Lone Shark Games, Monte Cook Games

name: What The Plot?!
description:
"A party game for people who like to talk sh*t."

Ever wanted to tell your friends how you lost your eyebrows or about the time you had dinner with aliens? Well, now is your chance!

Take a Prompt card. Take a Word card. You now have one minute to bullsh*t a story. After the minute is up, the player next to you has to continue your story and so on!

If a player doesn't use one of the three words on the Word card, fails to complete the challenge, can't bullsh*t a story (ex. says uhhhh a lot), or gets booed, they will have to keep the Word card or Boo card.

The first player to collect three cards is a terrible bullsh*tter and the story ends. The player who is not the worst wins!

name: Kieszonkowce quizowe. Wiesz, że nic nie wiesz
description: The game contains almost 500 questions about music, film and general knowledge.

name: Florida Man
description: There have been some crazy stories coming out of Florida these days, it seems truth is stranger than fiction! In Florida Man, travel your way through the state, from Pensacola to Key West, learning about some of the wacky things that have happened here, and some things that have not, by guessing which of these outrageous Florida Man headlines is NOT true! Each round, players will vote on which headlines they think are false. Winning voters will move forward a single space on the board, while incorrect guesses stay where they are for that round.

name: Sherlock Holmes Beratender Detektiv: Der Munitionsmagnat
description:
In this cooperative game, you investigate criminal cases along with the most notorious detective of all time. Follow the leads and gather clues. Go with your team and explore London in the Victorian era. To beat Sherlock Holmes at this game, carefully read the newspapers, follow your intuition, and use your deduction capacities.

This is case 1 from Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: The Thames Murders & Other Cases, which has been made available on its own as a Print & Play in Germany.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Il gioco di Paperopoli
description:
On the hunt for the missing keys to Scrooge's warehouse.
It's a board game similar to Monopoly where the goal is to recover three keys to open the Scrooge's warehouse. But beware of the path full of traps where every Disney character with his peculiar abilities can pass them unscathed or suffer them.
Who will arrive first? Donald Duck, The Beagle Boys, Daisy Duck, Huey Dewey and Louie, Magica De Spell, Gladstone Glander or Scrooge McDuck?
A Disney adventure suitable for children.

—user summary

name: Draw or Swipe
description:
In this fast moving 2-4 player tile game you compete to complete large triangular 'frames' using four smaller triangular tiles to score.

Each triangular tile has a number in each corner (1, 2 or 3). The corners of the four tiles must match each other when they go into the large frame.

A players turn consists of two parts: completing frame(s) and scoring.

To complete their frames, a player either 'draws' two facedown tiles from the tilepile or 'swipes' one faceup tile from another players uncompleted frames. A swiped tile gets a 'swipe token' put on it to keep it from being swiped by another player. Each player only has two swipe tokens to work with, so be judicious on the swiping.

Scoring is done once a frame has all four tiles placed in it. That makes it 'complete', and the tiles become un-swipe-able. The player moves their completed frame to the center of the table to corner match with other frames already in the center. The numbers in the center of the matched edge do not need to match, but there is a bonus if they do. Once a frame is moved to the center, any swipe pawns are retrieved by the player to be used again later.

The game is over at the end of the turn when the tilepile is emptied. Each player subtracts one point for every tile infront of them in uncompleted frames. High score wins.

Strategy hints:
Generally it is better to draw than swipe unless you are completing a frame.

If you are way ahead on points, it is better to draw down the tilepile to bring the game to an end.

Frames are scored on the corner numbers, so when possible put your higher numbers in the corner of the frame.

Always be building your frames with an eye on the frames in the center of the table. It does you no good to complete a frame if there is no place to put it and score.

There are six of each of the eleven unique tiles. Towards the end of the game you can look around to see whether the tile you really need is still in the tilepile, or whether you need to swipe it from another player.

-description from designer

name: Sekai no Hate made Itte Q!
description: A trivia board game based on a Japanese TV Show with the same name.

name: Конни Състезания Фюри
description:
A game like snakes and ladders, the theme here is horse racing. The game board is two-sided and one side is made on the TV series Fury.
The gameplay consists of throwing a dice and moving a figure according to the result. When certain fields hit, it skips forward or backward. The first to reach 103 wins the game.
categories: Animals, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Chef à la Card
description:
Chef à la Card is a quick and fun card game where you compete against your friends and family to create the perfect meal. By drawing different ingredients from four different themed piles you slowly build your final dish before you all go head to head in a final rating. There is no defined draw order so that everyone can draw cards at will. When everyone is satisfied with their dish (cards in hand) the final round begins (presentation and rating).
In that round everyone will have to present their creations to the others and will finally judge their opponents dishes by awarding them one or two points (cards you have to assign to the players). The dish with the most points wins.
After the winner is determined, is when 'Chef à la Card' reveals it's truly unique approach.
Because now it's time to change from the game table into the kitchen where you will prepare the winning dish for everyone to enjoy.

—description from the publisher

name: Goosebumps: Race to Dead House
description:
R.L. Stine’s monsters from the well known Goosebumps series of books Are on the loose all over the city! Werewolves, blobs, vampire poodles and more are running around trying to find the faster way to get toDead House, and they want your help!

In Goosebumps: Race to Dead House, everyone picks a team of three monsters and tries to get them to Dead House faster than anyone else by playing cards from their hand and moving the number of spaces around the board indicated on the cards.

But beware! Slappy, the Evil Gnomes, and the other players are all out to get you and slow you down!
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: What do you meme?: The Real Housewives
description:
Expansion Pack includes:

30 Caption Cards & 75 Photo Cards.

This is not a stand-alone game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Wizards of Mickey: First Age
description:
Wizards of Mickey Gioco di Carte Collezionabili is a brand new Collectible Card Game licensed by Disney. It has been published in italian only in February 2008.
Inspired by Disney comic books "Wizards of Mickey", in this game all-time popular Disney characters like Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck, Goofy, but also popular villains like Pet-Leg-Pete, Magica De Spell, the Beagle Boys (for the first time-ever with names!), and the arch-villain Phantom Blot are all there, but with many new twist (an "evil" Mickey Mouse? a real self-determined Minnie or Daisy that will save the day? Pluto as a were-dog?).
The game is an easy to learn collectible game, very fast (10-15 minutes for a single match), Teams of three wizards will challenge each other in magical castles, to obtain "diamagics" (magical gems that can also activate mage powers sometime). First team to grab 6 diamagics wins. Sounds easy? It is, but the game is deeper than it seems at a first glance!
Beautiful Disney artworks illustrate a set of over 150 cards.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Pummelomis Knusperkekse
description:
Small push-your-luck game, where players try to get the most grandmother-baked cookies by turning around coasters and rolling dice.

On their turn, players take a stack of coasters, turn them around and get a number of cookies depending on the front side of the coaster or in one case lose all their cookies gathered this round. A player may stop their turn before flipping another coaster to secure all their cookies. The first player with 54 cookies ends the game and the player with the most cookies wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: 7 Summits: Launch Promos
description:
Equipment is crucial to summiting the mountains. Pre-ordered copies of 7 Summits come with this pack of three additional equipment cards.

—description from the designer

name: Warhammer: Annual 2004
description:
Warhammer 2004 Annual is a compilation of Warhammer articles, combined with revised or previously unpublished material. Here you will find rules for all the latest releases, plus gaming articles and additional gaming material.

This includes new Army Lists for : the Cult of Ulric, Kislev Allies, Wood Elves, Empire Steam Tank and Dogs of War.

It also has profiles for Special Characters such as: Boris Todbringer of Middenheim, Eltharion, Shadowblade, Crom the Conquerer, Valten - The Champion of Sigmar, and Tzarina Katarin the Ice Queen.

Finally is has a complete list of errata.

name: Mémotager: Vegetable memory game
description:
Setup:
Plant all the vegetables: carrots, turnips, radishes... Don't forget the rabbits!
Push the wooden vegetables into the felt, only the green stalk must still protrude.
Finally place the scarecrow in the center to hold everything.

Gameplay:
Mémotager offers two game modes:

a classic memory in which identical pairs have to be gathered
an advanced mode, in which a soup recipe has to be recomposed. The first player to collect the ingredients for their soup wins.

name: Wetmore Forest: Picture Pairing Game
description:
Use your memory and search the forest for monsters that match the pictures on the cards. But be careful - if you draw a Scramble card, all the monsters will find new hiding spots!

On each player's turn, they turn over two tokens and try to match the creatures to any of the three cards available that turn. If they get a match, they take both the token and the card, then reveal more cards until there are three creature cards. If a Scramble card is draw, the tokens are randomized and play resumes as normal. Whoever gets the most tokens and cards wins the game!

name: Conquer
description:
The game board is similar to Ludo with four bases and a cross-shaped playspace.

Capturing is done when a player's piece lands exactly on a space occupied by an opponent's piece. The player's piece then moves together with the opponent's piece and brings it back to base. The capture is then complete.

If a player lands on a space occupied by an opponent with a captured piece, he may capture the opponent and set the captured piece free. There are green safety spaces on the board where pieces cannot be captured.

The game ends when all of one player's pieces are captured. The player with the most captured pieces wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture

name: Mustachio
description:
COME and Join this amazing trick taking game of strategy, quick wits, bidding, and point winning! Great for teamwork and strategizing with a team to be the boldest and most devious Nut on the planet!
Know your Cards! Some cards have points, some have tricks, and some have powers!

name: Turf Legends
description:
The legends - The sport of kings.

Whether it's stallions or stud farms or training stables for racing. Animal welfare with vets or horses logistics with transporters. It's all there for you.

name: Šalingrad
description:
Šalingrad is inspired by the famous detective game Scotland Yard.

The principle of the game is simple: a group of detectives moves around the city of Brno using public transports, trying to reveal the movement of the mysterious Baron and catch up with him.

The Baron's movement is secret at first, but later reveals its position several times.

If the Baron manages to stay untapped for 24 hours, he wins.

However, if one of the detectives enters the stop occupied by the Baron, the Baron must appear and admit his defeat.
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: The Bank Job: Mint Tin Edition
description:
Note: The mint tin edition has less cards and is only for 2-4 players while the standard edition is for 2-6 players.



You and your cohorts of crime have just pulled off the most successful bank heist of the century, including the theft of one of the world's most valuable diamonds. You must lay low for a week and guard your take; there's no honor amongst thieves here, and everyone wants the most they can get. Plus, rumors are there's a snake in your midst that might be out to get the prize jewel for themselves, and a rat could be trying to foil the whole operation.Each player will be dealt a random crew card to tell you what your part in this band of thieves is. These are not hidden from other players, since teamwork is dreamwork, after all. Each person brings their own unique talent, or specialty, to the crew, usable throughout the game. You will also be given a random role card, possibly giving you a secret double agent part to play. These should not be shared and will affect how you can win the game. There are four regular crew member cards, one snake card, and one rat card. As with any squad, the more people you bring in, the likelier it is to have defectors.

The game is played over the course of seven rounds, or days. Every day will begin with players taking turns to choose their actions for the day by placing a token on the box next to the action of their choice. For morning actions, you will use the numbers on your crew cards to determine turn order. After that, turn order is based on the last round's actions going from top to bottom on the action card in the center of the table.

Your goal, as the thief you are, is to hoodwink your way through the week, exchanging loot with players and the score to end up with the best take for yourself. Don't get too greedy, though! If you end up with more than the score, your zealousness will be shown, and the crew will take you out. The prized diamond is also supposed to be shared, so any crew member holding it at the end will mark you for an early demise, as well. Additionally, the bank loaded a tracker into the loot that will get you caught and disqualified if you're holding it at the end.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Hot Potato, Prisoner's Dilemma, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: De Ronde van Vlaanderen
description:
De Ronde van Vlaanderen, The official Tour of Flanders game.

Experience the magic of the Tour of Flanders and the Omloop Het Nieuwsblad .

Brave wind and weather, conquer the cobbles and slopes, try to shake off your opponents at the right time and stay ahead of the pack. Dose your energy, although you will have to dig deep into your reserves every now and then for profit and eternal glory!

Whether you choose the basic game or the expert version, each game will be different and surprising due to varying weather trend!

– Translated description from back of the box

name: Sea Monsters Battle
description:
In this matchbox-sized game, players are sending sea monsters out to battle each other.

Each player draws a hand of three sea monster cards and rolls three dice. Then, they each select one card and one die to send into battle. Players receive a point if their die matches the value on the card.

If both or neither players match -- or if the "Man" sea monster card is chosen, then the player with the higher die value wins.

name: 1863: London Underground
description:
A Victorian London setting sees players compete for financial success with numerous historical companies that can be founded, acquired, merged, and folded to represent an alternative history of the London Underground from its audacious beginnings to its eventual semi-nationalisation in 1933 under the umbrella of the London Passenger Transport Board.

1863 London Underground is railroad operations and share trading board game in the 18xx series of games, and based on the rules from the excellent 1817. The small geographic location and the addition of subsidiaries, operating costs, and the looming shadow of the LPTB are some of the main features that set it apart.

Each turn players can open new, or buy/sell shares in existing companies. These companies expand their underground network by laying track and running trains to generate revenue. This can be paid as dividends to share holders or retained to purchase new trains and cover expenses.

The end of the game occurs when either the last train is purchased or only one company remains. At this point the player with the highest personal wealth in cash and assets wins. With no luck involved, success is found through careful planning, shrewd decisions and ruthless actions.

-description from designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Loans, Market, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Kolekcjoner
description:
Players take on the role of art connoisseurs and create collections of works from the interwar period. In a simple and fun way, they learn about the artists and works created in the years 1918-1939.

In the following categories: Literature, Poetry, Painting and Music, nine works were presented, each with a short description and an illustration presenting the author. Critics' cards tell you what combination of Literature, Poetry, Painting and Music will bring the greatest glory to the collector. The winner is the player whose collection is worth the most points.

name: On to Stalingrad: Unternehmen Wintergewitter
description:
On November 19, 1942, while the main force of the German Army Group B was concentrated in Stalingrad, three Soviet armies launched an offensive against the Romanian units that were defending both flanks. This was the launch of Operation Uranus, aimed at encircling and destroying the German 6th Army. In response, the next day Hitler sent Erich von Manstein of the 11th Army, which was preparing to attack Leningrad, south to lead the rescue of Stalingrad. On the 21st Paulus of the 6th Army was ordered to defend Stalingrad — because Goering had assured that the Luftwaffe would provide the necessary supplies, and he waited for Manstein to come to the rescue.

The rescue operation, dubbed the "Unternehmen Wintergewitter", began on December 12. Although the advance was brisk immediately after the start of the offensive, the speed of the advance slowed down due to the reinforcements from the Soviet forces that kept coming. The Soviet forces diverted the troops that were to be used in Operation Saturn in an attempt to prevent Manstein from breaking the siege. Still in the lead, the 6th Armored Division came within 50 km of friendly forces in Stalingrad on the 19th.

If the 6th Army had broken through the siege at that time, it might have been able to escape the siege by attacking from outside and inside. However, Hitler did not allow the 6th Army to conduct Operation "Thunderclap". In the end, Manstein's relief force, which had reached the limit of its strength, was repulsed by the Soviet forces, and it was routed to the starting line of the offensive by the end of December.

On to Stalingrad: Unternehmen Wintergewitter is a two-player wargame based on Operation Winter Thunderclap. One player is in charge of the Axis armies (German and Romanian) and the other player is in charge of the Soviet army.


Issue game of Banzai Magazine EX #5.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control
publishers: Bonsai Games, Kuro Neko Design Workshop

name: Pájaros en el Alambre
description:
The title Pájaros en el Alambre means Birds on the Wire. The game consists of cards with ten different birds, all armed with guns.
At the beginning of the game, a wire with 10 different birds is laid out on the table. During their turn, a player may choose to either exchange a card from their hand with a card on the wire; or move a card on the wire to the left or right (as stated on the card). Each kind of bird has a requirement as to how many of them must be adjacent to another to form a set. When a player creates a set, they take out those birds as score cards and replace them with cards from the pile. When the wire cannot be refilled, the player with most points is the winner.

name: Mutant Mudds Deluxe
description:
Defeat the Mutant Mudds and collect the Water Sprites... WITH YOUR FRIENDS! The official Mutant Mudds Deluxe tabletop game uses a dynamic modular board game system and contains 2 bonus Mutant Mudds mini games.

Features:

Gorgeous hand-painted artwork
An adaptable Dynamic Board Game System
2-4 player gameplay
Combine with other Game Decks (like Mutant Mudds Super Challenge) for fun expansions
2 Bonus Unique Mutant Mudds Deluxe Mini-Games
Extra cards to create your own Board Designs


Players must collect Water Sprites by purchasing them with points they earn during gameplay. The player with the most Water Sprites at the end wins!

It's time to get Muddy!
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Atooi, Game Decks, Limited Run Games, You Lose I Win, LLC

name: Bimba: What Do You See
description:
Rediscover the power of your imagination as you take on the role of a storyteller. Use the Bimba Cards to interpret phrases in your own unique way. Then convince your fellow players that your interpretation is the most meaningful. Score points for every vote you get and every vote you can sway in your favour. You win if you have the highest number of points at the end of the game.

Game Play..

Each player is dealt with 5 cards and as game begins, One player picks a phrase card and reads it out to the other players,

Each other player selects the card in their hands that best matches the phrase and gives the selected card to the dealer, without showing it to the others.

The dealer shuffles the cards with all the received cards. All pictures are shown face up and every player votes for the cards that best suits the phrase. They cannot vote for their own card. Then one of the player challenges the votes and tries to convince the others about why another card is better suited and pitch for it. Players can tell stories, bring out instances to convince the other players to change their votes. The challenger scores one pink token for every vote they turn in their favour.

Players score points for every vote for their own card and collects the tokens.

Apart from the phrase cards, players can opt to create their own Stories, Verse, Phrase or a word. If they win this round, they get an additional 20 points apart from the votes.
The game ends when the deck is empty or when the players decide to end the game.

The base game and all expansions have 84 main Bimba cards each with phrase cards, Vote cards, 1 play mat, 84 winning tokens and 1 Rule book.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Open Drafting, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Targeted Clues

name: Children of the World
description:
Great for learning new cultures!

We are all different, but all equal. With so many countries to learn from, this will be a perfect start for a lifelong
appreciation for cultures.

Exploring people and cultures activates children’s natural curiosity, and keeps them engaged time and time again.

The child rolls the dice, chooses a continent and places a pawn there, chooses a card. We check that the card fits the continent. If so, the child solves the task. For the correct answer, he can add a stamp to the players' passport. At the end of the turn, he draws 2 tokens from the bag. If there are two conductors - the players lose one of the tickets.

If they fill out their passport before using all their tickets, they win.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Lose a Turn, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pokémon TCG: Sun & Moon Celestial Storm Expansion
description:
Watch out for the vortex in the Pokémon Trading Card Game: Sun & Moon—Celestial Storm expansion! It's a season of furious emerald storms and a sky alive with portents, as Pokémon and creatures from Ultra Space clash. Some ride the storm, and others defy it, with a lineup including Articuno-GX, Blaziken-GX, Scizor-GX, Stakataka-GX, and the amazing Rayquaza-GX, plus new Prism Star cards featuring Latios, Latias, and Jirachi.
