Face the winds of change head-on in the Pokémon TCG: Sun & Moon—Celestial Storm expansion!


Over 160 cards
3 Prism Star cards
11 Pokémon-GX and 3 Ultra Beasts
27 Trainer cards, plus Rainbow Energy



—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: たっちっち (Touch-Chi)
description:
(from the publisher)
TOUCH-CHI is a game to test your sense of touch. Match the Hole Cards with the Picture Cards. Search for the card with the matching number and shapes of holes using only your sense of touch.

12 types of specially made Hole Cards. Your fingertips will naturally want to explore the scattered holes. Contains a mix of easy and hard cards for all ages to enjoy.

Can you trust your fingertips?! A game of touchy-feely fun!

name: Animal Malmienu
description:
Find the Animals hiding in nature!

'Animal Malmienu' is a fun game of memory and speed. Hide animals in the grass, forest, and rocks and guess which is the last to remain hidden.

Four different games cater to a variety of age groups and player numbers.

Detective Battle (3 players; Age 10+; 20 minutes): Players reveal their animals hidden in nature one at a time and try to guess the final two missing animals

Memory Challenege (4-5 players; Age 8+; 15 minutes): Pass around the animals hidden in nature and try to remember them all. Which animal has been left out?

Speed Game! (3-5 players; Age 6+; 15 minutes): A race to capture the missing animal after checking all the animals hidden in nature.

Hide-and-Seek (2 players; Age 6+; 10 minutes): The animals are playing hide-and-seek. Can you guess all the animals correctly? A great game for young children.

name: Axis Mundi
description:
Axis Mundi is a 3X (Expand, Exploit, Exterminate) mythological-space themed game, in which each player commands one of four worlds: Olympus, Takamagahara, Asgard and Kukultan.

The goal of each player is to become the AXIS MUNDI - the axis of the world - of the intelligent and primitive civilizations of the worlds that populate the galaxy. In this way they will be the hegemonic culture of the galaxy.

A game consists of twelve turns. The game ends at the end of the twelfth turn.

In each turn, each player may perform up to three consecutive actions.

Actions allow movement and combat, the occupation of planets, the exploitation and regeneration of their resources, the deployment of combat units, and the development of one's own civilization on occupied planets.

A player wins if he has more controlled planets than the rest of the players at the end of turn twelve.

—description from the designer (translated)

AXIS MUNDI es un juego de temática mitológico-espacial 3X (Expand, Exploit, Exterminate), en el que cada jugador dirige una de estos cuatro mundos: Olimpo, Takamagahara, Asgard y Kukultán.

El objetivo de cada jugador es convertirse en el AXIS MUNDI –el eje del mundo- de las civilizaciones inteligentes y primitivas de los mundos que pueblan la galaxia. De este modo serán la cultura hegemónica de la galaxia.

Una partida consta de doce turnos. La partida finaliza al concluir el turno doce.

En cada turno, cada jugador podrá llevar a cabo hasta tres acciones consecutivas.

Las acciones permiten el movimiento y combate, la ocupación de planetas, la explotación y regeneración de sus recursos, el despliegue de unidades de combate, y el desarrollo de la civilización propia en los planetas ocupados.

Un jugador gana si consigue más planetas controlados que el resto de jugadores al finalizar el turno doce.

—description from the designer
categories: Civilization, Dice, Fantasy, Mythology, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Modular Board, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Zone of Control

name: The Whirling Tower
description:
a cooperative 3D Tower Defense game.

Try and stop the conquistadors from entering and destroying the Bacab Temple.
Work together simultaneous as a team to manipulate the tower, upgrade the weapons and turn each section for maximum damage.
Survive the onslaught for 6 or 8 rounds to win the game.

Each round has 7 phases

1. Building phase:
Build new weapons or abilities onto the tower
Research the next level of your abilities
Upgrade abilities on the tower to a next level

2. Turning phase:
Pass resources to other players by putting resources on the top of the tower
Decide as a group which levels of the tower to turn. To give each player the best fighting chance to win the next attack.

3.Second building phase:
Now the tower levels have turned, a new building opportunity has risen.

4. Attack phase:
Everybody can now attack the conquistadors in front of him, using the damage and abilities on the tower.

5. Resource phase:
Each player looks at the resource abilities on the tower on his side and multiply them by the same resource regions on his part of the battle map.

6. Move conquistadors phase:
Move all the conquistadors that are still alive one space closer to the tower. If they would enter the tower the game is lost.

7. Spawn phase:
Each player spawns 2 new conquistadors on his side of the board.

-description from designer
mechanics: Automatic Resource Growth, Cooperative Game, Negotiation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: デッキ構築型脱獄バトル (ALCATRAZ-2vs2)
description:
This game is a 2v2 cooperative battle deck construction type board game based on the jailbreak incident that actually occurred on the prison island "Alcatraz". Aim to escape from the prison island "Alcatraz" while cooperating with each other and obstructing the actions of the other party! Includes 597 cards.

Prisoners need to dig a hole from the prison and reach the raft outside the prison. However, there is only one raft for escape.
In order to dig a hole, you have to procure escape tools while stealing the guard's eyes. Explore various areas of the prison to find tools. Use the guards instead of avoiding them to control this Alcatraz and stop the other team from escaping.

The team that escapes, wins!

商品紹介 このゲームは、監獄島「アルカトラズ」で実際に起こった脱獄事件を題材にした、2対2の協力対戦デッキ構築型ボードゲームです。 味方同士で協力し、相手勢力の行動を妨害しながら、監獄島「アルカトラズ」からの脱出を目指せ！ [セット内容]　カード 597枚
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: クローバーブーケ (Clover Bouquet)
description:
For two people. Draw one card from the opponent player's hand with the same contents, add one card from your own hand and compare the size of the total number, but only when 4 is mixed, the strength of big and small is reversed. It's a rule.

A model for reading games. It's okay to read each other like this! It's strong to be able to count, but there is also a moderate amount of luck. With the information of the drawn cards drawn by each other, I wonder how to deal with the hand. It solves the problem that if you are completely lucky, it is just gambling, and if it is abstract, the one who is accustomed to the game tends to be unilaterally beaten / beaten.

二人用。中身一緒の相手プレイヤーの手札から1枚を引き、自分の手札から一枚を追加して合計数の大きさ比べをしますが、4が混じった場合のみ、大小の強弱が逆転、というシンプルなルールです。

　読み合いゲームのお手本。読み合いはこういうのでいいんだよこういうので！　カウンティング出来ると強いけど、引き運の部分もほどほどにある。お互いに引いた引かれたカードの情報がある中で、手札とどうやりくりするかを悩む。完全に運だとただのギャンブルだし、アブストラクトだとどちらかゲーム慣れしている方が一方的に殴る/殴られるゲームになりがちなのをうまく解決しています。

name: グッドプライス！ (Good Price!)
description:
グッドプライス！ (Good Price!) is a communication game from Japan. Players are business planners trying to bring together new products to sell on a TV shopping network. They must keep the products in a price range, and get them approved by the company chairperson.

The game has a deck of 52 Material cards, each quartile shows a product type, such as fish, futon, suit, song, curry.

The other decks have a variety of price info, from 100s to millions of Yen. There are numbered cards for voting and ranking cards, #1 marked as 'Chairman'.

The game has paper and pencils so players can write out their ideas. Once the products have been discussed, players vote on them, and the winning ideas get scoring chips.
user summary

name: Dywizjon 303
description: Each of the participants of the game becomes a pilot of Squadron 303. While circling the territory designated on the board, all pilots try to get a certain number of tokens as quickly as possible by accurately shooting in air combat or by knocking down enemy bombers. However, each pilot must be careful not to get hit himself. Knowing the history of Squadron 303 and the Battle of Britain (which can be found in the booklet attached to the game), players can earn additional tokens by answering the questions on the drawn cards. After collecting the appropriate number of tokens, you must still safely return to the base. Whoever does it first is the winner.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Educational, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Race, Set Collection

name: 零次元（Dimension Zero）
description:
A trading card game using many famous animes, such as naruto, bleach, one piece.
The game like duel masters, players can use any card as energy and use energy to play cards. Attack player use characters to attack and defence player can choose to block or take damage. Player takes 6 damage will lose the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: Szybkie bańki
description: The game objective is to find the right card faster than your opponents. The player who has the most cards at the end will win.

name: Hot Wheels. Вызов принят!
description: Children's racing game where players upgrade their cars and try to win trophies during the 3-laps' drive. The one who gets the most points in the end wins.

name: The 実名報道 (The Jitsumeihodo)
description:
The 実名報道 (The Jitsumeihodo) is a game from Japan in which players identify famous people by their real names. In japan, Jitsumeihodo means 'real name reporting' and is the somewhat controversial practise of identify people in news coverage by their real names.

The game has a deck of 60 cards, 30 being the real names of people, and 30 showing a colour photo of the person. On the back of the photos is the same photo min B&W and a short text explaining what crime they were arrested for. For example, a popular comedian caught with cocaine, or a hit-and-run driver.

The 30 photo cards are shuffled and laid out randomly on the table, showing only the colour photo side. The deck of names is shuffled up and placed in the middle, so the first name can be read out.

Players try to match up the correct name to the face. However, this is difficult since the people are generally known by a public name, not by their real name.

The game can be played solitaire.

Like many Loserdogs games, the game is sold in a large ziplocked bag with minimal production. The cardstock is thin but playable.
user summary

name: Lollipops
description:
Keep an eye out for the quantity, color, and type of candy. As soon as you see a common feature on 3 cards put them in your victory pile! Very fast, very simple, very fun.
There are 5 colours, 4 types of sweets and 3 options of quantity on the cards.
Cards are being laid out slowly.
All players watch the opened cards and act simultaneously.
As soon as there are 3 cards with a common feature on the table players have to identify the feature and say it out loud. E.g. "Ice cream!" or "Blue!" or "Two!"
Whoever calls out the feature first takes the cards.
The goal is to collect the most cards.
Where are some wild cards which can block a category or substitute any feature in category.

5 cool things about Lollipops

everyone loves sweets
fast-paced and noisy gameplay – perfect icebreaker
keeping in mind 3 features instantly pumps up the reaction, speed, and attentiveness
just a little space needed to play
easy to carry around.


—description from the publisher

name: う～っ「まん防」！ (Mmm..."Manbo!")
description:
This is a freebie game by Toryo Hojo where players are the head of local Japanese government and try to reduce the number of people affected by the decline of the economy from COVID-19.
Players muct make good use of the “Manbo” policy to slow down the new Coronavirus!

Each player controls regions of Japan that have a matrix of infected population and economic health. On their turn, a player rolls dice and performs an action from the chart:


COVID excise tax increase
Healthcare subsidy
Unemployment stimulus
Stay-at-home request
Go eat
Go travel
"Manbo!"


With the other die, they must raise the infected population of the matching region.

Because the COVID outbreak occurred in the same year the Tokyo Olympics were scheduled to happen, the torch relay happens contemporaneously with player actions and is used as a timer for the end of the game.

The game was included as a part of the Spring 2021 Market Crash pack.

name: Harry Potter: House Cup Competition – Draught of Living Death Promo
description:
Promo card only available at conventions through the USAopoly booth. Later added to Dice Tower Kickstarter 2021 as a replacement promo for the unfulfilled Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle promo.

Brew a Draft of Living Death:
Costs: 7 Potions and 2 Magic Levels.

You lose 1 Level but you give another player 3 Levels

name: Harry Potter: House Cup Competition – Locomotion Charm Promo
description:
Promo card only available at conventions through the USAopoly booth. Later added to Dice Tower Kickstarter 2021 as a replacement promo for the unfulfilled Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle promo.

Craft a Locomotion Charm:
Before placement, move another of your workers to a new location. Gain the reward at that location.

costs 7 Charms - 2 Magic tokens.

name: Harry Potter: House Cup Competition – Listen to Kreacher's Tale Promo
description:
Promo card only available at conventions through the USAopoly booth. Later added to Dice Tower Kickstarter 2021 as a replacement promo for the unfulfilled Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle promo.

Hard Challenge:
Listen to Kreacher's Tale
costs 9 Potions - 9 Charms - 3 Knowledge

If the challenge is won, the user wins
70 Gems and 1 Magic token.

name: Trust Me, I'm a Superhero!: Silly Expansion
description:
You've taken out the trash, and your city is safe again... Or is it? A range of sillier options for family friendly fun is available.

This expansion adds 20 more Powers and 20 more Supers to the game that can be mixed in to add a little silliness and wacky combos to the game.

There are no changes to the rules with this expansion, just mix in, play and laugh yourself silly!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game

name: マーブル (MABR)
description:
マーブル (MABR) is a word game from Japan. The 70 card deck has English letters on one side, and corresponding Hiragana on the other. With all the hiragana (including the dakuon and semi-voiced sounds) and the first letter of the romanised form (a for a, k for ki) written on both sides.

There are three different ways to play with the cards.

1) ガサゴソアルファベット Rustle Alphabet
Players put the cards spread out on the table, with the side with the roman alphabet facing up. Players choose a theme and have a limited amount of time to collect cards to make up words in Japanese that are associated with the theme. Players take up cards to make a word, seeing the Hiragana side.

For example, if the theme is 'summer', then players could make japanese words like すいか (watermelon), ひまわり (sunflower), ぼんおどり (bon odori), うちわ (uchiwa) and so on. But players can only see the roman letters on the table and there is only one card for each Hiragana. So if a player uses the R card for the Hiragana り (ri) in sunflower, then another player will not be able to complete 'bon odori'.

2) スリーレターズ Three Letters
The deck is shuffled and players are dealt three hand cards. Players hold their cards with the roman alphabet facing out to the other players.

In turn, players draw one card from the deck, and discard one card from their hand. A player is trying to get to a Japanese word using the Hiragana that they see. Once they have a word, they declare, and other players have 20 seconds to guess the word they've made from seeing the roman letters.

For example, if the player is showing KNK as their three cards, is their word きのこ (mushroom), or きんこ (Kinko), or こんき (Konki)?

3) もやもやメモリーズ Misty Memories
This is a team game played in 2 v 2 or 3 v 3.

Players are at a reunion, having a nice conversation. However, it's been a long time, and memories are hazy. Try to get through it with a reasonable answer!

Players use the cards they have been dealt to compose word using all the vowel sounds, AEIOU. The theme is decided by the letters on top of the deck, such as N → "The moment I wanted to cry". Then one team asks the other team to tell a story, using the roman letters to make a word key to the story. For example "Tell us about that time when you really wanted to cry. It was about... TKS!" The challenged team has to reach into their memories, and recount a story using a Japanese word formed from TKS and vowels. If they can make up a good story, they get awarded points.
user summary
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: KuruKuru Kitchen
description:
KuriKuri Kitchen is a game from Japan. Originally published in 2008 it was re-issued at the Tokyo Game Market in 2015.

The players are cooks in a kitchen putting meals together. There are head chefs that move about on a simple rondel of numbers. The value of the head chef aids the players. The cooks are melding card sets in the style of Mahjong and Rummy. When a player discards a card, that moves a chef around the rondel. The player can use the number of the chef to help complete a meld.
user summary

name: Sokushinbutsu!
description:
Devote yourself utterly to the way of the buddha, and mummify yourself to help in achieving salvation for all of man-kind!

In this three-phase rummy game, try to collect a combination, discard that combination you just got, then discard all your cards.

name: Tautotì
description: Tautotì is a creative writing game based on tautograms, a puzzle game that consists in forming sentences or compositions whose words start with the same letter. The youngest player draws an inspiration card and, immediately after, a letter card. He places them in the center of the table, clearly visible to all players. Then turn the hourglass: each player has the task, in the time of the hourglass, to write on his blackboard a meaningful sentence containing at least one subject represented in the inspiration card. One point is counted for each word in the sentence that begins with the letter drawn. One point is subtracted from this sum for each word that does not have the required initial. If, while composing a sentence, you come to a net of 5 words with the same initial, the score doubles. The game continues with another round of play (the player to the right of the last one draws the inspiration card and the letter card, and so on...). The winner is the one who reaches, first, the score of 35 points (or more, as chosen by the players before starting the game).
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Tour of Dice: Vietnam
description:
January, 1964: Welcome to the U.S. Military Assistance Command, Vietnam - Special Operations Group (SOG). By volunteering for this duty, we expect great things from you. The North Vietnamese Army and the Viet Cong are making a push towards Saigon. We’ll call their combined forces the VC.

Through covert ops, we need you to throw a wrench into the VC wheels and turn this war around for Democracy. We’ll be focusing in Laos and Cambodia, strictly unofficially.

As the One-Zero (Team Leader), your job is to outfit your crew, get in, get the job done, and get out. You’ll be heavily outnumbered and outgunned, but we believe in you.

Tour of Dice: Vietnam is a card-driven game for 1 player. Built from the ground up to be a great solo experience for the SOG player, Tour of Dice uses a solobot to control the Viet Cong.

As the SOG player, you sign on for 12+ secret missions from dangerous Assassinations, Heart-pounding POW rescues, Hijacking trucks, Infiltrating bases, and much more.

With limited resources, you can call on Chopper Support and Airstrikes in attempts to gain a hold on the battles. Your outnumbered team of special forces need to sneak through the jungle. Each unit of a team equals a single soldier working towards the cause. Heavy bunkers, hidden snipers, and torrential weather all stand in your way.

Will your Tour be a success or a disaster? Tactics and Luck will decide.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Aldarra
description:
Welcome back to the vibrant world of Sordane – a massive and sprawling setting of diverse nations, cunning crime syndicates, bustling economies, and adventure everywhere! Lost more than 300 years ago to a powerful convergence storm, Aldarra was left uninhabitable. Centuries later, the chaotic magical energies began to finally subside. Now, Aldarra is being claimed by those seeking wealth, land, and power. Suddenly, nations from all over Sordane’s largest continent, Bordair, are sending fleets out. The first to stake their claim will reap the benefits; the power, the advancement, the riches, but who will emerge victorious?

In Aldarra, you play as one of four mighty factions, warring for control of this long lost nation. Each Faction has its strengths, and its history, within the lore of Bordair. 3-4 players will select their faction and take as many paths as they can to emerge the new rulers of Aldarra.
Use your fleets to exterminate your opponents. Complete secondary objectives and build up victory points as you venture forth from your stronghold to explore new territories, expand your control. Manage and extract the resources and Sordalite crystals you need to grow, replenish, and upgrade your forces. Strategically use the unique abilities of your faction to out maneuver your opponents, and gain control of this magical land.

Aldarra will feature over 150 massive and finely detailed minis,randomly generated hex tile maps and variable starting positions that demand dynamic tactics from turn one and ensure no two games are the same.
categories: Civilization, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Tridoru
description:
Tridoru is a fast paced strategy game where two players will represent a clan, Mikoto or Kawagama, trying to conquer the reign of Tridoru.

Clans will use cards to deploy troop tokens in a 3x3 square grid board. You will have to carefully select these cards, since they will deploy your troops, but they will also deploy the other clan's troops.

Once a square has enough troop tokens on it, the clan will deploy a camp token on it. The first player who completes 3 squares in a row with camps wins the game. But watch the other clan, as they can steal your position.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Super Chess
description:
Super Chess is the ultimate card game for chess enthusiasts.

It is a card-based expansion of traditional chess that puts a twist on the way traditional chess is played by introducing 36 unique cards. When activated, these cards spice up the game in a variety of unpredictable ways.

A single card might turn the tide of the game in your favour, while a card used by your opponent could take the game in a completely different direction.

—description from the designer

name: Popcorn!
description:
A fast and competitive card game in which players try to get a set or run of cards before the other players, while also trying not to get caught hogging too many kernels if someone else beats them to a set.

Each player is dealt a hand of five cards, and then once the dealer says go, players discard down to no less than three of their cards and takes up to two cards from the middle bowl. Players may also trade cards between each other until someone has a run or set of cards. Either 5 cards in sequential order, or 5 cards of the same kernels, or 5 cards of sequential kernels. Once the qualifications have been met the player to do so yells "Popcorn!" at which point all other players cease discarding.

Players then see which cards they have in hand that do not belong in their hand, and the Popcorn! player gets the sum of kernels on the combined cards. Cards are shuffled and redealt by the next dealer, and play continues until everyone has dealt, whoever has the most kernels is the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Pez a la Vista
description:
The beautiful Tiwiimi River is home to the greatest fish. On its shores, various tribes compete with their handmade boats in a fierce annual competition. The tribe that catches the most fish gains prestige and honor. This time you will lead the expedition to the river so get ready and manage your boats as best you can to get as many points as possible.

During his turn, the player must risk taking out boats to have more options to fish. After a few decks you choose a fish card, and place it in the river to gain points and resources. Then the fishing phase follows where you activate your boats and use the resources to catch fish and earn more victory points. After this, the purchase phase follows where you acquire boats to improve the deck and catch a greater number of fish.

The game ends when the four decks have the same number of players or less and the winner is the one with the highest score among their ships of the same color and tokens.

—description from publisher



El hermoso río tiwiimi alberga los más grandiosos peces y en sus orillas diversas tribus pesqueras que con sus barcos hechos artesanalmente se baten en una feroz competencia anual, por tanto, la tribu que atrapa más peces gana prestigio y honor, esta vez tú lideraras la expedición al río así que prepárate y gestiona lo mejor posible tus embarcaciones logrando obtener la mayor cantidad de puntos posibles.
mechanics: Action/Event, Connections, Deck Construction, Pattern Building, Pieces as Map, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Connecting Cubes
description:
Players take turn placing cubes of their color onto a common place area. Get enough cubes in a row to win. Both game modes are characterized by there being no board and no limit to how far the common structure might expand as pieces are placed.

In mode A, players can only play flat onto the ground. They can expand the grid in any of 4 directions, but cannot stack cubes. Get 5 in a row to win.

In mode B, players can only play into a wall. They can expend it sideways in 2 directions or upwards. Get 4 in a row to in.

—user summary
mechanics: Stacking and Balancing, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Cookie Contest
description:
The goal of this strategic card game is to make a delicious cookie for as many famous food judges as possible.

The object of the game is to score the highest total number of points.

Players earn points when they make a cookie for a judge.

Players lose points when a judge does not receive a cookie before the end of the game.

—description from publisher

name: Ipse Dixit
description:
«Veni, vidi, vici», «One for all, all for one!», «I have a dream!».
Do you know the most famous aphorisms?
In this fun and original memory game for everyone, you associate each sentence with its author and discover sayings you've never heard before!

The maps are shuffled and arranged scattered and covered on the table (in an easier way the tiles can be arranged in a 6 x 8 rectangle). The youngest player first discovers a map with a black back (author) and then a map with a beige back (aphorism). If he manages to match an author with his aphorism, he earns the maps and continues to play; otherwise he covers them and the turn passes to the next competitor. The game ends when there are no more maps on the ground: the winner is the one who has earned the most author-aphorism pairs.

—user summary

name: More or Less?
description:
A real challenge of calculation in mind: spin the spinner, roll the dice and find the pairs before the others!

Keep the spinner at hand and place the discs in the center of the table to form a circle so that they are easily accessible by everyone. Each player gets a token worth three points.

The youngest player starts by turning the spinner: the number indicated by the arrow will be the goal for this round. The same player throws all the dice within the circle formed by the discs. Now alil the players, at the same time, look for a pair of same-coloured dice whose sum or subtraction results in the number indicated on the spinner. Whoever identifies a pair must quickly take the discs of that colour.

For example, if a player finds a pair of red dice, he/she must take the red discs. The beige dice works as a wild colour dice; that is, it can be added or subtracted from the other coloured dice: In this case, the final number is obtained using three dice, two of the same color plus the beige one. The game continues until one of the players, asserting that there are no more useful calculation combinations, takes the black "stop" disc. At this point, the players proceed with the verification of the calculations and point counting.

Final scores and game goal For each correct calculation, a player receives 1 point for each disc taken using the beige dice and 2 points if they did not use it (i.e. using only two dice of the same colour). The player who takes the black token also collects 2 points, but if he/she also took other discs, this is worth 3 points! For each incorrect calculation, the player loses 1 point, or 3 if she/he took the black disc, too. The game continues in the same way until a player reaches 15 points becoming the winner! If two players tie at 15 points, a tiebreaker round will follow to determine the final winner.

—user summary

name: Polihisztor
description:
In Polihisztor, players in their turn roll a 6d dice. If they landed in a blue space, they pick up a question card. The card has 5 trivia questions, if they answer correctly they move one step forward. If they don't then nothing happening.

The game ends when a player has stepped in all four castle. The players have 4 "puppets". They must conquer all the 4 corners.

The first player who has won the four corners, wins.

—user summary

name: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory: Factory Dash Game
description:
Race your friends to the factory gates by backing your favourite character.

Each player turns a card over to see which characters move forward, or backwards, until they reach the finish line. Play over three rounds to see who wins, and you can't pick the same character twice.

Contains 50 cards.

—user summary

name: Trivial Pursuit: Guinnessin virallinen pelikirja
description:
A book containing 3000 questions and answers in the six standard Trivial Pursuit categories:

Geography
Entertainment
History
Arts & Literature
Science & Nature
Sports & Leisure

There are always 25 questions of one category in one spread. Answers can be found from separate booklet.

—user summary

name: 60-luku: Vuosikymmenen peli
description:
How much do you know about the 60s, that decade of Beatlemania, Kekkonen and the landing on the moon?

200 cards with one question per card and the answer on other side. There is either multiple choice question from one of the five categories or kind of text recognition task.

Players take turns asking questions. The first player to get five correct answers wins the game. Multiple players can get points on a round.

—user summary

name: 70-luku: Vuosikymmenen peli
description:
How much do you know about the 70's, that decade of disco music, Lasse Virén and the spy agency?

200 cards with one question per card and the answer on other side. There is either multiple choice question from one of the five categories or kind of text recognition task.

Players take turns asking questions. The first player to get five correct answers wins the game. Multiple players can get points on a round.

—user summary

name: Strained Kingdoms: Strifull – The Card Game
description:
STRIFULL tells about the period of the Heretic Wars on the continent of Auslend, in the universe of Strained Kingdoms.

Choose your side, feel yourself on the battlefield amid swords, shields, storms and energetic explosions, and achieve glorious victory…or your own destruction.

Each of the factions has 60 Troop Cards (3 copies of 20 cards), 3 Leader Cards, 4 Tokens (representing the Elemental Stones) and 1 Die. In STRIFULL, players compete against each other while taking on the mantle of one of the Leaders of the chosen faction, crafting strategies and combos to beat the opponent!

Your cards are organized in two 3x3 grids, with your leader character in between them. Each of them has a specific role in the game, one being used to attack your opponent while the other is meant to defend your clan. In your turn, you will move your troops and your leader, use your leader's abilities, recruit new soldiers and engage in battle with the opponent in order to exterminate their lines. The first player to completely overpass all of the opponent's lines is the winner!

—user summary
mechanics: Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Square Grid

name: Magic Maze: Tile C
description: Promo Tile C is one of the tiles from the Magic Maze: 9 New Tiles set. This set was originally available as a full set at Spiel 2017, with the tiles made available individually through various outlets and partners after the show. BGG was given tile C to distribute.

name: Hippo Melonenmampfen
description:
A battery-powered motor placed in the center of the table rotates a boom with four hippos. Four radial arms lead out to the players' barns. When the hippo of your color passes by and opens its mouth, you have to throw the melon into its mouth with the help from a little lever. The first to munch 5 melons wins.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic, Real-time

name: Picaria
description:
Picaria (meaning "little stone") is a two-player abstract game from the Tewa tribe of the Pueblo people of the North American Southwest. Most likely it was derived from games introduced to the introduced to the natives by the Spanish in the 17th Century.

It is similar to tic-tac-toe, but more related to Three Men's Morris, Achi, Tant Fant, and others because the pegs can be moved after they are placed on the board.

An exact twin can be found in Scandinavia where it is called "luffarshack" and in Asia as part of the Ko-no tradition. Picaria in particular was first described in academic circles by the American game historian Stewart Culin in 1907. The game was analyzed by Larsson and Rocha at Dalhousie University, Halifax, Canada.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Homo
description:
Players each control 12 round, triangle, and square pieces that can move diagonally and orthogonally, diagonally, and orthogonally respectively. Capturing is done by sandwiching an opponent's piece between two of the same pieces. The winner is the player who captures all of his opponent's pieces. A player loses if he cannot move or no longer have two pieces of the same shape.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Square Grid

name: Året Der Gik! 2020
description: A 2020-themed expansion for Det dårlige selskab, with footnotes on all cards explaining the puns and jokes. 140 cards and three blanks for adding own fun.

name: Turf
description:
At the beginning, each player receives 150 marks, 3 green chips, 3 red chips and a betting slip. The race goes over different distances. Each player bets on the outcome of the race (win bet, place bet or run-in bet). The horses are moved according to the number of points scored. The green chips are acceleration tokens, the red ones are deceleration tokens. The winner is the one who has the most money after the winnings have been paid out.

—user summary

name: Die Kugelbox
description:
The further apart the balls are, the more points
points (distance between the balls or the area that is formed).Up to 25 points with one throw are possible.

The box contains 2 types of games:

Chikugo
A ball in which the goal is to get as few chips as possible
or to get rid of them as quickly as possible...

Steal Exactly
Ball game where the goal is to get to collect chips with as high values as possible and to or to steal them from other players...

—user summary

name: ME-MORY
description: In this game you match photos of landmarks of the German city of Mettmann from past times to the more current view of the same place. The game mechanism is the same as in the classic memory game, but each pair consists of two different photos: a current one and an older one.

name: ΜΕΓΑΣ ΑΛΕΞΑΝΔΡΟΣ
description:
Simple „Roll dice and Move“ game, similar to the „Game of Goose“.
Here players follow the path of campaign of Alexander the Great from Pella (in Macedon) through Asia Minor, the Levante, Egypt, Babylon, India (Hydapses) and Gedrosia to the Finish in Susa (Persia).

For the time the quality of content was great including plastic dice cups and Ancient looking - in fact Roman (!) - miniatures from famous firm Elastolin.

Gameplay is simple: Roll the dice and move along a given path. Certain spaces have „Events“ where things happen to you.

name: The Kingdom of Cuteopia
description:
As a brave explorer in The Kingdom of Cuteopia, your quixotic quest for fun, friendship, and treasure awaits. Yet, it will not come easy, as there are others traveling this region who have similar objectives, and dangerous pitfalls exist around every bend in the trail. Do you have the moxie and gusto to conquer the numerous baddies who stalk these magical lands, and be rewarded for the risk? If so, trek on, daring one. Become the hero you were meant to be.

How To Play
Players take turns drawing a card from the deck, or playing a card onto the discard pile. There are a few types of cards; "Treasures" go into their "backpack," "baddies" are placed face-up in an open area, and "item," "magic," or "friend," cards are placed in hand to be played on a future turn.

If an event card is drawn, the action stated on the card is to be immediately taken (if possible), and the player's turn ends.

If a player plays a card from their hand to the discard, the action stated on the card is to be immediately followed (if possible).

The game concludes when all cards have been drawn from the deck, and all players can make no moves. The player with the most points wins!
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Down & Across
description:
The game of quick-thinking wordplay presented by Will Shortz, NPR's puzzlemaster and crossword editor of the New York Times.

Down & Across is a fast, competitive word game. Draw your letter tiles, roll the clue dice, and be the first person to come up with a two-word crossword to fit the clues!

—description from the designer

name: Pictofun
description:
Pictures must be placed in a chain as long as possible. To do this, the other players must accept an association with a free category and the current card. You draw and show a card and name an association; in teams, the association named first is valid. If the association is not accepted or if there is no free space, the card is discarded and a new one is drawn. Another team/player can take this card and use it for a free category, it scores 2 points after time expires; the active team scores 1 point per card in the longest chain. The first to reach 25 points wins.

—user summary

name: とっとらりー (TToTT Rally)
description:
The original TToTT (Table Tennis on The Table) has been transformed into a new, easy-to-play card game that anyone can master.

Enjoy a rally with Hello Kitty, Pocchaco, Cinamoroll, and your favorite Sanrio characters.

Give one player all the pink back cards and the other player all the blue back cards. Each player places two service cards in his or her playing area. Shuffle the rest of the cards and place each deck face down. Both players draw five cards from their decks into their hands.

Use rock, paper, scissors to determine the starting player. The starting player chooses one Service card to play and initiate the rally.

A player must chose a card from his or her hand that features a character shown on the bottom of the card played by his or her opponent.

Keep on playing back and forth. Each player should draw a card from his or her deck after a successful turn in order to maintain 5 cards in his or her hand.   If a player does not have a matching character, their opponent wins a point. The losing player then returns all the cards in his or her hand to the deck, reshuffles, and draws 5 new cards.

The serving player rotates with every point scored. Players can use any service card as they wish.

The first player to score seven points wins!

name: Troja: Der zehnjährige Krieg
description:
Troja is a „theme box“ in the „Terra X“ series, „Terra X“ being a TV program and Magazine treating interesting themes from History and/or Geography.

The „Troja Box“ contains three things, one being a game.
1 Game Der zehnjährige Krieg ("The ten years war") to play the war
2 Forms, gypsum/plaster and acryl paints to make reliefs
3 Leaflet with comic strip plus instructions for #1 above

The board game consists of Trojan & Greek hero cards, god cards and Cards for the Walls of Troy or the Greek camp respectively.

Players play hero cards which can be upgraded by fitting god cards. The winner removes parts of the wall or the camp of his adversary

When 4 wall sections or camp elements are conquered, that side looses the game.

Nice graphics and all the important heroes from the Iliad are there.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Corner Crush
description: Your goal in Corner Crush is to get four of your pieces in a row before the opponent does, but the "game board" is a rotating tower that has four sides, with each side having two columns for playing pieces, with up to six pieces fitting in a column. You take turns dropping pieces in a column, and since the board is circular, you have to be aware that attacks can come from multiple directions.

name: Champions
description:
A game of strategy where players are trying to win medals in various disciplines by playing corresponding cards. There are always four different disciplines to score at any time. Gold, silver and bronze medals each can be won only once for each sport.
In turn, players either exchange cards drawing from the deck or play a matching set to claim the discipline. Others may play higher sets to steal the win or matching ones just to stop the player.
The game ends when someone wins 5th medal or the deck runs out. Points are counted for each medal won (3 -gold, 2 - silver, 1- bronze. The highest score wins.

name: Ghost Out (ゴーストアウト)
description:
Ghost Out is an abstract game where players cast ghosts at each other. The first player to chase out all the ghosts from his or her area is the winner. On their turn, players chose whether to cast a ghost from either their own area or a shared area space. Ghosts can be casted in any diagonal direction.

When casting, a player will pick up all ghosts currently on that area space. The player then choses a direction and puts one ghost marker on each space proceeding straight in that direction until they have used up all the ghost markers.

If a player finishes casting and the last ghost marker lands in his or her own Safe Area, the player may take this single ghost marker and place it off the board to be used for Reincarnation.

After finishing this Capture step, the player may then choose whether to use Reincarnation or Store. By using Reincarnation, the player will draw a card with a bonus written on it. Reincarnation rewards the player with a bonus but if the player Stores their captured ghosts, they can trigger an even bigger Reincarnation bonus later in the game.

The bonus enables the player to cast again and chase away more ghosts from their area. However, players should be careful not to chase away too many ghosts which could result in limited choices. Instead, they should strategize to chain the bonus events together so that they can win in one fell swoop. At the end of a round, remove any ghosts that remain in either player’s Safe Area.

name: Final Challenge: Rated R
description: Hide the kids, hide the elderly, send the easily offended and sensitive friends back home, because the content of the Rated R expansion really packs a punch. It’s cringe worthy, hilarious, and borderline unmanageable.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Acting, Player Judge, Real-Time, Role Playing, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Shake & Make
description:
A quick shake changes the position of the dice. Play solo, or take turns to play heat to head with a friend.

Shake & Make is a pure-luck game that is contained entirely in a single small plastic dome. Shake the dome and 4 dice fall into slots to display 4 random numbers. A rulebook (attached to the bottom of the dome) summarized different patterns, mostly following Yahtzee/Poker pattern rankings. Play solo for the best combination or competitively by comparing to see who rolled the best pattern.

Take turns to see who can get the best score - Highest total, 1 pair, 2 pair, straight, 3-of-a-kind, 4-of-a-kind...

Do you have the luck to shake and make the best roll?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Motif: Expansion Deck
description: A set of 52 Motif cards.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Zone of Control

name: Sudoku Explorer (數獨探險家)
description:
Each player takes a Sudoku board, 3 puzzle cards and 6 of each type of adventure.
The puzzle cards are inserted into the Sudoku board and the players begin to solve the puzzle at the same time.
Upon completion of the puzzle, the first player to solve the puzzle correctly receives 3 gems; the second player to solve the puzzle correctly receives 1 gem; and the player who solves the puzzle incorrectly also receives 1 gem after correcting it.
When everyone has completed all 3 puzzle cards, the player with the most gems wins!

name: Pandemie Poker
description:
In the humorous and instructive card game Pandemic Poker, everyone wants to protect themselves from the infectious viruses. Mouth and nose protection or disinfectants will benefit you and a few rolls of toilet paper can also help you out.

It is important to keep your distance, also with regard to the playing cards: the cards have different values ​​and may only be placed on the discard pile with a certain (number) distance. Each card has an additional function that can have an advantage or disadvantage for you or your fellow players. Whoever manages to discard all of his hand cards wins the game.

Pandemic Poker is Uno with distance rules and strange special abilities. No cards that are directly adjacent to it are placed on the stack, only those values ​​may be placed that are indicated as permitted on the previous card. After all, we have to keep our distance. In addition, there are special cards that I can play at any time if I have two of the same type. So I suspend or draw cards. Alternatively, I also get rid of CoVid19 cards or swap cards in my hand. And speaking of CoVid19 cards. If we have three of them in hand, we are eliminated from the game. Whoever gets rid of all of his hand cards first wins.

name: Crowded Kitchen
description:
Race your opponents in this lightning fast, real time, set collection card game. Fight over limited ingredients in the Kitchen. Organize your cook space. Plan ahead by storing ingredients in your Pantry. Compete against other chefs to complete recipes as fast as you can and earn the prestigious Excellence Stars.

There are no turns. All players play at the same time.

Players attempt to complete Recipe cards as quickly as possible using Ingredients taken from the Kitchen. Each player has their own deck of recipes, but the ingredients in the Kitchen are shared. When players complete a Recipe, they set that recipe card along with any ingredients used to complete it aside in a completed pile. Players then reveal a new recipe from their deck.

When a player has no cards left to draw from their Recipe deck, the round ends. Players score one point for each completed Recipe and Ingredient used to complete those recipes (ignoring Sketchy Substitutes). The player with the most points, wins the round and earns a star card. Each star earned increases the difficulty for that player in future rounds by limiting the number of recipes they can have active. The first player to collect the required amount of stars, wins.
mechanics: Race, Real-Time, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Journée de merde
description:
Your day started off pretty well but by adding "shitty day" cards to your story, you find that it just gets more and more rotten.

Accumulate awkward and embarrassing situations to have the worst shitty day by picking or placing a card.
The winner is the player with the high score (points are written on each card).
An aperitif game to spend hilarious evenings with friends.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Turn Order: Auction

name: Dice Plunder
description:
A jolly game of piracy for 2. Loot cargo from your opponent to upgrade your ships and rule the seas.

The seas are ripe for plunder! Pirates fight for control of cargo and territory, clashing in epic naval battles for supremacy. You and your ragtag fleet of ships encounter another captain on the seas. This means war! Upgrade all your ships from Sloops to the Man O’ War to seize the ocean!

Players move their ships by flipping coins, battling and plundering their way to earn coins. With these coins, they upgrade their ships.

To win, upgrade all of your ships to Man O’ War. Once all three of your ships are Man O’ War, you drive out your opponent’s fleet and conquer the seas!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Pirates, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Square Grid

name: Crowded Kitchen: Salt & Pepper Expansion
description:
The Salt & Pepper Expansion adds additional recipes, stars, and ingredients to the base game, Crowded Kitchen. These cards allow Crowded Kitchen to be played with up to 7 players, 2 more than the base game's player count of 2-5.

The rules and gameplay for the Salt & Pepper Expansion are the same as those for Crowded Kitchen when playing with 4 or 5 players.
mechanics: Race, Real-Time, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dr. Seuss: Happy Birthday to You! Game
description:
Today is your birthday, the Day of All Days, and it’s time to gather friends and family to celebrate with a game! Wake up to the Birthday Bird and travel with him to the wonderful places of Katroo.

Players spin to find out how many spaces they can move and collect colorful presents along the way like birthday cake, rockets, flowers, and more! Once the presents are all gone, it’s time to race back to the Birthday Palace for a celebration. Be the first one to arrive at the Palace and gain bonus stars!

players count up the start on their present cards and, if you have the most stars at the end of the game, you win!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Jungle speed + Jungle speed électronique
description:
In Jungle Speed, you must rely on your keen sense of observation and quick reflexes. It requires a steady hand -- which can be hard to maintain during the many fits of maniacal laughter! The wooden Totem sits in the middle of the table, waiting for the player with the fastest reflexes to snatch it up and win the game.

Each player is dealt a hand of cards. In order to win you must be the first player to get rid of all of your cards. Each turn, all of the players reveal one of their cards. If two cards are identical, those players must make a grab for the Totem. The faster player then gives their cards to their unfortunate adversary.

To add to the difficulty, certain cards are almost identical, which can trick a hapless player into grabbing the Totem by mistake -- a grave error. Other cards force all players to make a grab at once, change the method of play, or otherwise add to the difficulty.

Jungle Speed Electronique keeps the familiar game play elements from Jungle Speed: Players reveal cards from their individual stacks one at a time, and whenever two players have identical cards face-up in front of themselves, they race to grab the totem first. Whoever does so gives his cards to the slowpoke. The first player to rid himself of cards wins.

What's new in the electronic version of this game is the totem will give you directions from time to time that change the nature of game play – some of which might lead you into doing the wrong thing! Jungle Speed Electronique includes three levels of game play with a dozen special actions programmed into the totem.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Frozen II: Splash Match
description: Fill the game tray with water and try to pick up snowflakes with tweezers and try to collect a set before the timer/water Nokk (horse) pops up.

name: Totta vai tarua?
description:
Can you spot the real items from the made up ones? Start your inner lie detector.

Everyone takes turns to be a reader, reading one card of six items on any given category. Other players use tokens to mark whether they think those are real or fake. Points are tallied, and after equal number of turns, highest score wins.

name: Firebox
description:
A real-time railway building game for between 2 and 5 players.

Pick up and deliver your six passengers (miniature dice) to other players' stations, preferably by the longest and most interesting route possible (you get more points that way).

Each player has 16 matchsticks, a locomotive, six stations, six passengers and a tunnel/hill obstacle (they do need to provide their own pencil and paper, however). In real-time, they build end-to-end matchstick tracks connecting with other player networks and then shunt their passengers and locomotives to their destination stations.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Real-Time

name: 红色记忆——党史学习专用教具 (Red Memory)
description:
《红色记忆》是一款集教育性和趣味性为一体的红色主题桌面游戏。教具以中国共产党百年历史关键事件为主线,选取“历史长流、时代大潮”的设计意向,将党史教育内容科学地与教育学、游戏学相结合,让参与者能够全面熟识并深度理解党的历史与经典事件。游戏参与者依托过往的党史知识积累、游戏策略熟识﹐能够沉浸式感受到中国共产党百年历史的艰辛与荣耀，在参与者将每一个事件支流汇入到党史长河的过程中,无人不从内心燃起对于国家的认同感和归属感。
The game is a China-themed board game that integrates educational and fun features. The teaching aids are based on key events in the 100-year history of the Communist Party of China, and the design intention of "long history and tide of the times" is selected, and the content of party history education is scientifically combined with pedagogy and game science, so that participants can fully understand and understand the party. History and classic events. Relying on past accumulation of party history knowledge and familiarity with game strategies, game participants can feel the hardships and glory of the 100-year history of the Communist Party of China in an immersive manner. In the process of participating in each tributary of events into the long river of party history, no one is absent. I ignite a sense of identity and belonging to the country from the heart.

name: Terraternity: The Card Challenge
description:
Terraternity: The Card Challenge is a fast-playing strategic card game for 2-6 players. Master a touch of dexterity and overcome the challenges of reducing CO2 with renewable energy sources.

Your goal is to develop renewable power plants in various countries to make them carbon neutral. You will first need to play a country card to ‘activate’ it, which lets you build renewable power plants within it but adding its CO2 output - literally! - to the Terraternity globe. You’ll need to make sure this globe stays balanced - too many CO2 cubes, and you risk a climate disaster. Whoever balances five countries first is the winner!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Peace: A Card Game
description:
Make peace, not war! This hopeful twist on the classic game of "War" challenges players to outdo each other with increasingly generous acts of kindness. Each card depicts a good deed ranging from simple things (I picked you flowers) to grand gestures (I love you). The most thoughtful act wins the round and if there's a tie, players must find peace.

—description from the publisher

name: All-Terrain
description:
All-Terrain is an off-roading board game where players explore trails and obstacles while racing through a continuous map.

In All-Terrain, players become the driver for one of the unique off-road vehicles. Drivers begin by outfitting their 'rig' with a set number of over-landing add-ons to try and gain the best situational advantage. As drivers leave the garage, they'll need to strategize by plotting their course through the known environment and around other drivers.

Out on the trails, drivers and their vehicle capabilities will be tested on hidden obstacles and unexpected events throughout the map. Once an obstacle has been revealed, other drivers can use that knowledge to their advantage when planning their own routes.

To win the race, you must be the first to run a full lap through the world and a final reverse lap. May the best driver win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Lose a Turn, Race, Variable Set-up

name: Chroni: Les femmes célèbres
description:
From the arrival in Gaul of Clodion the Long-haired (around 430) to the overthrow of Napoleon III (1871), find in this title a selection of 60 sovereigns who have marked the history of France.

Chroni - The Famous Women is a learning game with which we have fun gradually and durably memorizing the big dates. Ideal for the curious who wish to discover or rediscover History in all or simply or the amateurs who want to consolidate their knowledge.

Chroni is a card game where each card depicts a historical event, invention or discovery on both sides, with the year in which that event occurred, invention or discovery was made on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

name: Motamo Junior
description:
Motamo Junior it is a language game to play in family. There are teams of two players. On each team one players has to get the team mate to guess the four images on the card using just one word for each mate.

Each card score one point. The team with teh most points will be the winner.

name: Animal Warrior: Juego de cartas
description: Animal Warrior is a Colombian card game where two races of warriors face off Animals vs Warriors The objective of the game is to gather the sacred jewels mystical artifacts with incredible power that grant their owner fantastic battle skills, it is a living Card Game also the player you will have at your disposal a human hero with unique abilities whose destiny is to become the maximum leader of the two worlds
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Fantasy
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Thieves
description:
Thieves is a fast paced game of stealing and backstabbing set in Victorian London!

In this game you will use your knife to mug other players for all of their gold, but be careful, they might have a gun. Or you could try and steal money from their secret safe using your lock pick. But again, be careful, there might be a body guard around.

The game is about attacks, and counter attacks... and sometimes counter attacks to the counter attack.

In the end the richest person will win the day!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Kill Steal, Lose a Turn

name: Relick TCG: Character Deck WD
description:
Relic is a card game that recreates the relick manga battles in which you will have to create your deck with one of the characters from the series and fight with different weapons and objects from retro video games such as the power glove and the plumber's star! !

WD's deck is all about discarding cards from your hand for crazy fun effects

name: Ukaž, co umíš
description:
Czech board game about knowledge. This game was to test children's knowledge in a fun way. The children are accompanied by a pioneer who shows them the correct answers to the questions.

Translation of the name is "Show what you know".

Description of components and game mechanism:
The game contains a playing area, which is divided into two equally large circles. One circle contains questions on its perimeter - and the other circle contains answers to those questions. In total, the game contains 8 sets of questions and answers to various knowledge topics. The questions are from topics: technology, physics, history, sports, riddles and knowledge of Czechoslovakia.

The game also contains one figure that depicts a child pioneer (scout), who has a wand in his hand and points it to the ground - to questions and answers. The figure can be rotated in the base.

At the beginning of the game, players choose one game board with questions and place it in the game box. The player then places the pioneer piece in the center of the question circle (the pioneer pedestal fits into the recess) and the player turns the pioneer stick to the question he wants to answer. The player then tries to answer the question. Players take turns and count points for correctly answered questions. The winning player who answered the most questions correctly.

name: You Must Be Bunkers
description:
The world is ending and you and a group of like minded individuals have a bunker to live out the apocalypse.
However, there are people wanting to join you in your bunker, but there is limited space. You and your group must decide who is worthy to join.

You Must Be Bunkers is a 3 to 5 player party game where the objective is to take turns to recruit the "best" candidates to join your bunker to live out the apocalypse. The objective of the game is to get the people you deem worthy into the bunker before it reaches maximum capacity.

Each player gets dealt 3 cards from the each deck. This is your hand. One player is then chosen as the leader for the first round, this can be done by playing rock, paper, scissors or flipping a coin or just picking at random.

It is the leader's job to listen to all the other players and decide who gets to stay in the bunker. It is up to the remaining players to convince the leader to choose their person, by any means necessary. The person the leader chooses stays in the bunker and the player that convinced the leader to pick their person gets a ration.

After the leader has chosen a card and a ration has been given, the leader changes from player to player going around clockwise, you then repeat until you fill the bunker.

The game ends when you have 10 people (including the players) in the bunker. The player with the most rations is the winner!

name: Depredadores: Cazando en la Isla
description:
The predators face off in a night scene where the most agile and fastest survives. Jaguars hunt alligators, curiyú, owls and toads, while spider web traps and the smell of skunks turn the game into chaos.

Includes 2 game modes: Hunting on the Island and Gathering Herds.

Hunting on the Island

With the agility of predators and knowledge of the species, protect the weakest animal on the island and take all the cards. You have to be very attentive, the fastest hunter wins!

Deal all cards among players, who will leave them in a face-down pile. At the same time, all players reveal their first card. The first player to cover the weakest animal on the food chain and shout its name, wins the round and take all cards. There are also some special actions cards that could change conditions for the round.

When all cards were played, the player with the most cards, wins.

Gathering Herds

To survive on the island, cunning and agility are essential. Group the animals by species and use all your speed to win the game.

Deal 5 to 7 cards to each player (according to the number of players). Leave the rest of the cards in a face-down deck in the middle.

The dealer signals the start, and each player, at the same time, can:

Put down a pair of equal cards.
Put down a card equal to a pair another player put down.
Take cards from the middle deck to form pairs.


When a player is out of cards, the round finishes. Each player gets 1 point per card left in their hand.

At the end of the fifth round, the game ends and the lowest score wins.

name: Río Profundo: Pesca Vertiginosa
description:
Deep river, mysterious because of the brown that covers it in the eyes of those of us who live above, hides thousands of species that coexist in that muddy and mighty ecosystem, where silver beings swim with the current looking for small prey and escaping from the larger ones.

Fish, predators and birds are confused with canoes, rods and the odd lost shoe in this exciting search game that will take your breath away. Accumulate as many letters as you can by responding to the search prompts. Become the best fisherman on the Paraná River, finding the species or lost objects that the cards ask you to win a race played at the speed of the current.

Place all the river cards on the table face up in the way you prefer. Place the stacked slogan cards face down.

Take a card from the deck of slogans. The player on the left is asked to call out a number from 1 to 6. The mentioned number will show what and how much the player has to catch. If the number you touch is the one with a picture, "Everyone should search at the same time." The first to find it wins.

If the player points to a drawing that does not correspond at all to the mission, they will lose a turn.

If the player completes the mission in less than 30 seconds, he keeps the slogan card. If it fails, it puts it at the bottom of the deck.

The winner will be the player who has won the most cards after four rounds.

name: Rise and Decline of a Galactic Imperium
description:
Rise and Decline of a Galactic Imperium was inspired by both Consim Press´ The Hunters and Decision Games´ Struggle for the Galactic Empire, though the former served more of a scrib sheet of what to copy while the latter served as an example of how NOT to do it. Other influences include "Sid Meier´s Alpha Centauri" and "Babylon 5", and surely many others, but those are the big ones.

As a solitaire wargame, the player leads his nation through up to 60 turns of three different "ages" of a nations history, from the Rise, to the period of highest power, down to the inevitable fall from inside and outside sources. Each turn the player will encounter random events, diplomatic conundrums, great battles and economic dilemma, always wondering which action to invest into during this and future turns.

The game ends once the the 20th, 40th or 60th turn has been played, depending on the scenario the player chose at the start of their game.

Players win by accumulating enough victory points to gain at least a marginal victory, the amount needed for each scenario is detailed in the manual.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Events, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: パタルタ (Pataruta)
description:
Pataruta is a new take on the classic Japanese game of Karuta. The title of the game is a portmanteau of "pattern" and "karuta".

At the beginning of each turn, a card is flipped from the stack to create the winning conditions for the turn. The conditions include two parts and a Venn diagram. Depending on the Venn diagram, each of the two parts must be included or excluded from a card in order for it to fit the winning conditions.

The quickest player to find a card with the correct combination of parts wins the turn. If no cards match the conditions, the fastest player to pick up the condition card wins instead.

When there are no longer any cards left in the stack, the game ends. The player who has collected the most cards is the winner.

name: Pop for Letters
description:
How to Play:

Place the popcorn box in the middle of the table.

Take a popcorn card out of the box and read it.

If you read the word correctly, keep the card. If you read the word incorrectly, place the card in a separate pile of "un-popped" words to be read later.

If you draw "POP!" card, return all of your cards to the box and move that "POP!" card from play.

Take turns playing until the popcorn box is empty. The player who has the most popcorn cards at the end of the game wins.

name: マカリョーシカ Macaryoshka
description: Each player chooses a color of macaron. Players take turns either drawing mini macarons from a bag or choosing one from their personal supply to place on the board. If once color dominates a 4 piece area the macarons grow to the next size. If an area is tied for color, the player placing the last macaron chooses which color will grow. The player that triggers the growth will also determines which color(s) return to the bag. The game ends when one player has placed their two largest macarons or no more macarons can be placed.
publishers: natriumlamp games (ナトリウムランプゲームス)

name: Kenji's Quest: Book One
description:
Kenji’s Quest takes the best elements from the 90’s era adventure/rpg console games and translates them to the tabletop. Featuring exploration, turn-based battles, mini-games, and more—Kenji’s Quest utilizes a ground-breaking Companion App to enhance the experience.

Using the Companion App, the Game Host leads the players through the game by displaying art, showing stats during battle, playing sound—like our Battle Theme below—and much more.

Designed as a trilogy, Kenji’s Quest: Book One allows for you and your friends to experience the book’s six chapters—but here’s a crucial twist—the decisions you make influence the plot, the content you experience, and eventual outcome of the story.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures

name: Arcanon: gra karciana
description:
Arcanon a card game is a proposition for novice players. Take a part in the Acumulatory Race and collect as many paradox charges as possible within a specific time.

Good, Strength, Beauty, Wisdom, Truth - the names of the domains that are supervised by five ministries in the O'vsemir universe. Right here in incessant maze of political intrigues lasts fight for the absolute power. Arcanon is strategical and tactical game that throws more light on the diamond of all fields of Wisdom - Magic.

Plan your actions and manage elements in a matrix to adapt to the constantly changing situation. Do, what all mages do, bluf, reiroll dice, make and break alliances and most importantly, don't get caught. Decide where you want to win and where to lose. Maybe you will lose all battles to win the war? Only here the price for victory, may be the bitter taste of failure.
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Negotiation, Race, Turn Order: Auction

name: Chimp!
description:
CHIMP! is a game based on definitions of weird and wonderful words. Can you tell which are fakes and which are strange but true? Can you fool the others into making the wrong guesses? Can you make up some CHIMP! definitions of your own? Who will be first to score 25 points and win the game?

Take turns as a Reader, and whenever you are not the Reader, you are the Guesser. Up to 8 can join in and everyone is in play all the time. It’s great fun for those who love words and those who delight in telling lies with a straight face.

One each card there is one true definition and 2 fake definitions, but you also have the option of devising a 'CHIMP' which is a fake definition of your own, a tactic that offers more points.

CHIMP! is a pick-up-and-play-anywhere game that takes no setting up, is easy to learn and rewards mischief-makers from age 12 up.

—description from the designer

name: Graal: Les Cartes Goodies
description:
Three additional quest cards: The Gates of Galvoie, Broceliande and The White Lance are available from the publisher as a Print On Demand expansion for the base game.

•••

Trois cartes quêtes supplémentaires et diablement redoutables : les Portes de Galvoie, Brocéliande et la Lanche Blanche. Demandez-les !
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Creative kids
description:
"Creative Kids" is a collection of simple educational games in a 'Print and Play' format for use at school/daycare/home. The set consists of:
-Tetrigo- stacking blocks based on the rules of the game tetris.Each player places blocks (which are determined by a dice roll) on their board in such a way as to cover the scoring fields. The player with the highest sum of points wins

-Seal- guide a seal through a section of the ocean.The player chooses what kind of movement the seal has to make on the board (which are disposable), along the way it has to avoid dangers and collect points in the form of fish. The player who earns the most points wins

-Hello Autumn- collecting leaves in autumn
Players assign dice values to a puzzle that must meet certain values. They receive points for meeting the condition (e.g., an even sum of dice, greater than a given number, etc.). The player with the highest point total wins

-Bee home- a puzzle about creating a bee route to the hive.
The player arranges a travel route for 3 bees of different colors from random pieces. The player who arranges the route first wins

-Block Craft - extracting resources from a mine.Players draw a pit shape which they then draw on their choice of 6 pit maps. This way they extract treasures while avoiding weak points that can collapse the mine. The player who has the highest treasure score at the end of the game wins

-Just Run- a dog race on an obstacle course
Players roll two D6 dice. They choose one of the results and move their character by that many spaces on the map. In this way they earn points and collect sets. Getting to the finish line first also gives a big point bonus. The player with the highest amount of points at the end of the game wins the game

-Impostor- find hidden on the map space traitors.One player secretly marks the position of the 3 astronauts. The other players use 10 questions to try to guess the position of each astronaut. Players who guess correctly are awarded points. Then they switch roles. The player who gets the most points wins the game

-Bowling snap- Players draw the path of the bowling ball. Then they cut it out and put it on the board scoring bonus points and penalties. After 5 courses, the player with the highest sum of points wins

-Pixel People- Players draw a task then arrange the human elements (heads, torso, legs, shoes) into a whole human. Each element has a point value, the goal is to create a man who will have the same value as the task. We arrange 3 people as quickly as possible, the player who does it first wins the game

-My farm- Each turn, players roll a pool of 6 D6 dice. These resources serve as currency with which they buy and improve animals living on the farm, build fences. Some animals can only live in an enclosure with certain others. Each animal gives a certain number of points. The player who has the highest point total at the end wins

-Seeker - Each player gets a board with 100 drawings labeled with numbers. One player chooses a picture and describes it, the rest of the players have to give the number of the picture as quickly as possible, the first one who does that gets a point. After 10 turns we count the points and the player who scored the highest amount wins

The games form a coherent set, outside of which they are not accessible in any way. Each of them contains some educational element and they are designed for children 5+
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Voting

name: KHG: Korrupte haben Geld – Kurz und Sündig
description:
Twenty new additional cards make the game even more exciting and faster. Action cards with which the player can rake in even more dough by taking Austria for a fool. Disastrous chats and the new corruption prosecution complicate the player's life, but with a little skill you can get your sheep in the dry as part of the family.

Contents of the expansion set Short and Sinful

20 expansion cards
84 large banknotes
Game instructions
Facts and figures about the "role models
(The expansion set is only playable with the board game KHG Corrupt Have Money)
Certificate to a false doctorate

name: Kriminalkuvert: Ein schweres Erbe
description:
This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

Your great-great-uncle, whom you never knew consciously, gave you an inheritance in his will.

You are already excited to see what to expect when only this envelope arrives.

The initial disappointment with the supposedly useless inheritance quickly turns into keen interest when you discover that your relative, a police officer by profession, has left you documents on a criminal case that he apparently worked on unofficially in his spare time.

And with whom he personally had more to do than he should ...

You can buy it here:
https://www.ergoetzlichkeit-shop.com/

name: Mothership: XL Add-On Pack
description:
Go Extra Large - Beef up your galaxy with a bigger board, new ship colours and massive 8 player games!


XL Board: Set up your perfect galaxy on a larger, 24" board with new artwork. Connect it with the existing board to go even bigger!
New Colours: Conquer your enemies in style with new black and silver fleets.
8 Players: Includes all the needed components to add 2 more players to the game, including extra mineral planets.

name: huh?
description:
