"huh?" is a game about Boolean logic. It is played with two kinds of cards: "pattern" cards which each have a Boolean function, e.g. "(a or b) and not c," and "epsilon" cards which each contain three out of a set of six letters.

Five games are provided, each of which works the same way: some number of patterns are provided and each player substitutes some of the six letters into one of the patterns to make their secret function. Players take turns selecting an epsilon card from a display and asking another player whether their function produces the result true or false for that card. The object is to be the first to deduce another player's function.

There are also two "pregames" to get players used to Boolean functions.

name: Who is Who?
description:
Similar to Guess Who?, but with full length characters carrying various items. One of the characters is selected, and players take turns asking questions to try to guess which one.

From the publisher: There are 50 characters to choose from. Players compete to be the first to guess which one is pictured on The Who is Who card in play. As questions are asked and answered, characters can be removed from the board, narrowing the choices.

In the advanced rules players don’t remove characters from the board.

name: Nichtlustig: Superlemming – Trinkspiel-Promo
description:
These are ten new promo cards, two for each player.

German card texts:
"Ein Spieler deiner Wahl muss trinken."
"Ein Spieler deiner Wahl muss dir was zu Trinken ausgeben."

name: ブブカ (Bubka)
description:
In ブブカ (Bubka), seemingly named after famous Ukrainian pole vaulter, Sergey Bubka, the players are beginning pole vaulters who are bidding on a series of poles to use in their first competition.

Players will earn points for having a series of poles that are close in length at the end of the game. Each turn a pole is auctioned off, and the players have a limited set of chips to bid with, and will not receive change. Players also may not measure the pole on auction and must visually inspect it at a distance.
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Constrained Bidding

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Hall
description:
War has ravaged nearly all of the Inner Sphere’s core planets, and Hall is no exception. Caught between the conquests of empires and the ambitions of warlords, the world’s history is as harsh as its unforgiving deserts, howling canyons and shifting sands. Hall has been at the crossroads of some of mankind’s most brutal wars, conflicts which have left centuries of secrets ready to snare the unready and tempt the unwise.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.

name: BattleTech: Operational Turning Points – Widowmaker Absorption
description:
In 2834, the feud between Clans Wolf and Widowmaker came to a head, and the resulting Trial of Refusal led to the tragic death of ilKhan Nicholas Kerensky at the hands of Clan Widowmaker. Furious at the ilKhan's death, the Wolves took it upon themselves to hunt down every last Widowmaker warrior in a bloody Trial of Absorption that spanned multiple Clan worlds.
Using the Turning Points PDF exclusive format, Operational Turning Points: Widowmaker Absorption lets players experience the events that turned the Clans' world upside down and set Clan Wolf on the warpath. Witness firsthand the unbridled savagery that forever altered the course of early Clan history.

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual Missions or Touchpoints, following a campaign arc, and inserting it into their own campaigns. This PDF exclusive includes detailed information on every world where Clan Wolf hunted down its prey, a rundown of the forces involved in the conflict, an overview of the historical campaign, and several tools and tracks that players can use to run historical characters and battles from this time period.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Historical Turning Points – Tortuga
description:
While the Jihad raged, pirates had their way with the newborn Filtvelt Coalition. Finally, the Filtvelters had suffered too much. They launched an invasion of Tortuga Prime, to punish the pirates in their den. But the force sent to exact retribution found itself mired in a close-packed city filled with traps and enemies too numerous to count. The invasion became a desperate effort to survive to return home, bearing secrets the pirates and their Word of Blake sponsors would prefer remain concealed.

BattleTech: Historical Turning Points: Tortug uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, or inserting it into their own campaigns. This PDF exclusive includes a rundown of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to recreate the entire violent conflict on Tortuga. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Operational Turning Points – Fronc Reaches
description:
After the Jihad, Inner Sphere border worlds were no longer easy pickings for Periphery pirate bands. Instead, they returned their attention to the Periphery’s weaker nations. The nascent military and non-existent intelligence assets of the Fronc Reaches made the young nation a particularly tempting target. Opposing them were the Colonial Marshals, who risked everything to permanently drive the pirates from their worlds, but faced vastly superior numbers. Would the campaign be the dawn of a new nation, or the twilight of the Marshals?

Operational Turning Points: Fronc Reaches gives players the chance to recreate this desperate struggle for the very survival of a young nation. This campaign uses the Chaos Campaign and Alpha Strike rules in concert to allow players to fight individual Missions and Touchpoints, follow a campaign arc, or inserting the Marshals’ bold plan into their own campaigns. Included are detailed information on the worlds involved, full details of the units which took part in the campaign, an overview of the historical campaign, and several tools players can use to run historical characters and battles from this time period. The only limits are the players’ imagination!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: NätTrollz!
description:
NätTrollz! is a party card game for 2 to 5 players (you can be more but then the choices are reduced slightly) from 10 years. In the game, you shoulder an online role with a single purpose - win or destroy as many discussion threads as possible on your particular social internet platform.

On your turn, players lay cards on the discard piles by matching the color icons in the upper corner. A player wins a discussion thread by playing a picture of a Cute Kitten in the thread.

The game ends when all 5 cats have been played. The point values of cards are totalled and the player who has scored the most points when all five cat pictures have been played, wins the whole evening and can calmly log out with the keyboard intact. The cards you have left on hand at the end of the game give minus points, so you never want to let a good argument be lost!

name: Warsemble
description:
Warsemble is a turn-based strategy game for two to four players. The rules of the game allow for different situational games in which the target, the size of the field, and the size of the armies can vary.

There are only three rules in Warsemble (movement, rest, and battle), which reflect principles of actual military action:

The game is played in turns. With each turn, the player can move or update all figures.


Movement: Figures can move in four directions (forward, backward, left, and right) to adjacent accessible squares. Each time a figure enters a new square, its strength is reduced by points equal to the effort value of the square. Within each turn, the figure can be moved to as many positions as its strength allows.



Rest: Each figure that stays in place and is not attacked increases its strength by one point each turn, until it reaches a maximum strength of six.



Attack: The attacking figure must enter the square of the opponent figure, following the rules of movement (i.e., it must expend the strength needed to enter the opponent's square). After moving, the strengths of the two figures are compared and the stronger of the two survives.


The game is won by the player who first brings the crown to the base.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: カキタス進化論 (Doodled-On Evolution)
description:
カキタス進化論 (Kakitasu sinka ron) Doodled-On Evolution is a game from Japan. Animals have survived by undergoing a series of changes called evolution. And evolution takes place when an animal's wish to change is conveyed to its Evolution Agent.

In this game, the players, as Evolution Agents, help animals evolve according to their wishes by the magical "paint-on" pen. If an animal wishes to eat leaves in height, extend its neck and tongue. It would also be nice to extend its limbs.

However, do not be complacent. Other players will ask questions to check if each evolution fulfils the wishes. Through the repeated process of evolution and checking, aim to be the best Evolution Agent.

生命創造系 お絵かきクイズゲーム
進化とは動物たちの「こうなりたい！」というノゾミが、担当の進化係に伝わることで起きている！？
あなたは進化係となり、動物にペンでカキタス(書き足す)ことでノゾミ通りの進化させましょう！
どのノゾミを叶えたか他のプレイヤーに当ててもらうことができれば、優秀な進化係として得点を獲得できます。
上手く伝わるように進化させ、高得点を目指しましょう！
publisher's summary

name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3145 Capellan Confederation
description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Capellan Confederation introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.

name: FrogKnight: Ribbit Royale
description:
A battle has broken out between Frogs, Knights, and all creatures of the Ribbit Kingdom.

Players battle around the board acquiring all different kinds of weapons, ranging from a measly fly-swatter to Bazooka to a swarm of flesh-eating beetles and eliminating other players. As the playable area shrinks, players are forced in towards the middle until one is left standing as King of the Hill. Champion Royale. Winner, Winner, its Flies for Dinner!
mechanics: King of the Hill, Player Elimination

name: Giftabell
description:
A judge draws cards to help inspire a fictional character. One card gives the first letter of the character's name, the other card gives the first letter of a profession, species, or other descriptor.

Then, 2 more cards are drawn. Everyone else thinks of a 2-word ‘gift’, starting with one letter from each card. Whilst people are thinking of gifts, the judge can improvise some details about the person.

Once more than half the people have decided, they all explain their gifts and then the judge picks a winner (the most useful gift for that character), to become the new judge. That player also gets the 4 cards used in the round.

At the end of the game, whoever has the most cards is the winner!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play, Word Game

name: FuertoRite
description:
FuertoRite (フエルトリテ) is a trick-taking card game from Japan. The game box shows a sail boat on Lake Ashi, which looks strangely familiar.

In FuertoRite, players follow normal trick-taking rules, but with some changes. Players draw more cards as they play, so ending with more hand cards than when they started.

Further, players draft cards with their neighbors during the game. This mix of drawing, drafting and hand management gives the game a different feel.

Scoring is based on which cards players win, but only the smallest set counts, so players must be careful to balance their winnings.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Field of War micro card game
description:
Field of War is an asymmetric game for 3 players. Quick to setup and play, but deep in strategy and escalating consequences. 2 players will fight over the territory playing command cards, recruiting troops and rolling dice to attack each other. While a third player will try to farm his fields while dodging bombs in a worker placement and resource management style of game. Wait enough time, and the farm workers will raise against its oppressors.

On a turn, the farm player will use their workers to do an action of one of the available fields. Those actions allow him to gather resources, recruit more workers, build a barricade to peacefully trade with the surrounding troops. The army players however, will pick a command card from his hand to choose actions and march over the fields of the farmers, shoot any enemy rolling dice, recruit more troops or upgrade them.

Both sides will collide and at any time, the farmer player can decide to turn intro a revolutionary and fight the armies back.

The game ends when the farmers gather enough resources to pay for mercenaries. Or when the armies eliminate the opponents or troops arrive at the opponent's command base.
categories: Card Game, Farming, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Worker Placement

name: ABC Miam
description:
OBJECT: to fill up the two monsters you own by drawing the right animals.

Each player is the proud owner of 2 monsters! Greedy but difficult monsters, because they only feed on certain letters contained in the names of animals. To try to feed them, you have to draw a card. You then say the name of the animal shown on it. If this name contains one of the letters the monster likes, the monster can be fed. To be full up, it will need 15 calories, i.e. 15 points shown on the cards... Beware of the “indigestion” cards which can make you lose points. The first player to fill their 2 monsters up wins the game!

+++ 2 difficulty levels so players can play at their own pace!

—description from the publisher

name: Forty Thieves
description:
A board game using cards from a traditional deck, Ace through 10 in four suits, and a 6X6 square grid, and colored pieces of two colors. Each square on the grid is labeled with a number representing all combination of products of the card ranks, e.g. 1 (1X1),2 (2X1),3, 4 (2X2, 4X1)..81 (9X9). Two players take turns play a card from their hands into either one of two rows, and then place a piece of their color into the location on the board matching the product of the two cards. For instance if a 3 is the top most card exposed and they play a 7 they could put a piece into square 21. This continues until a player gets four pieces in a row or the other folds.

—user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Stega och dippa
description:
A simple roll and move game with dinosaurs that accompanies the comic book "Kalle Anka & C: O" no. 42, October 18, 1993 (Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck). Roll the dice and move your game piece, read what is in the square. First in goal wins.

—user summary

name: Äggjakten
description:
A simple roll and move game included in the comic book "Kalle Anka & C:O" no. 13/14, March 28, 1994 (Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck). Roll the dice and move your game piece and read what is in the square. The goal is to collect the most Easter eggs before the finish line. The one with most eggs when everyone has reached the finish line wins.

—user summary

name: Cirkus-spelet
description: In the comic book "Kalle Anka & C: o", no. 21, 21 May 1984 was a simple roll and move game with circus theme (Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck). Cirkusspelet is a simple roll and move game where the first in goal wins. If there is a square with a number, read the instructions and follow them.
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Jakten på Spökplumpen
description:
A game that was included in "Kalle Anka & C: o", no. 34, 22 August 1988 (Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck).

In Jakten på spökplumpen you have a round disc with white dots on it with a bowl of water next to it. Each round, dip a finger in the water bowl and rub on a white dot so you see the clue. Then everyone guesses where "Spökplumpen" is hiding. The one who guesses correctly wins and if no one guesses correctly, it is the next player's turn. This person dips a finger in the water bowl and rubs on a white dot to see the clue, then everyone guesses where "Spökplumpen" is hiding. This is how the game goes on until someone has guessed "Spökplumpen's" hiding place. Whoever guesses correctly wins.

name: Knatte-kul i jul
description: A simple roll and move game with a Christmas theme that was included in "Kalle Anka & C: o", no. 52/53, 21 December 1992 (Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck). Each turn roll the die and move. If you end up in a red square with a number, read the instruction for that square and follow it. First in goal wins.
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Improving Games: Battleship
description:
The Battleship cards were called "Fixing Other Games" cards, and I don't think that's the perfect title. We're not trying to make them better (although many will say that games like these need to be better), we're just trying to craft a different experience.

The Battleship cards, while tiny and dark, they make the game less of a seek and find and more of a seek and learn. And the Captains cut the length while giving cool bonus abilities. Just a few small changes, but a very different experience.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical

name: Pokémon Scratchees:  The Flame Pokémon-athon
description:
Pokémon racing game with flying, dragons, fire, electric, and bug Pokémon. "Gotta scratch 'em all!"

In this scratch off game, two players scratch off a square on the track, revealing Pokémon, Team Rocket, treasures, etc. Depending on the revealed icon, players get to scratch off other sections of the card and potentially score points. Whoever collects the most points wins the game.

For solo games, the player plays both sides until a winner is determined.

name: Baby Dinosaur Alphabet
description:
Complete the dinosaurs and learn the alphabet by matching the two dinosaur halves together! The dinosaurs have been all mixed up, but you can help get them back together by matching the front and back half of the dinosaur by the image or by matching the first letter of the dinosaur type with the first letter of the dinosaur’s name.

Baby Dinosaur Alphabet is an easy to learn matching game for toddlers as young as two! With multiple ways to play, help kids learn image-based memory and matching skills, letter recognition, and the alphabet. Players start by spreading out the cards face down, and on their turn, they will flip over 2 cards. If the cards are a match, they set the pair aside. If the cards do not match, players will have to remember where they were and find the other matching pieces on their next turn! The player who creates the most matching pairs wins!

The colorful cards are a fun way to learn the alphabet and can help toddlers develop new skills. Kids can play on their own, against their friends, or cooperatively to match all the dinosaurs together!

-description from publisher

name: Khepri
description:
The High Priest of the Order has passed away, after some good years of service, leaving the place vacant. Now the God-Emperor of Egypt must deliberate who will fill the position.

After a revealing dream, where the God-Emperor has a conversation with the God Khepri himself (Scarab God of Ancient Egypt), it is decided that the way of election must be by confronting the Priests to a battle of cunning and strategy that will leave one of them on top.

In Khepri, players play the role of an aspiring Priest of the Order of Khepri. The winner of the game will be elected the new High Priest.

Khepri is a board game for 2 to 4 PLAYERS, where there is no chance, therefore what prevails is strategy and logic. It is an abstract game where the number of players, per game, forces to change the strategy to win. Duration: 30 min. to 45 min.
The rules are very easy to learn, as they occupy only 1 sheet of paper. Three types of maneuvers, movement and how to score.

The game has been completely designed by Pere Martinez, who already has some other experience in this game world, such as Kao.
For the magnificent illustration of the box and the design of the board we have counted on Amy Kitsune.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Först till skatten!
description:
A roll and move game where you roll the dice and move your game piece every round. If you end up on a red ring, read the instruction in the speech bubble and follow it. The player who comes first to the treasure chest in the cave wins. But watch out for the troll on the way there.

The game was included in Semic´'s "Barnens Jultidning" in 1978.

name: Gift game: Nic nie ukryjesz
description:
Pointing fingers is usually considered rude, but it's downright obligatory in this game!

One player reads the question, everyone counts down to three, and selects the person they think best fits the description. All players who fall into the majority group win a card. The first player to accumulate 5 cards wins the entire game.


Wskazywanie palcami jest zwykle uważane za niegrzeczne, ale w tej grze jest wręcz obowiązkowe!Jeden z graczy odczytuje pytanie, wszyscy odliczają do trzech i wskazują osobę, która według nich najlepiej pasuje do opisu. Wszyscy gracze, którzy znajdą się w grupie większościowej, wygrywają kartę. Pierwszy zawodnik, który zgromadzi 5 kart, wygrywa całą rozgrywkę.

name: Safari-spel
description:
Safari-spel is a roll and move game with a safari theme. Each round, roll a dice and move the number of squares it shows. If you end up in a square with an animal, read the instructions and follow it. First to the village in the middle of the game board wins.

Safari-spel was in the comic book "Musse Pigg & C: o" No. 2, February 1983. Musse Pigg is the swedish name for Mickey Mouse.

name: Disney's-Jubileumsspel
description:
Place "Kalles Kalas"-cards in a pile with the collector image side up. Roll the dice and move. If you end up on a question symbol, the player on the left must pick up a card and read the question with the same symbol in front. If you answer correctly, you have to roll the die again and move. If you answer incorrectly, you must remain in that circle and the next player in turn must roll the die. When a card has been used, it is placed back at the bottom of the pile. If you end up in a red circle, the next player will have to choose which category you must answer. Nothing happens on yellow circles. First in goal wins.

The game was included in "Kalle Anka & C: o", No. 16, April 18, 1994. Kalle Anka is the swedish name for Donald Duck.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Trivia

name: Escape from Earth
description:
The Faction needs you! The End is near and you are there, looking at your cell phone, sweetie! They called them conspiranoids, they laughed at them, and the vast majority did not heed the signals, but NOW ITS HERE.

The famous Meteor that everyone has heard of is about to collide with our planet and the Government continues to deny it to avoid chaos. The time has come to decide: Do you accept your fatal destiny or do you rebel and fight to create a new one, safe from Final Destruction? Are you willing to face your friends and family to the last consequences? Steal their resources and boycott their advances? Will you leave them lying at the last minute in order to save your skin? Congratulations. You are the kind of person that Escape From Earth needs!

The player in his turn draws cards and performs actions on the cards in his hand. He can attack another player or draw resource cards from a market. The objective is to obtain cards that have the 5 types of resources.

name: Skurkregister
description:
All but one of the villainous faces should be covered with the villainous images. The pictures are placed upside down and the cards are placed randomly.

It's about finding face pairs. In turn, you turn over the cards, compare with the image on the board that becomes visible and put the image back if it is not a pair.

If you get the right card, place it with the image facing up in the box with the same image. The box where the card was located will now be open and it is important to find that face. So you continue until all the face pairs are found. For each pair you get one point. If you find a pair, you have to try again. If you do not find the right face, the tour continues. The one with the best memory and the most points wins.

This game was included in the comic book "Kalle Anka & C:o", no. 39, 20 September 1996.

name: 5 Surprise Mini Brands!: Mini Market Dash! Game
description:
Get ready to dash! Race around the market using one of the Mini Brands Collectable movers, gathering all the Mini Brands you can. Complete your cart to collect them all!

—description from the back of the box

The game is based on a series of collectible miniatures based on actual brand name items, four of which are included to use as pawns representing the players. Players also receive three cards representing a shopping list, with three food items on each. On your turn, you roll a single die (d6) and move that amount around the board. If a space has a face-down token it is revealed, and if it is an item you need you can pick it up and put it on your list (it stays on the space if not). There are also a few "wild" tokens that can used for any item. Other spaces let you draw from a deck of cards with a variety of actions, including stealing tokens from an opponent's list. Complete a list and you get another, and the first player to complete three lists wins. Any token from a completed list is put in the center and can be collected if a player lands on an empty space; as such, the game picks up pace as it goes on as more items are readily available.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Take That

name: House of Cronies
description:
To play House of Cronies, each player’s Cabinet consists of up to 6 cronies; each carrying a set number of votes, plus an optional foreign ally. All cronies, besides the foreign allies, can be elected as president or vice-president. Other positions such as Finance, Justice, Service Delivery and Communications, can only be filled by specialists.

Two decks of cards are placed on the table: the main deck and the tactics deck. The main deck consists of influence, corruption and crony cards and the tactics deck contains only tactics cards. Players start with seven cards from the main deck and two tactic cards each. Any cronies or foreign ally in the initial hand must be placed in the cabinet immediately (and any crony or ally that can not be placed is discarded).

In each round of House of Cronies, five cards are drawn from the main deck and placed face up in the middle of the table. In turn order, players can either pick up an influence / corruption card OR bid influence, corruption or a combination of both for a crony. Players can only gain one card per round, so any player who outbids another forfeits their turn. Players that are outbid, get their turn and their influence / corruption bid card back.

The end of the game occurs when there are no cards left in the deck or fewer cards than needed to draw for a new round. A final round is played for players to buy and used tactics before the election takes place and the player with the most votes wins!

name: DTwww
description:
DTwww is a trick-taking game without cards. The game uses 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, and 20 sided dice in 3 suits and a wild suit. Players draft the dice from a bag -with explicit rules' permission to feel for the number of sides they want, as long as it doesn't take too long- with some of the dice being public in front of a player screen, and others being behind it.

Once everyone has drafted their dice, they are rolled. The game is "must-follow", but the lowest number played of the lead suit will typically win the trick, and the highest number played, regardless of suit, will lead to the next trick.

The winner takes their die and sets it in a special scoring cup; dice from the cup will be rolled at the end of the round to determine each player's rank, with higher rolls being awarded with more points.

The player with the most points after a number of rounds wins.
publishers: Tanuki Tsune Komuten (たぬきつね工務店)

name: Kodiak: l'île aux saumons
description:
In this fun hand management game, you have to carefully play your cards. Play your bears to steal your opponent's salmons and make sure that your salmons do not get caught by the other bears.

In the new game, the players no longer have just bears on their hands but predators (a mixture of bears and a wild animal). Each predator has a unique value ranging from 1 to 60. The player playing the predator with the lowest value gets to pick a salmon first. This way, it is less likely to have ties.
Besides, the ties are now sorted with a new mechanism, the waterfall. In case of a tie with two predators of the same value, the player whose token is closer to the bottom of the waterfall gets to pick first. Then, the token gets moved to the highest spot on the waterfall.

Finally, the new game introduces a handicap card. Each player gets a +15 card that, which when played, adds 15 to the value of another predator, having an impact on the order of the players getting salmon.
mechanics: Hand Management, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Animals
description:
Animals is a game for 3-6 years old published by Ravensburger. Game comes with several sets of rules for different kinds of experience. All the modes are desinged to help kids with different skills.

In the main game animals are placed on their boards and they each need three different kinds of food. The food pieces are placed in a cloth bag. Players take turns picking a random food piece from the bag and place it on an animal, that can eat it (there are different kinds of foods, such as hay, insects, carrots etc. and each animal can eat 3 different types of foods). When a player feeds the third kind of food for an animal they get the animal for scoring. The game ends when all the animals are fed and the winner is the one, who has most animals collected.
mechanics: Matching, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Robot or Not
description:
It's time to prove you are not a robot.

Pick several images that have a common connection. The other players try to figure out the connection. Do they all have traffic lights? Is someone sitting in every image? Or is the connection...coffee! Do not pick one so easy everybody can figure it out. But be careful, if you make it so hard nobody gets it, everyone scores but you!

—description from back of box

name: やーいすけべ (Yaisukebe)
description:
やーいすけべ (Yaisukebe) is an adult-themed party card game from Japan. Players are lads at school. Somebody has brought dirty magazines to school, and tries to hid them in someone else's schoolbag. There's a bag inspection! Nobody wants to be caught with it, and players try to empty their hand while passing it on.

Alternately, if a player can collect all the porn, they win.
user summary

name: Podaj Łapę
description:
This time it is you give a paw to your four-legged friends!

The players volunteer for the shelter and help find suitable dog houses.
The participant of the game must plan and execute a training plan for his pupils in order to improve their skills and strengthen their qualities. Each of the owners who want to adopt a pet expects different characteristics. Some are looking for a companionable and patient dog, others - courageous and strong.
Pass the paw and become a friend of the animals!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: HotRod
description:
HotRod is a game of collecting fast cars and modifying them to race on different terrains. Players use dice to create tracks, collect HotRods or modify them. Every 5th turn, players will complete a scoring round for one of the Bonus cards. Players may want to delay a bonus card, but doing so will only offer them half of their points.

Specializing in certain Terrains or Track types can help players win big when they race each of their collected HotRods at the end of the game.

Uses language independent components!

HotRod is playable by 1-100 players (or more) in 30-60 minutes. HotRod is part of Roll and Write Revolution! Digital release initially, digital and physical copies will be available from the Game Crafter after the campaign ends.
publishers: Lagniappe Games, Roll and Write Revolution

name: Busy Busy Bake Shop
description:
The Busy Busy Bake Shop is the most popular donut shop in town! They have all kinds of flavors you can mix and match. But lately there’s been a problem: a donut-loving mouse is sneaking off with some of the donuts! Can you stop the hungry mouse from swiping all the tasty donuts? Match up the different flavors of donuts to boost color and pattern matching skills, and practice counting as you calculate how many donuts you saved and how many treats the mouse snuck off with! Players work together using simple strategy and fine motor skills: if you can place 4 donuts in a row before the mouse runs off with 3 donuts, you win the game!

Develops fine-motor skills, cooperation, counting and color and pattern matching Ideal for home or classroom use.

—description from the publisher

name: Boggle First Words
description:
Kids can practice their spelling and word recognition while playing this Boggle game for little ones. With 2 different levels of difficulty, The Ready Set Discover Boggle First Words game is an exciting entry into the world of words. The Find and Match level is a fun activity that helps kids explore words by matching the colored letter cubes to the colored letters on the card. The Roll and Spell level has kids rolling the letter dice to match a die with each letter on their card trying to complete the word within 3 tries. When each letter has been matched, they say each letter out loud, spelling the image they see on the card.

Includes: 5 letter dice, 30 double-sided word cards, cardboard game mat, and instructions.

name: Elefun Flyers
description: A plastic elephant launches circular discs up into the air. Load the flyers into the elephant's trunk, and step down on its tail to launch them into the air. Players take turns launching discs and try to catch them in their nets. The person who gathers the most discs wins the game.

name: 寂晝狼蹤 (Dawn of Werewolf)
description:
A werewolf is attacking the village and the remaining villagers are trying their very best to survive until dawn.

Dawn of Werewolf is a re-theme of Not Alone which is an asymmetrical card game, in which one player (the Werewolf) plays against the villagers.

Playing as villager, you will explore the wild using Place cards and try to avoid, confuse or even stop the werewolf from killing your friends until dawn arrives.

Playing as the werewolf, you will stalk and predict where the villagers hide themselves. You try to kill all the villagers before the dawn.

Dawn of Werewolf is werewolf theme based card game, where you need to guess, bluff, and observe carefully to achieve your goal, kill all the villagers, if you are the werewolf, or survive till dawn as villagers.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Death Ride Normandy: CW Air-Maintenance-Logistics Enhancement
description:
This enhancement provides Air, Maintenance, and Logistics elements to support the Commonwealth forces in the Normandy campaign.
This enhancement provides the Commonwealth player with the entire II British Tactical Airforce. Additional maintenance recovery units, supply transport units, and supply units, all spell extra detail that players will appreciate.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Le croque-couleurs de POP
description:
Pop, the little dinosaur, has lost all his colors! Be the first to feed Pop so that he becomes multicolored again.
Use your memory skills to match food cards with Pop’s color cards and unlock the corresponding stripe color stripe. The first to get all 7 colored stripes wins the game.

This family game requires memory and association skills.
Can be played alone or with the family.

name: Escape the Box: Der verfolgte Sherlock Holmes
description:
Should the great Sherlock Holmes have fallen victim to one of his many enemies? For Watson and his companions, the search for the missing genius becomes their greatest case. A breathless chase through the foggy alleys of London begins, from mysterious crime scenes to behind the doors of secretive gentlemen's clubs. Can they uncover Moriarty's plot before it's too late?

Using dividers and floor cards, you'll transform the game boxes into a unique setting for your Sherlock Holmes mystery. Solve all the puzzles and unravel the secrets inside and outside the box to find the missing consulting detective. This Escape Room will show you if you have what it takes to take on the London underworld.

-description by the publisher

name: メガチェン (Megachen)
description:
メガチェン (Megachen) is a party game from Japan. The players are running an opticians shop. Different women come in and want new glasses to suit a certain style. The players offer different frames and explain why they suit the customer's needs. Players take turns being the customer and vote with a love heart for the best offering.
user summary

name: メガチェン for Mens (Megachen for Mens)
description:
メガチェン for Mens (Megachen for Mens) is an expansion deck for メガチェン (Megachen). This deck brings male customers looking for new glasses to your shop.
user summary

name: Sequence: Jewish Edition
description:
Dreidel ... Haggadah ... Grogger ... Shofar ...

In this special Jewish edition of the popular Sequence board game, players will find symbols of Jewish culture pictured on the gameboard and playing cards. The cards also provide a brief description of each symbol. Players match a picture on a card to one on the gameboard, then place a chip there. Five chips in a row wins the game! It's a wonderful learning tool as well as great fun for families and friends!

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Lords of Lore and Loot
description:
Lords of Lore and Loot is a turn based game that allows each player to build their kingdom from within, explore their surroundings, and defeat the other players. Each round consists of accounting for income, building improvements in their kingdom, training combat units, and exploring the countryside with the player's heroes. The heroes can amass an army of various combat units available to each player in their kingdom according to their faction. They can explore the areas surrounding their kingdom, defeat rogue warbands guarding resources, buildings, mines, and artifacts. Experience is gained from defeating rogue warbands and another player's armies. Those guarded treasures can be used to grow the player's kingdom and armies.

The game takes place over a series of Weeks (turns) and Months (4 consecutive turns). Each week players collect gold for from their kingdom. Each month players collect resources from their mines and controlled buildings. Each player's turn consists of actions they can perform. Collect gold. Move their hero up to their movement speed. Engage with any space along their moved path. Spend gold on an improvement in their kingdom. Spend experience to level their hero up. Learn spells and abilities to aid their fighting armies. Fight rogue warbands or other players to take control of valuable spaces. Dice, from the d4 up to the d20, will be used to fight and perform abilities. Each player controls a faction with a set list of units with various combat characteristics and prompts for which dice to use.

The player that conquers all other players or the objectives set out in the chosen scenario wins the game. Conquering a player happens when a player no longer has a kingdom or a hero. They are then removed from the game. Specific scenarios will outline additional game mechanics and win conditions. There is no set number of turns or time limit for the game.
categories: Economic, Fighting, Print & Play, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Grid Movement, Income, Investment, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Phase Order

name: Monster on Card Game
description: The official Monstermon Card Game is finally here! With 50 cards to battle with, you can fight your friends and local dumpster dwellers like you were back in Kindergarten! This player's set includes everything you need to dominate the playground, from the fearsome Ultralodon to the cuddly Marshmallow.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Build Divide
description:
Aniplex's first trading card game, released in sync with the TV anime of the same name.
In this game, players construct a deck with 40-50 cards and use it to fight with the opponent. Players use character cards to fight, if a character card give the opponent a directly attack, the opponent will lose one life card, the player who makes the opponent's life card to zero will win the game.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: Dark Hand
description: Dual Playing cards, allowing for a number of game variations. Rules for various games are available from the Dark Hand website.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Bankrut
description: Polish version of Monopoly released at the turn of the 70's and 80's. It differs from the original in that you can take profits from your territories while sitting in prison.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: 東方采霊弾 (Tohosaireidan)
description:
東方采霊弾 (Tohosaireidan) is a 'Living Card Game (LCG)' from Japan for two players. It is unofficially based on the popular video game series Touhou Project which introduced the 'bullet hell' mode of play.

In the card game, players choose two of four characters to compete, and each character has their own deck of 18 cards, from which 12 are used.

The game also uses dice to enable cards to be played and for characters to build up their strengths on a character board. The dice have four symbols, a red sun, a blue moon, a green star, and a black Taijitu symbol (popularly known in the West as Yin and Yang). Players roll the six dice, and can hold two and re-roll the rest.

The decks include Barrage cards for bullet hell, which can be used offensively or defensively. Players use their dice rolls to bring cards into play, and then activate them next turn. The goal is to exhaust your opponent's hit points to win the battle and the game.

Players make tactical choices as they develop their decks, but the game also carries a dose of luck with the dice.
user summary

Shoot back! Bulletstorm Card Battle! Use your spell cards to line up your barrage! Beat back your opponent's barrage with your barrage! Team up with your chosen characters and fight with your own unique strategy!

What is Tohou Saireidan?

Toho Saireidan is a two-player LCG (Living Card Game) based on the shooting game from the Toho Project.

In addition to the fun of building a deck of unique cards, you can also enjoy the luck of the special dice, the offsetting of bullets, and the feeling of actually playing a bullet battle.
Experience a new kind of barrage battle!

Included characters
The following four characters are included in the first game.
Reimu Hakurei
Marisa Kirisame
Remilia Scarlett
Flandre Scarlett

撃ち返せ!!弾幕カードバトル!スペルカードで弾幕を並べろ！相手の弾幕は弾幕で打ち消せ！選んだキャラでタッグを組んで、自分だけの戦略で戦え！

東方采霊弾とは

東方采霊弾(さいれいだん)は「東方Project」のシューティングゲームを元にした2人用対戦型LCG(Living Card Game)です。

個性豊かなカードでデッキを構築する楽しみだけでは無く、特製ダイスの運要素や弾幕同士の相殺、実際に弾幕バトルをしているような感覚が味わえます。
新しい弾幕バトルを体験してみて下さい。

収録キャラクター
第一弾に収録されているキャラクターは以下の4人になります。
・博麗 霊夢
・霧雨 魔理沙
・レミリア・スカーレット
・フランドール・スカーレット
publisher's summary
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Gaudeamus!: Zbuduj średniowieczny uniwersytet
description:
Travel back in time to medieval Cracow and become one of the historical personages: Queen Jadwiga of Anjou, King Władysław Jagiełło, King Casimir the Great, or Cardinal Zbigniew Oleśnicki. Build the first Polish university and make it famous all over Europe!

The action of the game takes place at the turn of the 15th and 16th centuries, in the heyday of the University of Krakow. The goal of the game is to found a university with 4 faculties: liberal arts, medicine, law, and theology. The first player to create all of them wins. To build a faculty, a player must collect the required cards and pay its cost.

In each game round, players take their turns consecutively. During single turn, the player first draws and resolves the effect of a Random Event card, and then performs one of the available actions:
a) opening a faculty (if the player meets the requirements),
b) exchange of up to 3 cards from hand,
c) using a special card and resolving its effect,
d) buying a card from the board.
At the end of the round, players bid for new action cards and collect coins from the faculties that are already running.
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Events, Race, Set Collection

name: Gartenparty
description:
You're having a summer party in the garden. A few friends arrive early in the afternoon to help with the preparations: Beer tables are dragged, tablecloths laid out and space made for the drinks. In one corner of the garden, however, a loud competition breaks out over who will hang the most beautiful string of lights. Who will hang the coolest fairy lights at your garden party?

All cards show three power lines with light bulbs and lanterns of different colors hanging from them. You place one of them in front of you as your own starting card. The rest of the cards are placed in the center of the table. Look at them carefully, because it's all about speed! Once you've all placed one hand flat on the table, you're ready to go.

You grab cards with only one hand at a time, as fast as you can, and place them on your string of lights. Also make sure that the power lines are not always straight. This can get lost in the heat of the moment. You can also flip cards, because maybe the back side will be more useful. But you have to put your hand flat on the table again before you can return to the action.

Whoever has laid the required length first, depending on the number of players, gives the signal to the others to come to the end. Now you can see who has really conjured up the best string of lights:

The more light bulbs and lanterns of the same color follow each other in a line, the more points the chain of lights earns you. The lanterns are particularly valuable because, unlike light bulbs, they also count individually and even double the point value if they are part of a row. When your arms are unknotted and your eyes are no longer spinning, you can immediately start the next round.

It's game 17 of the series "Die Kleinen Feinen".

name: Big Ten Game Day
description:
The player on offense and the player on defense each plays a card face down. Both players then flip their cards over at the same time revealing the selected plays. Once a card is played, it is discarded in a separate pile which becomes the discard pile. After each play advance the down counter to the next down unless there is a first down conversion, a scoring play, or a turnover.

The game is played in two “halves”. A half is over when there are no more cards available and neither player has a card in his hand. A half will take from 30 to 45 minutes. When the half is over, shuffle all the Offense, Defense, and Special Teams decks. Each player draws 5 cards to start the second half.

The Game is over at the end of the second half. The player with the most points wins. For a shorter game, play 1 half.

name: Iwoká: La Tierra sin Mal
description:
The game is called Iwoká: La Tierra sin Mal (The land without evil). It is played on the space of a board, between two players: one will be the Tupi-Guarani aboriginal people, and the other the viceroy with his army. But, while the game is played, the competitors -due to the characteristics of entertainment- will be invited to walk the path of historical knowledge; they will be able to know the circumstances of the time; the rituals, legends and cosmogonies of the aborigines; They will be able to delve into the war iconography of the time, the weapons and ships of the conquerors, their war tactics, etc. And, also, some continental geography.

Two players or teams can play the Iwoká from the age of 9. One will be the Tupi-Guarani people, and the other will be the viceroy and his army. It is played with green and brown chips, in circular movements. On the board the most important place is the center called Arete (the promised land of the aboriginal people). The viceroy is occupying this sacred place: his objective will be to leave through four paths or exit points, from the center to the outside of the board, and flee by ship with the stolen riches. In the escape, he will be protected by his army.

The Tupi-Guarani, who are around the Arete, have the mission of preventing the viceroy and his army from escaping with his riches. How do they prevent the flight of the conquerors? Enclosing them with tokens. The army can be "eaten" with the tokens and eliminated, but the viceroy must be locked up with the tokens.

The invaders win if the viceroy reaches any of the four starting squares, and flee with the riches. The natives win if the viceroy is trapped between tiles.

name: Escape: Secret Agent
description:
It is time for a covert operation, agents. Our arch-rival, Mr. X, is said to be building a sort of a time bomb back in the late 1960’s. Our intel is that the plans for this bomb, as well as how to disarm it, can be found buried in the files in a skyscraper run by Mr. X. We need you to infiltrate the tower, avoiding security, and to make your way to the very top. Uncover everything you can about his dastardly plans and escape the tower before you can be compromised. Then, use what you discovered to determine the location of the attack. It will be up to you to find and disarm the bomb before it detonates. If we do not stop Mr. X’s plans, the consequences could be disastrous. In this family-friendly spy adventure, you have two games to complete in the box, facing twists and turns… traitors and cliffhangers… Work your way higher and higher up the tower to discover all of the plans in time.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Vier Königreiche
description:
For many centuries there was peace in the four great kingdoms and life in the lands was simple and carefree. One day, however, unfriendly and warlike tribes appeared from the lands beyond the horizon and brought danger to the four kingdoms. The four rulers decided together to protect the people from the evil invaders and bring them into the cities. However, because the cities were too small and unsafe, they were first to be enlarged and expanded. Defensive towers, churches and a city wall were to be built around the stately palace, which was also to be newly erected. And so the great builders of the world were commissioned to plan and implement the buildings for the kingdom of the mountain lands in the north, the kingdom of the sun in the east, the desert kingdom in the south and the kingdom of the forest peoples in the west. In order to get all this done in time before a possible attack by the enemy tribes, the builders gather people from all walks of life - from peasants to princes - to help and cooperate from the lands. Each person is given his or her task, which must be completed exactly according to plan and order.

You and your fellow players slip into the role of these master builders. Everyone tries to place all their cards with the helping citizens on the building sites before all the other players. Act wisely and strategically as a master builder and you may become the greatest master builder of the four kingdoms...

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Was ist Was: Junior – Ritter
description: In the children's game for ages 4 and up, the players choose their medieval knight figure, each from a different era. The cards with the images of heads, bodies, legs, and arms lie face down in the center. Now the fun begins! What number does the die show? Is there a matching part for your own knight? If not, just give it to another player. The first player to finish the puzzle has won. But be careful! A robber baron has mingled with the knights in this exciting educational game. If the knight is completed first, everyone has lost together in this children's game.

name: Pomenia
description:
Pomenia is a fairytale adventure game that gives you magical powers, such as social skills, emotional understanding and calmness, not to forget the motor skills.

Pomonia comes with a two sided game board that has "day" and "night" sides, which are separate games. In the "day" game players excercise their motor skills, emotional awareness and social skills, while the "night" game is more calm and silent. Day game can be played during the busy day time and the night game is meant to be played before going to sleep.

In both games players roll the dice to move and do various task, find the golden heart and save Ruttu-fairy. The player that saves the fairy is the winner.

name: KHG: Korrupte haben Geld – H.C. – Hard Core auf Ibiza
description:
A small expansion for KHG including 20 additional cards, more cash, rules, and a booklet with background info.

"20 neue Karten, Geld und mehr, sehr schoaf"

name: Surviving Singapore
description:
Life in Singapore is full of obstacles. Can you survive?

Surviving Singapore is a strategy card game where players attempt to overcome obstacles, and be the first to reach the level 8 to win the game. From running out of toilet paper, losing your IC, to being in the same room as a cockroach that can fly.


Overcome obstacles: Face obstacles and beat them to gain a level
Sabo your friends: Slow down the competition and hinder their progress
Reach the top: Be the first to climb your way up to level 8


Can you survive all the obstacles that SG can throw at you?

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Gusk Knife
description:
Guilt is the force that drives Grimmory. Betrayals mar his conscience, sins for which he can never fully atone. His shoulders are heavy with death and his heart is lost in the past. His Knives serve two masters. Grimmory believes he is the stronger of them.

—description from the publisher

These gear cards are Beta versions, that were included with the First Run Collector's Edition of the Grimmory miniature.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rackare! 2
description: This box expands Rackare with 600 new cards, 200 white and 400 black. The expansion can be played alone without the main game. The mechanic is just the same as Cards Against Humanity where you fill in blanks with words or sentences from the cards you have at hand.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pop-A-Tops: Match-A-Martian
description:
Pop into the fun with Pop-A-Tops Match-A-Martian! “Roll” the dice and try to be the first one to spot the matching alien card! With Pop-A-Tops, everything fits neatly inside the container, with the dice included in the domed top. Never drop your dice again with them safely contained! Have fun giving the container a pop! to see what you roll!

—description from the publisher

On a player's turn they roll the dice which show the shape, background and color of the Martian. The first player to grab the corresponding card keeps it. The first player to grab 5th or 7th card (depending on number of players) wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Speed Matching

name: Magic: The Gathering – Time Spiral Remastered
description:
Time Spiral Remastered is the very first remixed Magic: The Gathering set to appear in paper (previous remastered sets were digital-only), collecting nearly 300 of the greatest cards from all three sets in the original Time Spiral block and reprinting them in a single unified booster expansion.

This limited edition expansion contains 289 cards (121 commons, 100 uncommons, 53 rares, and 15 mythic rares). It also features a bonus sheet of 121 additional "timeshifted" reprints in the classic old-school frame, one of which appears in every booster.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Lockdown!: A Card Game
description:
Travel back in time to the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic and slip into the role of governments, as they implement various measures to contain the disease in their country, Save the most COVID-19 patients, while different forms of trouble arise on the way. Find out which public health measure to employ in each situation and ask for international collaboration when things get really tough.

Lockdown! is a fun and educational, competitive card game for 2 to 6 players where players draft cards and try to lay out COVID management measures and sending the patients to the relevant location. The goal of the game is to score more points than your opponent(s). Make use of cards to disrupt other players COVID management measures. each treated patient earns you a point. You win if you have treated more patients than your opponent(s) at the end of the game.

—description from the designer
publishers: National University of Singapore Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health

name: Ka Pai: Roto Waho
description: Variant of Ka Pai released during quarantine, where the result of both dice is used on separate sides of the field.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Wie ben ik?: Het Spel
description: A party game to guess who, what and where you are. A spinning wheel decides what type of question you can ask. Played with three different categories, who first has unraveled their card in each of the three categories wins the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Activity Chaos
description:
Unlike the classic Activity, there is not only one acting person per round. No, all team members try their luck at the same time with terms represent and guess. But that's not all: The degree of difficulty is additionally complicated by the given types of representation. Instead of explaining, as is usual in most activity variants besides drawing and pantomime, plasticine is used here.

Two teams of the same size compete against each other. Each team member grabs his own card and starts to represent the term - all at the same time, of course. While you are representing yourself, you try to guess the terms of the other team members at the same time in order to score as many points as possible. You have exactly 60 seconds to do this.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Al Casino 6 Black Hearts
description:
This game has 5 turns as 1 round and repeats the rounds. Each time you repeat a round, the points of the curse written on the curse card will be added.

At the time of point calculation for each round, the player whose total curse points are 13 points or more loses the game. The player with the fewest curse points at that time wins the game. In adition, the player who wins all the curse cards by himself in one round wins the game. In this case, everyone except the winning player will be defeated.

name: Qube: Utan tvekan
description: You get 10 questions in quick succession. And you must not answer yes, no, repeat the question or hesitate. The questions try to get you astray so it's easier said than done. At the slightest hesitation, your opponents throw themselves over the stopwatch. Collect cards by keeping your tongue straight in your mouth. Are you in?

name: Argos2022 Space Backpack + R05Y-J
description:
A space adventure in 2 parts and in solo : 2 r'n'w that will propel you on Argos to try to terraform the planet and a trip to its moon R05Y-J to search for traces of life.
Each r'n'w is a standalone but in the same universe. You can play Argos than R05Y-J to an excited journey.
Roll 4 dice, check the damages on your ship, try to exctract hydrogen and ore to activate modules, Argos it's a little bit maths but a lot of stress.

name: The Dark Quarter: Lost to the Night
description:
Thirteen year old Susanna has disappeared without a trace and the NOPD are powerless to find her. A band of misfits, brought together by their connections to Susanna, will do what the police cannot and bring her home!

While not investigators themselves, this group congregates around "The Alligator" club and have seen the dark and magical underbelly of New Orleans with their own eyes. They also know that Susanna might well be connected to the arcane as she is no ordinary teenager.

With Susanna's life on the line, the stakes will be higher and more personal than ever.

What's Inside:

3 feature-length scenarios
30 location tiles
3 scene tiles
21 NPC markers
28 consumable cards
21 story cards


Characters:

Jane 'Bluejay' Tien: The Sister
Hector Zavaleta: The Protector
Fermin 'One-Eye' Lafayette: The Teacher
Evelyn Dansky: The Mother


Each character comes with:

1 character board
1 32mm miniature
9 ability cards


Miniatures:

1 Small NPC Mini (~32mm)
1 Medium NPC Mini (~44mm)
1 Honey Island Swamp Monster (~70mm)
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Mature / Adult, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling
publishers: Grimspire, Lucky Duck Games, Van Ryder Games

name: Bamse och Vulkanön
description:
Travel to the North Pole with Bamse and his friends

Go on an adventure and research trip to the North Pole to look for different animals. With a little luck, you can get help from Bamse, Lille Skutt and Skalman. With a little bad luck, you risk loose some animal between the stations. To try to save your animals, you do different challenges. The one who first filled his tray with animals has won.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Sapiens
description: Sapiens is a simple shape+colour recognition game in which players try to find an image shown on two cards. Each card features four symbols (mammoth, club, fire and woman), each with a background in one of four colours (red, blue, green, yellow). One player reveals one card and chooses symbol (and its colour in the card), saying it in the in-game "prehistoric language" (mammoth = mamu, club = gra, fire = ouw, woman = bula). All players must then play a card that matches the said symbol and colour. Whoever does that, says another different symbol, and so on. Whoever runs out of cards first wins!

name: The Singaporean Dream: 2021 Booster Pack
description:
The Singaporean Dream: 2021 Booster Pack captures the most iconic moments of 2021, and features newly created cards you can add to your existing The Singaporean Dream: The New Normal deck.

This booster pack consists of 30 cards including:
2 NEW Personality Cards featuring the Delivery Rider and Sovereign.
5 NEW Dream Cards such as Food Arrives on Time and Dining In Again.
17 NEW Action Cards featuring the good, bad, and funniest moments of 2021.
6 Cash Cards.

With the TSD 2021 Booster Pack, you can expand your game of The Singaporean Dream: The New to include 2 to 8 players (previously max. of 6 players).​

name: Darts 'n Dice
description:
A dice game, like darts! Move your pawns across a round dartboard-style board, and try to occupy the scoring spots. A bit of luck is needed, but you'll never make it without tactics - and there's those pesky cards to consider as well.

A family game of dice and tactics.

name: Dice Town: JAB Promos
description:
A set of 3 cards designed by Ludovic Maublanc and drawn by Pierô Lalune, the set brings the organizers of the JAB gaming convention in the game of Dice Town. Originally planned as a goodie awarded for all 2020 attendees, it was later postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic until the 2022 edition.

The JAB (Jeux au Boute) convention is the largest open gaming convention in the province of Quebec.


Convert all your Jacks into Queens
Each player must give you a card, then return a card to each player
Each player must give you 1 nugget, 2$, or a card
categories: American West, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Right or Racist
description:
Right or Racist is the party card game that confirms and combats stereotypes based on data, studies, and general information. There are 500 cards included.

Stereotype Cards present the players with a statement asserting a stereotype. Players must determine if the statement is right (true) or racist (false). While Debate Cards are subjective statements that players will vote on to determine if it's right or racist - and unlike America, majority vote wins!

But be careful, too many wrong answers and you run the risk of being labelled:
a) a racist bigot who incorrectly believes in too many stereotypes OR
b) a sissy snowflake that cries racism when it doesn't apply.

name: Intersection
description:
Players take turns rolling dice and strategically parking (locking) at least one die or combination of dice to score, but don’t get too comfortable because once you park and score, you can risk that score and go for more! Risk versus reward, a little luck, and strategically choosing ways to overcome will ultimately determine how high you can go.

The goal of the game of Intersection is to accumulate the highest total game score. To score points, players must park dice, fix “Sad faces”, and overcome the “Slow”, all while avoiding the “Stop”.

Set includes: 6 game dice, 1 velvet storage bag, and 1 printed instruction book.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 时间互搏：假面骑士 (Chrono Clash System: Kamen Rider)
description:
From the mind of renowned American game designer, Ryan Miller, comes Chrono Clash System.
The cost of the card moves the marker towards the opponent's side, and when it goes over 1, then it's your opponent's turn!
Play many low cost cards or play a high cost card from the get-go. Play your favorite cards whenever you want in this dynamic but easy to play game!
Utilizing the universal Chrono Clash system, the universes and characters used will draw in players of card games, board games and each respective universe's fans alike!

The Chinese version Chrono Clash System has two series：Kamen Rider and LoveLive.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: Planetenjäger
description:
"Planetenjäger: Discover the solar system"

Are you ready for one of the most adventurous expeditions
ever undertaken by man?

Then discover our solar system! Travel through the solar
system on an exciting and dangerous hunt for the planets.
Only if you move tactically smart with your rocket over
their orbits, you will reach the goal and get the planet
cards.

But be careful: As a hunter you can become the hunted,
because other players are eagerly lurking as space pirates
for prey - for the fuel of your rocket and your planet
cards! Comets can seal your fate, so keep an eye on them!

With friendly support of ESA and DLR.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race

name: Crime Files Adventskalender: Die Northpole Gang
description:
Solve a Christmas mystery using real clues and evidence in this realistic mystery game - you have 24 days to catch the culprit! Open a sealed envelope every day, solve the hidden messages and unmask the right suspect. The ingenious Advent calendar is suitable for crime fans between 1 and 4 players.

—description from the publisher

name: Zoknifogócska Szofival
description:
Sophie doesn't want to wear socks. Mom worries she will catch a cold and tries to put socks on her doughter. Though she starts sneezing, Sophie runs.

Will mom catch her or will Sophie stay barefeet?

Playing as Sophie you try to blow over standing cards just like you would blow candles. Lesser the tries the more you can move. Mother can follow by remembering the color of the blown over sock cards.

Based on a story from the Szofi book series by Bálint Harcos.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Memory, Novel-based, Racing

name: Crazy Hedgehog
description: In turn, each player must spin the roulette wheel and draw the color and amount of spines to pull from the hedgehog. Hint：The player should choose the spines on the center and take it very carefully so as not make the hedgehog dropped. If the player take the spine out and does not make the hedgehog dropped, the it would pass the turn to next player. If the hedgehog dropped, the player will finish the turn of the game. The other players set up the game again and continue with another turn. Continue in this way until only 1 player is left. He/She will be the final winner of the game.

name: 时间互搏：学园偶像计划（Chrono Clash System: LoveLive!）
description:
From the mind of renowned American game designer, Ryan Miller, comes Chrono Clash System.
The cost of the card moves the marker towards the opponent's side, and when it goes over 1, then it's your opponent's turn!
Play many low cost cards or play a high cost card from the get-go. Play your favorite cards whenever you want in this dynamic but easy to play game!
Utilizing the universal Chrono Clash system, the universes and characters used will draw in players of card games, board games and each respective universe's fans alike!
The Chinese version Chrono Clash system game comes two famous IPs, Kamen Rider and LoveLive project.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: Space Fruit Tree
description:
1 - 2 player space-themed tile game in which you grow a space fruit tree to earn points

Grow the largest tree, take some fruit and win!

In this 1 or 2 player space themed tile game you will grow a space fruit tree to earn points.

During the 1 player game you'll Grow 2 Space Fruit Trees on your own while keeping each tree balanced so you can score as many points as possible.

During the 2 player game you'll be able to steal branches and fruit from your opponent's tree to earn even more points. The first player to earn 15 points wins!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Science Fiction

name: Escape Game Junior: Dans les Griffes de la Sorcière
description:
You are prisoners of the witch Maléfys! Only one solution to escape: solve a series of puzzles and face his monstrous acolytes one by one. NO TIME TO LOSE, you only have 45 minutes! Luckily, DZ13 the robot is here to help you.

—description from the publisher

name: Tension: Foodies Edition
description:
The sizzling hot foodies version of the popular Tension board game; from a Greek Salad to a Napoleon Brandy to a Pavlova, Foodies Tension covers all food & drink topics from around the world
At the top of each card there is a topic and a list of 10 possible answers, the object is to see how many your team can guess in 60 seconds; the unique Tension score slider makes marking down the shout-outs so easy
10 British cheeses; 10 types of cake; 10 herbs used in cooking, sounds simple but you have to get the exact 10 on the card
Call out as many examples as you can and don't give up until the timer runs out

name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Dimir Rogues
description: This 60-card deck is tournament-ready and playable right out of the box. Fan-favorite cards from Zendikar Rising, Ikoria: Lair of Behemoths, Theros Beyond Death, Throne of Eldraine, and Core Set 2021, the Dimir Rogues Challenger Deck is forged from some of the most powerful strategies in Standard. Force your opponent to mill cards and reap the benefits of their expansive graveyard.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Christmas Scavenger Hunt
description: Christmas Scavenger Hunt features hundreds of cards with typical objects that can be found around the house at Christmas. Deal out some cards to each team and get hunting. It's that simple!
mechanics: Elapsed Real Time Ending, Team-Based Game

name: Joke King
description:
Joke King is a hilarious create your own comic strip family card game for kids and adults!

In this Kingdom, laughter is the law, and the funniest player wins the Crown! Joke King was created by the team that bought you the award-winning family game, Kids Against Maturity. Here, you make funny comic strips of the KAM FAM by playing illustrated comic-book style card combinations. Joke King is simple to play and has multiple play styles and difficulties. The object is to create the funniest card combinations and show your friends that you are The Joke King!

- How To Play -
Deal everyone 10 cards.

Choose someone to wear The Crown.

One card is flipped from the deck face up.

The Crown plays one card from their hand before or after the flipped card.

Then the other player chooses one card from their hand to finish the comic strip.

The Crown reads all cards out loud and chooses their favorite

That player wins the round, and the first player to win 5 rounds is crowned The Joke King!
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Party Game

name: Star Wars: Galactic Hide & Seek Action Board Game
description:
"A Galactic Hide & Seek Race is underway! Obi-Won Kenobi, Anakin Skywalker, Yoda and Ahsoka Tano must find the Jedi Force tokens and be the first to race back home!

Players take the role of one of four Jedi: Obi-Won, Anakin, Yoda or Ahsoka. They take turns rolling the dice moving around the board to get to concealed Jedi tokens. When a player find all four of their character specific tokens they must race back Home before the other players to claim victory.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lord of the Chords: Who Let The Chords Out? – 2nd Booster Pack: Composers
description: What is the best way to commemorate the greatest classical composers of all time? Pun-ify their names and crack jokes about their past of course! It's your Rachmanin-off day! Ravel in the Satie-sfaction of not needing to go Bach to work with puns that you'll never be Hayden!

name: Bogyó és Babóca Évszakok
description:
The four different board games based on the Bogyó and Babóca series are primarily for 3-8 year olds, mainly the preschooler age group.

The simplest type of game is card collecting, the third is a classic step-by-step countdown game that aims to get to the polka dot ladybug house, and the fourth, conversational game requires the help of an adult who reads out questions related to the theme of the seasons.

name: Escape Quest: Au delà du Virtuel
description:
Escape Quest is a game book in which you must solve puzzles to advance in your adventure. Each page has its clues: combinations, labyrinths, word games, hidden images ...

Your logic and your sense of observation will be put to the test!

Los Angeles, 2101. ASTRAL, the largest VR online gaming platform in the world is run by Demosthenes, a true AI, and something went terribly wrong. Millions of users suddenly dropped into a virtual coma, and nobody knows why. It falls on you to understand what happened and save the countless lives at stake. Confront the virtual worlds designed by the AI, for their many deadly challenges hold the key to solving this not-so-virtual mystery !
categories: Adventure, Book, Deduction, Puzzle, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: Don't Panic Games, Egmont Polska, SD Games, Ynnis Éditions

name: The Emperor Mini Expansion
description:
This mini expansion can be added to Iron Forest and ICECOOL/ICECOOL2. This expansion comes with 1 flickable miniature and 6 snowflake tokens.

In Iron Forest this mini expansion can be added to any scenario. The Emperor is trying to freeze both teams' mechas. If a team's all mechas are frozen, they lose the scenario.

In ICECOOL "The Emperor" lets you mess with other players or help yourself. By collecting snowflake tokens, you can move fish onto any other door or exchange your fish cards with new ones from the deck.

name: Everest Challenge
description:
Spin for your chance to make it to the top first. Use teamwork to find the best way up but watch out, a fall is only a spin away

Players have two different climbers with pegs in their feet. They spin a spinner and climb up the side of the mountain but watch out! Their is only room for one climber in each peg so your opponent can very quickly knock you out! First to have both climbers to the top wins.

—user summary
mechanics: King of the Hill, Ladder Climbing

name: Robot Wrangler
description:
Corral the robots by color or type, and the first to empty their hand wins!

To begin the game, each player is dealt 5 robots which they lay face-up in front of them. An additional robot is placed face-up next to the draw pile. On each player's turn, they can play a robot from their hand that matches the type or color of the top robot on the discard pile. If they cannot play, they must instead draw one robot and end their turn. A wild card can be used at any time, and the player can select which color they want it to represent.

The first player to play all of their cards wins.

name: Metro Domino
description:
