Join Mr. Owl in Hoot or Toot, a twist on a traditional memory game in which you need to match his hoot and toot sounds with illustrated tokens. Shake the little owl and listen carefully to the sound he makes, then flip a token on the table to see whether it matches the sound. Remember where each token is to collect them faster! The first player to collect six tokens featuring each color wins.

name: Stadt Land Vollpfosten: Party Edition
description:
The good mood edition of the cult game STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN around the theme of party and celebration.

The ultimate game block with 32 creative and fun categories for an unforgettable party. Fun guaranteed!

This game promotes knowledge and creativity!

The PARTY EDITION contains an exciting variety with 32 different categories.

Examples: on the dance floor, crazy hobby, party snack, my club would be called, helps against hangover and many more!

Innovative letter bar against cheaters.

Just swipe your index finger over the letter bar. When one of your teammates says "STOP", the letter to play with is fixed.

This ultimate game block in A4 format contains 50 sheets. This provides for many extensive game evenings with family and friends.

Perfect to give away or the next vacation.

GAME PROCEDURE:
Each player receives one side of the A3 block and places it in front of them. A time is set for each round (we recommend 2 minutes as a limit). The innovative letter bar helps to determine the letter. Then it is a matter of entering all the terms as quickly as possible. There are 13 terms sought per round.

POINT DISTRIBUTION:

You can't think of a correct term = 0 points
At least one other player has the same term as you = 5 points
No other player has the same term as you = 10 points
You are the only one who can think of a term in the category = 20 points.


In addition, there are so-called FULL POST fields where you always get double the points.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die Gute-Laune-Edition des Kultspiels STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN rund ums Thema Party und Feiern.

Der ultimative Spielblock mit 32 kreativen und lustigen Kategorien für eine unvergessliche Party. Spaß garantiert!

Dieses Spiel fördert Wissen und Kreativität!

Die PARTY EDITION beinhaltet eine spannende Vielfalt mit 32 verschiedenen Kategorien.

Beispiele: auf der Tanzfläche, verrücktes Hobby, Party-Snack, mein Club würde heißen, hilft gegen Kater und viele mehr!

Innovative Buchstabenleiste gegen Schummler.

Wische einfach mit dem Zeigefinger über die Buchstabenleiste. Wenn einer deiner Mitspieler “STOPP” sagt, steht der Buchstabe fest, mit dem gespielt werden muss.

Dieser ultimative Spielblock im DIN A4 Format beinhaltet 50 Blatt. So ist für viele ausgiebige Spielabende mit Familie und Freunden gesorgt.

Perfekt zum Verschenken oder den nächsten Urlaub.

SPIELABLAUF:
Jeder Spieler erhält eine Seite des DIN-A3 Blockes und legt diese vor sich hin. Es wird eine Zeit pro Durchgang ausgemacht (wir empfehlen 2 Minuten als Begrenzung). Die innovative Buchstabenleiste hilft bei der Ermittlung des Buchstabens. Dann gilt es so schnell wie möglich alle Begriffe einzutragen. Pro Runde sind 13 Begriffe gesucht.
PUNKTEVERTEILUNG:
• Dir fällt kein richtiger Begriff ein = 0 Punkte
• Mindestens ein Mitspieler hat denselben Begriff wie du = 5 Punkte
• Kein Mitspieler hat den denselben Begriff wie du = 10 Punkte
• Dir ist als Einziger ein Begriff in der Kategorie eingefallen = 20 Punkte
Außerdem gibt es sogenannte VOLLPFOSTEN-Felder bei denen man stets die doppelte Punktzahl erhält.

—description from the publisher

name: 割算: １・２・３からはじめるトリックテイキング (Division: Trick-taking starting with 1, 2, 3)
description:
In the trick-taking game 割算: １・２・３からはじめるトリックテイキング (Division: Trick-taking starting with 1, 2, 3), the deck consists only of cards numbered 1-3.

Each player starts with a pair of cards in front of them that make a two-digit number, then in turn order they each play a third card that divides this number, e.g. 12 divided by 3 or 23 divided by 2. Whoever has the largest quotient wins the round, scoring points equal to the divisor they played, then for each player the second numeral in the dividend drops down in front of the divisor to create a new two-digit number. The winner then leads a card, and everyone follows.

Keep playing tricks until the cards run out. Whoever scores the most points wins.

name: 손맛 전자 빠른 수리 (Hand Repair by Sorting)
description:
Fix the television by sorting the components. The first player who repairs get the job. Find a way to efficiently sort the cards!

'Hand Repair by Sorting' is a game where players sort number cards in ascending order. The player who sorts the cards first wins the game. All players progress through the rounds simultaneously. Each round consists of 'flipping cards' and 'shuffling the deck'.

In the 'flipping cards' phase, each player flips over one card and performs an action that allows them to sort the number cards. In the 'shuffling the deck' phase, each player has the option to shuffle all the used cards back into the deck.

-description from designer

name: Foursquare
description:
In Foursquare, you are the mayor of the fictional Flavortown, a trendy neighborhood known for being the birthplace of cutting-edge restaurants. New restaurants (cards) will be placed one at a time in a 4x4 grid. Placing the highest or lowest card in a
row or column causes all other cards in that row or column to flip over, as other restaurants go out of business or try to challenge the newcomer. Your task is to end up with sixteen open restaurants in your city, while preventing too many from being closed at once.

As part of the Isaludo collection, the rules can be found in this forum thread.

name: Typewriter
description:
Spell words, flip your typewriter keys, and build combos in this new game in the Paperback series. This travel-ready game comes in a small box, and can even be stored in the included zipper bag. Acrylic tiles instead of cards mean even a bit of rain or ocean spray won't dampen your fun.

Every turn, you will spell a word with the tiles in front of you. Use all your starting tiles in the word to send a tile to your scoring stack. And at the end of each round you'll grab a shiny new tile for yourself from the offer. Since you can only take a tile from the offer after your turn, you can start spelling out your next word while the other players take their turns.

Sounds simple enough. But there's one more twist: every time you spell a word, you'll flip all the tiles in that word, revealing new letters and a completely new puzzle.

The tiles you take might have potent abilities that can be recharged by using a letter in your word to flip them back over, or you might grab tiles that help you score set collection points at the end of the game. Other tiles are bigrams that let you claim common vowels, and sometimes a tile just has a real tough letter that can score for real big points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Chalk-A-Word
description:
The more words you know the greater your chances. Use your letter cards to create new words or add to existing words in play. Spell as many words as you can and earn the most points before the chalkboard gets wiped clean.

Using the letter cards in their hands, players take turns creating new words or adding to words already in the play area. Points are awarded for each letter used. In addition to Letter Cards, there are other cards that are wild or award special powers. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Wild Webs
description:
Test your knowledge on the world of animals as you race through the Wild Webs! Play cards that describe the animals to move forward, and be the first one to reach your tent to win!
—description from the publisher

In Wild Webs, players are working with a hand of 3 cards to select 2 cards containing attributes of the animal in the next path space. Since that is not easy, players are allowed to take and use the top card (only) of other players’ discard piles to use instead. Players try to avoid leaving helpful cards on top after their turn. Usually a space only has 1 or 2 forward path links, so it is not always easy to advance along a direct path. The deck consists of 100 cards, with plenty of duplicates and some multiple options cards with 2 different attributes listed.

This game is marketed as an educational game that is a fun way to reinforce knowledge of animals and the “game builds observation, strategizing, memory, decision making & process planning skills.” Those are present, but to a limited degree since the design is intended to allow players as young as 6, and the complexity of game play is low.

—user summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Timeline：中国古代史篇 (Timeline: China Ancient History)
description:
Timeline series aims to combine playing and learning together.

Timeline: China Ancient History is a card game. Each card depicts an invention on both sides, with the year in which that invention was created on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

Note: This game can be combined with any other title in the Timeline series.

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: Efteling
description:
This is the Dutch Efteling edition of Monopoly from publisher Identity Games. Note: The box contains the regular play figures, no Efteling play figures are included!

In this enchanting edition of the well-known Monopoly game, you will discover Efteling in a completely new way. You won't visit the park, but you might become the all-important director of the World of Wonders! As an amusement park strategist you are responsible for the success of Efteling. You ensure that the guest can enjoy as many well-known attractions as possible, but it is also your job to offer enough fairytale overnight stays with cottages and hotels. During this adventure, the Small Message and Treasure Chest cards can help you in your mission. But as in every fairy tale, an unexpected danger can lurk here too. Do you know how to let visitors enjoy your park the most? Accept the challenge and win the game!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Identity Games International B.V., Winning Moves Germany

name: Trouble: Across The Spider-Verse Part One
description:
Marvel fans can imagine an exciting Spider-Verse adventure with The Trouble Game: Spider-Man Across The Spider-Verse Part One edition board game! Players assemble their spider-team then move through Spider-Verses among the 3 different gameboard rings. The first player to get all of their team safely back Home wins. The Pop-O-Matic die roller determines how far a player can move, and if they can twist and turn any of the gameboard rings. Launch into action by lining up Portal spaces to move into another universe, but watch out for Spot spaces that can bump players back!


TROUBLE GAME WITH SPIDER-VERSE THEME: It's a Spider-Man twist on the classic Trouble game! Players race their hero through the Spider-Verse to be the first one to get their team to the Goober and back Home



SPINNING GAMEBOARD: It's a different Trouble gameplay experience as players twist and turn 3 movable board rings to connect and unlock Portal spaces, move pawns through the rings, and block the competition



POP THE DICE: Players pop the iconic Pop-O-Matic die roller and take different actions depending on the number and symbol shown on the 2 dice



SPIDER-VERSE GAMEBOARD SPACES: Each space on the gameboard has players doing different actions, but they can only move through the rings by lining up the Portal spaces


—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Stellar Leap: Creativity Promo Card
description:
Creativity is an additional card for the Dangerous Deck in Stellar Leap.

Creativity has no overpopulated resources listed as it can't be overpopulated! It is also special due to the fact that it generates every resource and if you labor here, you can get three resources of choice. It's the planet with the highest threat level in the game, but if you can get there, it'll definitely pay off.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Jump 3
description: Sixty-six cards are numbered from 3 to 30 in multiples of three, with each number appearing on several cards. Players take turns playing cards onto one of two discard piles so that the number of the card played is either 3 greater than or 3 less than the top card in the pile. Draw a card if you cannot play. The first player to shed his hand wins. There also is a speed version with simultaneous play.

name: Défis Nature: Dinosaure 1
description:
Défis Nature - Dinosaur 1 (a.k.a. "Nature Challenge - Dino 1") is a quick and educational nature themed card game.

The goal is to hold all the cards of the game.
for shorter games, players can choose a playing time and the winner is the player with the most cards in hands at the end.

Each card shows a dinosaur with some infos and four or five caracteristics (depending of the edition).
The first player choose a caracteristic (for exemple "weight") and lays a card, in turn each player lays a card and the player with the highest value in this caracteristic win all the cards of this turn and starts a new one.

The cards are classified in 4 "lifespan" categories.
The 3 shorter lifespan categories allows to change the choosen caracteristic of the turn (in order of priority)
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Premier League Adrenalyn XL
description:
Choose your squad and play head to head with your friends in this football (soccer) based trading card game.

Collect cards and select your squad before choosing your formation. Pick a system that suits your players best. If you have a lot of good defenders then go for a more defensive position.

Once you've chosen your squad plus 3 substitutes, lay your cards face down on your side of the table. Once your cards are set out, you're not allowed to check them again, so choose wisely.

Flip a coin to see who goes first, then the starting player turns a card over and chooses a value (Defense, Attack or Control). Their opponent then chooses a card and says aloud the corresponding value (if the first player chooses Attack then the opposing player chooses Defense etc). Whoever has the highest value scores a goal. If the values are the same then the total value is compared. If the total is still the same then both players discard and nothing happens.

Play continues until all cards have been played and a winner declared.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction

name: Mission Ocean
description:
“The ocean animals need our help! In this cute board game, players race to collect plastic waste floating among the waves and take it to the ship, cleaning up the water to protect sea creatures.”
--description from the publisher

In Mission Ocean, each player is working to rescue their selected sea creature from the plastic waste that is encumbering that creature. Players are racing against each other to be the first to remove the 6 pieces of plastic waste from their creature and place the waste into “The Ocean Cleanup” ship. That ship is actually a 3D cardboard ship with a colored waste hold compartment matching the players’ colors and is visually and tactilely engaging for young kids.

In essence, this is a “pick up and deliver” (in this theme “recover and dispose”) game simplified for young kids. It includes customized dice and tries to provide some real world context at an age appropriate level. This game is marketed as an ocean pollution educational game that is a fun way to internalize knowledge of how plastic waste affects sea life and part of the proceeds go to The Ocean Cleanup nonprofit.

-User summary
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Race

name: The Hunt for the Dragon Throne
description:
Up to 4 intrepid adventurers set off, each on their own individual quest to ascend to the dragon throne and win the game. Players roll a die to (a) select their uniquely-powered character, then (b) move along the 109 numbered spaces on the winding board, and (c) resolve the effects of the various encounters described on the board spaces. Finally, both (d) the combat system (between players & against the creatures on the board) and (e) actually moving onto the winning space at the end of the trail are both resolved through rolling the same die.

The Candyland-style board experience has several unique features.
The first 22 spaces are inside the castle, where you are in the "safe zone". But even there you are not safe, due to things like space #3 ("Encounter a bandit, you lose the battle return to start") and #7 ("Encounter a tornado Go back 2 blocks") and #12 ("Feel unwell, take a rest and skip a turn"). Finally, right before you exit the castle, you may get lucky and land on #20 which says: "Spin the wheel to draw a weapon". This spinner has 16 spaces which award adventurers with a free weapon, such as an "Algae Machete" or a "Fire Whip" or a "Sword of Ice"...unless you get 1 of the 4 "Better luck next time!" spaces.
Space #29 is a "Detour" right before the encounter with the Fire Dragon. The detour all takes place within space #29, but it is a 10-space run around the terminates right at the Fire Dragon encounter space anyway—so, no avoiding this fight!
Lastly, space #109 is where the namesake 5-piece plastic dragon throne sits. Players will lose their turns until they manage to roll the exact number necessary to reach this space.

Beyond the castle walls, combat becomes part of the game. Combat losses force players to lose HP (which are represented by AWESOME wooden tokens), and when any player is reduced to 0 HP he must retreat back to space #22—with 109 spaces in all, and no control over where you land on a turn, this is a LONG way to fall! You will have access to item cards, but your choices are limited here, because you can hold only 1 card at a time—the one you have may not be what you need most.

Other spaces offer opportunities to earn coins from die rolls, or sacrifice your next turn to acquire coins or HP. Plot cards are encountered every few spaces, and if you land on them, they add both positive & negative effects (along with some thematic flavor text) just like you'd find in Monopoly's "Chance" or "Community Chest" decks.
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Barking Chicken
description:
Shuffle both stacks of head and tail cards, keeping them in separate piles. Place both piles facedown in the center. The player going first draws one head and one tail from each stack. Then the player begins talking like the head of the animal and walking like the tail of the other animal. Players must refrain from describing the animals.

Whoever successfully guess the combination wins one point. First player to get 10 points wins the game.

Includes 40 cards and rules.

name: Pompon
description:
At the village fête, there's a new carousel in the park and all the children want to get on to catch the pompom.
Each player has to help the children in their team catch as many pompoms as possible. To do so, you need to anticipate the carousel's movement and move the children in your team in front of the pompom square.

—description from the publisher

name: Picto Bric
description:
Drawing with a pencil is easy, but what about using bricks?
This original drawing game using rectangles and circles requires creativity and efficiency. Play with friends or family for guaranteed giggles and good times.

—description from the publisher

name: Morskie głębiny
description: Dive into the sea depths and become the greatest explorer of the underwater world! To find out what the ocean hides, you need to demonstrate perceptiveness and sensational memory! However, you are not the only one to explore underwater mysteries, so good reflexes will also come in handy. Play all the mini-games and earn the title of the best explorer of the sea depths.
mechanics: Bingo, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Speed Matching

name: UNO: Barbie The Movie
description:
The game of Uno with a Barbie The Movie theme.

A special “Played With Too Much” rule will have players both discarding and drawing cards.

Game play matches the classic card game where players match colors and numbers to get rid of all their cards.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 100 Wacky Things Card Game
description:
100 Wacky Things players will do some ridiculous things while laughing uncontrollably!

Always..
..stand up and act like a bird by flapping your arms and whistling.

Whenever..
..someone stands, march up to the person and salute!

One Wacky thing definitely leads to another in this zany game of craziness!

—description from the publisher

name: It's Lit! Broadview Literature Card Game
description: This card game is a promotional item published by Broadview Press. It re-implements the card game Timeline, asking players to order 52 literature and philosophy titles published by Broadview Press, an academic book publisher. The cards show the covers of 52 classic works that belong to the English-language literary canon at large, from Antiquity to the mid-20th century, and are mostly comprised of classic books originally published in English. The gameplay is in every way identical to Timeline.

name: Cat Face
description:
Cat Face is a cat meme party game brought to you by the crazy cat people at The Pet Collective. An internet cat game that you don't play on the internet. Featuring cats from some of your favorite viral videos, players compete to find the funniest combination of cat faces and funny captions (no litter box required).

—description from the publisher

name: Kleine Sünden
description:
Only those who behave in an exemplary and virtuous manner are in the King's favour. But as a little rascal, your life at court is full of pranks and little sins. Will you be able to cover up your deeds before someone tells the King?

Players take on the role of little rascals up to no good at the royal court. But only those who behave in an exemplary and virtuous manner are in the favor of the king. Those who go too far are threatened with banishment. So the players are busy trying to cover up their deeds as quickly as possible before someone tells the king. Those who are lucky may even get help from the court magician.
The game is played with 54 playing cards, including 52 "sin cards" and two "court magicians". All players try to discard their sin cards from their hand. The higher the point value of the card, the more serious the deed in the eyes of the King. Players with 7 or fewer points in their hand may choose to report the other players to the King. The betrayed players then receive sin points for each card in their hand. If you successfully betray the others, you will get off scot-free and will not receive any sin points yourself. But be careful! If another player has the same number of points or less, you will receive an additional 30 points for the failed snitching. The player who covers up his deeds best and gets the fewest sin points wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Medieval

name: The Game of Life: Generations
description:
Greatest Generation, Baby Boomers, Gen X, Millennials, and Gen Z all think their generation is better than the rest, but who really is the greatest? Bring family and friends together to play The Game of Life board game reimagined for intergenerational connections. How you handle major events in the game depends on how you choose to play. Older adults can interact with younger generations and share the laughs and stories that come with connecting through the power of play. Make family game nights memorable as you experience the unexpected twists and turns of life’s adventures from start to retirement as one of five generations.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Storytelling

name: Cursed Manor
description: Cursed Manor is a print-and-play escape room-style game in which you help a team of ghost hunters in unraveling the mysteries of a haunted mansion.

name: F2F
description: F2F is a face-to-face sci-fi ship battle game for 2 players. Each player draws from their own deck and lay a face-down line of cards, which could be ships, traps, or other effects. Players take turns revealing and attacking with one ship. The last player with one or more ships remaining is the winner.

name: I Saw It First!: Ocean
description:
Three hundred ocean creatures populate the board of this carefully engineered game. Some are familiar like the blue whale, sockeye salmon and the clownfish, others less so, like the water bear, barreleye and horse-eye jack.

Pick a counter from the box and be the first to spot that animal on the board!

Each counter features the animal's commonly used name, so you can learn about different species as you go.
The hexagonal game board is composed of several double-sided triangular pieces that you can rearrange to keep the search for sea critters a challenge!
Featuring 300 charming bespoke illustrations by Caroline Selmes.
It's simple to understand and play, but addictively competitive!
A fun and challenging game to delight adults and children alike.

name: Kulture Karaoke
description:
You will need at least 3 players for a battle. One person will pull a card. Then both competitors have to pick a song based on that same card and perform. The 3rd player will act as the judge and decide who won that round (based on song selection and overall performance).      

If you have more than 3 players that's okay, you just need someone to act as the judge each round. Keep going until each player has battled at least 4 times, and then declare the winner!

If playing with groups, first pick group names just to add to the fun. There should be 2 or more groups battling at a time, and 1 group serving as the judges. One person from the first group will pull a card, and all of the groups have to pick a song based on that same card and perform.

The judges will decide which group won that round (based on song selection and overall performance). Keep going until each group has battled at least 4 times, and then declare a winner!

name: Das kleine Wir
description: Where is the little WIR hiding now? It always hides when people fight. To help it emerge from its hiding spot, players in Das kleine Wir must puzzle and solve tasks together. Find certain shapes and colors, then position their game pieces accordingly on the game board — or elsewhere. Can you balance the colorful cardboard pieces on all three figures?

name: Movie Geek
description:
Who among your friends is the ultimate movie geek? Let’s settle it here and now. The rules are simple. drag a card to show your opponent. Your friend need to name the character on the card and the film he/she is starring in. If failed. put the card back among the other and let the next person drag a card from the deck. If succeed. they are ready to get the in-depth. hardcore. questions about that film to get some extra points.

—description from the publisher

name: Unicorns
description:
Unicorns is a fast-paced card game with the art of modern animal unicorns, but not only the well-known horses.

Everyone plays simultaneously. The aim of this game is to find the unicorn animal that is shown exactly as many times as it is shown on the back of the next card (top of the draw pile).

Fastest player to identify the animal correctly will get the card. If he is incorrect, card gets discarded to the bottom of the deck as well as one of the cards the player won before (in one of the previous turns).

Game ends when there is a last card in the deck. The player who collects the most cards wins the game.

name: Secret Ranking: Friendly Blue
description:
Secret Ranking is a party game about ranking your co-players in a certain category. One player leads the round, and gets a randomly selected category (e.g. "Most likely to have been class president.") The player then ranks the other players according to their view on this category.

The other players do not know which category the ranking is based upon. Rather, they know it is one of six which are visible on the table. These players discuss which category they think they were being ordered according to, and then, competitively, choose.

name: I Spy: Find it Fast Dice Game
description: Roll the dice, find a match and find it fast! Players roll nine dice with realistic pictures on each side. They try to find a match on an overturned picture card filled with a variety of different objects. Be the first to find the most matches and you win!

name: Velbloudí karavana
description:
Velbloudí karavana is a quick and easy card game where you become a merchant travelling through a desert and trading with other players. You trade cards for precious coins, but transactions can be affected by other players' cards, hence nothing is certain. The player who crosses the desert as the wealthiest becomes the winner.

The game is quite swift and full of interactions between players, so you must stay on your toes.

name: Dicey Devices
description:
Each player plays a mad scientist, but, of course, there is only room for one. The game is one part Engine Building, Set Collection, and Area Control. It is up to you, as the maddest scientist, to use your laboratory, robots, and trusty assistant Igor to gather the resources and inventions you need in order to build your death ray and incapacitate the others before they incapacitate you.

Players that have been hit will have chances at reviving themselves using various means while continuing to play their turns, only losing the use of their death ray and assistant Igor while they’re down. However, when a player is the last mad scientist left standing, they win the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Puzzle, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: 0-100 Jorden runt
description:
A trivia game where you have to answer with a number ranging from 0 to 100. Answers can be in length, width, height, temperature, speed, size, age and given in units like centimeters, years, hours, crowns etc. The game differs from other trivia games which are often limited by given answer options.

The game is played in three rounds, consisting of seven questions each. The player with the lowest score at the end of the game is the winner.

There are a total of 1064 unique questions.

name: Cast Party
description: Divide into two teams answer trivia questions based on Broadway musicals. The first team to get 13 right is the winner. Most of the questions are naming the play from a quote, or completing lyrics.

name: It's Complicated: Board-Game-In-A-Poster
description:
It's Complicated is an obtuse game for 2 players that includes parts of chess, poker, snakes & ladders, resource collection, dice rolling, worker placement, and more! It intentionally takes longer to explain than to play.

Players roll dice, use the dice through worker placement to take actions in each of 4 sectors. There are 4 ways to win, but most often winning depends on the control of the four sections: Warfare/Chess, Politics/Poker, Science/Snakes & Ladders, and Economics/Resource Collection.

The board-game-in-a-poster edition of the game includes all components, even papercraft dice and chess pieces, in one 18x24 inch poster.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Grid Movement, Race, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Square Grid, Track Movement, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Rank Up!
description:
In Rank Up! the players are competing to win the most cards through a series of rounds where all players compare a statistic chosen by the round leader. The core of this game builds on the classic “war” card game that most kids already know how to play.

Design features added in this game include: 1) rolling a game-specific wooden die that will determine whether the highest or lowest stat wins the round, 2) players (usually) get to look at 2 cards each round and choose which to play, 3) a memory game element of needing to remember the cards looked at, and 4) the lead player choosing 1 of 4 stat categories for that round’s comparison rather than the simple comparison in “war” of the traditional card rank value. The winner of a round is the lead player for the next round.

Another significant difference from “war” is that this game is “once through the deck” and see who has the most, rather than the “win all the cards” victory condition of traditional “war” card games. This significantly shortens the game play and allows for a predictable playing time. The publisher says 20 minutes, although that may be a bit optimistic when playing with younger kids.

There are 100 game cards with 4 factual statistic categories on each. Also on each card is a fun fact which is not used in play of the game. Initially the publisher is releasing two versions of this game of “Amazing Animals” and “Countries of the World”.

name: Cyber-City
description:
Cyber-city is a cyber-punk themed game based on a map with a maze and a deck of cards.
The mechanics of the game involve exploration of the map coupled with the Flip and write game mechanic.
The aim of the game is to track down and defeat all the criminals living in the city before the time runs out.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Maze, Print & Play
mechanics: Drawing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Aleph Null: The Next Level
description:
This mini-expansion for Aleph Null contains four new Interference cards at Level 4.

You can add them to the choice of Interference cards on the Circle of Master, Grand Master, or Prince but beware: they are highly punishing!

—description from the publisher

name: Chick Maze
description:
Chick Maze is a maze and write game where you take the place of an angry chick who explores a double-sided map depicting a farmyard and the underground, to look for the Hen and bring her back to the chicken coop. As you explore, you will find items that can help you overcome obstacles, and you will also encounter enemy creatures to defeat.

—description from the designer

name: Board Bits
description:
Breakfast Shy postcard game, include in May 2023 Board Game of the Month Club Postcard package.

Very light game rules, a game that could be on the back of a cereal box!


Fill in squares with icons to form contiguous groups. The bigger the groups of your icon, the more points you’ll score.

Each player chooses one of the 4 icons.

Players take turns adding icons to the board. On your turn, draw your icon on any one unfilled square. Then, draw another player’s icon on any other unfilled square. Play passes to the next player.

Once all squares have an icon, the game ends and each player scores points for contiguous groups of their icon. The player with the highest total score wins!

name: Hero Realms: Parsons the Insider Promo Card
description:
This card was given out at Origins and GenCon 2023

Parsons the Insider
Champion - Human, Mercenary Cold Cost: 5

No Faction, choose a faction when you play this card. It has the chosen faction until it leaves play.

Expend: Gain 2 Gold. You may put a card from your discard pile onto the bottom of your deck.

Shield/Defense: 5
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Take That

name: Lyrically Correct: A Music Trivia Game – 90's & 2000's Hip Hop and R&B Edition
description:
Lyrically Correct is a music trivia card game that tests how well you know the lyrics to some of the hottest songs. This game will have you laughing, arguing, singing, and most of all enjoying time with friends and family.

Are you ready to turn up at your game night? Be prepared to rap your favorite rhyme or sing your favorite R&B line.

We have created a game so HOT that the VIBE will shift with every new card. Some cards are INTENSE FACT CHECKERS, some will MAKE YOU DANCE, and others will lead to a STRAIGHT UP KARAOKE SESSION. This is a UNIQUE EXPERIENCE like nothing else on the market.

Grab two or more players (pick your teammates wisely) and take turns answering questions about 90's and 2000's Hip Hop and R & B hits.

Hold up, that’s not it! Just when you think you have the right answer, a challenge card can be issued at any time which will test everyone's knowledge a little more.

—description from the publisher

name: Justin & Dave's Awesome Would You Rather...? Game
description:
Would You Rather? The card game full of deranged dilemmas and difficult choices. It's a simple choice between A or B. This card game will divulge your deepest desires and reveal a little more about you than you probably want. Discuss, debate, and laugh your way through the game that's guaranteed to break the ice at any party.

A card-based version of the classic game. Guess how your opponent will answer your custom question and, if you're right, you'll score a point. The first player to five points wins.

name: Gigantosaurus: The Adventure Game
description:
Are you ready for adventure? Delve into the exciting world of Cretacia, and find all of your hidden friends!
Are you as brave as Rocky, as smart as Mazu or do you want to go exploring with Bill or Tiny? Play your favorite dinosaur and see who is the first to find all the friends and items listed in your Gigantopedia. But watch out! The bullies are also hiding and working against you. Fortunately, Gigantosaurus is there to help you!

Gigantosaurus is a family adventure game for 2 to 4 players. Players collect tokens that are facedown on the game board by rolling a dice. To first to complete a set of tokens wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Set Collection

name: Light The Night
description:
This game is set in Taiwan in the 1950's. In an old bar, a group of people seeking solace in the nightlife telling their stories over a drink.

In the game, you will draw scenario cards and row the Chinese-alphabet dice. You have to use the Chinese-alphabet to create a sentence that matches the situation on the scenario card. The person who succeeds in creating a sentence within the time limit can move one step forward. The first person to reach the end wins.

name: The Mines of Pekari
description:
The Mines of Pekari is a strategy game for three to six players. Each player takes on the role of the chief of a tribe of goblin miners under the rule of Zafrat, the Goblin King. During the game, you will make decisions on how to allocate your resources (ingots) by providing good working conditions for your miners, paying tolls to the Trolls of Tuuk for the use of their shifting tunnels and mountain passes, paying for mining reports, or buying items from the goblin merchants. This will be done in the face of uncertainty regarding mining conditions, the demands of the trolls, gem price fluctuations, and testing availability.

Each round, you will have the opportunity to dig from one of four mines and then sell gems that result from your dig. As you dig deeper into the mines, conditions will become more treacherous as the threat of a cave-in or the release of dangerous gasses increases. Your opportunities, however, will also increase. Word of the mines' riches will quickly attract Goblin Merchants with valuable wares to sell to your miners, and the Goblin Engineers will offer to sell you information about the likely bounty of your efforts before you dig.

At the end of the game, the goblin chief with the most ingots is the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: Θα πεις και ένα τραγούδι (You will sing a song)
description:
How many games will you find with a word?

Sing any song with the word "love" in the lyrics. Now try the word "holiday". Or do you prefer the word "heart"? I think we just found another musical talent!

name: Uno Pixar Card Game
description: Essentially the same Uno but with several Pixar characters and a new rule: The Pixar Pop Quiz (applied to 4 wild cards). The person who plays this card chooses any other player and asks them to name a Pixar movie. The player holding the wild card must name as many characters from that movie as they can (up to five characters). The other player then must draw one card for every character named correctly.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Rainy Ranch
description:
Your toddler will build fine motor skills, color matching, shape recognition, direction following, and turn taking with Rainy Ranch! Roll the die to lead animals into the barn, watch out for raindrops, and get everyone safely inside before it rains.

Ravensburger preschool games grow with your child! Rainy Ranch includes multiple ways for your child to play on their own and for you to play together. Since 1883, Ravensburger has built a reputation across the globe as a trusted brand for parents and children. Ravensburger’s toys, games, and puzzles encourage discovery of what really matters through play.

Solo & Family Play!
Flexible Play for Growing Children – This game grows with your child! Explore multiple ways for your child to play on their own and for you to play together. Variant rules allow you to adapt the complexity of play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gnomes
description:
Three fun and educational games. In this game, jolly gnomes invite children to have fun while learning about colours, patterns, shapes and observation. There are three different ways to play.

—description from the publisher

Find the Gnome – All the gnomes are placed in a circle face up and the picture cards of the gnomes in a pile face down. One by one the picture cards are revealed, and the players try to find gnomes that match with their colours and shapes to the picture. The goal is to find as many gnomes as possible.

Patterns and Colours – All the gnomes are placed randomly face up and the picture cards in a pile face down. Each player takes a card from the pile and tries to find as many matching gnomes as possible. The game ends when all of the gnomes have been collected and the player with the most gnomes wins the game.

Hide-and-seek Gnomes – All the gnomes are placed randomly face down and each player is dealt four pattern cards. The aim is to find gnomes that match the player’s pattern cards by turning one gnome at a time face up. If the gnome doesn’t match, it is turned face down and it is a next player’s turn. When one of the players has found three gnomes the game ends.

name: The Game of Life: Giant Edition
description:
Life is anything but boring in the giant version of this iconic Hasbro kids’ board game. The Game of Life is giant sized and extra fun. Take a trip through The Game of Life: Giant Edition- a futuristic world so big that you become the mover on the board! This classic game made big is perfect for outdoor get-togethers or birthday parties. Play indoors or outside with this board game for kids 8-12. Whether it is summer or winter, you can play this kids’ game wherever you like! The large, illustrated vinyl game board makes for big fun in the house or as an outdoor game. The rules to play this fun game are simple and easy to play. The player with the highest score wins. Collect a family, pet, vacation, & career to complete your adventure card! Then retire in your dream home. This family game for kids and adults is for 2-4 players, ages 8 and up. It is super convenient to be able to play as a 2-player game or as a multiplayer game. Cards in this iconic game for kids can range from “I celebrated my 100th birthday” to “Become a famous artist” to “I went on an exclusive vacation to a private island”. Get ready for tons of fun and imagination in The Game of Life: Giant Edition.

- description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Economic
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation

name: Till toppen
description:
In this fast-paced and educational board game, players gain important knowledge and lots of laughs through fun physical challenges and clever questions on their way to the top of the mountain.

Till toppen was developed by three young girls who had an idea for a children's game that reduces sedentary time and screen time and that turns knowledge and social interaction into something fun. The questions and challenges have been developed together with children in the target group to make the game fun and just the right amount of difficulty.

name: Mafia: Devenez le parrain de la ville
description:
You are a member of one of the 5 largest Sicilian families. Your name inspires respect and fear. The community ranks you among the favourites to take over from the great Godfather. You're so close, all you have to do is prove that you're up to this huge responsibility.

MAFIA literally plunges you into this world of mafiosi, where the big families compete for the ultimate title of "Godfather". Designed for 2 to 5 players, MAFIA is a family strategy game. Adults will quickly appreciate its simplicity and strategic aspect, while younger players will love the twists and turns, the many possible interactions and the game's theme. Your aim is to take control of the city. To achieve this, you'll need lots of henchmen, plenty of cash, a few sticks of dynamite, some well-placed dirty cops, good investments and, above all, luck and determination. Whoever has accumulated the most cash at the end of the game will win the coveted title of "Godfather of the Mafia".

name: Tabloids
description:
Now you can make the news. Make UP the news, that is. Just like the real tabloids do.

Everyone creates a headline . . . crazy, sinister, or all too true. An instant judging round lets everybody vote on the best headline. And it's on to the next round!

This fast-moving game for three or more players includes 320 cards and easy rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Sallys Far: Bandekassespillet
description:
The picture books about Sallys father, by Thomas Brunstrøm and Thorbjørn Christoffersen, has been very succesful in Danish children's homes, and with 'Bandekassespillet' (The Swear Jar Game) the universe is turned into a solid board game. In the game Eddie and Sally have made swear jars for everybody, but who will be the first to fill it up with coins?

Primarily a game about rolling the die and following the path, but it allows children to play with language and swearwords in a fund and liberating way within the context of the game.

name: Rolling Trains
description:
Rolling Trains is print'n'play game in roll and write genre for 1-4 players. Your task will be to deliver goods from factories to correct cities. You play on a map without any railroads built. It is your job to construct them and use them for delivery.

Players will play in turns. During each turn, player will gather funds to build railroads, factories and stations. Each turn you roll 3 dice and assign them to actions. Each die result allows you to choose 1 of 3 actions. Available action types are: building railroads, factories or stations and gathering funds. If you do one type of action more, you will do the other types less.

name: HIDE and SHARK
description:
HIDE and SHARK is a card game for a 2-5 players which you collect treasure from the ocean floor.

If you flip a card and match the color or pattern, you can get a treasure card. But watch out for the shark!
At the end of the game, the player who has collected the most treasure wins.

This game requires luck, strategy, and memory.
Dive down into the thrilling and exciting ocean floor, won't you?

name: What the Facts?!
description:
During What the Facts?!, one person is the clue-giver and reads one side of the card aloud and keeps the other side to themselves. The other players will now start asking yes or no questions such as "Is it about an animal?" in order to hopefully reveal the fact!

Available at CraftyCow.store

—description from the publisher

name: Thirty-one
description: Thirty-One is a trick-taking game with six-numbered cards where players engage in l different play feeling for 31 days. The game contains 31 cards with 31 ranks that work as suits and where each card features six numbers in a similar to Dobble, where only one set of any two cards overlaps.

name: Ryki Afryki: Hieny – karty promocyjne
description:
Hyenas are sneaky predators that will use every moment of inattention to attack the participants of the Summer Parade. Hyena cards can be added to the game to make it even more unpredictable.

The game follows the normal rules with one exception: The Hyena card must be played on any previously placed animal card. Hyenas cannot be played on an "empty" column. A played Hyena card reduces the value of the card underneath it by 1. If, at the end of the round, the Hyena is the last card played in the column, the value of the tokens of this animal is 1 lower than on the last card played of this animal. You cannot play one Hyena onto another.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Colorbars
description:
Each card in the 72-card deck is emblazoned with four color bars, each bar in two sections, and those sections are either red, green, yellow, or blue. The objective is for each of the 2 to 6 players to create a row of connected bars at least five cards wide, scoring points based on the length of their single-colored bars. But there’s more! Each card has a value that allows the players to purchase cards from an array on the table, or even bargain with each other. The more valuable cards also have special actions that can be used during play. Try for lots of shorter colorbars or go for the longer high-scoring colorbar. Your strategy may shift, depending on how the cards interconnect!

—description from the publisher

name: GeoTop
description:
Educational card game based on geographical facts of Chilean cities.

Can be played in two ways:


Fact comparison. The highest number of the selected attribute (i.e. population) wins a card. The goal is to collect as many cards as possible.
Set collection. The goal is to collect as many sets (of 4 cards) as possible.


Contains 33 cards of Chilean cities.

name: Purranormal Cativity
description:
UNLEASH YOUR INNER DETECTIVE AND SOLVE THE CLAW-SOME CRIMES IN PURRANORMAL CATIVITY!

Purranormal Cativity is the mystery game for people with mischievous cats or those with a love for cheeky animals! It is now your task to uncover what happened in the scenes leading up to your arrival.
Winning Combination…

Identify the criminal cat, their mischievous crime, motive and hiding place! When you believe you have the answer, give your best Meow before revealing your guess to your opponents!

name: Kawaii War
description: The deck is evenly distributed to all players, any spare cards left in the box. Each player draws three cards and tries to play the most powerful weapon (bombs, firearms, knives, bludgeons) to win the trick. The deck isn't reshuffled between rounds: whatever cards you have won (plus any left over from your previous deck) become one's new deck. After five rounds, the person with the most cards wins.

name: Monopoly: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Mutant Mayhem
description:
Hop into the sewers as one of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles!

Calling all mutants! Team up with the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles as they rise out of the sewers to take down the evil mutants and save New York City from their very not rad mutant powers! Your ninja abilities and Turtle Powers will help you along the way. And one last Turtle-y awesome thing-theres pizza! Cowabunga!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: La Fleur
description:
Grandeur, love, and flowers! La Fleur is a strategy board game where you take on the role of a French Rococo garden enthusiast as you build your château, host garden parties, and gain prestige to hold the greatest of all garden gatherings, the Grande Soirée. Each player begins the game as one of a multitude of characters with a château that is rather, well....plain and empty. How will you ever attract visitors to your château and build your reputation if there are no fountains to admire, no paths to wander, and, most importantly, no flowers!

Each round you will send your artisans to different parts of Paris to acquire floral beauties, hire additional help, earn coins, commission new garden features for your château, and do many other things that artisans generally do. But be quick! Resources each round are limited, and the first artisan to each location gets their pick of the crème de la crème. Each round ends with a garden party, where visitors from across the globe come to shower you with prestige and opportunity. Be wary of your neighbors, though! If their château is more attractive than yours, some visitors may be more enticed to attend your neighbor’s garden party than yours. Sacrebleu! As word of the beauty of your competing châteaus spreads, more and more visitors will flock to your gardens. When one player gains enough Prestige, all players add their bonuses from their objectives and garden features, and the player with the most Prestige is declared the Host of the Grande Soirée!

—description from publisher

name: Caligula
description:
Caesar Commands You...To Drink!

Under the dissolute Emperor Caligula, the Roman Senate gets down to the serious business: drinking. But they keep on making laws. The usual penalty for disobedience: take another drink!

Everyone is Roman Senator. There are eight divine laws that are set in stone. Every Senator (player) must follow divine law. There are up to twelve Caesar's Commands put forth by the Senators (players). Laws must either require some action, or prohibit some action. A rule can include a penalty, within the limits agreed at the beginning of the game. If no penalty is specified, the penalty is "Take a drink." Two special positions in the game are the Arbiter, and Fool. The Arbiter's job: Keep the scroll, and fills in new laws (rules). Advises on wording of new laws (rules). Judges compliance with new laws (rules).

The Fool's job: Does not have to follow any of Caesar's commands, and may deliberately break them to lure others into error. If they make someone laugh, that person drinks. The fool must still follow divine law. Everyone starts with a small amount of coins. Coins can be used to pay fines and avoid drinking.

You win if: (1) You have twice as much money as the rest of the players put together (not counting what is in the pot), or (2) Everybody agrees that you win.

name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Magical Mayhem – 3D Board Game
description:
Witches and wizards, welcome to Hogwarts! Looking for fun new adult board games, kids board games, or Harry Potter gifts for women? Test your wizarding skills in a collection of magical trials with the Wizarding World Harry Potter Hogwarts Magical Mayhem 3D Board Game! You will love the castle gameboard that is over 1 foot (30.5 cm) tall! This game is for 2-4 players, ages 8 and up. Magical trials and challenges await you in this action-packed adventure game. As students of Gryffindor, work together to defeat the other Hogwarts Houses in a test of your wizarding skills. Throughout the castle, you’ll be competing in mini family board games to earn House Points. Experience real magical mayhem as you become immersed in the 3D Hogwarts gameboard and try to win the most points! Challenges include your favorite classes such as Potions, Herbology, Divination, Care for Magical Creatures, and Defense Against the Dark Arts. If you love Harry Potter Legacy, Harry Potter toys, or your Harry Potter wand, this is just the game for a fan like you. For gamers alike – kids games, adult games, or Hogwarts Legacy fans – this 3D castle game is sure to keep you competing all night long. Whether you are a Gryffindor, Hufflepuff, Ravenclaw, or Slytherin – test your wizarding skills with this immersive 3D board game – Hogwarts Magical Mayhem!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Flicking, Matching, Memory, Modular Board, Ordering, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Cards Against Humanity: Movie Pack
description:
The all-new 30-card Movie Pack about our love-hate relationship with Hollywood and the delicious hog slop they keep feeding us.

This pack is included in the Cards Against Humanity Movie Night box which also includes microwavable popcorn, Calm-O-Naise seasoning, 4 packs of Fun Dip, and a digital ticket to watch the 10 short films nominated by Cards Against Humanity to be part of their film festival where the viewers vote who wins the $100,000 grand prize.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Brainbox: Spain
description: Memorize the front of the card in the 10 second allotment time and answer as many questions as possible from the back of the card.

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fourth Edition): The Fall of Medusa V
description:
War calls you. Will you answer?

This supplement allowed players to take part in an exciting new campaign for Warhammer 40k.

The Fall of Medusa V was the 2006 global campaign run by Games Workshop. Unlike the previous global campaign, Eye of Terror, the campaign is based only on one planet, Medusa V, much like the Third War for Armageddon campaign.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Мед (Honey)
description:
Proper Honey is a bright board game for 2-5 people, dedicated to one of the most delicious and healthy products in the world - honey! The game will allow you to become funny bear scientists who have set themselves an excellent goal: to prepare the best kind of honey and prepare for the winter. Players will plunge into the world of dangerous research, where the developments of their neighbors are brazenly used.

How to play?
Each player receives a swarm card, as well as a certain number of game cards and honey tokens, which are indicated on that swarm card.

Each round, all players secretly select a card from their hand and then reveal them together. The effect of cards often depends on what cards neighbors have played. Therefore, players have to calculate not only their own choices, but also those of others, and also predict some events.

Card effects are applied in a specific order - first from honey cards, then from exploration cards, and then from swarm cards.

Honey Cards – Allow players to take honey tokens. By fulfilling additional conditions on the card, you can receive additional chips. The conditions are related to the type of cards that your opponents played this turn or you yourself played in the previous one - if they match, you get a bonus
Research Cards – Research cards are applied in ascending order of numbers on the cards. Otherwise the principle remains the same. Research cards allow you to draw cards, but the maximum number of cards in your hand is limited to 9 cards
Swarm Cards – Swarm cards are also played by number. First, players count their honey and experience tokens. The one with the highest total discards the honey tokens and takes a swarm token as a reward. If a player plays a swarm card but fails to obtain a swarm token, he can choose either 1 honey token or 1 card as compensation. The swarm card is always returned back to the player's hand

name: Paddington: Sightseeing Adventures
description:
PADDINGTON BEAR GAME: This fantastic new game allows you to take Paddington Bear along his travels through London on the way to The Browns. This will be a great contribution for a Paddington Bear party.
PADDINGTON BEAR FILM: This great british game will make a fantastic paddington bear present for those that loved the Paddington Bear movie or Paddington Bear film that were set in London.
PADDINGTON BEAR PRESENTS: You and your family will have great time helping Paddington Bear get home to 32 Windsor Gardens. On this way around the board, you will visit some of London’s famous landmarks and take selfies for his scrapbook.
PADDINGTON BEAR BOARD GAME: This game suitable for kids above 5 years old. The aim is to collect 4 selfies and get Paddington Bear home in time for tea. Paddington gets the chance to stop for Marmalade sandwiches and practice the Paddington Bear stare.
PADDINGTON BEAR ARTS AND CRAFT: This fun Paddington Bear activity game is a fun way of spending time with your kids or grandkids. This game will accompany Paddington Bear merchandise or other Paddington Bear toys that you already own

—description from the publisher

name: Host Your Own Escape Room: Mars Edition
description: Are you up for a challenge? An asteroid is hurtling towards Earth with just 24 hours until total destruction. With limited spaces on a shuttle to Mars, only the smartest people can solve the puzzles and be granted a seat. Time is ticking with just 90 minutes until the last shuttle leaves, so you'll have to think fast to prove your worth! Whether you're an escape room regular or new to the adventure, this is the game for you (extra hints and tips are available in the instruction booklet for newbies).

name: Goering's Jets
description:
The year is 1946, at the end of World War II. On this day, unlike the large-scale air raids on the German mainland that had been carried out every day, the Allied Forces aimed to show decisive "power" in the war, thereby weakening Germany's will to fight and forcing it to surrender. Bombers attempt to bring the war to a close by dropping multiple bombs on the German mainland, the first in history to have the power to blow up a city.

The German Air Force deploys the latest jet fighter Me262 to intercept them. What will be the outcome of this battle?

Goering’s Jets is based on the premise that Hitler adopted a more rational force conservation policy in the latter half of World War II, that the war continued until 1946 and the Allied forces were unable to prepare for the final war. This is a battle-type simulation war game that recreates the strategic bombing of mainland Germany using "city-destroying bombs" in order to bring the curtain down.

—description from the publisher (translated and adapted)
categories: Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Aquatica: Coral Reefs
description:
Coral Reefs is an expansion to the base game Aquatica that introduces the Southern Tribes, more underwater creatures, new characters, and Manta Ray encounters that can turn the rules of the game upside down!

In Aquatica, an engine-building strategy board game, players compete to become the most powerful Sea King. They will play cards from their hands, activate powerful combos, capture locations, recruit creatures, and more—everything to gain the most Victory Points by the end of the game.

Coral Reefs perfectly complements the base game and its other Cold Waters expansion. It comes with several new modules with additional goals and mechanics, along with new components like coral reef miniatures and transparent reef cards.

Together with its expansions, Aquatica is a fascinating strategy to play with family or friends! The game takes around 50 minutes to play and is suitable for 1-5 players aged 12+.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Nautical
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: The Lost Shaman
description:
Puzzle game inspired by nostalgic role-playing adventures. (print-and-play solo game with the integration of voice control)

Game Overview

Players: 1
Playtime: 15-30 minutes
Ages: 7+
Format: Print & Play with pplication (Web application)

You will explore the dark areas, trying not to be devoured by monstrous creatures. A race against time to find all the keys and exit the maze before running out of assistance from the wise shaman guiding you from the phone.
Explore with voice control if you like!

"The lost shaman" is a puzzle game in which the device places keys and doors in increasingly complex mazes from which you must emerge safely, avoiding or fighting monsters and using the resources found in the maze. It is a hybrid system in which finding clues is a crucial process for success.

It takes advantage of voice control to explore, allowing you to focus more on the printed map. A tribute to those who love paper and those who love pixels.
categories: Print & Play, Puzzle, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Chaudron magique
description: Each player is an apprentice witch. Players randomly select a book of witchcraft with four potions listed per page. Five potion cards will be revealed from the deck of potion cards, with each potion listing a specific combination of ingredients required. Players will begin with five ingredient cards. On their turn, they pick up a sixth card either from the face down ingredients deck, or from the top card of the face up discard pile of ingredients. If a player has the corresponding ingredients to make one or more potions, they discard the ingredients face up, take the potion card(s), and place them face up in their player area. The potions row is then replenished so five cards are face up. Players may negotiate and trade ingredient cards, one for one, with other players. At the end of a turn, players will draw or discard ingredients so that they have five cards in hand. The first player to complete four potions from one of the pages in their book of witchcraft wins the game.

name: Caterpillars
description:
Caterpillars is a simple two dice roll-and-write game in which players have two assign points to their three caterpillars. In the end, the lowest and highest scoring caterpillar are eliminated and the median caterpillar determines the final score.

Players roll two dice, and choose which die indicates the square to fill out and which the points to write down. Three times during the game, a player may use a special helper to improve their score.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Flamboyance: Unleash the Pack!
description:
Gather prides of lions, bobs of seals, murders of crows, and all sorts of quirky animal collectives in Flamboyance: Unleash the Pack!

In detail, you draw cards from a common deck. Cards can be used to form sets of same-colored cards or for their special power. Every card has a different term for an animal collective, and some cards give you a reward if you know animal collective terms. Collect enough sets to win.

name: Dragon Hero
description:
Floating high above the ground are the evil sky prisons that track down and trap any dragon they can find. With only 3 dragons left; The Fire Dragon, Water Dragon and Thunder Dragon; it's your job to direct those dragons from castle to castle to help them free their friends.

Dragon Hero is a solo or cooperative game intended for a younger audience. But the complexity can be scaled up for anybody! Each castle has a weakness on each side. Once you've moved the proper dragons into place to take advantage of those weaknesses you've freed the trapped dragon. Free all trapped dragons before going through the 9 movement cards and you win!

This is a quick, light, portable pocket game that can be played solo by young gamers or play cooperative as a family and have each person control their own dragon. Work together to figure out the right movements to free all the dragons and win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Matching, Modular Board, Movement Template

name: Meow Oracle
description:
Arrange the Oracle cards while taking turns in dealing out the cards.

When it's your turn, you reveal three cards and deal them one each to yourself, the next player, and the player after that.
Arrange the dealt cards in a 3x3 grid.

Cards that have already been placed face up cannot be moved or stacked on top of each other.

Then, if you cut out 9 pieces in a grid, you will calculate your score.

Scores are obtained by the number of cards lined up in ascending order and by the line where three cards of the same color are lined up.
Compare their scores (round points) with their neighbors on both sides, and if they are higher, each person gets 1 point.

You win if you get a total of 3 points.

—description from the designer

name: First in Flight: Richard Pearse Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of Pack Druid from the Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Blue side: Setup: Set aside 3 random Technology cards as your "Ideas".

Ability Side: Whenever you Gain a Technology card, you may select one of your Ideas instead.

Exhaust: Pay 1 Coin and 2 Time to Gain a Technology card.

name: Friends: Trivia Quiz
description:
Test your knowledge of the TV Show Friends.
The box contains 50 Quiz Cards, each with a "fan question" (worth 1 point) and a "super fan question" (worth 2 points), plus one card with instructions.
First to ten points wins.

—user summary

name: Just Peas
description:
Breakfast Shy postcard game, included in the June 2023 Board Game of the Month Club Postcard package.

Very light game rules, a game that could be on the back of a cereal box!


Each turn, roll 2 six-sided dice. Place each of these values into a different, unfilled pea (circle).

To place a value, it must be exactly 1 higher or lower than each adjacent filled pea. Adjacent means directly left, right, up, or down and does not include diagonals. For the purposes of placing a new value, ignore the values of any smushed peas and any peas in pods that are adjacent to the intended placement. After placing both values, start a new turn.

If you cannot or choose not to place a die value, instead smush any pea (including a previously-filled pea) by crossing it out. These will count against your score.

Instead of placing the values rolled, you may instead create a pod. Circle any 3 peas (filled, unfilled, or smushed) that are continuously adjacent — in other words, A is adjacent to B, which is adjacent to C. Pods may not overlap. Filled peas within a pod must always have the same value. Any unfilled peas when the pod is created can only be filled by using that value; this is an exception to the normal placement requirements. Each pod’s value is independent of each other pod. Peas in a pod may be smushed as normal. After creating a pod, start a new turn.

When all peas on the board have been either smushed or filled, the harvest is complete.

Count up the number of smushed peas to determine your score. The lower your score, the better you’ve done. Complete the harvest without smushing any peas to make Peater proud!

name: Fistful of Lead: Galactic Heroes – Codex Galactica: Grimdark Edition
description:
The Galaxy is locked in an endless war. The Empire, guided by their undying Emperor faces enemies on all sides and even those from within.

Herein lies a list of Mankind’s forces, its enemies and catalog of known psychic powers.

Warning: Possession of this text is heretical and punishable by the Inquisition.

Do you like the Grim Dark genre set in the distant future, where a stagnant human civilization is beset by hostile aliens and supernatural creatures? Do you crave a universe populated with a mixture of humans, aliens, and supernatural monsters, wielding futuristic weaponry and supernatural powers?
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Botanical Bliss
description:
Welcome to the world of Botanical Bliss, a captivating print & play, roll & write game where you can unleash your inner gardener and create a stunning oasis.

Dive into the art of flower growing and strategically plan your dream garden, filled with vibrant flowers and charming decorative elements.

Featuring relaxed gameplay and endless creative possibilities, Botanical Bliss is enjoyable for everyone from board game lovers to nature enthusiasts!

Botanical Bliss is a roll and write puzzle game sent to all backers in a print & play, digital format. All you need to provide is the writing tools and dice! The main objective of the game is unlocking these pesky eye pleasing patterns!

Featuring randomness from dice rolls, strategy in your choices and placement, and passive competitiveness between players.
Take turns rolling for your flower specifications, planting them in your garden, and reaping the rewards of your careful planning and coordination.

On your turn, roll 3 dice and place them on your sheet in their correct order and position. Decide whether to stick with the
rolls, or use a dice mod. Then fill in flowers in your garden based on the conditions you rolled, trying your best
to complete patterns.

If a pattern is achieved, roll for decor and decide where to place it in any qualifying area in your garden.

Repeat until day 20, or until a player fills their entire garden plot!

name: 僵尸貓的試膽大會 (Zombie Cats Daring Contest)
description:
The zombie cats are holding a competition to decide once and for all who is the most daring of them all.

On your turn you keep flipping over cards until the total reaches at least 7. Once you reach 7, you may claim the cards as your points, or you may also continue to draw. If you reach exactly 10, you win a trophy. However if you exceed 10, you end your turn empty handed.

There is one special die. If you forgo claiming any cards, you may roll the die instead. You may get to steal a trophy, steal cards, but you may also lose cards.

Play until the deck runs out. The player with the most points is the most daring zombie cat and wins the game.

name: Штурм бастиона (Assault on the Bastion)
description:
Assault on the Bastion is about assaulting a fortress that is full of treasure. The boss and his army are going to have a tough time breaching the defenses.

Each turn consists of three phases:
1.Manuever
2.Shooting
3.Battle

Manuever - a player rolls a die for how many actions they get. A piece can move one space for one action and may do up to the total rolled in actions. You can also split the total actions over several figures; if a five was rolled you could move two figures two spaces each and another figure one space. Up to two figures can be in a space.

Shooting - The defender then shoots adjacently with his archers, needing a 6 to hit. The arc of fire is front, back, left, right, but on a tower you can also shoot diagonally.

Battle - Figures that are adjacent (not diagonally) can fight. Both roll a die and the high side wins and removes a figure. If there are additional figures in the space, then roll again, until the space is cleared. There are some modifiers to this roll. Archers are minus one to the roll and fight after any other knights in the space, and the boss is plus one.

If the attackers enter the treasure room they win. If the boss is ever killed, the attacker lose.

The game includes:
-map
-Attacker army with 15 figures (8 knights, 6 shooters, 1 master)
-Defending army of 15 figures (8 knights, 7 shooters)
-one die

name: Vérité ou conséquence: 18+
description: Vérité ou conséquence 18+ is a game in which players must spin the roulette wheel to determine whether they will have to answer intimate questions or complete dares otherwise they will see their character lose clothes. The first player to find themselves with a naked character loses the game!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Bard in a Box Promo Card
description:
SlugFest Games promo prize card for donation to Extra Life 2022!

Text on the card:
Bard in a Box
Prize

When you win this Prize, add it to the Prize Bin, then gain 2 Fortitude and pay 1 Gold to the Inn.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Maligno Trip
description:
Maligno Trip is a social deduction game set in the Philippines. A game of betrayal roles, suspicious actions, and deceptive talk. Players must work together to go home to Manila, the capital city of the Philippines. Amongst the players are Maligno, a shapeshifting monster that is trying to kill them all.

Going home with their car, a group of travelers will find themselves riddled by detours, wrong turns, and long routes which affects gas consumption. While the goal of the travelers is to go home, Maligno aims to consume all the gas in order to kill them before they go home.

The trip will involve hidden information. As the maligno may curse and kill during the night, humans must find out who are their ally and their enemies. They must use their social skills to convince other players that they are on the good team, even if they are actually on the bad team. Actions, body language, and behavior of every player must be considered.

Each day, a designated driver is elected by the group. During each turn, the driver and navigator will work together to decide which route to take. Every action is dictated by a random deck. Players must figure out if the actions of the driver are based on luck or based on deception.

The objective of the Human team is to make sure the car token reach Manila. The objective of the Maligno team is to consume all gas so that the car token will not reach Manila. The board map is divided into 4 blocks or days. Each day, a designated driver is elected by the group who will decide the final action of the car token. When the car token landed on a location that is found beyond or on the boundary of blocks/days, then the night phase is initiated. Players will sleep during the night phase.

The movement of the car token is dependent on turns. A navigator is assigned each turn to work with the driver. Navigators are automatically assigned counter-clockwise of the driver, starting on the right of the driver. Each turn, the navigator draws 3 action card from the deck and discards 1 action card.
