The navigator will pass the remaining 2 action card to the driver. The driver selects 1 action card and discards the other. A new turn will occur after the driver selects the final action card.

The driver has the choice to reject any card that is handed by the navigator. Navigation rejection may only be done if the driver has not yet seen the action cards. The navigation bar on the board describes how many rejection has been made. Each day, three rejections may be done by the driver. The navigation bar resets each day. Depending on the action card, the car token may move from one location to another. Only the driver may place the car token to its proper place.

Maligno, from the Filipino folklore, is a concept encompassing numerous malevolent creatures that embody misfortune, illness, and all things evil. The nature of these beings, who are often depicted as agents of chaos and suffering, are shapeshifters that are believed to inflict illness, possess individuals, manipulate dreams, and even cause death. Their presence is often associated with unusual occurrences, like inexplicable sounds, sudden illnesses, and unexplained misfortunes.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination

name: Aethermon: Collect Expansion Pack
description:
An 18 card expansion for Aethermon: Collect.
Includes:
Solo Mode
1 player tracker
4 Character Direction Trackers
5 new Artefacts
5 campaign missions

This pack contains all the physical card stretch goals from the Gamefound crowdfunding campaign.

name: Star Realms Academy
description: Star Realms Academy is a simplified version of the spaceship combat deck-building game Star Realms that features less math and no reading.

name: Tu préfères quoi?
description:
Tu préfères quoi? is a game where you have to make a choice between 2 statements proposed by a YouTuber and explain why. The choices are extremely difficult to make and will create atmosphere, chatter, questions and more during your evenings! The game is ready in just a few seconds and is easy to understand for maximum fun and minimum explanation! You will find several ways to play, and you will also be able to combine cards from all editions of the game Tu préfères quoi? to increase possibilities and pleasure.

The player who take the card secretly chooses one of the two options. Then everyone else votes simultaneously for the answer they think the player chose, and everyone explains the reasons for their vote before the player reveals their decision. Everyone who had the correct answer scores a point. At the end of the game, the person with the most points wins.

name: Lemon Game
description:
Lemon Game is a competitive party game where your goal is to be the first to make the perfect pitcher of lemonade! 2–4 players will race to sculpt their hands while sabotaging other players and struggling against hazards.

Begin your turn by resolving each Hazard card in your hand. For each Mold, discard a Lemon card. Then do the same for Sun and Fly Hazards. Tip: Holding on to Hazards can be used to get excess ingredients out of your hand without using your action.

Take one action. This is where you can further manipulate your hand and those of your opponents! Actions involve drawing, discarding, and swapping cards from your hand, your opponent's hand, or a set of available face up cards called The Stand. Tip: If an opponent had no Hazards, it may be a good time to swap with them :)

At the end of your turn, you may draw two cards from the Draw Pile, but you do not have to. Tip: Keep an eye on whether or not your opponents are drawing :) If at any time you have three of each Ingredient and no other cards, reveal your hand to win! Tip: An opponent swapping with you can cause you to win on their turn!

Remember, when life gives you lemons, play Lemon Game!

name: Faux Auction
description:
A hot auction game with psychological warfare and talk battles!

You arrive at a certain auction venue. However, the true identity is a counterfeit seller! Selling a fake work that has been mixed up with a masterpiece, and winning a bid for a gorgeous masterpiece... I'm going to make a lot of money today...! ! ……eh? In fact, all the participants today are selling counterfeits! ? I-I haven't heard of that! !

Determine the authenticity of the work and get what is truly valuable to you. Counterfeit auction is an auction game that features fun conversations between buyers and sellers and heated psychological warfare.

---

心理戦とトークバトルが熱い競売ゲーム！

とあるオークション会場にやって来たあなた。しかしその正体は贋作売りだ！名作にしれっと紛れ込ませた贋作を売りつけて絢爛豪華な名品を落札…… 今日はボロ儲けだ…！！……えっ？実は今日の参加者全員贋作売り！？そ、そんなの聞いてないよ！！
作品の真贋を見極め、あなたにとって本当に価値のあるものを手に入れましょう。贋作オークションは、売り手と買い手による楽しいトークと熱い心理戦が魅力の競売ゲームです。

全国のイエローサブマリン店舗で販売しております。

name: Rock Festival
description:
Organize your own rock festival with your buddies and meager resources. Select the best bands of the moment for your program. Recruit technicians, organize refreshments, security, set up the stage, handle communications and find funding. Avoid the hassle and enjoy the festival!

Rock festival: Crescendo is a cooperative game. Players start the game with 20 resources and a motivated team of 15 volunteers.
Depending on the number of players, you have 8, 10 or 12 rounds to recruit 10 of the most popular artists from around the world.
During his turn, each player must select a card from among 6 cards (the river, which will be reconstituted at the end of each turn), paying for the necessary resources or volunteers. Each type of card allows you to gain either fame (by recruiting artists), or additional resources or volunteers. Additionally, by collecting cards of the same type you'll get bonus points at the end of the game. But beware, some cards (galleys) will get in your way, and you'll have to spend your resources and volunteers to discard them as soon as possible: accumulating 4 galley cards in the river will make you lose the game.

The game is won if, at the end of your festival, you have at least as many Resources and Volunteers as at the start, i.e. 20 Resources and 15 Volunteers available to organize the next edition of the festival.

The artists you've recruited during your festival will determine your degree of victory.

name: Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Storming the Warp
description:
Anyone who has explored the galaxy of Warhammer 40,000 will know that it holds a vast variety of planets. Some of these worlds appear in dozens of stories, such as Holy Terra, the capital of the Imperium of Mankind – others only get a passing mention as they are devoured by a Tyranid hive fleet. This Dungeons expansion for Munchkin Warhammer 40,000 brings 20 of these worlds to your table to add more Chaos (and fun) to your grim, dark games.

—description from the publisher

name: Hockey Tactique
description:
A card game in which you try to the win an hockey game going through the deck 3 times like periods in real hockey game. The game is playable with or 4 players. To make the most goal in a game you must play card when you are attacking. You opponent must stop you playing defense card. Depending on which card is played the next player can only play specific card to take control of the game.

—user summary

name: Smoki: Atak kruka – dodatkowa karta
description:
A set of four promo cards for the game "Smoki". Atak kruka(Raven attack)
The player that uses the card can put it in stack face up or use its special action: the player put it in theirs dream and exchange any of cards among his/her dream with any of others player's cards among their dream.

name: Grab Your Asses
description: A set-collecting party game where the goal is to find all a farmer's lost donkeys. Players are dealt three cards and must play one and discard one card per turn. If at any point you have less than 3 cards you are eliminated. Each card has unique abilities that allow one to draw from the discard pile, steal cards from another player's hand, or take donkeys from another farm, for example. The first player to get three donkeys wins.

name: In the Footsteps of Marie Curie
description:
In this family game, enter Marie Curie's laboratory and help the famous scientist win her double Nobel Prize!

Conduct experiments, improve your workshop and complete Marie Curie's research before the other players.

In the Footsteps of Marie Curie is a game featuring resource management and transformation mechanics with a card river and contracts. Resources distribution (Pitchblende, Uranium, and Radium) is done through a cube tower, and the retention or overproduction of these brings a set of surprises each turn. Players progress on a central board through Marie Curie's life timeline. The game ends when players reach the end of this timeline.

-description from publisher

name: ふわふわのクリスマス (Fluffy Christmas)
description: A set collection game using the patchwork system in which you can only move up to 3 spots in front of you. Collect presents, reindeer, dice, and +7 point cards to get the most points possible.

name: Kawaii Krush
description:
Scramble to collect and krush your opponents in Kawaii Krush, a rapid-paced party game. Everyone will be racing - be quick or your opponents might grab your hand first

—description from the back of the box

To win player must have 8 of the same Kawaii cards, then reveal their hand and shout a final Kawaii Krush to win the game.

name: Hot Sauce Poker
description:
Hot Sauce Poker is a push-your-luck, bluffing card game where you make spicy decisions! How well can you read your family and friends? Can you outbid them? There's only one way to find out!

Hot Sauce Poker takes place over a series of rounds where players compete in the Hot Sauce Challenge. The first player to gain two victories is the winner.

In each round players start with five sauce cards from which they choose one to keep and pass the rest to the player on their left and repeat this process five times. Then each player chooses three cards they wish to use and places them face down in front of them (the two cards remaining in their hand will be used for their special abilities later). Players in turn state higher and higher challenges (how much heat they can consume) or pass. The player with the highest challenge then has to turn over five face-down cards belonging to any players. If the total heat level of these cards matches or exceeds their challenge value, they take a victory card, otherwise they failed and gain a penalty card.
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Push Your Luck

name: Bamse Världens minsta äventyr Spel
description:
Nalle-Maja has lost her pearls from her necklace, and Bamse and his friends promise to help her find them.
But during the excursion, they happen to drink Skalman's XYZ juice and shrink to tiny sizes.
Among leaves, grass, flowers and mushrooms, they continue their search, helped by small insects and a friendly frog.
Your goal is to help them find all the gems and then drink ZYX juice to return to normal size.
Who will drink the juice first and win the game, proving that even small heroes can make big changes?

name: Around the World in 10-15 Minutes
description:
Phileas Fogg and Jean Passepartout needed 80 days, but you'll only need 10-15 minutes. In this print-at-home game with a leader-follower mechanic, one player each turn is the Navigator, which chooses an action that all players must take.

Choose to Travel between cities, Explore the city you're in, or pick up some Souvenirs to fill your suitcase.

When anyone has visited at least one city on each continent and returned to their starting city, the game ends - count up points, and the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Yumi & Tomu: Spelmästaren
description:
Yumi and Tomu are trapped in the Gamemaster's dungeon with their friends Jeff and Mumbi. In order to be free again, you must pass different challenges ranging from singing or dancing to writing as many names as possible starting with the letter 'a'. Fore some of the challenges you'll use a 20 seconds timer.

On your turn, you draw a random token to see if you'll get the possibility to walk 1, 2 or -1 steps towards the goal. Then you draw a card from the deck corresponding to the token. Lastly you roll a die to determine what challenge on the card to do.

From the Gamemaster's dungeon, the friends move from room to room by completing the challenges. Whoever reaches the rainbow on the green meadow first wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Music, Racing, Real-time, Trivia

name: Waffles vs Pancakes
description: Both teams blindfold one player, and then they compete to scoop the most pancakes or waffle cards onto their plate before the time runs out. Talking is encouraged, and the other team members can give directions to help their player scoop up cards and avoid the dreaded Doom card, which causes your team to lose the round immediately. Special Food Fighter cards give your team advantages, such as allowing a teammate to use their arm as a backstop for the spatula, or making the opposing player smack themselves on the head with the spatula after every scoop.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Gossip Trip Trix
description:
You are office workers of a certain political party who have been summoned by a reporter. He gets paid if he provides juicy material courtesy of your gossip — but if the article is widely reported and your role in its creation comes out, the responsibility that awaits you is...being fired! You absolutely do not want to leave the political party and need to make somewhat unconventional arrangements, perhaps kicking down your colleagues instead.

Gossip Trip Trix is a trick-taking game in which you want to avoid points, that is, credit for the gossip being spread. The deck consists of four suits numbered 1-11. Lay the 8s in a vertical column on the table as pat of an imaginary grid, then shuffle and deal the remaining cards.

The lead player plays what they want, and each player must follow suit, if possible; otherwise, they play what they wish. The highest card of the lead suit wins the trick, then all played cards are placed into the grid in the appropriate places: 1-7 to the left of the 8 of the matching color, and 9-11 to the right. Whoever won the trick scores points equal to the longest run of consecutive numbers from 1-7 in the winning suit, then they lead the next trick. However, if the 9-10-11 of a color have been played, then tricks won in this color are worth 0 points.

Once the 9-10-11 of each color have been played, the round ends. Shuffle the cards, then start a new round. After each player has been start player once, the game ends, and whoever has the fewest points wins.

name: Migo
description:
As a Migo, also known as a Yeti by some, you love to decorate your cave with goodies taken from the mountain explorers that you eat — and thankfully no matter how many you eat, that supply doesn't stop!

Each round in a game of Migo, the player with the most points wins a flag, and whoever collects two flags first wins.

In the first round, shuffle the 25 double-sided cards, then lay them out in four or five columns depending on the player count. On a turn, draft a card from the end of a column and add it to your collection. Each card depicts one or more symbols — ropes, crampons, etc. — while also showing what's on the back. If you draft a sherpa, discard it immediately, then optionally flip over one of your cards. If you draft a mountain climber carrying vodka, on a future turn you can empty the vodka to take another turn immediately.

Once all the cards have been drafted, tally your score. Wool hats are worth 2 points each, empty vodka bottles are -3 points, and for each other symbol score 1 point per symbol, with a 4-point bonus for whoever has the most ropes, the most crampons, etc.

Ahead of the second round, flip half of the cards to their other side, shuffle the deck, lay out the cards in an inverted pyramid, then draft and score as described previously. For the third round, lay out the cards in three inverted pyramids. If a fourth round is necessary, choose one of the previous card arrangements or create your own.

name: Joe Connaissant: Quiz Presto
description:
Tokens containing different words are spread out in the middle of the table. Players are split into two teams.

Every turn, one player from each team has a duel: a clue is read out loud and the first to grab the correct token scores 3 points. The first team to reach 30 points wins.

name: Code Breakers
description: This box of bafflement contains a series of cunning ciphers…but what do they mean? It’s up to you to crack the codes and reveal the mystery phrases, songs, film titles and so much more. Challenging? Possibly…but help is at hand because each card has a teasing topic that points you in the right direction. Can you determine what the mystery letters stand for?

name: Ranking! Cultura Friki
description:
Ranking is a party game for the whole family. Each player must order the 5 options creating their own Ranking, trying to guess the actual order. To do this, players use 5 cards that shares icons with options.

This self-playing sequel is based on geek culture - video games, anime and comics. It can also be mixed with the original game.

—description from the publisher

Ranking es un party game para toda la familia. Cada jugador deberá ordenar las 5 opciones creando su propio Ranking, tratando de acertar el orden real. Para ello, los jugadores usarán 5 cartas que comparten iconos con las opciones.

Esta secuela autojugable está basada en la cultura friki - videojuegos, anime y comics. También se puede mezclar con el juego original.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Tipni si!: Známe se?
description:
Do you know how many of your friends have been to Africa, how many sleep in their nightgowns, and how many of them vacuum up spiders? Even if you don't know, you can guess.

In the party game Tipni si! Známe se? (Take a Guess! Do we know each other?) you'll learn the first and last thing about your friends - although you can never be sure who chose the answer. And if you're not shy, you can play an open game and bet directly on a particular player's answer!

There are 900 statements, divided into 6 categories: Travelling, Cooking, Dressing, Hobbies, Household and Pets. So you'll really learn a lot about your friends - and maybe even some surprising things.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Ross the Boss
description: Ross, the Boss is a pleasant not only children's game, in which you, as a cat, have to watch out for the adorable dog Ross! Ross faithfully guards his yard and is not very happy if you sneak around him. Can you get to safety before he spots you and scares you? The combination of a flashlight dog and cats flying through the air out of fear is sure to entertain younger players.

name: Five Gems
description:
It is a game where the objective is to collect all the jewels before your opponent.

In order to win, you must be careful not to reveal the jewels you want to collect, and deduce the jewels your opponent wants to collect, and stop them from collecting them.

name: Cat Territory
description:
You've turned into a cat! Steal, lie ... anything goes. Battle for food! Will you survive?

In response to the bait (score) that comes out each time, put one card from your hand face down onto the field.

At that time, you declare the contents of the card, but
you can lie only 5 times during the game. Once everyone has played their cards, they are flipped face-up and the player with the highest number wins the food.　

You win if you get more bait (total points) than anyone else.
publishers: Joynt Game Factory (ジョイントゲームファクトリー)

name: ColGolf
description:
An exciting new game to test the skills of golfers and would-be golfers. Enjoy the challenge of a major golf classic, the tension of the skins game, or relax over a game of crazy golf. Medal, bogey or matchplay - enjoy it all in the comfort of your home!

—description from the box

name: Divine Cross
description:
Divine Cross is a two-player competitive trading card game that when you open 5 packs, it becomes your deck. Of course, you can also collect your favorite cards and build a deck!

Enjoy card battles easily with “Divine Cross”!

ディヴァインクロスは、5パック開封すると、それがそのままあなたのデッキになる2人用対戦型トレーディングカードゲームです。もちろん好きなカードを集めてデッキ構築することも可能！

「ディヴァインクロス」で手軽にカードバトルを楽しもう！
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Video Game Theme

name: Message in a Bottle
description:
A bottle with a letter inside was washed ashore by a giant wave. Challenge yourselves to decrypt its mysterious message!

Shake the bottle with the dice inside. The first to name a word with all the letters the dice are showing. Receive tokens for correct answers and win the game!
categories: Dice, Educational, Party Game, Word Game

name: Zakodowany kosmos
description:
Zakodowany Kosmos ("Encoded Cosmos") - is a follow-up to Coded Castle designed for children who are already a bit familiar with the mechanics of programming.

Players race to their opponents' galactic bases. To do that, they draw tokens that represent and place board pieces allow them to move, and tokens that represent coding commands. Players may also encounter commands IF and FOR. Whoever plans their algorithms the best and visits their opponents' bases, wins.

name: Electric Arcade Mini Mini Golf
description: Just like in real mini golf, the objective is to knock your ball in the hole in as few strokes as possible.

name: Cocktail Poison
description:
Cocktail Poison is a game from Japan with players trying to poison other players' drinks for fun and profit.

The game has a set of cards for 6 different shaped glasses for drinking (flutes, bowls, martini and so on), and tiles in 4 colour poisons (Red, Yellow, Blue, Green) and a white antidote tile. Each player is dealt one secret empty cocktail glass (the martini glass must be one as that decides the next start player), and gets a set of the five tiles. The start player is the last person to break a glass.

Each player chooses one of their five tiles in secret and places it face-down with their empty glass card face-down on top. This makes a combination of glass style and colour which is secretly poisoned.

The rest of the glasses cards show each style of glass with each colour of drink, making up 24 cards. The four colour cards for each style of empty glass being used are selected and shuffled to make a face-down deck. Three cards are dealt up (four with 5 or 6 players).

Players then take turns drawing a face-up card, and placing it up in front of themselves until each player has drawn four cards. Then the secret combos of glass and poison are revealed and players work out their scores for the round.

If a player has a combo of poison and glass style that another player has drawn, they gain +2 pts, and the poisoned player loses -1 pt. If a player has drawn no poisoned cards, they gain +1 pt.

The white antidote tile is used during the card draw turns. If a player has chosen to hide their antidote tile, they can play it onto one of glass cards at the time they select it. This neutralises the poison, meaning if another player then had that combo, they do not score 2 pts because the poison failed. And the victim gains +1 pt for successfully using the antidote, but did not have a poison combo in play.

Players cannot score less than zero on a round, and the game continues until a player scores at least 5 points. The player with the most points is the winner.

The second edition corrects the rule that whilst a player may rarely draw more than one poisoned glass, if they successfully apply an antidote to one, they still gain +1 pt for that and do not take -1 pt for the further poisons they did not cancel.
--description by user
mechanics: Deduction, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Bop-It!: Star Wars BB-8 Edition
description: The BOP IT BB-8 game commands you to do three actions in random order. Respond as quickly as you can. If you respond correctly, you will hear another command. Keep going. If you’re not fast enough or you respond incorrectly, you’re out! (From instruction booklet)

name: Cuidado con el tiburón
description:
You have to remove the pieces from the shark's mouth without getting caught in its jaws by the fishing rod.
The person who gets bitten by the shark is the one who loses.

Tienes que sacar las piezas de la boca del tiburón sin que te pille sus mandíbulas la caña de pescar.
A la persona que le muerda el tiburón, es el que pierde.

name: King and Courtesan
description:
King and Courtesan is a drawless two player army game where each player seeks to get their king into the enemy home square, or kill the enemy king. Players make one move per turn, starting with Red. Players will always have a move available, and must make one. Passing is not allowed.

There are three possible types of moves:
1. Kings and courtesans can make non-capturing moves by moving to an adjacent, unoccupied square in any of the three forward directions.
2. Kings and courtesans can capture by moving to an adjacent, enemy occupied square in any of the eight directions, capturing the enemy king or courtesan by replacement.
3. You can transfer the top checker of your king onto an adjacent, friendly courtesan in any of the three forward directions, thus exchanging king and courtesan.

King and Courtesan was invented by Mark Steere in May 2022.

name: ELEVEN: Players on Loan
description:
There are times you don't have the funds to buy a player you desperately need. Fortunately, player loans exist - they play with your team for a while to see how it is, and when the contract ends, they might decide to join you for free! - Description from the Publisher

Promo for ELEVEN with new rules to expand the transfer market and 4 cardboard token.

name: シェルブール攻防戦　(The Battle of Cherbourg)
description:
This is a supplementary game to the No.2 of "TACTICS" which was the Japanese wargame magazine.

It simulates the battle near Cherbourg that began on June 19, 1944.
It is a wargame for beginner to practice.

18 Turns
29 units.
Map size is 210mm wide and 297mm tall.

name: ブノット・ヤコブ橋 (Benot Ya'akov Bridge)
description: This is a game that simulates the tank battle on the Golan Heights on the northern front of the Yom Kippur War (1973).

name: エプソム作戦1944年9月25日 (Operation: EPSOM)
description:
This game simulates the battle for the city of Caen in northern France in 1944.
■Game Scale
1hex=2km
1unit=battalion-division
1turn=2days

name: 大堡塁ーボロジノの戦い1812年9月7日ー (Great Fort: Battle of Borodino, September 7, 1812)
description:
This game is a simulation of the Bataille de la Moskova.
Game Scale
1hex=500yard(450m)
1Turn=90minuites

name: اوهام (Oham)
description:
اوهام (Oham, "Hallucinations") is a strategic and completely Iranian-made game in the resource gain and resource management category. It's been designed by Faezeh Khomeirani, and Pouya Taymorian has done the art for it.
The goal of the game, is to have the most mental illnesses. Players, by using event cards, increase their negative emotions in order to gain mental illnesses. Also they will try to create positive emotions and give medication to their opponents, in order to stop them from getting the illnesses. The illness cards have variable points. As soon as a player reaches 20 points, the game ends; after calculating special points, the player with the most points wins the game.

—description from the publisher (tranlated)

name: Tortilla SLAP
description:
It’s a race to get rid of your cards first in a classic game of Snap. All you’ve gotta remember is Snap the burrito card or get a Tortilla Slap
Stay alert and be the first to snap a Burrito card. The slowest player gets slapped with the foam Tortilla by the quickest player.

—description from the publisher

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Deathgorge – Malevolent Masks Rivals Deck
description:
The ice-coated tunnels of the Deathgorge contain untold treasures frozen within their walls. Those brave enough to traverse the freezing continent of Bjarl and weather the Everwinter's curse must still battle rival warbands to have any hope of claiming these riches. The Malevolent Masks lay long-forgotten in the depths of Bjarl. Lost for centuries, they have now been discovered in the glacial chasms of the Deathgorge. Donning them grants the bearer power, but often at a cost, as few truly realise the consequences of wearing such an item.

This deck contains a 32-card universal Rivals deck consisting of:

12x objective cards
10x gambit cards
10x upgrade cards
1x background card that includes a deck list of the Malevolent Masks cards


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Freak Cults Dungeon
description:
One fine day, when churches on Earth were too many, representatives of them made a wise choice to prevent constant struggles finally: Each church chooses its champion and these blessed ones are put deep into a grim dungeon. The one who fights his way to the top is the one God has chosen. His church will rule the Earth and followers of all the lying sects will be voluntarily executed as stinky heretics.

What an idea! And here is the best part of it: You are one of these champions!

Freak Cults Dungeon is a fast and simple dungeon crawler/boss-fight card game on just 12 business cards that fit in your wallet.

The replay value is not high and is based on the fact of needing repeated plays to beat the high level of difficulty. Box not included, as the whole game fits in a wallet perfectly, making a super compact travel game, needing just a one-sheet-size of space on a table (no dice needed either, just 3 coins or other small tokens).

A black background is recommended for the full visual experience. And you can burn incense or two while playing, listening to Valaam choirs.

—description from the publisher

name: Was war wo?
description:
Now it's getting tricky, because in this memory game your own memory will trick you. Was the last card really a shark or a banana? And you've already seen the rocket ... but which of the four piles is it in? A game for clever minds. Confusion and fun guaranteed!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Giant Beaver! Tiny Ass!
description: Shout it loud and proud in this outrageous boasting card game that’s definitely not for the faint-hearted. Win each round by trumping your opponents with a higher-value card, but be careful if someone plays a SWEATY card you’ll lose the point.

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers – The Set of Four Games
description:
There are 4 games includes.

THE MAGIC SQUARE: Create Magic Square by correctly placing all cards. The correct solution must form a square.

THE MAGIC TRIANGLE: Create Magic Triangle by correctly placing all cards. The correct solution must form an [sic] triangle.

THE MAGIC HEXAGON: Create Magic Hexagon by correctly placing all cards. The correct solution must form a triangle with 6 portraits!

TRI-MEMO: Turn three cards to collect triads with the same picture or verses.

The game contains 70 cards. On 63 cards there are 21 characters from The Two Towers movie, 3 times each! Six card form two triads, which contain the ring verses.

Play either simple version for beginners or move to the more advanced version for the experienced.

—description from the box

name: Crash Landed
description:
Crash Landed is the ultimate family-friendly party game! You and the fellow players are space racers who have crashed on Earth… do you have what it takes to sabotage, steal and strategise your way to success and be the first off the planet and back in the race?

You play cards from your hand to either build your own spaceship or sabotage your opponents. Each player also has an alien character card that gives them special powers (e.g. play an extra card on your turn, protect a part of your ship, or swap cards with an opponent). The first player to build four working parts of their ship wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Park Life: People
description:
It was a beautiful day in Hawthorn Heath. People were dancing, reading, playing. Suddenly the weather changed. No one was ready… Except for you, a clever merchant.

Sell umbrellas when it rains, ice cream when it’s hot, tea and coffee when it’s cold, kites when it's windy, and masks when it's hazy. Park Life is trick taking game with 5 weather-based suits.

But customers are savy, so only the merchant with the last lowest price will make the sale. The lowest value card on suit wins the trick, but it is also is worth fewer points in the end.

You also have opportunity costs. Every sale makes you feel like going home, so you discard extra cards face down when you win a trick. You can quickly make small sales, but you’ll go home before others, giving them the opportunity to make huge sales alone! This well-balanced hand management action economy avoids perfect information and fills Park Life with rich choices.

The merchant who has made the most money at the end of the game wins! For solo and co-op, there are set point goals needed to win.

—description from the publisher

Although very similar to Park Life: Hedgehog, this design isn't just different in aesthetics but also by its deck composition (5 suits numbered 1-7 and the inclusion of wild cards), by its scoring (done only after 3 rounds), by the lack of card reset after a round and by its winning condition (most points after the third round wins). It is considered a bit less family-friendly and more oriented towards "gamers".
categories: Animals, Card Game, Economic, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trick-taking

name: Le grand quiz manga
description:
A board game designed for the many manga and anime fans of all ages, a particularly fashionable topic in recent years.
400 questions divided into the four categories manga, anime, manga culture and genius. 60 additional challenges divided into three categories: forbidden words, draw or mime, say it with a word or hum it.
A game for two to eight players to challenge friends, enthusiasts or not and of all ages, given that the game includes both the great classics of the past and the latest productions.
Whoever answers the most questions and wins the most challenges, thus demonstrating the most culture and intuition, will be the first to reach the dragon's head at the end of the game and win the game.
It contains a 96-page book which, in addition to summarizing the rules of the game, presents the reader with an overview of the most well-known characters and series of all time.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: 2GM France
description:
Play as France!

This expansion includes a complete deck of the nation of France and the units that participated in World War II.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Moving Multiple Units

name: 2GM Total War
description:
Add allies to your 2GM TWG game.

This expansion includes unit cards from various other nations that actively participated in World War II, to join the Allied or Axis armies
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Moving Multiple Units

name: bRainbow
description:
bRainbow is a fun game based on the Stroop effect of human psychology.

It is about a delayed reaction when reading the names of colors when the color of the text does not match the meaning of the word (for example, the word "red" is written in blue). There are rumors that, thanks to this trick, the CIA exposed Soviet spies! The game trains reaction and memory, and also teaches you to concentrate on several things at the same time.

Basic rules:

Each player receives 6 different colored cards. In the center of the table is the main deck, from which the task card is opened:

If the word "color" is on the card - each player searches among his cards for those that correspond to the color of the letters
If the word "name" is on the card - each player searches among his cards for those that correspond to the name of the color
If the name of the color is written in black letters - each player looks for cards with a similar background color
If a "bRainbow" card has fallen out - you need to quickly cover it with your palm


Whoever fulfills the necessary condition first takes the card. The winner is determined by the number of received cards. There are also additional rules to increase complexity.

name: Volcan Aventura
description:
Juego electrónico de habilidad y rapidez. Mueve los discos de la montaña durante tu turno para que tus bolitas (gemas) bajen y lleguen a tu bote salvavidas. Ten cuidado con los caminos sin salida y evita que tus oponentes se lleven sus gemas antes.
Gana quien tenga más gemas de su color.

Electronic game of skill and speed. Move the discs on the mountain during your turn so that your balls (gems) go down and reach your lifeboat. Be careful with dead ends and prevent your opponents from taking their gems first.
Whoever has the most gems of their color wins.

name: Futgoal
description: Football on a soft touch mat. In futgoal, you are both the coach and each of your 11 players on the field. A dice game that capture the excitement of playing football for real. You need a mix of strategy and luck to be futgoal champion.

name: Trivial Pursuit Mini Pack: 2000s
description:
If you love playing trivia games anytime, anywhere, then the Trivial Pursuit Mini Pack 2000s game is for you! This quick-playing game features trivia questions from the years 2000 to 2010. Since it includes cards only, you can take it to parties, get-togethers, on vacation, and more. On your turn, another player will ask you a question; get it right to keep the card. The first person to earn 5 cards wins! Answer fun trivia questions like "In 2001, scientists discovered that an octopus has eight additional brains, one for each arm. True or False?" and "Which country gave up the escudo and adopted the euro as its official currency on January 2, 2002?" Here's your chance to prove your prowess of 2000s pop culture!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Trivial Pursuit Mini Pack: 2010s
description:
This quick-playing game features trivia questions from the years 2010 to 2020. Since it includes cards only, you can take it to parties, get-togethers, on vacation, and more. On your turn, another player will ask you a question; get it right to keep the card. The first person to earn 5 cards wins! Answer fun trivia questions like "What hybrid pastry, fried like a donut and flaky like a croissant, became a delicious craze in 2013?" and "What Internet craze of the early 2010s involved participants lying face down in unusual locations?"

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Piratas
description: Game of attention and strategy. The player who gets a pirate family first wins. You can buy cards with coins or lose them to the bomb!

name: Luup
description:
Two players take turns placing stones on empty spaces of an initially empty hexagonal grid of hexagons, one stone per turn. There must never be a stone adjacent to six other stones on the board. You win if, after your placement, there is an empty space whence the edge of the board cannot be reached through a series of steps onto adjacent empty spaces. The empty area including that space is then said to be looped.

If you play several rounds, note after each round the size of the looped area and add it to the winner's running score. Whoever reaches a predetermined score first wins the match. The loser of one round plays first in the next.

Like all impartial games, Luup is exquisitely boring. To make it partisan (if you must), fill a looped area with markers of the looper's color and keep playing until there are no more legal moves available. If you loop an area, you must make another move on the same turn. Whoever has more markers in the final position wins.

As an alternative to the standard placement restriction, one may forbid non-perimeter placements that complete minimal triangles of stones around a vertex of the grid. This is a bit less elegant but possibly more fun and accessible. Loops are guaranteed in both cases.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Enclosure, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Race & Write
description:
Race & Write is a dynamic filler racing game. In just 15 minutes, you will experience the full excitement of a high-stakes race, making it the perfect game for those short on time but looking for a quick adrenaline rush! It will give you the unpredictability of racing with the need for tactical thinking.

Navigate through a diverse track full of twists, turns, and unexpected surprises. You’ll face a series of challenges and unknowns, making each playthrough unique and exciting. Game is prepared for 1-5 players in mind.

Each round lasts five turns. During each turn, players choose their gear (based on their position in the race) and move using speed points. Bonuses are available at various points of the track. After 5 turns, a new round begins with a fresh gear box. First car across the finish line, wins!

Buckle up for a high-octane experience, start your engines, and may the best driver win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: Math Island
description:
Be the first to escape the lava-filled ruins of Maths Island with this exciting maths board game.

Help children practise counting, adding, and subtracting up to 20.

Designed for 2–4 players, this adventurous game takes intrepid adventurers around the mayhem-filled confines of Maths Island, where they must use their addition and subtraction skills to escape and win. This fun maths game for children includes fun equation dice that serve up a different maths problem with every roll. Solve the problem and discover how many spaces you move. It’s a fun way to promote number learning for children.

name: Starship Interstellar: Danger from Kuiper
description:
During the game the players will be able to capture asteroids thanks to their launch bases, located on the asteroid belt. The asteroid thus acquired will create a personalised effect track, which will give each player unique bonuses. However, the asteroids could also crash into planets in the solar system, modifying the status of the deposits in the planetary zones or even the resources that can be extracted from the sun.

In Starship Interstellar each player takes the role of a powerful corporation, and all of them are “cooperating” to save humanity from the disaster they themselves caused: they have to build the Starship Interstellar, hibernate in it the more people they can, and find a route to an inhabitable planet.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Point to Point Movement, Resource to Move

name: Rai-Net Access Battlers
description:
Rai-Net is a Japanese board game based off the 1980s German game Good & Bad Ghosts but with clear differences. It originated in an anime called Steins;Gate as a spin-off of the in-universe media franchise RaiNet Kakeru. It has since been been manufactured by GigasDrop for fans to enjoy.

In an 8x8 grid square board two players receive a set of 4 Virus Cards ausernd 4 Link cards. Each have two middle spaces called the "Server Port" areas, along with each players' Stack areas which consist of spaces for captured Links and Viruses. Players also receive 4 Terminal Cards with various special effects that change the gameplay significantly.

Players alternate moving their hidden pieces in the board, trying to capture the opponents Links and avoiding their Viruses while also trying to do the same to them. Any card that make it to the opponent's Server Ports are also stored in their Stack area, so the player can infiltrate their cards to the opponent.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Static Capture

name: Liikennepeli
description: Educational roll and move teaching various traffic rules to players. Board contains numbered path around Helsinki city centre, with certain numbers highlighted in red. Should player hit one of those numbers they read related event and follow instructions in it.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tortoise Tumble
description:
Impress your fellow players with your tumbling skills as you roll your tortoises across the garden to score. How and where your tortoises land decides how many points you win, so you’ll want to work out your best tumbling technique as quickly as possible. But be careful not to land on your back—that would be extremely embarrassing. The first player to earn 500 points is the winner and is crowned Top Tortoise Tumbler!

Perfect for friends, families, and lovers of tortoises, it's suitable for ages 8+, 1+ players, has an average 15-minute gameplay, and includes English instructions. Made using FSC paper and soy inks.

How to Play:
To begin the game, you must first create the garden. Piece together the nine scene cards in any position you like. There are potential bonuses on each card, so think carefully about where you place the highest earners!
The first player rolls the two rubber tortoise pals onto the garden and checks the scorecard to see how many points they’ve won. For instance, landing on your shell side will earn more points than face-planting but landing on your back scores zero! Remember to check for bonuses on the card where you landed, too. Not happy with your score? You can re-roll twice per turn but remember: your score can decrease as well as increase. And if a tortoise misses the garden altogether, you score zero and cannot re-roll. When you’ve done all you can, record your total score for that round on the scorepad and pass the tortoises to the next player. The garden layout stays the same throughout the game. The first person to earn 500 points is the winner and is crowned Top Tortoise Tumbler!

—description from the publisher

name: Assimilation
description:
Assimilation is an asymmetric zone-capture/battling game. Each round, 4 war zones will be up for the taking, but the points you score aren’t only dependent on the zones you capture, you also score points based on the number of troops that have been played to capture the zone, both yours and opponents! Quick-paced thanks to single action turns, each decision you make must build toward your strategic plan for victory.

In Assimilation you’ll battle rival commanders as you strive to outmaneuver whatever tactics come your way with your own clever strategies. Will you hammer down on a single zone or spread your resources wide in an attempt to trick your opponents into sacrificing their valuable resources? Whatever strategy you use, one thing is always true: the commander with the highest number of points at the end of the game wins and there is no prize for second place.

—description from the publisher

name: Aetherstream: Interceptor – Callistonian Empire Squadron Set
description:
The Imperatrix has made the call and Callistonian's are answering. New fighters need pilots and crews to keep the Commonwealth at bay. The Empire will need all of its resources and ingenuity to fend off their military might. New tactics and resources will help but it will be those on the front lines who will make the difference and pay the price.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: NOVA Trading Card Game
description:
NOVA (means Narrative of visual actual) is a Japanese Trading Card Game. In this game, two players construct their own 40-to-60-card main deck and a 10-card character deck to fight with each other, the player who makes the opponent's life point from 2000 to 0 will win the game.
A special point of this game is the character deck. Each player can choose a character from this deck to play once per turn, and the level of character to choose will decided by player's life point, when a player's life point reduce to 1500 then he/she can use lv.2 character and when a player's life point reduce to 1000 then he/she can use lv.3 character.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: Magnet Club
description:
Magnet Club is for ladies and gentlemen who love to stick magnets together.

As cards in your hand, you are dealt an S-pole card (numbers/magnetism 1-6) and an N-pole card (also numbers/magnetism 1-6), You also dealt an anti-magnetic card that prevents magnetism.

These cards can be erased when the magnetic forces are balanced/attached to each other.
The aim is to get rid all of the cards from your hands.

—description from the designer

name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Professor Bruttenholm And Young Hellboy
description:
This year's (available April 2024) event season miniature will be... Professor Bruttenholm and Young Hellboy!

This limited edition agent booster mini-expansion for Hellboy: The Board Game brings Professor Bruttenholm and Young Hellboy to your adventures.

PVC model supplied unpainted.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: みんなでアテタンゴ (Atetango)
description:
Guess the words from strange questions!
A conversational guessing game that can be played with 6 cards!

What kind of power does an apple have? How much does a deserted island cost?
Ask questions to identify the secret word.
When you get the correct answer, Atetango! Win by guessing the most words!

へんな質問から単語を当てよう！
6枚で無限に遊べる会話型推理ゲーム！

りんごはどんな力を持っていますか？ 無人島の値段はいくらですか？
質問をしながら、親だけが知っている秘密の単語を特定しましょう。
正解にたどり着いたらアテタンゴ！ たくさん単語を当てたら勝ちです！

name: Get Salty
description:
There’s one thing that is clear when you enter the bar: there is no way that you are sipping your sodas without a pack of snacks! Due to different demands and preferences you end up ordering a bunch of different ones: some are salty, some are not; and you definitely have a preference as well. Collecting together your favorite type of snacks is what will make you satisfied!

In Get Salty players will take alternating turns to place or move snacks with the objective of getting three snacks of the same kind in a row with different winning conditions for each player.

Includes: Get salty bag + Get Salty cardboard snacks + Rulebook

name: Kichi Kichi Kitchen
description:
In this game, you have a limited time to find a card from a deck of cards with ingredients and characteristics that matches the dish presented to you, and ask your friends to guess which dish it is.
You must manage to tell your friends which dish you are looking for even though the ingredients you want may have been taken by other players or you can't find them.
Be tactful and express your dish!

—description from the designer

name: Les Guignols de l'info
description: Based on a famous and popular French TV show, the players compete as teams and the purpose of the game is to answer correctly to a series of questions about the show.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Smocza jama
description:
The goal of Smocza jama is to reach the castle and, along the way, sneak past the pit of a voracious dragon. Monsters (on the board in large yellow squares) help the dragon capture the player. However, mysterious creatures help the player by giving him "lucky stars" (fields with a star), which allow him to summon a knight who will defeat the dragon. Dwarves (fields with dwarves) also help by giving items (sword, bow, invisibility hat) or revealing a spell that helps defeat monsters.
Players take turns rolling the dice and moving their pieces by the number of points on the dice. When a player stands on a square with a star, he or she receives a card with a star. When the player stands on the field with the dwarf, he receives a magic item on a cardboard in the color of the dwarf's hat. When a player stands on a space with a creature, he draws a card with that creature. It then moves to the circular track in the center of the board. Now he moves on it. When he stands on a green space, he is saved by a sleeping knight and goes to the space of the color indicated by the arrow on the creature card. When he stands on the red square, he is eaten by the dragon and returns to the start. If a player who stands on a space with a creature has a star, he gives it up and moves to the track with stars, crosses it, is then saved by a knight and moves to the space in the color indicated by the arrow on the card with the creature. If a player who stands on a field with a creature has a magical item, he defeats it, puts the item in the box and continues.

name: Na wyścigach
description:
Players receive 2 tokens (plastic tiles) worth 50, 2 tokens worth 100, 2 tokens worth 500 and 1 token worth 500. In addition, each player has one pawn corresponding to one horse. Players roll the dice and move the horses. When the pawn (horse) hits the red square, the horse is relieved of its injury and is eliminated from the game. When the pawn hits the yellow point, the horse spooks and the player loses one turn. When a horse hits the green dot, it means the horse is in good condition and receives an additional throw. In addition to players moving horses, they can bet on which horse will win, and they can also bet on their own horse. You place bets by placing tokens symbolizing money on fields with pictures of horses. The money you have placed cannot be withdrawn, but you can add more until the horses pass the halfway point - the field with the letter P. The game ends when the first horse crosses the finish line. The player who predicts the winning horse wins all the money. If several players guess correctly, they share the winnings equally. Whoever has the most money at the end wins. The game can be finished after the first game or after each subsequent game. You can play as long as players have "money".
The game is intended for 6 people. If there are fewer people, you have to figure out how to handle all 6 horses running.
categories: Animals, Party Game, Racing, Real-time, Sports
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Real-Time, Track Movement

name: Jurassic World: Camp Cretaceous Board Game
description:
Escape from Isla Nublar with the Jurassic World Camp Cretaceous Board Game.

Based on the Netflix original animated series Jurassic World Camp Cretaceous, this board game allows players to become a part of the world of dinosaurs. Role the dice and move across the board into different sectors of the map. Visit camp highlights along the way such as the botanical gardens and the T-Rex kingdom. Each sector has its own corresponding game cards which determine your fate. Will you be chased by a Velociraptor and have to run back 2 spaces? Or will you get a ride in the Gyrosphere and roll forward?

—description from the publihser
categories: Animals, Dice, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Biome
description: Players are dealt hands of cards that display a black or white number or one of seven biomes (suits). In rummy fashion, players draw from the draw deck or from either the number discard pile or the biome discard pile to create melds (followed by an optional discard). Players must shed their entire hand at once with one or more melds. A meld consists of (i) a white number card with a matching number of similar biome cards or (ii) a black number card with a matching number of biome cards, all of which are different. Score a point for each card in the meld(s). Replenish to a hand of five cards and play until someone reaches 50 points.

name: Square One: Joker Expansion
description:
The Joker Expansion enhances Square One’s gameplay beyond its initial borders. It features three-reward and 4-point sequences, along with a versatile Joker piece that substitutes for any other piece. All together offering unique mechanics that can’t be found in the base game.

As an additional bonus with the Joker expansion, you can enjoy playing Square One with 5 or even 6 players!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting, Resource Queue, Tile Placement

name: フーダントリック (Who Done Trick)
description:
Disguised as a detective, I come across another phantom thief at the place I robbed. That phantom thief was also disguised as a detective. A large amount of treasure has been stolen, and if things continue like this, I will inevitably become suspicious…

Who Done Trick is a trick-taking game where you need to deduce from the tricks, match the alibi, and uncover the phantom thief who left behind evidence.

name: Siglo 20
description:
20TH CENTURY is a fun and anecdotal game that consists of placing curious events of the present century (XX) in the year in which they occurred. – It is not about being a “know-it-all”, but rather locating relevant events in the year in which they occurred.

—description from the publisher (translated)

SIGLO 20 es un juego divertido y anecdótico que consiste en situar curiosos acontecimientos del presente siglo (XX), en el año en el que ocurrieron. – No se trata de ser un “sabelotodo”, sino de ubicar relevantes hchos en el año en que acontecieron.

—description from the publisher

name: ㅊㅅ게임왕 훈민정음 실종사건 편 (King of initial consonant game)
description: A simple game where you hide two cards with Korean initial consonants on them and guess the corresponding initial consonant by saying the word.

name: Escape from the Lost Gardens
description:
There's no better way to enjoy a spring afternoon than with a walk through the woods. Your relaxing stroll quickly spirals out of control however when you find yourself trapped within the gates of a most sinister-looking garden. You just can't shake the feeling that something strange lurks within the long grass. You need to find your way out, and fast!

—description from the back of the box

name: Sali Scendi Cambia Colore
description:
An easy to learn card game in which you have to match colors and numbers in an ascending or descending manner. Play strategically, change direction or color, finish your cards and win the game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Crossroads: The Linking Game
description:
A strategic game that gives great importance to the harmonious shape of the design. Whoever closes the most circuits wins!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Fidati
description:
A classic bluffing game with picture cards!

The practical pocket format is perfect for bringing the fun always with you!

Play cards, deceive other players and don't get caught!

Doubt everything and everyone!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: 간장공장 공장장 (Mr.Kang from a Soy Sauce Factory)
description:
Mr.Kang from a Soy Sauce Factory (Tongue-twister) is a game of quickly reading or repeating sentences that are difficult to pronounce quickly, and sequel of Mr. Smith Living in Swiss.
Race to accurately and swiftly read the unfolded word cards to claim victory.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: ¡BOOM!
description:
Put yourself in the shoes of a contestant from the hit television game show with the official BOOM game. An exciting game in which a team of contestants must defuse bombs by answering several questions correctly within a certain time. Discard the wrong answers and prevent the bomb from exploding.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Ponte en la piel de un concursante del exitoso concurso de televisión con el juego oficial de BOOM. Un trepidante juego en el que un equipo de concursantes debe desactivar bombas respondiendo a varias preguntas correctamente dentro de un determinado tiempo. Descarta las respuestas incorrectas y evita que explote la bomba.

—description from the publisher

name: Drama Lama
description:
The games are quick, simple and full of tension to have fun together in any place and at any time.

Play the Action cards and be careful not to get spit on by the Llama!

A game full of humor, perfect for having fun in evenings with friends.

Players start with six cards in their hand, and are awarded 4 or 6
hearts, depending on the number of players. On their turn, players can either do nothing or play as many cards as they want and apply their effects; playing cards is optional. At the end of the turn you must always discard one card, and possibly more to return to having three cards in your hand. If a DRAMA LAMA is drawn, a life is immediately lost.

Players who remain without hearts are eliminated, the last player remaining in the game will be declared the winner.

name: Courting the Royals
description:
As a Noble, you have always been trying to win the favor of the Royal Family. Well now is your chance! Build influence with all four Families, as you seek to climb the ladder and join the Royal Court. Be careful though, events with the Families also have assassins, deal makers, and spies in attendance, all of which will manipulate the way influence is gained. Will you court enough of the Royals to win their favor, or will you be forgotten?

In this 2-4 player card game that is played with a regular deck of cards, you will be drafting cards from a central area, trying to gain more influence than other players. Collect sets of cards in the same suit to improve your chances, but don't forget about the other suits, as you can only win if you have more than one family's support. So grab a deck of cards, and print out our free rulebook. Joining the Royal Family is only a shuffle away.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Go Gin
description: Basically a variant of Gin Rummy where the cards have letters on them instead of the traditional numbers and suits. You collect sets of cards in order to spell words and then either knock with the fewest exposed points or Go Gin!

name: Sauve qui poux!
description:
Sauve qui poux is the third game from young French publisher L'Auberge des Jeux.
(The title is a word play in French that bases on "every man for himself ").

Description by publisher:
Caution: Completely delirious lice unload on an innocent head!

Use with relevance competences of your army - queen, workers, infantry, rifleman and chemists - to keep the supremacy of your colony.

Collect barrels of blood and play your action cards wisely.

Will you be able to lay enough nits and to protect them? Will you manage to occupy the gameboard strategically?
Solo or in teams, take the command of your units and make your adversaries bite the dust.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Соображарий: Герои (Think it up!: Heroes)
description:
Соображарий: Герои ("Think it up!: Heroes") is a new version of the famous board game for cozy little companies and grand parties. This time you have to quickly remember the most famous people of different times and nations! Don't forget about your sense of humor too: the name of one of your rivals can be a suitable answer to a tricky question!

Open the task
Open a letter
Be the first to name the correct answer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Blacks & Whites
description:
Warning: This game explores issues of racial inequality and it is useful to read the context of the game design before playing. Some may find the method of exploration of these issues offensive.

Originally published as a free game insert (with paper board and unmounted cards that had to be cut out) in the March 1970 issue of Psychology Today magazine (which simultaneously advertised a version in a long cardboard box, with better components and play money, for $5.95), “Blacks & Whites” was a socially-conscious game which not only reflected the signs of the times but was also meant to effect change. In a sense, it was something more akin to a social experiment and performance art in game form. On the bottom side of its box, the game description reads: “Experience the ghetto. Live on Welfare. Try to buy a place in a white suburb. Your challenge: To keep the land-hungry majority type from winning the game cheaply and quickly.... If Black players turn the tide against white advantages, a kind of irrepressible excitement takes over the board.”

Players were divided into Whites and Blacks and had to make economic progress while competing with each other. Based on "Monopoly", the idea was to demonstrate how the odds were stacked against black people in society by having different rules for each race in the game. The difference between this and all the other roll-and-move go-around-the board-buying-property games is that before the game, each player assumes the role of either a Black or White person.

Whites start out as the majority with $1,000,000.00 to spend and are able to buy property anywhere. Blacks start out as the minority with only $10,000.00 to spend; are unable to buy certain properties; have to draw from a separate Chance deck; are banned from purchasing property in the 'Surburban Zone'; and collect less money for completing a lap around the gameboard. Blacks are limited to certain areas of the board until they had accumulated at least $100,000.00. Players are encouraged to change the rules when anyone lands on the People's Park space.

Needless to say, it turned out to be one of the most controversial board games of all time and even merited an article in Time magazine: "The game, produced by Psychology Today Games (an off shoot of the magazine) now on sale ($5.95) at major department stores, was developed at the University of California at Davis by Psychology Department Chairman Robert Sommer. It was conceived as a painless way for middle-class whites to experience — and understand — the frustrations of blacks. In Sommer’s version, however, the black player could not win; as a simulation of frustration, the game was too successful. Then David Popoff, a Psychology Today editor, redesigned the game, taking suggestions from militant black members of 'US' in San Diego. The new rules give black players an opportunity to use — and even to beat — the System."

Although turning "Monopoly" into an attempt to draw people’s attention to social issues seems a little bit of a long shot, it’s worth noting that the original version of 'Monopoly' itself, called ‘The Landlord’s Game‘, was designed to demonstrate how the current economic system led to inequality and bankruptcy.

Psychology Today’s board game division seems to have been short-lived but other titles included 'The Cities Game' involving ‘urban tension, corruption and the undercurrents of city politics'; and 'Woman and Man' where ‘Each woman must accumulate enough Status Quo points (100) to prove her equality to Men. Each man must collect enough Status Quo points (100) to prove once and for all a Woman’s place is beneath his.’
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Communications/Research/Machines/Inc., Dynamic Games / Dynamic Design Industries

name: Pig
description:
Scarne did not create Pig. He describes it in 'Scarne on Dice' (1945), saying, 'I suspect that the game was invented by the con men and is simply a variation of their favorite swindle The Tat dressed up in new clothes.' Therefore the game is almost certainly older than that.
Highly doubtful that Scarne, or anyone else, sold a boxed set for this game. It only uses one regular d6 die.

Each turn, a player repeatedly rolls a die until either a 1 is rolled or the player decides to "hold":


If the player rolls a 1, they score nothing and it becomes the next player's turn.
If the player rolls any other number, it is added to their turn total and the player's turn continues.
If a player chooses to "hold", their turn total is added to their score, and it becomes the next player's turn.


The first player to score 100 or more points wins.

name: Monopoly: Magnetic Pocket Edition
description:
The classic Monopoly game. Only the game parts are smaller. The board, houses, hotels and tokens are magnetic.
The pieces can put in a tray. everything is put in a small case (1,5 x 10,5 x 18 cm), so you can carry it easily with you.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Parker Brothers, Tonka Corporation, Waddingtons

name: Trivial Pursuit: The Year in Review – Questions about 1993
description: This edition of the TRIVIAL PURSUIT Year in Review Series captures the highlights of the year 1993, and it lets you play your favorite trivia game in a whole new format. The game consists of cards with over 1300 questions, a color-coded die to decide categories, and six scoring tokens with enough wedges for six players or teams. The special book-style slip case makes it a perfect addition to your book or game shelf.

name: Drinkagon
description:
Description from the publisher:

Drinkagon is a board game for up to 6 players that combines drinking and strategic thinking. You have to carefully plan your moves and find the shortest possible way to win your opponent’s base. You need to use tactics and strategy in order to stay sober and try not to step on the green (TRUTH) or red (DARE) fields.

To spice up the game you can use your moves to move your opponent's’ figurines far from their win. Make them lose, answer tricky questions and do crazy challenges or just get them drunk.

We have developed a free iOS & Android app with hundreds of truth & dare cards which makes the game endlessly fun and surprising.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: M400
description:
From the IndieGoGo campaign

The union of history, art, strategy, entertainment and passion, that’s what M400 was born from. A game of conquest, which revolves around an important and defining historical period: the 1400.

But this century is so much more than just a bunch of years: it’s one of the most magnificent periods in the history of Italy and the European culture. Because it’s not a coincidence if the end of this century marks the beginning of the “Modern Age”.
M400 comes from the idea to bring strategic board games to the next level; neither the name nor the historical references to the XV century are just a fortuity. The century that saw the fall of the last Eastern Roman Empire, the birth of the power of Spain and England, the ascent of the Russian Republics, and the achievements of the glorious Republic of Venice are the ideal background for the birth of this new way to have fun with history.
M400 has a high level of playability with multiple players, and the cards allow an always different gameplay, helping the creation of new and different matches. Every time a player finds themselves in the late Medieval period of the game, they can rewrite important pages of history in new ways, through trades, battles, journeys and revolutions. The challenge and the strategy also allow to create with the opponents new dynamics of gameplay beyond the rules: deceptions, bluffs, silent and secret alliances. The almost total absence of chances and coincidences, linked to the dices, reduces the possibility of a player to win just by chance.
M400 is a game which contains very different elements, elements that can mix, and give the player a unique and unpredictable kind of entertainment. This game is for everybody, and the choice of the Latin makes it reach a new level of universality, just like the one of the world of the XV century.

M400 is a card-driven Risk-like game. A player's turns consists of four phases: 1) draw cards, 2) trade cards with other players, 3) move army, 4) expand. Players use cards to resolve combats and score points by occupying a region (temporary points) and defeating opponents (permanent points). The game is won by the player who first achieve a determined number of points, depending on the number of players.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Dice Chasers
description:
A press-your-luck dice game where you earn chips based upon the results of rolling four dice. Every time you roll two or more matching dice, you earn chips. You can choose to reroll as many times as you like to earn more chips but as soon as your roll shows no matches, you bust and lose the chips you earned that turn.

When you bust, roll a single die and note the number, then select one of the upright cups from the center of the table. Either keep the cup for yourself or give it to another player. Whoever takes the cup flips it upside down and either loses, gains, or steals chips equal to the number rolled. Play continues until all cups are flipped over (with a special rule for the last cup). The player with the most chips wins.

name: ゴリラ人狼 (Gorilla Werewolf)
description:
In ゴリラ人狼 (Gorilla Werewolf, which is pronounced "Gorilla Jinrou"), you take on the role of gorillas with poachers in their midst. Gameplay is much like normal Werewolf — except you can speak only in grunts. Luckily when gorillas die, they gain the ability to speak human words briefly, and dying gorillas can choose any two words to teach the remaining players.

Can you overcome the limitations of your vocabulary to find the traitor in your midst?
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Voting
publishers: ボドっていいとも！ (Bodo Is Good!)

name: Scalaparola
description:
Scalaparola is a collection of 10 games to play with words, for 2-6 players.
The box includes tiles and cards featuring letters of the alphabet.
The characteristic of this collection is that the words formed during play earn more value if they match a category choose at random before starting.
The games are:

CROSSWORDS
Is to form words on the board with the tiles, making them cross each other.

ANAGRAMS
The goal is to earn more points by transforming or composing the words on the board.

SCALAPAROLA
Words are made using the cards you receive at the beginning of the game. Player who gets rid of all their cards win.

MIXER
Extracted 18 cards, players must form words and intersections using all 18 letters.

LONGEST WORD
Players must form the longest word using the 18 cards drawn at the beginning of the game.

THE HIDDEN WORDS
From a grid of cards, players turn as many cards as the value of the roll of a dice. If they can form a word with these letters withdraw the cards, otherwise they turn and make them available to other players. The memory component in this game rewards players.

TOUR OF WORDS
Players are given a card and select a category. Who can form a word that starts with the received card receives points. Whoever reaches the target score early in the game wins.

WORDS OF INTRIGUE
Players must make up the largest number of words with 18 letters selected at the beginning of the game. Player who arrives first at the target score.

PASSWORD
A player secretly made up a word of at least 5 letters. So put 30 cards on the table and represent how many letters the word is formed that has made. The other players must turn round a card, the first player declare whether it is part of his word, the player who first manages to figure out what was the word formed early in the game win.

WORD FOR WORD IN
Select a category, players are dealt 7 cards. They must form a word, as long as possible, inherent to the category selected, and the letters received. Player who first reaches 50 points.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: De Slimste Mens Ter Wereld Junior
description:
Now you can play the Junior edition of The Smartest Person in the World!

The Junior edition of The Smartest Person in the World includes 5 rounds of questions specially devised for younger players aged 8 and upwards.
Get your opponent down to 0 seconds and take the crown of the youngest Smartest Person in the World!

The game can be played with the whole family in combination with the basic game.

-description from publisher
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Frog and Toad Adventure Game
description:
Frog and Toad are about to set off on a grand adventure through the woods! They need your help to navigate the paths, streams and leafy forest.

3 ways to play.

Helps develop visual, spatial, fine motor, critical thinking and social skills

name: 3 gewinnt!
description:
3 gewinnt! ("3 wins") is a children's game similar to Connect Four.

Players take turns dropping checkers into a seven-by-six grid (the "cheese"), with the intention to make a three-in-a-row. Each checker shows a mouse: either boy or girl, and either red, green or blue. A three-in-a-row consists of three boys, three girls, or three mice in the same color. Each player has a hand of two checkers, and chooses which one to use each turn.

When a player creates a three-in-a-row, he gains a piece of cheese. Initially, these have one hole. When the pieces of cheese with a single hole run out, pieces with two holes are awarded, and when those run out, pieces with three holes are awarded.

The game ends when all the cheese has been claimed, or when the grid has been filled completely. The player with the most holes in his pieces of cheese wins.

name: Toverschoenen
description:
"Toverschoenen" is a game in which max. 4 players use action cards (depicting different types of shoes) to travel roads. These roads will lead them around the board, allowing them to collect diamonds.

The first one to collect his 5 diamonds, wins the game.

Dutch rules can be found on: http://www.tactic.net/saannot/nlpdf/toverschoenen.pdf

name: Real Life
description:
Accumulate trauma and debt as you try to make it to old age in this dark parody board game. Start with an emotional flaw and an arbitrary amount of debt. Decide whether or not you believe in free will.

Players take turns rolling dice to move their way through the board. Spaces you land on require you to: pay rent, get into a traumatic situation, find a partner, have them break up with you, trigger a world event that hurts everyone in the game, so on and so forth.

Use jobs to help your fellow teammates along their way.
Take therapy at an absurd price to keep your growing trauma in check or your character commits suicide. But don't land on the black space, or else.

The game ends when all players are dead. If you make it to the end of the board and old age, congratulations! You win or something. You're still dead though.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation

name: Donut Disaster
description: Be the first player to get rid of all your donuts by placing them on the soft rod on top of the temperamental donut-making machine before it explodes and sends everybody's donuts flying. If it does so on your turn, try to catch as many donuts as you can so you don't get stuck with them.

name: Byte
description:
Byte employs either a standard 8x8 Checkers set with 24 checkers, or an international Draughts set with 40 checkers.
