During the game three stacks of eight checkers will form (five stacks of eight in the international version). Stacks can be made up of any combination of the two colors in any order. The player who wins the majority of the three stacks wins the game.

Two major mechanisms cause the players to cooperate in forming the three stacks of eight. One mechanism brings stacks nearer to other stacks and a second mechanism merges adjacent stacks together.

There is no jumping, capturing, killing or any of the usual mechanisms. Byte is a game of cooperation. Someone will always win though - draws and ties cannot occur in Byte.

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: Crazy Bluff
description:
From the Blue Orange Games website:

Bluffing has never been this Fun ! Bluffer, Bluster and Bluffie get ready for some extreme bluffing as they race to be the first to get rid of all cards in their hands. Taking turns, players can match the last card played, draw or... bluff as all cards are played face down ! But watch out ! Don´t get caught bluffing because Bluff Busters are always on the watch

name: Ming Mang
description:
Ming Mang is a traditional game of Tibetan origin played on a NxN board.

The setup has all cells on the edges are occupied. The left and upper side by one player, the right and bottom side by the other. All pieces move like the rook in Chess. A piece is captured when it is between two enemy pieces - irrespective of the number of empty cells between the pieces. Captured pieces are converted to the color of the captor. Thus, although very unknown in Tibet, Othello (Reversi) pieces would work well.

When played on a 8 x 8 - board each player would start with fourteen men on the board and 14 in reserve to replace captured enemy pieces.
publishers: (Public Domain), Geoludie, L. P. Septímio, Mitra, toytoytoy

name: Cards: Die Partie deines Lebens
description:
Cards: Die Partie deines Lebens is an unusual card game, one in which you have to master crazy tasks and tricky riddles. You play on your own, and the game can take weeks, months, or even years to complete. Each card provides a new challenge that works its way into the player's life. Only when you fulfill the condition on a card may you reveal the next one.

Cards: Die Partie deines Lebens contains fifty cards, and as soon as you have fulfilled the last card, you have completed the game.

name: Goal-A-Minute Soccer
description:
Goal-A-Minute Soccer uses 6 dice (12 total included in the set) to determine the outcome of a play. On each die there are different results (i.e. goal, pass, dribble, etc.).

The offensive player chooses one die from their red "strategy" dice (i.e. shot on goal, pass, dribble, kick deep) and places it in a cup (not supplied) with the 4 white "play" dice.

The defensive player also chooses one die from their green "strategy" dice (i.e. block, intercept, steal, tackle) and places it in the cup.

The dice are rolled and the common result of the dice is the result of the play. There are 40 total plays per half and once 80 plays are completed the match is over. There are additional offensive and defensive strategies the can affect the results of the plays as well as rules for breaking ties from the dice throws.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Unspoken Word
description:
From the Box:

"If you speak an Unspoken Word, "BAAA, BAAA," the Overseer sounds the sheep. A clue went astray!. . . In other words you goofed! Your opponents score the point. Move on to the next card and score as many points as possible before the sands of time run out. The Unspoken Word is an enjoyable way to explore the Bible with family and friends!"

The Unspoken Word is essentially Bible Taboo. You receive a card with "The Word" on it, along with five words you may not say to get the others on your team to guess "The Word". Say "The Word" or one of the five other words and the opposing team gets a point.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Tumblin Dice Timberrr
description:
Tumblin Dice Timberrr (that's how the name is really spelled!) is a tower building game like Jenga, but with 48 brightly coloured wooden rectangular bricks, and a large colored die. The wooden bricks are built into a tower with 16 layers of three.
Object: Roll the die to see what colour block to draw from the tower (with one hand) and restack on top. Skip a turn if you roll a "Pass" on the die.
Winner: The last player to stack a brick without the Tumblin Dice Towerrr falling wins the game.
Components: Includes 48 wooden bricks, a large die, and a Safe Stacker to make building the tower easier.

name: Hydro Battle!
description:
Here is an interesting variant on the Battleship concept. Each player has 2 boards side by side, one is on your left - this is where you place your ships secretly. On the right is where you make your guesses, but when you make your guess, you push a Laser Missile Launcher - if you get a hit, some light misting water squirts the other player. It also features sound effects to include explosions.

Like the classic Chinese checkers game board reconfigured as "Canadian checkers" for Canada's centennial in 1967, now there's Electronic Hydro Battle--an even more elaborate, tricked-out version of that other battleship-sinking game, which here shall remain nameless. Apparently it's no longer enough that an opponent calls out grid coordinates in an effort to find and sink the hidden fleet you've placed on your side of the board. With Electronic Hydro Battle, players guess the location of opponents' ships by inserting a wired "torpedo launcher" into the screen, switchboard-style. Missile sounds are heard; if you strike an opposing craft, you'll also hear a blast, followed by the spectacle of your victim getting sprayed with a squirt of water from the game's refillable tank! Whether this funky marriage of "Mighty Mo" and Gong Show represents a high-water mark of fun or a sign of low tide is up to you.

The object of Hydro Battle game is to be the first player to destroy all five of your opponent's ships. If the Launching Sound is followed by a Blast Sound that will also be followed with your opponent getting sprayed.

name: Gra Rycerska: Bitwa pod Grunwaldem
description:
Gra Rycerska: Bitwa pod Grunwaldem (Chivalry Game: Battle of Grunwald) is a simple family game designed to describe (in a very simplified way) one of the largest battles in Medieval Europe The Battle of Grunwald or 1st Battle of Tannenberg.

One of the players takes on the role of Władysław Jagiełło (king of alliance of Poland and the Grand Duchy of Lithuania) while the other one commands Teutonic Knights forces as Ulrich von Jungingen. Each of the player forces consist of several formation of different unit types such as foot men, knights and archers.

On his or her turn player spins a spinner that determines one of his or hers formation. Then the player chooses one of the units belonging to this formation and can move and/or attack with it. Each unit type has specific movement and attack rules. First player to eliminate set number of enemy units is declared the winner.

Game was designed so it could be used as an introduction to abstract strategy games and to war games.

UPDATE: At the end of production process the name of the game was shortened to Bitwa pod Grunwaldem.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Fighting, Medieval

name: Rento
description:
Rento is advanced business dice game.
In the game you roll "Wheel Of Fortune", trade lands, build houses, win auctions, roll 2 metal dices and one special dice and most importantly - have fun.
The goal of Rento game is to bankrupt the other players by taking rents and becoming the richest player.

You have to predict chances, calculate risk and make smart trades. However that is not so easy because the game has strategic game tweaks that are dynamically changing the game, so you have to be careful.

Good luck!
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Kung Fu Monkey
description:
Kung fu Monkey is a card game, of strategy and of fate. The objective: be the first one to become the Kung fu Monkey by accumulating a series of eight cards representing so many landings of learning of this combat sport. Warning, wild fights in sight !

Every player can exchange, fly and take back to other players cards necessary for his/her learning, while making a gesture of kung fu. Suspense, strategy and pleasure guaranted for the young and old people !

Include French & English rules.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Trading, Variable Phase Order

name: La Puta i la Ramoneta
description:
La Puta i la Ramoneta (in Catalan) is a card game of political fiction to undo the tie between Catalonia and Spain. Catalan independentist, Spanish unionist, Autonomists and other characters will pursue their goals and play the cards the best they can to add up points and subtract the adversary ones. Each character will be able to negotiate and play the roles of the Puta and Ramoneta, in other words, to deceive or to prevent deception.

The game is a satire to the actual system of politics in Catalonia. It wants to dedramatize the process of independence and rivalry between the two nations.

Each player takes a position in the political representation and tries to win by accumulating points of Culture, Economy and Laws to eventually carry out his political project. Whether it is Catalan independence, more autonomy or Spanish centralization.

name: Mondrio
description: There are 24 tiles with four sections in different sizes and colors. These are assembled to form a rectangle, so various smaller rectangles are built. Players are assigned a color before the game and have to try and complete as many rectangles in their color as possible, with larger ones counting more points. The player with most points wins.

name: Uno: The National Parks Edition
description:
America's #1 Card Game meets America's most beautiful national treasures. Includes 112 cards featuring everyone's favorite parks plus an exclusive parks card and rules.

Created in response to the new Ken Burns documentary The National Parks: America's Best Idea.

name: BGCon Fusão
description:
This was a free give away gift for those who went to the 1st BGcon in São Paulo, Brazil.

This game combines classic RPG characters from various RPG systems in a fast and furious game play.

Each round, players choose which characters they will play based on the cards they receive, each character was a weakness, an attack and a victory condition. Then each player reveals his attacks and then his character. It is possible to quit an attack after the character revelation, after that the attacks are resolved and victory conditions checked.

All characters that achieve their victory condition in that round give their player an experience level.

The winner is the first player to achieve the 5th level.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Ceilikan Jogos, Funbox Ludolocadora, Hidra Games, Ludus Luderia

name: Exposaurus Erweiterung
description:
This is a small expansion for Exposaurus.

It consists of a small ceramics dinosaur and a sheet of rules.
The first player to include all 6 types of fossils in their museum gets the dinosaur. At the end of the game, the dinosaur is worth 4 additional victory points.

name: Lego Nexo Knights Trading Card Game
description:
Trading Card Game based on the LEGO Nexo Knights franchise. Two players build decks from a card pool of character, action and vehicle cards. Each deck must contain at least 20 cards in the base game or 30 cards in the advanced game. The same card must not be included more than once per deck.

During the game, players alternately placing one character on a playing field containing 3x3 spaces (base game) or 4x4 spaces (advanced game). Character cards feature numerical values on each of the four card edges. After a character is placed next to at least one opponent's character, one or more duels are fought by comparing adjacent numerical values. The character with the higher value wins the duel, and the losing character is turned by 180°, indicating a change of control. Action and vehicle cards provide boosts to character stats or have other effects. The game ends when all spaces of the playing field are filled with a character, and the player who controls the majority of characters wins.

Game is sold in booster packs containing 5 cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components

name: Be a Broadway Star!
description: Roll-and-move board game for theater fans with cards that challenge players to sing, dance, or act out lines from famous Broadway shows. Similar to The Game of Life, but for the Broadway-bound. Players start out in acting school and work their way up to the top, buying pictures and resumes, earning an Equity card, getting an agent and publicist, going to auditions, getting cast in shows, and maybe even winning a Tony Award. Players are awarded Fan cards during the game, and whoever has the most fans at the end wins. Created by Broadway producer Ken Davenport ("Godspell," "Altar Boyz").
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Dotto
description:
From the box:
Ready, steady – Dotto!

Race against the timer and use the coloured cubes to form the patterns on the cards. Try to complete the pattern and pass the turn before the random timer goes off. Who’s got the fastest fingers and the coolest nerves – find out with Dotto and have cube loads of fun!

name: Sing It Back Music Quiz
description: Read out the lyrics from a well known song - your team mates must then guess the next line - singing is encouraged! Earn extra points by guessing the artist and song titles. This game includes 280 classic pop and rock hits from the 50s up to today's tunes.

name: BEERU and Sausages
description:
How many sausages can you win?
Let's try how lucky you are!

After rolling dice, check points you can get.
The player with the biggest number wins sausages from the player with the smallest number.

If you roll 4 the same number, you win 4 sausages from every players!!!

If someone runs out of sausages, the round ends immediately. The player with most sausages can get garlic. The winner is the player with 3 garlics.

name: Monopoly: The Here & Now New Zealand Edition
description:
(from the box)

What would monopoly be like if it were invented today...?
New Zealand has changed over the last few decades. This special aniversary edition celebrates 21 years of NZ's favourite game with a modern day equivalent that was voted by New Zealanders.

Choose from a range of new tokens including a mobile phone,jandals, sheep or even a jar of vegemite!

Rents have skyrocketed all over the country and you can build property in places like the Waitomo Caves, Cathedral Square or next to the Ohakune Carrot.

Play to win New Zealand - in millions of dollars, not just hundreds!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Hoffman-Singleton
description: A card game based on the Hoffman-Singleton graph, one of the most symmetrical objects in mathematics. Each card is connected to exactly 7 other cards by simple rules. Any two non-joined cards are connected by a unique card. The smallest cycles of connections are pentagons. With these connections, people must find sets of connected cards, much like Set. Whoever collects the most cards wins.

name: Freeze Up
description:
Players are given categories and letters to associate together. It sounds easy but this game has a ticking timer. Players must answer the combination and pass to the next player before the time is up and they're "frozen out". The last player left is the winner.

The game play is a word association party game combined with hot potato!

name: Bitwa na morzu
description:
Big naval battle is waged on the Caribbean Sea. Every captain wants to win and bring precious treasures to their port. To win, you have to use either your wits or great firepower. Which tactic will you choose?

At the beginning of the game, each player gets 6 cards representing ships and their abilities, and 6 tokens representing ship upgrades.
Every turn all players simultaneously choose 1 card and up to 2 tokens to play. Then the fastest and strongest ships sail safely to the harbour and other ships are sunk (they score no points). Game ends when all cards are played. Player with the most treasure chests in port wins the game.

name: Mio!
description: Mio! is an Uno variant that adds a ‘star’ card. Once a star is played, only other stars may be played until a matching color card is found.

name: RIFF: The Music Trivia DVD Game
description:
A smart DVD trivia game for music fans. Very creative ways of presenting the questions. Great to play with a bunch of friends. There's a game called Battle of the Bands which pits the two teams against each other head to head.

All the questions were new, nothing repeated unlike some other DVD games, and it was really easy to play.

name: Flying Kung-Fu Frogs
description: In the game Flying Kung-Fu Frogs, players try to launch their colored frogs onto the game base's spinning platforms to score points. Each platform is worth a different point value from 10 to 40 points. If you land on a gray base or get stuck on a branch, you score no points. If your frog lands on the table or anywhere besides the game base, pick it up and try again. To launch a frog, press down on its rear to fling it forward. As your finger slips off, the frog should jump toward the platforms. Once all frogs are somewhere on the game base, the game ends. Count up your points, and the player with the most points wins. This game is for two to four players. It comes with a Kung Fu Training Center game base, 20 frogs (five of each color), and a sticker sheet.

name: Lairs
description:
In Lairs, players play strange creatures that are excavating strongholds in the same mountain. Buried in this mountain are powerful artifacts and treasures, that grant their finders great power.

​In the first portion of the game, players build long winding Lairs towards the center of the mountain. All competing to to claim one of these prizes.

Once one player has taken the prize they become the Enemy of the other players. The remaining players become the Allies and must fight their way through each chamber of the Enemy’s lair, and duke it out in a climatic finale.
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: On the Buses
description:
"On the Buses" is a board game based on the hit 70's UK television situation comedy of the same name.

A game of fun and skill, the object being to "drive" your bus around the board and get three passengers back to the bus depot to win, but watch out for Blakey!
publishers: Denys Fisher Toys, Toltoys, West 11 Designs

name: Excursions
description:
Excursions is an action-packed Travel/Vacation game which combines the elements of fun, fantasy, social interaction, strategy and risk. Based on an exciting new concept, it is sophisticated enough to challenge the adult imagination, yet simple enough to provide a fun-filled family evening.

The game features beautiful pictures of exotic world destinations and is played on a quality board of unique design.

name: Jogo de Veja
description:
Trivia game based on a brazilian magazine.

The game has 6000 questions (500 for children) about news published on past editions of the magazine Veja in six categories: economy and businness, general knowledge, world, arts and entertainment, sports, Brazil.

The gameplay is very simple: each player receives a pawn and a booklet of questions. Each turn the current player must throw two six-sided dice: a numerical one (10, 20, 30) and a colored one. The player on the left must open the booklet and ask a question of a certain type (10, true or false; 20, multiple choice; 30, direct question) about the category indicated by the colored dice. For instance, if the result of the dice are 20 and green, the player on the left must ask a multiple choice question about Brazil. If the current players gives the correct answer he must move his pawn 2 green spaces ahead. If the answer is incorrect the pawn is moved one space back. In the last part of the board the players must answer questions about all subjects and move their pawns only one space ahead for each correct answer.

The game ends when the one of the players reachs the final space on the board.

name: Paris Metro
description: User review: Each player begins the game with three random Destination Cards and a pawn on Start. In turn, a player will roll the dice and move one's own pawn the total or difference of the roll of the two dice. The player must land on a destination by exact count to get credit for it. In moving, a player can change lines only by landing by exact count on a Transfer Station. A player my send another player's pawn back to start by landing on it by exact count. Ending movement on a star earns a player an Assist Card, which may offer a reward or penalty. Rolling doubles earns that player an extra turn. Reach all three destinations and returning to Start earns the player three more Destination Cards. The player who has scored the most points when the Destination deck is depleted is the winner.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Curious George: Super Helper Game
description:
The game of ball bouncing, dice tumbling, coin flipping fun!

You can be a neighborhood Super Helper just like Curious George! Volunteer at the firehouse, pitch in at the restaurant, or help tidy up at home. Flip over three cards to see who needs help. Chose where you want to help—at home, the firehouse, or the restaurant—then drop the ball, coin, or cube into the tower and try to make a match!

The bouncy ball, flippy coin, and dice cube tumble through the roof of the tower and magically come out on different sides. The player who helps the most wins the game.

Super Helper game prize stickers add to the fun!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: J'ai mon voyage
description:
A fun and simple family board game. Each player gets two secret missions to save animals. These missions correspond to two specific tiles on the board. The goals are achieved by wisely using the set of actions available.

In his turn, a player plays one of his Action card and does the action described on the card. These actions consist of moving one or more tiles on the board, either up (Card+), down (cards-) or by switching two tiles (Switch cards).

A round can end either when a tile reaches the highest level or when all players have played all their Action cards.

Each player then reveals his two Mission cards and scores the number of points corresponding to the tiles drawn on each of his Mission cards

name: Sozoikum
description: Players represent Stone Age people looking for partners and wanting to build their own homes. Players must bluff and negotiate help to get enough stones to build their home.

name: Mechanisms
description:
Mechanisms is a game of mechanisms.

To play, deal each player 3 Mechanism Cards and place the included hodgepodge of components within reach of everyone on a table. The first clue-giver is the person who most recently posted a comment on BoardGameGeek.

Starting with the first clue-giver, then clockwise, each clue-giver has 30 seconds to silently use the components on the table (as well as fellow players) as props to get someone to guess 2 of their Mechanism Cards. Clue-givers are encouraged to pair the mechanisms in a set of seemingly seamless actions as if they were playing a game with all mechanisms present. The guesser(s) gets the correctly guessed Mechanism Card as a point and the clue-giver gets the third Mechanism Card as a point if 2 mechanisms are guessed.

After everyone has had a turn, shuffle all non-point Mechanism cards and deal 2 new Mechanism cards to each player, continuing the game.

The player who collects 5 Mechanisms first this way, wins! As a finale, feel free to pitch a fun, creative, and unique game idea using all of your mechanism point cards!

—description from the designer

name: Bridgerton: The High Society Game
description:
It's the first social of the season, the most important time in a young aristocrat's life.

Bridgerton: The High Society Game brings to life the social scene from the hit Netflix series of the same name. In the game, you attend balls, dance with eligible prospects, and vie with others for the affections of suitors based on their prestige, desirability, and love – all with the ultimate goal of an auspicious marriage proposal.

You have only eight balls to secure your future, but don't be hasty as every prospect has hidden traits that affect their desirability and prestige. If you are determined, you can find the best match and marry someone you truly love. Of course it certainly won't hurt your chances if one of your competitors is caught in a bit of scandal...

name: Café International Junior
description:
(from publisher's website) Welcome to the international café that's just for kids. Here you can meet girls and boys from the USA, Greenland, Italy or Bermuda and drink a soda with them. Slip into the role of a waiter, and seat as many international guests as possible at the café tables. For doing this you receive points. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins and becomes the headwaiter.

Contents: 105 point chips, 100 guest cards, 24 table tiles, rulebook

Ages 6 and up.

name: Judge 'n' Jury
description: 100 court cases are summarized on audio tapes. 2-4 players or teams listen to a case summary, then try to predict the real-life verdict.

name: Super Spy
description:
In Super Spy the players are given the task of sneaking through the headquarters of a spy agency and retrieving secret documents. They have to do this without setting off the hidden alarms.

At the start of the game, each player draws an assignment card which tells them the documents they must find. For example, one card may tell them to get the "Radio Messages from Project seafarer" and the "Micro-film of laser beam patterns". They travel through the spy headquarters visiting the Map Room, Radio Room, Microfilm Room and File Room and must carry their documents to the Vault.

What makes the game difficult is that there are hidden "alarms" throughout the headquarters. Whenever a player lands on an alarmed space the bell rings. The player must then draw an alarm card and go to the "safe spot" in the room on the card. As players move around the headquarters they must remember where the alarms are.

Whenever a player lands on the name location of one of the rooms they search the documents in that room and retrieve the one they are looking for. The first player to get all of their documents to the vault is the winner.

name: Goosebumps: A Night in Terror Tower Game
description: Object is to find a magical stones card and be first to successfully roll the magical stones die from the Terror Tower into the Spell Chamber. This casts the spell that returns Sue and Eddie to the 20th century.

name: Stadtgespräch
description:
Here is a description of the game the publisher:

This game needs people who know people! How many women would rather be a man? How many singles go to a party with a condom in their pocket? Spicy questions ensure heated debate and exciting times! Whoever knows the likes, habits and traits of their fellow human beings the best scores the most points. That the discussion should turn to the likes and dislikes of the players themselves, that's hard to avoid...

name: ESPN Jeopardy!
description:
User review: One player acts a gamemaster for two to four other players. In most editions there are five categories. Each catagory has five dollar amounts. Behind each dollar amount is a statement of trivia having to do with the category. When a player thinks he or she knows the correect response to a statement, that person signals and responds in the form of a question. A player is rewarded with the amount associated with the statement if correct, and penalized the corresponding amount if incorrect.

When the board is cleared, the process is repeated for "Double Jeopardy" with five new categories and double the stakes.

One statement in the first round and two statements in the second round are designated as "Daily Double." Only the person who chose the statement may bet any or all of his or her winnings on giving the correct response. Unlike most other editions, the Daily Doubles have been chosen by the publisher.

One of the highest valued statements in a category has been saved for the last round, "Final Jeopardy." In this phase, the players secretly bet any or all of their winnings and record their responses.

The player with the most amount of money at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: God of Luck
description:
Players are the candidates to be the new "God of Luck". By rolling dices, players try to complete various tasks to raise his Fu-Chi, which means good fortune. Players also can employ many Chinese traditional immortals to help himself. The player who earns the most Fu-Chi will become the new "God of Luck".

User Summary:

On each turn, player rolls a specific number of dices, if the result of some dices match the requirement of a hand card, which also calls Fu-Chi card, then the player could play that card from hand into his playing area. Player may discard some Fu-Chi cards from his area to invite an immortal to join him. Pick that immortal character card into his playing area. All of immortals have some special abilities to affect the result of rolling dices, such as seem 2 as 4, or just simply increase the volume of dice pool.

When someone owns 8 immortals, or 2 stacks of Fu-Chi cards have been drawn, the game will enter the final turn after the current turn. In the final turn, player has to do one's best to match the requirement of their hand cards, he cannot invite any immortals in the final turn, but can use the abilities of those invited immortals in the previous turns in his area. After the final turn, any Fu-Chi cards and immortal character cards in one's area would be scored as their illustration. The player with most scores (Fu-Chi) will become the new "God of Luck".

name: Jurassic Parts: Tantrumsaurus Rex Promo Card
description:
Promo card originally released during the Tantrum House Season 7 Kickstarter campaign.

A player may use this card after a Split occurs, but before any concealed tiles are flipped over and revealed. For the selections of these tiles, the concealed tiles must remain concealed making choosing those tiles a little bit of a gamble.

The player who plays the card does not have to be an active participant in the Split for which it will be applied.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Set Collection

name: Kooky Cats
description:
Kooky Cats is a cat collecting card game featuring over 50 quirky and close-knit cats brought to life by Jean Jullien in his second collaboration with us ? It’s a bit like Happy Families meets Go Fish, but where all the fish have been eaten by cats, and instead of being happy, the families are all a bit bonkers.

The game features twelve groups, or Cat-egories as we like to call them, each consisting of four cats with the same distinguishing features. To win, you want to collect the most complete Cat-egories before the game ends. However with Special Cards and Kooky Tokens thrown in the mix, things might not always go to plan.

As well as twelve Cat-egories, the game features seven stupendous Special Cards, twelve Kooky Tokens, and the game changing, face-shifting The Cat That Got The Cream Card. The Special Cards consist of Catnap, Back'cat You!, Cat's Got My Tongue, the Catfish, and of course the Dodgy Dog – each with the ability to turn the game upside down!

name: Vegas
description:
Players take turns rolling dice and advancing around the board. When they land on an unowned casino they may purchase it. Once they own a casino they may purchase 'tax stamps' for it. Once a casino has at least one tax stamp it is open for gaming.

When a player lands on an owned property with a tax stamp the player and the owner must play the house game with each other. There are four house games; slots, roulette, craps and blackjack. The amount they must wager is determined by the number of tax stamps on the casino. The loser must pay the winner. Remember, of course, the house always has the advantage (just like in the real Vegas). The winner is the last player remaining after all of the others have gone bankrupt.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Barbarossa
description:
The Emperor is dead. The throne is empty. The courts are out of order and power is in the hands of whoever holds the sword. Everybody asks: Who will be the new Emperor? Four kings claim the throne. Who will have it?

Barbarossa (translated to Redbeard) was the nickname of Emperor Friedrich I, who lived from 1123 to 1190. He was crowned as king in 1152, and Emperor in Rome in 1155.

The players take roles of medieval kings, trying to get rich by conquering cities and castles. Possession of cities and castles gives the right to claim taxes. Taxes are used to buy knights, squires and archers to protect the kings interests.

Before the game starts, the players agree on a playing time. Whoever is the richest (cash plus value of knights, squires and archers) by that time wins the game. In addition you can win by being the only player with a live king, or by having a certain numbers of cities and castles (2 players = 16, 3 players = 14, 4 players = 12).

There are rules for movement, which depends on the unit, and the terrain moving through. Combat, which depends on the units, and the defenders position. Tax collection, including the ability to bleed the peasants, and their possible revolt. Pillaging of cloisters, buying now units, and drawing a chance card at the end of each year.

Marketed as a family game, but rather complicated for that.

name: Hooked
description:
A fishing game for 2-3 players Ages 4 and up. Switch it on and use the rods to catch the fish.

Game 1:
Each player selects a coloured rod. The first player to catch all their own fish is the winner.

Game 2:
Stick the numbered score labels on the underside of the fish. Catch fish of any colour. When all fish have been caught, the player with the highest score is the winner.

name: Python-opoly
description:
From the publisher:

Officially licensed Monty Python game of buying and selling property in King Arthur's Britain while hunting for the Holy Grail.

You, too, can quest for the Holy Grail, buy hovels, build castles, enjoy a spanking, and even make it to Scene 24! Charge excessive groats for hanging out at your Castle of Aaarrrggghhh in this great game based on Monty Python and the Holy Grail.
categories: Economic, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Fairytale Spinner Game
description:
Spin for a Hero, or something to ride,
A Rival, a Treasure (to find or to hide)

Choose a cave, or a castle with fortified towers
A friend and an object with magical powers

The object of the game is:
Get all of the elements first and you’ll get the glory,
Of winning (the hero, a ride, a rival and a treasure)

Then the winner has the privilege of using them all in a story!

Players spin to select the elements for their fairy tale. When they have collected a scene, a hero, a magical helper, a rival, a magical object, transportation, and a treasure, they tell the tale that these elements evoke. Game extensions encourage compassion in suggesting using a misunderstood rival as a hero on occasion, and longer tales for two players.

name: Wisconsinopoly
description:
From the manufacturer:

On Wisconsin!
Bucky Badger is for sale for a mere $70! And Camp Randall Stadium for $250!
Buy, sell and trade the University of Wisconsin in this game designed for alumni, students and fans of Wisconsin. You could soon be marching in the UW Marching Band…or hanging out at the Kollege Klub.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Treasure Planet Adventure Game
description:
In Treasure Planet Adventure Game, players must navigate the universe in their own RLS Legacy ships, avoiding supernovas, overcoming pirates, and even the evil Scroop in an attempt to find Treasure Planet and its vast fortune. However, once on the planet, it’s a race against time to find the secret portal and an escape before the planet explodes.

The game includes a Gameboard, 72 Game Cards, 5 Dice, 21 Treasure Planet Tiles, 4 cardboard Legacy Ship Pawns, 1 Trap Timer Pawn, 5 Plastic Pawn Stands, a label sheet, and instructions.
categories: Children's Game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Star Poker
description:
Object
Create poker hands - pairs, straights, flushes, etc. - to score points. After all the tiles have been played, the player with the highest score wins!

Contents
54 poker tiles including 2 jokers
Scoring chips: Blue = 5 points, Red = 10 points, White = 25 points
7 racks
Disk
Label
Score card

Set up
Players draw a tile from the "pool;" the one with the highest tile goes first, then play moves in a clockwise direction. Return those tiles to the pool and mix them.

Playing
On a turn, place a tile on one of the seven sides of the disk. Then take a tile from the pool so that you always have five tiles in your hand. Play continues to the second player who can place a tile after the tile just played, or on any of the other sides of the disk. Then he takes a tile from the pool. Players continue taking their turns until someone scores.

Scoring
Players score by making various poker hands: 1 Pair, 3 of a Kind, Full House, Straight, etc. (see POKER HANDS). The hands are formed by combining the last or "open" tiles in any of the paths leading from the disk.

Blocking
When you do not have a tile that you can lay down to score points, you may want to block the other players from scoring.

5 Tile Plays
Any time a player scores by creating a 5 of a Kind, Full House, Straight, Flush, Straight Flush, Royal Flush after receiving his points for that round, ALL of those tiles that were used to score are turned face down so that they cannot be used again. Players can play tiles from their hands off of the turned down tiles, as if starting from the beginning (tiles placed before the turned-down tiles cannot be used to form hands).

Note: Do not turn the tiles over upon creating 2 pairs and 4 of a Kind. This allows for the creation of a Full House and 5 of a Kind.

Jokers
A joker can be used as a "Wild Card" to represent a ny tile. (Color does not matter - a red joker can represent a spade or club, etc.) The player that places a joker determines what tile it represents; the joker will remain as that chosen tile for the rest of the game. If another player holds the tile that the joker represents, he can play that tile as well.

Points Chart
Some of the scoring in Star Poker differs from the scoring in the standard poker game. This is due to the probabilities of creating different hands.

1 Pair = 5 pts.
2 Pairs = 10 pts.
3 of a Kind = 30 pts.
4 of a Kind = 75 pts.
5 of a Kind = 100 pts.
Full House = 40 pts.
Straight = 50 pts.
Flush = 50 pts.
Straight Flush = 100 pts.
Royal Flush = 100 pts.
Blue Chips = 5 pts.
Red Chips = 10 pts.
White Chips = 25 pts.

Ending and Winning the Game
Players continue until there are no more tiles to draw from and all tiles in their hands have been placed. In a four player game, once a player draws the tile that leaves two tiles left, the game ends after that player takes his turn. In a five player game, play until there are four tiles left and in a seven player game, play until five tiles are left. The player with the most points wins.

name: Quest for the Princess
description:
from the website http://www.elveneargames.nl

Five of the most noble knights in the country, all want to marry the princess. There is one problem, though. The princess has been kidnapped by a dangerous dragon Fortunately, something good comes out of this situation too. This is the ultimate chance for the courageous warriors to make a good impression on the princess. That is why they go to battle to save the princess. Because only one of them can marry the lady, the knights do everything whithin their power to make life miserable for one another. This whole spectacle is watched by a very critical royal family. The knights really work their heads off to win the sympathy of the family. They will most certainly put in a good word for them with the princess.

Goal of the game:
The players are knights. The player who makes the biggest impression on the princess, can marry her and wins the game. Players collect points by fighting other knights (fighting), impressing family members of the princess with their spectacular horse riding shows (showing), riding faster that their opponents (trotting), winning a tournament and ofcourse by saving the princess.

The player characters in the game:
Sir Thanks-a-lot, Sir Chop-a-lot, Sir Robin Rudes prince of Dudes, Sir William Wimpy and the Dirty Duke of Dastardshire

This game is released at Essen 2007.

name: Osiris
description: 12 priests follow 12 gods in ancient Egypt. Players distribute support between the gods and then the priests are moved and conflict and a power struggle to reach the pinnacle of a pyramid. The game involves magnetic stickers being placed on the god and priest counters, so that a priest connects to its particular god in secret initially. One of the gods is hidden at the top of the pyramid. When it is revealed, the player who has the most supporters in that god's temple will win. Nice graphics.

name: High Risk!
description:
HIGH RISK ! captures all the feel of international struggle - political, economic, military - and translates it into an exciting, realistic and very playable simulation that puts you at the helm of State! Assuming the role of both national leader and representative of a world ideology, you strive with other players for global domination, compete for scarce resources, make (or break!) treaties, mobilize for war or become an industrial giant! Countless opportunities - and threats - confront you and challenge your skill as a diplomat, economist and general.

HIGH RISK ! is for those who aren't afraid to play for big stakes! Whether through negotiation, bluff, treachery or just sheer force, you've got to beat the odds and the competition in order to rise to the position of WORLD LEADER!

Basic version includes a 24x36 4 color map, over 500 plastic counters, 3 types of playing cards and various other player aids.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Batameuh
description:
A card game for children (4+ years).

From the publisher: "Moooooo! Baaaaaa! A beggar-my-neighbour card game where players make the cries of farm or wild animals. Easy, fun.... and completely crazy!"

The game contains a deck with 40 cards with different animals in two categories: wild animals and pets.

All players must show in the same time the top card from his own deck. If a player sees an animal of the same category of his card should imitate the sound of his animal. The faster player wins the cards in the table from his category.

Wins the player who collects all the cards.

name: Crime
description:
A crime has been committed! Miss Molly Q has been found dead! It's all over the newspapers and you as a detective has to solve the crime.

"New York - Wednesday. She had everything: fame, fortune and men, and that fascinating smile that had made her a legendary screen personality during her lifetime. Who does not remember movies such as 'Angel, don't knock', 'Exotic Escapades' and 'That's all, but not everything', the film a famous critic said he wanted to see on his deathbed. And now: Molly is dead. On paper that's only a four-letter word. But in reality it spells an emptiness the depth of which cannot be fathomed."

The players roll the die and move around the board with the shared playing piece to search for the suspects first. As soon as a player has at least one complete suspect consisting of four cards each, they can start collecting and adding clues to the shared dossier that will implicate their suspect. They can also switch out clues so the dossier will point exclusively to their suspect and not to a suspect of one of the other players.

The player who first has all the clues in the shared file that implicate one of their suspects, wins the game!
mechanics: Passed Action Token, Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Slapagories
description:
A spin-off of Scattergories. Players sit around a small round board with the words "I know" on it. There are two decks of round cards in special holders, one that has a single letter on each card, and one that has a category. The decks are placed FACE UP.

The first player to say "I know", and slap the board, gets to take either the letter or the category card, which thus IMMEDIATELY changes the letter or the category - and starts the next "turn". Conflicts are resolved via majority vote.

When either deck runs out, the game is over. Whomever has the most cards wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: The Man from U.N.C.L.E. Card Game
description:
A very simple card game. The game consists of a deck of 42 cards, seven cards each of numbers 1 through 6.

Each player is dealt a hand of three cards and plays one to a central pile, then refills his hand. If the total of all the cards in the pile is a multiple of 10, the player scores one point for each multiple (e.g. 10 scores one point, 30 scores three). Points are tallied by chips, 50 of which are provided. When all the chips are drawn, the game is over and the player with the most points wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tiltin' Milton
description:
DON'T TILT MILTON WHILE HE'S SNOOZIN' ...
... I'LL BE WINNIN', YOU"LL BE LOSIN'

so goes the rant on the box of this typical late sixties plastic offering from Ideal.

The object is to place as many objects on Milton as possible without causing him to topple out of his hammock. Objects come in pairs - 10 large objects (e.g. bird nest, hat) and 10 smaller 'accessory' objects which pair off with the relevant larger object (eggs, feather etc). The first player places one large object on Milton & their turn ends. The next person to play places the relevant accessory object and then also another large object on Milton & their turn ends. Play continues in this manner until Milton topples out of his hammock; the player who causes this event to occur is eliminated from the game. All objects are removed from Milton, who is replaced in his hammock & play commences again until only one player, the winner, remains.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Real-time
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination

name: Kookie Cookie
description:
A blue plastic cookie jar is placed in the center of the table. A deck of 40 round cards are dealt into one face-down stack per player. There cards show a chocolate chip cookie on the back and one of several Sesame Street characters on the front. Each player also gets two cardboard cookie chips with a unique border color.

Players count aloud and then simultaneously flip over the topmost card of their stack and then quickly scan all of the newly flipped cards for any that have matching characters on them. If there are no pairs, then everyone counts and flips another card. If a pair is spotted, the players must try to toss their cookie chips into the jar. Whoever does so first, as determined by the bottommost chip, claims all of the flipped cards and adds them to the bottom of their stack. The player that eventually claims all of the cookie cards wins.

name: Waffen SS/The Fanatics
description:
Vaipa Express' Up Front expansion depicting the Waffen SS. This expansion contains a set of Personality Cards for the Waffen SS and rules for their use.

Expands:

Up Front


Expanded by:

The Polish Never Quit!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Who Framed Roger Rabbit?
description:
Based on the movie, this game's object is to discover your opponents' identities, find the Will and return to your home space.

On your move, you roll two dice (black and white); you move as indicated by the white die (1-6), adding the black die (1-3) if you choose to. Movement around the board can be accelerated by the Trolley or by Benny the taxi cab (each uses his own special die to move, which boils down to a 1 in 6 chance of stopping --this mechanic pervades the game as you'll see).

Identities can be guessed by looking at cards set up on the board; each shows half a character's picture, in a player colour. Once you've seen both halves of a given colour, you're allowed to guess that character as that player's identity. Each correct guess allows a search for the Will, checking the Confidential cards that lie on the Dip Cannon circle. Once a player has grabbed the Will, the others go after him and forget about identity-guessing.

You can steal the Will by Dip Cannonning the Will-holder, by sending a Weasel after him or by landing on him by exact count. To use th Dip Cannon, you use your (one and only) Dip Cannon card or one of the Judge Doom cards you've previously found, then roll the Dip Cannon die. Each "Dip" rolled turns the cannon one space towards your target; the "cancel dip" die face stops the process altogether. If you successfully Dip him, he drops the Will and is sent back to any home space. Weasels work in similar fashion, the Weasel token starting beside your token and moving towards its quarry with each successful weasel die throw. Used Weasel cards may be recovered by landing on a special space in the Dip Cannon circle.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battleship: Outer Space
description:
Battleship: Outer Space is your game of Battleship using three different layers. The game follows basically the same rules as normal Battleship however instead of calling individual spots you will call one of the three sectors (layers) and then a row or column. If any ships are in that row or column you hit all the spots.

—user summary

name: The Last Straw
description: Load the camel with straw, but don't be the one to add the straw that breaks the camel's back! Two piece camel on wheels, held together with a rubber band, will eventually collapse under the weight of the wooden sticks.

name: Tongbrekers
description: Tongbrekers (a.k.a. "Tongue Twisters") is a Dutch game in which players draw cards (from a deck of 51 cards), then attempt to correctly utter the tongue twister on that card three times in a row at an ever faster speed. If they succeed, they get to keep the card, which can be used to complete sets of cards for extra points. In addition to the 48 regular cards — which come in eight colors, with two cards in each of three degrees of difficulty — the game includes three special cards that allow a player to attempt to steal a card from someone else. The game ends once all cards have been drawn, and the player with the most points wins.

name: Crescendo
description:
[From the game box description]
On the 60 lovely squares, 2, 3, or 4 players move their pawns to build a tower as quickly as possible. But do pay attention because an unprotected tower risks being dispersed to all four points of the compass by an unscrupulous opposite player! The last one to finish his tower is eliminated and the survivors get themselves ready to start a new game with more pawns. Crescendo offers a lot of possible game boards to develop vigilance and tactical sense in common with psychology and taking risks.

name: The Lost Pueblo of Doctor Green
description:
A free game from the Cheapass Games double-secret website.

From the website:

"Someone has stolen the Pueblo! Can you guess who it is? The Lost Pueblo of Doctor Green is a simple card-passing game with a strong bluffing element."

name: Catch the Hare
description: The earliest recorded hunt game in Europe, Catch the Hare was mentioned in Libro de los Juegos (Book of Games) commissioned by Alfonso X in 1283. It is played on an alquerque board, with one side taking the part of a hare and the other taking 12 hunters. The hunters must trap the hare so that it cannot move; the hare must kill enough hunters to make their task impossible.

name: Shuffle Dice
description: Shuffle Dice plays like shuffleboard, with players trying to push objects to the end of the game board — without going over! — to land on the highest scoring regions. In this game, however, players roll dice instead of pushing discs, and the numbers rolled on the dice can multiply your score.

name: Trivial Pursuit: X
description: Trivial Pursuit X was created for adults and features edgy trivia. The game comes with an inked "X" stamp for players to stamp on opponents' foreheads when they answer a question incorrectly. When a player has 5 "X" stamps on their head, they lose.

name: Finis ton Assiette
description:
It's dinner time! On today's menu: raviolis, strawberry tarts, chocolate eclairs… Yum yum! Each player has 3 plates and must finish them as fast as possible, by using the “Fork” cards of the right color. And thanks to the magic fork, some lucky players will finish even more quickly. But beware! One can play nasty tricks to another by switching plates or by adding extra plates to an opponent…

A game by Pierre-Nicolas Lapointe illustrated by Arnaud Quéré 2 to 4 players from 6 & up. Strong points: A cute and simple game you can sink your teeth into! A variant for younger players (without the special cards) is available.

In the box: a deck of 46 cards (14 “Plate”, 27 “Fork”, 2 “Extra Plate”, 3 “Plate Switch”, 2 rule summaries)

name: Monopoly: Bass Fishing
description:
Bassopoly

A Monopoly version with a bass-fishing theme, featuring 8 tokens (fishing hat, bass fish, bass fishing boat, lure, trophy, reel, trolling motor, tackle box)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Dr. Karl's Fact or Fishy
description:
Dr. Karl Kruszelnicki is an author and popular science commentator in Australia.

From the box:
Here's your chance to join Dr. Karl and wow the opposition with how much you know in the fast-paced scientific trivia game that almost anyone can play. Packed with real-life experiments, multiple choice questions and speed rounds there's only one question that really counts, is it Fact or Fishy?

Re-implements:

Fact or Crap

name: Sunny and Stormy Day!
description:
Sunny and Stormy Day is a cooperative game that encourages discussion of feelings through the metaphor of "sunny" and "stormy" experiences. The game has 3 separate activities, a variant on the classic tile matching game, and a draw bag with tokens that ask for the players to discuss a part of their day, and a book that tells the story illustrated on the tiles.

The book tells the story of a day in the life Max the Hedgehog. During the day he experiences "sunny" and "stormy" events. The draw bag contains 3 tokens, a sun, a cloud, and a rainbow. They ask the participants to share part of their day that was sunny, stormy, or to share something they are looking forward to. The book and the tokens support the game in teaching about emotions but are not a part of the game.

Twenty sunny and stormy scenes from the book are paired together to create 10 matching sets (for example having fun splashing in puddles and being cold and scared in the rain). The goal of the game is to find all the pairs. The rules state three variants of increasing challenge. Variant 1 is a cooperative matching game in which tiles are placed face up. Variant 2 is a cooperative matching game in which tiles are placed face down. In variant 3, Max's day is almost over and he is remembering the sunny and stormy parts of the day. He must find all pairs before it is night and time for bed. This variant adds 4 nighttime tiles to the cooperative matching game that when revealed require the players to add a puzzle piece to a night puzzle. To win the players must find all matches before the puzzle is completed (6 puzzle pieces). Night tiles are not removed from the board when revealed. There are 4 tiles and 6 puzzle pieces so if players remember where the tiles are they will win.

name: Die LeuchtturmArchitekten
description:
A card driven placement game for Lighthouse Architects. Discs in black, white and red are moved to construct stacks matching the color bars off the lighthouses on the cards.

3rd Place 1993 Hippodice Spieleautorenwettbewerb.

name: NAQ
description: NAQ, pronounced "Knack", is a party game where all players become trivia buffs because the trivia is based on the knowledge of the players in the game. A fun, fast-paced party game where you can mix people with different levels of education and cultures with everyone having an equal chance of winning. More information available at http://www.naqgames.com/index2.html

name: Lange Jan
description:
Roll the diamant die (a transparent d8) to determine the goal-number (= die roll + 4). Then any player is dealt this number of cards from the shuffled deck, that contains the various body parts: feet, legs, torsos, shoulders, and heads in lots of length and combinations.

Your goal is to build a "Langer Lulatsch" (Beanpole) with the right length (the goal-number as number of cards) to get the most points in the round (goal-number +3). Everyone who finishes a correct Lulatsch within the same trun, gets the number of cards of his figure.

The problem is to decide when to add which cards to your figure, as you have only one action per round deciding wether to draw a new card while discarding an old one (either from the drawpile or one of the discardpiles) or "build" your figure. And for example not all feet go with all legs as some have trousers and other have not. Once built you can't change the features and you have to build from bottom to top.

There is another round until the first player gets 50 points.

name: Shaun das Schaf: Kuchen-Chaos
description:
Shaun das Schaf - Kuchen Chaos is an easy kids game, with a variation of a dice tower - a cake machine - as core mechanic.

In every turn, a player throw in muffin-tokens (one pink and one blue with different shapes) into the tower and than moves one of the 4 platforms, to open or close holes. So after some turns, muffin-tokens will fall out of this cake machine. The player during whose turn the muffin drops out of the tower gets it. The first to collect 8 muffins wins the game
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dirty Minds: The Ultimate Board Game for Adults
description:
The Ultimate Edition of Dirty Minds contains four new categories of relatively innocent material that only YOUR mind can make naughty.

Dirty Clues is a category featuring clean answers to naughty clues.
Dirty Deeds are naughty stories about innocent acts.
Dirty Lies means the truth is just too naughty.
Dirty Secrets is a category in which you decide to tell, or not tell.

The seemingly filthy clues point toward totally clean answers.

Added to them is Dirty Deeds, which sound like naughty little stories, but they're about completely innocent things. In other words, if you have a dirty mind, you'll lose.

Dirty Lies contains simple facts of interest to adults... along with two ways to lie about them; Dirty Secrets are tasty little tidbits from your own very personal experiences. You alone must choose to either tell the truth or lie about them. With both Secrets & Lies, other players score by correctly guessing your intentions.

Each game comes with 63 Dirty Clue/Dirty Deeds cards, 63 Dirty Secrets/Dirty Lies cards, 24 dirty bets cards, 1 dirty board game, 8 dirty pawns, 2 dice and instructions.
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia

name: Rokada
description:
Rokada is an abstract strategy game which reminds chess a bit. There are actually 3 different games depending on the size of the board (55, 77 and 99, 5 times 5 squares, 7 times 7 squares and 9 times 9 squares). Additionally it can be played as a parlor game (when the dice are used) or as a skill game without dice. The game is either for 2 players or for 4 players in which case two teams are formed.

First players choose which type of game is played and then they set game pieces on the board depending on the size of the board used. There are round and square pieces with different heights. In the parlor game the dice is used to tell whether the player may move round or square piece or if the player misses his/her turn. The object of the game is to reach the other players end of board or to eat the other player's every piece.

In the skill game the dice is not used.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Puppy Pals Bingo
description:
Welcome to Puppy Pals Bingo, where you match colors, patterns and shapes to find homes for friendly pups!

This game is one in the latest wave of games by Cranium for preschoolers. These games intend to bring parents and their little ones together by participating in a fun and interactive setting.
The three games in the trilogy (Puppy Pals Bingo, Polar Bear A-B-C and Duck Duck 1-2-3) are a fun way for your preschooler to learn about matching shapes and patterns, simple counting and spelling.

In Puppy Pals Bingo, you must match a color, pattern or shape to one on your board and find a new home for all your little puppy dogs. The first player to line up three puppies in a row wins.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Number, Word Game

name: Der Maulwurf schaut genau
description:
Do you see the little mole?
While playing on the meadow or at the sea, making a picknick or working in the garden? But only if you look carefully at the pictures you'll recognize all the details to be able to identify the correct tiles for your board.

Ravensburger children's game. Among 32 different tiles those have to be found which are matching the details on your cardboard.

The rule booklet offers four different variants of playing the games to provide challenges for children from 3 to 6.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Till Eulenspiegel
description:
Till Eulenspiegel is a memory game for 2-5 players Ages 5 and up. The theme of the game is based on one of the legendary pranks of Till Eulenspiegel, a jester well-known in German oral tradition.

The game board shows a rope with 15 spaces for placing wooden tokens showing 5 different types of shoes.
The same shoe types are also depicted on the 16 cards that come with the game. Players try to cross the rope by finding the show cards corresponding to the shoe tokens.

To set the game up, the 15 shoe tokens are shuffled and placed face down on the 15 spaces on the game board. Each player receives a number of cards which they place face down in a row in front of them. Each turn, all players turn their leftmost card face up and then pass them on to their left neighbor who places them face down at the right end of their row. The active player then tries to find the shoe card that shows the same shoe as the current shoe token. The further the player is from the start of the rope, the more cards he/she has to find. The first player to reach the end of the rope is the winner.

name: Bible Trivia
description:
Answer a question correctly on your turn, then roll the die and move along the path. When you land on a Judgment space, draw a card and follow its directions. First player to reach Finish wins.

There are separate question cards for Children and Adults. Each card's questions all relate to one theme rather than coming from different categories.

Not to be confused with the earlier game Bible Trivia also published by Cadaco.
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Caramba
description:
Caramba is a racing game for two players where each has a set of runners that are trying to make it to the finish and a set of hunters that attempt to stop the opponent's runners.

The game consists of a board, 3 runner pieces per player, 4 hunter pieces per player, a card identifying each of the 6 runners, two dice and a set of rules.

After all the pieces are in place, the game commences with the hidden selection of each player's "favourite" runner. This is done by placing the card representing this runner face-down but in an open location. Runners are distinguished by the colours of their sombreros. Rolling the dice, the players move either their runners or hunters around the multiple paths on the board. Taking care of special board spaces and certain limitations on movement, each player will be moving runners towards the end goal while trying to capture an opponent's runners with his/her hunters. When a hunter captures a runner, the player that was attacked reveals the hidden runner card. If the favourite was captured, the game ends. If not, a new favourite is secretly selected and the hunter must return to the start.

The main goal is either to stop the opponent's favourite runner or to make it to the end with your own favourite.

name: Break the Bank
description:
Break the Bank is a trivia game where players answer questions for money.

There are five categories of questions:

Story Land
Geography
Sports]
Show Biz/Music
History


A player spins for a question category and if the question is answered correctly, gains money, then advances towards the "Gateway to the Bank". Once the "Gateway" has been reached, a special Bank Breaker question is asked, and if answered correctly, the player gains one of twelve $100,000 bonus coins and returns to start again at the beginning of the track.

Penalties are applied for answering a question wrong. These range from losing money to moving backwards on the track. Play continues until all of the bonus coins are awarded.

The player with the most money wins.

An interesting note: each question card contains two questions, one marked 'grown-up' and one marked 'youngster'. These can be used to balance the game if younger players are involved or handicap players if the 'yougster' questions are considered too easy.

A nice trivia game, but limited to only 30 questions per category. And because the game was produced in the 50s, the questions (which were current at the time) are dated.

name: Basti Bär hilft seinen Freunden
description:
Basti Bär hilft seinen Freunden is a simple memory game for the very young. In the middle of the table, sixteen tiles are placed face down, eight of male animals and eight of the corresponding female animals. Surrounding these tiles, eight young animal tiles are placed face up.

On a turn, the player rolls the die, moves the bear meeple along the "track" of animal children, then tries to turn over the one "male" tile and one "female" tile that match the young animal tile on which the bear meeple stands. If she manages to do this, she receives a flower token as a victory point. If she does not make a match, then she turns the adult animal cards face down, and it is the next players turn. The first player to collect three flowers wins.

name: Confetti
description:
Designer Sergey Machin has created a game in a completely new genre – the active party game – with the name coming from a traditional Russian new year's entertainment for kids and adults alike: Confetti.

The point of the game is simple. We toss half the deck on the table, sit down, then while the hourglass runs try to create different card combinations that bring us victory points (VPs).

One side of a Confetti card shows three differently sized and colored circles; by collecting cards with a small, medium and large circle of the same color, the player receives 1 VP. The other side has different shapes, but the idea is the same; a small, medium and large shape of the same color is worth 1 VP.

What makes the game tough is that you can take cards from the table only by using the fingers on your right hand and sliding them across the table. You'll also need to use your left hand to hang on to cards already taken or else other players can steal them from you. Finally, any cards you collect that aren't used in a combination with others cost you 1 VP at the end of the game. (Bear in mind that any shape on a card can be used in only one combo!)

Confetti lasts three rounds. During the first and second rounds you can collect and keep six cards in your play area; during the third round nine cards. In between rounds, you can keep some previously collected cards, specifically a number of cards equal to the number of VPs you scored in the previous round.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: 4 Thrones
description:
4 Thrones is a solitaire card game based on a traditional deck of 52 cards. There are four piles (thrones/kingdoms) on which to place all the cards remaining in the deck, one by one. The basic rule of thumb is to place higher cards on lower cards.

The face cards are unique, though, in that they will accept lower cards of certain suits. The Jack accepts a lower card of any suit, the Queen accepts lower cards of hearts or diamonds (love or money, respectively), and the King accepts lower cards that are spades (a soldier's sword).

The game is based on the idea that the four thrones are kingdoms, and you are placing people in power to maintain balance. If you can get through all the cards in the deck successfully, you win.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hungry Hungry Hippos Launchers
description:
The Hungry Hungry Hippos Launchers game is a flippin' fast feeding frenzy as players launch plastic watermelons directly into their hippo's mouth. The motorized game unit has the hippos opening and closing their mouths while players continue to fling the melons, hoping to land the most shots. It's fun for kids to press and release the melons from the launcher, and watch each swallowed watermelon roll back down into the scorecard ramp. Like the classic Hungry Hungry Hippos game, this electronic game is fun for boys and girls ages 4 and up. Play it on rainy days, play dates, and Family Game Night.

ELECTRONIC FLIPPIN' FRENZY GAME: Introducing a twist on classic Hungry Hungry Hippos gameplay. In this electronic version of the board game, players race to launch plastic melons into their hippo's mouth
5 IN FOR THE WIN: Who likes watermelon? These hippos do! Each player gets 5 plastic watermelons. Ready, set, launch! The player whose hippo is the first to eat 5 melons wins
PRESS, SLIDE, RELEASE: Press down on the launching tab, slide your finger off the back, and it'll release the melon into the air. Try to get it to land right into your hippo's moving mouth
CHOMP CHOMP: The hippos' mouths open and close, adding an exciting challenge as kids try to get the watermelons into the hippos' mouths. It features Beginner and Expert modes of play
FUN FAMILY GAME: Remember playing the classic Hungry Hungry Hippos board game as a kid? This Hungry Hungry Hippos Launchers motorized game is great for kids' play dates, and rainy day entertainment

—description from the publisher

name: Regicide
description:
From the publisher's web page:

Regicide uses a standard card deck, tokens to mark each player's territories, the board and the rules. This is a game that you can play in 10-15 minutes and turn around to play again. You can enjoy tournament play by tracking points won at the end of the game. Abilities are granted to certain suits and allow you to perform tasks, win points for your trophy pile and control territories for points.

The game board is set with eight territories worth 1-3 points. Players battle each other for control of these territories and their points. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Uses a standard 52 card deck, the Regicide board, and tokens to mark territories of each player.

Expandable by adding more boards and decks to allow more than 8 players!

name: Howzat!
description: "Howzat!" is a must have board game for all lovers of the sport of cricket! Roll the dice and make your shot. Try to out-do your opponent in this game of wits and strategy. Will you make a century or be out for a duck? If it's not "Howzat!" then it just isn't cricket!

name: Cha•lén•gah
description:
Cha•lén•gah is a unique board game designed to challenge your determination, creativity and insight. You'll race to the center of the sun, conquering challenges from the four elements - earth, air, fire, and water.

Cha•lén•gah is not a trivia game where you either know or don't know the answers. It is a game where you develop or create solutions, often limited only by conventional thinking or your own imagination. Playing the game will change the way you think! A piece of valuable advice to succeed at this game is...if it doesn't say you can't, you can!

Challenges come in a variety of shapes, sizes, and levels of difficulty. Be prepared to brainstorm anything from secret codes, analogies, or missing components, to puzzles, wacky wordles, and creative problems. Some challenges require creative, off-the-wall thinking. Some are logical, requiring a right answer. Others have several possible solutions. As you begin to associate each color/element with a particular type of challenge you may wish to avoid certain elements.

name: Flinke Fliegen
description:
The game board depicts a cherry pie. On the pie there are flies which are attached to strings held by the players. Each flie is different; wearing different items of clothing. The active player holds a fly swatter and rolls a die (d12). The players whose flies show an item of clothing that was rolled have to pull that fly's string instantly while the active player is trying to swat the fly. A player who was too slow or pulled the wrong string has to give the active player a pie chip. The player with most chips at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: A Lot of Gems
description:
In 宝石がいっぱい！(Romanization: Houseki ga Ippai!) players take turns flipping over cards in search of valuable gemstones.

On each player’s turn, he or she turns over one face down card in the field. Depending on the revealed card, the player may be able to collect a gemstone, gold, or part of a fossil. They may also be able to steal a card from one of their opponents if they find the thief card.

After all eleven gemstones have been collected, the game ends. The player with the highest total of valuable cards wins.
publishers: Arclight Games, ライフタイムゲームズ (Life Time Games)

name: Periodyx
description:
Periodyx is a card game based on the Periodic Table of Elements. The game can be played by 2-10 players. Each player is dealt 5 cards, the winner of the game is either: The first player to hold 10 cards, or if one player loses all their cards the player who, at that point, holds the most cards. Cards are gained or lost among players or from a central pile. A Game indicator card with the titles of 11 games is passed around the players the holder of this card being the "lead player" in each of the 11 rounds thus making each round of play random, and different. The prime purpose of the game is to become familiar with the elements, players with more familiarity will stand a higher chance of winning.

The rounds listed on the Periodyx Game Indicator Card are:

1) Atomic Power!
The lead player asks ONE OTHER player to choose a card in their hand and to read out loud that element’s name (do not show the card). The lead player then chooses a card from their own hand, and reads out loud the element’s name. Both cards are now compared. The player whose card has the HIGHER Atomic Number wins, takes both cards, and adds them to the cards in their hand. This ends this lead player’s turn and play moves on to the next player.

2) A-2-Z!
The new lead player picks any letter of the alphabet and then asks ONE player of their choice if they have an element beginning with the letter they have named. If the asked player DOES have an element that begins with the letter the lead player asked for, they must give the lead player the card (or cards if they have more than one that begins with the asked for letter). This ends the lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.
If the asked player DOES NOT have an element that begins with the letter, the lead player asked for, the ASKED player takes the top card from the “draw pile” and adds it to the cards in their hand.
This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

3) Hot Stuff!
The new lead player asks ONE OTHER player to choose a card in their hand and to read out loud that element’s name (do not show the card). The lead player then chooses a card from their own hand, and reads out loud the element’s name. Both cards are now compared. The player whose card has the HIGHER boiling point wins, takes both cards, and adds them to the cards in their hand.
This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

4) Hi-Lo!
The new lead player takes any one card from their hand, and places it face up in front of them. From this card the lead player chooses ANY ONE of the stats from in the Stat Section (except the date stat) and predicts whether the next card turned over from the “draw pile” will have a higher or a lower number in the same stat. Once the prediction is made, the top card from the “draw pile” is turned over and the two cards are compared.
If the lead player has predicted correctly, they take both cards, and adds them to the cards in their hand. If the lead player has predicted incorrectly, both cards are given to the player on their left.
This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

5) Neutron Countdown!
The lead player asks ONE OTHER player to choose a card in their hand, and to read out loud the name of the element (do not show the card). The lead player then chooses a card from their own hand, and reads out loud that element’s name. Both cards are now compared. The player whose card has the HIGHER number of neutrons wins, takes both cards, and adds them to the cards in their hand.
This ends this player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

6) Add-it!
The lead player takes the top card from the “draw pile,” and adds it to the cards in their hand. This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

7) Big Freeze!
The new lead player asks ONE OTHER player to choose a card in their hand, and to read out loud that element’s name (do not show the card). The lead player then chooses a card from their own hand, and reads out loud the element’s name. Both cards are now compared. The player whose card has the LOWER melting point wins, takes both cards, and adds them to the cards in their hand. This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

8) Element of Surprise!
