The lead player asks ONE OTHER player to hold out their cards fanned-out, facedown. The lead player then takes ANY ONE card from the asked player, and adds it to the cards in their hand. This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

SPECIAL NOTE: The lead player cannot take the LAST card from any player.


9) Early Bird!
The lead player takes ANY card from their hand, and places it face up in front of them. They then predict whether the next card turned over from the “draw pile” will have an earlier or later date of discovery than their card. Once the prediction is made, the top card from the “draw pile” is turned over, and compared. If the lead player has predicted correctly, they take both cards and add them to the cards in their hand. If the lead player has predicted incorrectly, both cards are given to the player on their left. This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

10) Match!
The lead player takes ANY card from their hand, and places it face up in front of them. They then ask ONE OTHER player to do the same.
Now ALL of the players play at the same time and try to be the first player to spot how the two cards match, or are the same in any way. Are they both metals? Both solids? Do both element names begin with the letter ‘P’, any similarity can be a correct match. The first player to spot the match keeps both the matched cards. This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

11) Natural/Synthetic/Atomic
The lead player takes ANY card from their hand, and places it facedown in front of them. They then ask ONE OTHER player to do the same. Both cards are turned over, face up at the same time. Check the Natural/Synthetic/Atomic symbols at the bottom of the cards:
• Natural beats synthetic/atomic,
• Natural/atomic beats natural
• Synthetic/atomic beats natural/atomic.
The winner takes both cards, and adds them to the cards in their hand. If it is a tie, both players keep their own cards. This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

The Mendeleev Card
If on a player’s turn (before taking their turn), they can place a card next to the Mendeleev Card so that the colored bars match (see example) they may play that card on the table and draw 2 cards from the “draw pile.” If there are 2 or more cards in play on the table (this begins to form the periodic table). Any cards that match any of the cards can be played in this manner, drawing two fresh cards for each card played.
Winning!

Two ways to end the game:

1) The first player to collect TEN cards in their hand immediately stops and wins the game!

2) The first player to lose ALL the cards in their hand stops the game. The player who, when the game is stopped, has the highest number of cards in their hand is declared the winner. In the case of a tie, the player who has the card with the highest Atomic Number wins.
Ties or N/A!
If during any round of play the stats are tied, the round is void, this ends the lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player, and the next game on the Periodyx Game Indicator Card.

If there is a N/A (not applicable) on a card, this round is void. Players have the option to keep a card with a N/A or to exchange it by returning it to the bottom of the draw pile and taking the top card from the draw pile.

There is an expansion book available with rules for 10 further games.

name: Poker Bingo
description:
From the box:

Poker Bingo consists of an exciting variety of five games using Bingo boards, chips and a deck of special size playing cards, which are all included. Each game combines the play of Bingo with a poker style.

Each player takes a Poker Bingo board and chips for markers. The dealer shuffles the cards and places them face down in front of him. He turns the top card and calls it out. The players that have the called card space on their board, cover that space with a chip. Play continues in this manner.

name: Eurovision Song Contest
description:
Join the Eurovision Song Contest with your own entry and try to score as many points as possible in the Eurovision Song Contest board game! Test your knowledge, prepare your own performance, and participate in the most popular song contest! Will you get those 12 points first?

—description from the publisher

name: Die Goldene Eins
description: Based on a German lottery game. Seems to be the very best TV-based game ever published to me. Each player has to move his figure around the circle by hitting one of three movement arrows, tries to collect numbers and move those number cards the right way in his card holder... Try to be the first who is able to get the chosen number to get money.

name: Caracalla
description:
In ancient Roman times Caracalla was a beautiful public bath, the cultural an social center of these times.

Players try to meet their family members (and other family members) in one of the 6 baths by placing their members in the Caracalla and moving them around. Points are awarded for holding meetings where only certain persons score (e.g. only the female, only the grandparents etc.). Every player (family) that participates in the meeting scores a certain amount of points for each scoring member.

Winner is the player who reaches the temple first (which is in fact the end of the scoring track).

Quite interesting game about forming different types of groups and so influencing not only the personal score, but also the score of the other players.

name: Real Vegas
description: Bring home the excitement of a Las Vegas casino into a board game. Players work their way around the board as a group and play all the great casino games, including Poker, Blackjack, Roulette and Craps. The winner is the player with the most money when crossing the finish line. The journey around the board is alive with activity and has its own brand of Vegas-style pitfalls and inspirations. “Real Vegas” is a new concept that combines all the extremely popular elements of casino play into one outstanding game. Great fun for when friends or family get together for theme nights.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dicecapades! Kids Version
description:
This is a party game with simplified mechanics from the original version, DICEcapades. This version comes with far fewer dice than the original version (13 vs. 133). Players navigate a board while competing in several activities, including trivia questions, pictionary-style drawing, word and number play, and physical challenges.

Contents: 13 jumbo dice, 20 Actionland cards, 20 Thinkingtown cards, 20 Triviaville cards, writing pad, pencil, 4 character pawns, sand timer, instructions. Ages 6 and up.

name: Smoleńsk 1941
description:
This game presents operation of German 2nd and 3rd Panzer Gruppe in July 1941, which conducted to fall of Smolensk.

The game uses rules of the "WB95" (Great Battles 1939-1945) system designed for dealing with large battles of World War II. Counters represent regiments (Germans) or divisions (Russians), one hex represents about 2500m, one turn represents one day.

name: Labirynt Śmierci
description:
Labirynt Śmierci (Labyrinth of Death) is a cooperative game in which players explore big and very unusual maze - this is not a typical underground, every single location may contain large areas, a big pack of monsters or even entire castle. You can meet the essence of both very bad and very good. Often, instead of fighting, you can make a deal and sometimes to gain allies...

Each player controls a group of one to three characters. These are the heroes and even gods or beasts like dragons, known from world of RPG game Kryształy Czasu (The crystals of time).
Each character is represented by two or three profession cards with different stats and skills (one of them is choosed during every encounter) and five to seven cards with spells and special powers. This are one use only with some chance to take it back.

At the beginning of the game, players choose the type of expedition and how many encounters they want to play. Single encounter involves drawing a single location (there are 250 of them), after which the players choose which profession will have their characters in this challenge. Then they find out what is happening and who they face. If there is a fight, players must collect with their parameters, spells and abilities enough Power points and Trap points to reach danger lever in this location. If they do it they acquire treasures, if they don't they receive wounds.
After all the encounters is checked whether players were able to meet the objectives related to the expedition they choose.

name: Ti non es de aquí?
description:
Ti non es de aquí? is a board game in traditional board format, cards with questions and cards, in which it is tried to test the knowledge that the participants have about Galiza, answering questions about different aspects of the nation, divided into 5 blocks or thematic areas:

Language, literature, biographies, literary awards, Días das Letras, toponymia...
Prehistory, suevians, priscilian, middle age, the irmandiños, politics...
Monuments, heritage, painting, sculpture, architecture, museums, ethnography...
Music, cinema, television, radio, awards, sports, festivals...
Geography, celebrations, fishing, agriculture, industry, gastronomy, fauna, flora...

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME
First of all, finish the route of the board, a route on the Galizan map, answering as many questions as possible.

It is designed for people with an average cultural knowledge about Galiza. Children from 14 years of age will be able to play, although students from the secondary school will be ideal.

—description from the publisher

name: The Famous Robin Hood Card Game
description:
Try to be the first player who gets out and earn one golden coin plus a bonus by collecting "the Poor" and the "Gold" cards and avoiding the Sheriff on Nottingham.
You get 7 cards at the beginning of each round. Starting card is " The poor" now the next player can also play "the Poor" or a "Gold" card. After Gold its the SHERIFF after that an OUTLAW card and finally ROBIN HOOD.
If you don´t have a suitable card you have to take the discard pile plus 2 Cards.
Beautifully illustrated card game
publishers: Heritage Games, Inc., Intellectual Pursuits Limited

name: Flouk
description:
Everyone is informed of the terrible cataclysm which endangers this little planet at the far end of our galaxy. We have to help the different races that inhabit it, as they have no choice that to seek refuge on new planets. Today, we learned that Earth will welcome 5 different extraterrestrial tribes: the Bloups, the Paroks, the Faars, the Mutas and the Napils. The issue is that no-one is able to predict how these 5 species will co-habit together...

The game is played in several turns, each made of 2 phases:
- New Flouks
- Entrance in the Village

Each player takes 4 cards, keeps 2 of them and give the 2 others to his neighbors. Everyone then choose one of the cards in his hand and play it simultaneously. The cards are resolved in the following order: Decrees, Flouks, Chief Flouks then Actions.

Decrees have an effect only on their owner: it increases the amount of a type of Flouks depending on a some conditions. The action of a decree lasts all game long and we can have only 1 decree per village.

The Flouks are only used to populate the village. The Chiefs Flouks can enter a village only if a Flouk of the same specy is already there. The Chief has a power which apply when he enters the village.

The actions all have different effects that apply only when they are played.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Science Fiction

name: Crime Master
description:
Description from the publisher:

A bank heist in Berlin-Tegel, a painting theft at the Stuttgart state gallery, a corpse in the inner harbor in Hamburg — these cases and 22 others from 25 cities in Germany, Austria and Switzerland are really demanding. The mysterious crimes in Crime Master can be solved completely only by the cleverest investigators.

name: KQJ
description:
KQJ is a point trick*taking card game for up to 6 players.

If you like trick-taking games like Belote or Hearts and want to play with 6 players, this game is for you!

The rules are very close to "Belote", except that there are 4 new cards (Hero) in addition to the classical King, Queen and Jack (KQJ).

The game is played by team, 3 vs 3 or 2 vs 2 vs 2. You can choose to play with or without auctions, and choose your preferred victory conditions (500 / 1000 / 2000 points): as you can see, this game gives you a lot of flexibility to enjoy the best trick*taking games you'd like to have with your friends!



Gameplay and GoalKQJ is a broken down into several Rounds each containing multiple Tricks.


A Trick is a group of cards made of one card from each player, it is won by the one who plays the highest card (Trump > Normal & High value > Low Value).
A Round consists of 8 Tricks and up to the exhaustion of the dealt cards.
The "Master" card of a trick is the highest card of the requested series or the highest Trump card if any.
Each card of the trick has a value: added to the others, it allows to determine the winner of the Round.


The team that scores the most points win the Round.



Deal PhaseWhen launching the game, players place around the table randomly and teams are formed. The players of the same team are "Partners".

Each player is dealt 5 cards and can see them in his/her hand. Then another card (The Return) is revealed in the middle of the table. Starting in the clockwise seat from the dealer, each player has a choice to take The Return card or pass to the next player. If everyone passes 2 times, the round is closed.

The player who chose to take The Return is called The Sender. The Sender's team are the attackers (Contractant), the other team is designated as defenders (Defendant).

During the first selection round, the Return's suit dictates the Trump suit for the round. During the second selection round, The Sender picks between the Trump suit, no Trump, or all Trumps.

Then each player receives 3 cards, except the Sender who only receives 2 cards (The Return counts as the 3rd card).

At the end of the Deal, each player has 8 cards in his/her hand.



Play PhaseThe Opener starts the 1rst Trick and puts at the center of the table a card from his/her hand face up. Then, when his/her turn comes, each player must play one card face up.
The one who starts may play any card from his/her hand, the suit of this card is the "requested" suit.
The other players follow the rules below:

When you have the requested suit
You must play a card of the suit and if the Trump is requested, if possible, you must play a Trump card that beats all previous ones.

When you don't have the requested suit and one of your partners is "Master"
You can play any card of your choice,
Or, in order to become "Master", you can Trump (play a Trump card) or Over*trump if someone has already played a Trump card.

When you don't have the required series and the opposing team is "Master"
If you can become "Master" you must Trump or Over*trump,
If you can't become "Master", you can play any card of your choice.



3 principles to determine the "Master" card:

The Trump prevails against normal suits.
Among the suits of the same rank, the requested suit wins.
In the same suit, the card of higher rank wins.


Normal suits
Rank
A 10 H K Q J 9 8 7 6 5 4
Value
12 pts 10 pts 7 pts 5 pts 4 pts 3 pts 2 pts 1 pt 0 pt 0 pt 0 pt 0 pt
The Trump
Rank
9 8 7 A 10 H K Q J 6 5 4
Value
27 pts 22 pts 14 pts 12 pts 10 pts 7 pts 5 pts 4 pts 3 pts 0 pt 0 pt 0 pt
The sum of the points is (3 x 44 pts) + 104 pts = 236 pts.
When a Trick is finished, the one who played the "Master" card wins, puts the trick with hidden face in front of him/her and begins the next trick.
When the players have no cards left, it is the end of the round.

A Bonus is an event, announced or not, which corresponds to a number of points that a team will add to its tricks points: The Bonuses help to fulfill the Contract.

The Ten additional: 10 pts which are always awarded to the team that wins the last trick.
The Capot: 154 pts awarded to a team which wins all the tricks.
The KQ: 20 pts for the team of the player who has announced "KQ" during the round. The bonus is confirmed if:
A player had the Trump cards King (K) and Queen (Q) in his/her hand,
These cards have been played in this order: the King then the Queen,
This player has said "K" playing the King and "KQ" playing the Queen.

The KQJ: 50 pts for the team of the player who has announced "KQJ" during the round. The bonus is validated if:
A player had the 3 Trump cards King (K), Queen (Q) and Jack (J) in his/her hand,
These cards have been played in this order: the King then the Queen then the Jack,
This player has said "K" playing the King, "KQ" playing the Queen and finally "KQJ" playing the Jack.



KQ provides no point when there is a KQJ.

When the last trick is picked up, the values of the cards in the tricks of each team are counted.
Then bonuses are added to the scores of the teams who have won some. At least, one of the teams wins the Ten additional.
The team with the highest points at that time, fulfills the contract and wins the round!

Only the team that fulfills the contract scores its points rounded to the nearest ten:

The totals which end between 1 and 4 are rounded to the under nearest ten (154 becomes 150).
The totals which end between 5 and 9 are rounded to the upper nearest ten (155 becomes 160).


Finally, scores are added to previous scores.

In the next round, Opener (left of the Dealer) becomes the new Dealer.

In general, a game of KQJ is played in 1000 pts.
Once a team reaches or exceeds 1000 pts at the end of a round, the game is over: this team wins!

name: BallCube
description:
Who has the best strategy to get their marbles out of the BallCube? Who has worked out how the marbles will fall? In the end, all that counts is to block and open the slots with the pusher in order to get your marbles out as quickly as possible while hindering the movement of your opponent's marbles.

BallCube is a mind game for 2-4 people (teams), that encourages spatial thought, tactics and strategy.

Game contents: 1 gamebox (consisting of 8 elements), 27 marbles (8x black, 8x red, 2x white, 5x blue, 4x yellow), 2 sets of perforated pusher (each set with 12 pusher, whereby the number and positioning of the holes in each pusher are arranged differently.)

name: The Cities Game
description:
The Cities Game
Urban Tension & Negotiation.
A psychology today game.

You make secret deals. Apply economic muscle. Buy votes. Break promises. Explore the psychology of power and politics. Develop your skills as a persuader, an agitator, and a negotiator. But above all, you get the mental sharpening of dealing in the complexities of city strife.

Set your own rules. This game has no dice, no complicated instructions, no restrictions. Like it or not, you must form coalitions with other players. Or risk riots, unnecessary police action and unpredictable change.

You play the role of Government or Agitator or Business or Slum Dweller.

Discuss and negotiate issues such as riots, teacher strikes and business boycotts. Your vote could sweep you into either "The Future City" or back into the chaos where you started.

Explore the sources of urban tension, corruption and the undercurrents of city politics. The Cities Game -- designed with a purpose. To simulate the realities of city life. Your life.
publishers: Communications/Research/Machines/Inc., Dynamic Games / Dynamic Design Industries

name: The Pink Panther
description:
The object of the game is to be the first Inspector (the players are all Clouseaus) to catch the Pink Panther four times, thus putting him in the pokey and out of circulation.

The Pink Panther starts in the inner track and rolls two dice; the players start on the outer track and roll one die. Note that the Pink Panther moves on each player's turn. Whenever the Pink Panther lands on a "Trapped?" space, a die against die check is made, re-rolling ties; if red is higher than white, the Pink Panther escapes. Otherwise the player gets a Pink Panther card.

The players can enter the inner track, triggering "Trapped?" checks as before. The risk, however, is that by landing on an "Escapes?" space, the player may lose a Pink Panther card (this isn't as bad as it sounds, since the space gives a card as often as it takes one). If both the Pink Panther and the player land on an "Escapes?"/"Trapped?" space simultaneously, this is considered an automatic Escape/Capture.

On an "Escapes?" space, if you have two or more Pink Panther cards, you may go for the "Big Chance". This is a die check as above, the stakes being all of your Pink Panther cards against instant victory.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Disney GuessWords Game
description:
Similar to Password, but all Disney-related clues, and uses an electronic gizmo to display the word to the clue giver and also for timing.

Played in 2 teams. Clue giver for team one places a disc in the gizmo, reads the one or two word answer, gives a one word clue, and starts the timer by pushing a mouse ear on the gizmo. Team two has until the lights go out on the timer to yell answers. If they don't get it, the gizmo is passed to the other team, whose clue giver may give one new word as a clue. Gizmo goes back and forth until someone gets it.

Disks have A side with easy words ("Bambi" is pretty easy to get if you give a clue "deer") and B side with harder words (the hardest one we found was "twitterpated").

Fun little game for a family and/or group of Disney fans.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Ruhe in Frieden
description: Every player has got 5 relatives that are on the brink of dying. The trouble is that there are only 5 graves to bury them in and they all want to be buried in the same cemetery. So you have to speed up your relatives destiny by bribing the doctor to give them placebo medicine while trying to help the doctor keep other players relatives alive.

name: Vegas
description: Vegas is a card game directed by a six-sided roller. When the roller stops spinning it leaves one side facing up with a "Key Letter" showing. Several "Pots" can be won during the game for certain lettered cards played and for special scoring values. The ultimate goal is to win the Big Pot and to have the most chip value at the end of the game.

name: Zig-Zag Zoom
description: Each player takes their turn rolling their colored balls, one at a time. Players attempt to make their ball zigzag around scoring holes in an attempt to have it drop in the hole farthest to the end. Scoring holes range in point value as follows: 1, 2, 3, 5, and 10. A gutter around the sides is worth no points for those who roll their balls with too much speed. It takes skill and practice, or a lot of luck to score 10 points in one roll. Player with the most points after 5 rounds is the winner.

name: More S'mores
description:
The object of More S'Mores is to score points by building as many S'mores as possible, using cards that represent graham crackers, toasted marshmallows and chocolate bars. However, there are also burnt marshmallows and chocolate-eating ant cards which deduct points from your score.

Contents:

20 graham cracker cards
10 toasted marshmallow cards
10 chocolate bar cards
5 burnt marshmallow cards
5 chocolate-eating ant cards
Rules on game box

The game starts with the removal of 10 of the graham cracker cards, which serve as the "cracker pile". The remainder of cards are shuffled and dealt out to the players, and placed face down in front of each player. Cards are played in order as play rotates around the table, until one of the players plays another graham cracker card, completing the S'More. A new S'More is started when a graham cracker card is played from the cracker pile; play resumes until another S'More is completed. The process is repeated until the cracker pile is empty, and 10 S'Mores have been built.

Points are awarded for graham cracker cards (+1 point), toasted marshmallow cards (+3 points) and chocolate bar cards (+3 points). Points are deducted for burnt marshmallow cards (-5 points) and chocolate-eating ant cards (-5 points). The player with the highest point total wins.
publishers: IDEAlogists LLC, Madd Capp Games, MJ Moran Company

name: Once Upon a Castle
description: From the publisher: Race to construct your own castle! Once upon a time there lived a Princess and a Knight who both wanted to rule their kingdom. But only one ruler was allowed, so they decided to have a race. Whoever can build their castle first may claim victory! But watch out, the mischievous Ogre wants to spoil their plans. Who will escape his antics and become ruler of the land?
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Fantasy, Memory
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Fisher Price, Mattel, Inc., Playchest Games

name: Chariot Dice
description:
Race around the track, balancing speed and control, in this quick, free, print and play game for 2-3 players.

Each chariot consists of two dice, representing the speed and health of the chariot. Every turn players must decide between speeding up, slowing down, or attacking. The faster you go, the greater you risk uncontrolled movement. Players must navigate the track to avoid running up against the walls, crashing into other players or running over debris from previous races. The goal is to be the first to make it to the finish line, but in some races this will simply mean being able to survive to the end.

name: Rat-Man: Il gioco senza nome
description:
Rat-Man - Il gioco senza nome is a collectible card game based on the comic/cartoon character Rat-Man by Leo Ortolani.

The game reflects the ambience of crazyness of the characters and the enviroment of the comic/cartoon.

Each player chooses his own main character (Rat-Man, Brakko, the Chameleon or the Clown), builds up a gag(action)-deck and a equipment-deck. The players now pick-up a card from the mission-deck.
The characters moving in the `unnamed city` (a square-map) have to accomplish the mission assigned or kill all the others characters.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Glide: Tabletop Shuffleboard
description:
From the company website:

"Introducing Glide the fold-up tabletop shuffleboard game that's sure to be a hit with young and old alike!

Take aim and carefully push the handmade GLIDE stones across the supersonically slippery board to land in the target. With a 4 foot long board, only the most skilled will have the aim to knock an opponent out!"

The game is similar in gameplay to actual shuffleboard and also to Sorry! Sliders board game. Each player shoots his stones down a 4' board, attempting to stop them inside of the bullseye. Players are awarded 25-100 points based on where their stones end up by the end of each round.

name: Μιλάτε ελληνικά;
description:
A Modern Greek word game.

Info from the publisher's website:

You are given the definition of a word, its first letter and what kind of word it is. Find which word it is and beat your opponents while at the same time you are expanding your vocabulary.

Info from the publisher's website in Greek:
Έχεις τον ορισμό μιας λέξης, το αρχικό της και τι μέρος του λόγου είναι. Βρες την, κέρδισε τους αντιπάλους σου, πλούτισε το λεξιλόγιό σου.

Components (info from back of the box):
- Cards with 1800 Greek words
- Cards with 1200 foreign words
- 1 dice
- 6 player pieces
- 1 board
- 1 sheet or rules

name: Accionista
description:
Game of financial operations
Accionista mains shareholder in Spanish
Board similar to Monopoly, but include option as Tax Heaven Bonds, Takeover Bid.

The game consists of two to four players and a referee Exchange. Each player has a card of one color and 28 bars of the same color of your tab. Players are placed in the outlet box and go out one by one. Every time you come to a square that represented an action and has no slug, such action the referee should make the Exchange compulsorily the Parquet and all players will bid for it, the more money that will stay with her . The more shares you have the same group may be charged when an opponent gets there.

In the game look not only the number of shares of the same group but it must also look at what makes the index Roulette, which will be on the game board represented by - x - y - z -.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Disney Edition Kartensatz
description:
1 box with 1500 additional questions.

There are 6 categories:
Cartoons & Movies
Donald & Mickey
Disney facts
Disney Trivia
Disney Environment
Walt Disney's World

Unlike Trivial Pursuit: Walt Disney Family Edition Card Set it does not have two colors of questions, separated for children and adults.

name: Rock On!
description:
Rock On! The Geology Game of Brains & Sheer Determination

Spark or expand kids' interest in Rocks, Geology and our magnificent Earth via the EXPANDED VERSION of this teacher-recommended, fun, learning game.

Now includes 5 levels of play offering fun, challenge and education for the pre-reader through elementary school age.

This American-Made product includes 60+ polished Rocks & Minerals and a 15-Specimen Rock & Mineral Collection any kid would be proud to own.

Player Cards for up to 6 players along with a Master Rock Guide and 18 Rock Call Cards chocked full of educational & fun facts.

How to play:
Rock Hound Level -
Players take turns drawing a call card from the pile. If the rock on the call card matches a rock on the player cards, place any random one of the 60+ rock marker chips on top of the picture on the player cards.

Winning: The first player to cover all the rocks on their player card wins by saying "Rock On!"

Pink, Green, Purple and Orange Levels -
Choose to play 1 of the 4 pick axe levels on the call cards. Each level is played the same way: The 1st player draws a card from the call card pile. Without revealing the card, they read the name of the rock. Anyone who has that rock on their player card, places a random marker chip on top of the picture on their player card. Also match and place the rock specimen on its picture on the master rock guide. Next, the player who drew the call card asks the player to their left a question from the correct level of play. If they answer correctly, they place a marker chip on one of the "Rocky" the Geologist squares on their player card. If answered incorrectly, continuing clockwise around the table, players take turns trying to correctly answer the question. Of a "Rock my world" card is drawn and the question is answered correctly, 2 "Rocky" squares may be covered on the player card.

Winning: The first player to cover all the squares on their player card wins. Or, After all call cards have been drawn, the winner is the player with the most squares covered on their player card.

name: Schicht im Schacht
description:
The moles are always digging in the soil and building tunnels. The goal of this card game is to lay down cards as neatly and to build as many tunnels as possible. If a player completes a tunnel, he or she is allowed to clear away the cards and leave them as a reward in front of him or her. The one with the most gained cards in the end wins.
Each player gets twelve cards and two cards that are the beginning of the tunnels. Then each player choses one card and discards faced down. The player with the highest number wins and is the first to place his card. It is important to only place cards to rows and columns in the same color (red, yellow, green, blue) and to place cards in the right number series. To gain points, the player has to complete a tunnel of four cards, which lay down in a row, a column or as a stack. The game ends if all cards are discarded. Additionally there are joker cards, which can be replaced for all other colors.

name: Mäuse-Ralley
description:
Small printrun game by a small and already extinct German publisher.

This time it's mouse-racing instead of horse-racing although the goal of the game is pretty much the same.

You can acquire mice and try to make them win the race and/or you can bet on the outcome of the race. During the race every mouse has a base movement of two spaces plus or minus everything it gets from the influence of the players (which can be -1 / +1 / or +2). Also the players can move the cat (which 'runs' in the opposite direction) and try to catch the mice.

Whoever makes the most money out of a certain number of races wins.

name: Spyrol
description:
This is a race game for 2 or 4 players, with some aspects of both Ludo and Snakes and Ladders. As in Ludo, the goal is for each player to get all four of their counters to the Home space, in this case the very center of a long spiral. Counters of different colors may capture each other, while two or more counters of the same color may form a Barrier that cannot be captured or passed.

There are also seven Ladders set on the board to reach across rings of the spiral. A counter which lands at the base of a Ladder will shoot to the other end, capturing any opposing piece in the Ladder's path.

The game may be based on the older and more complex Willy's Walk to see Grandmamma, which features a similar layout.

name: Star Wars: Say What You See
description:
The Star Wars edition of Say What You See is a super version of the classic quick-fire catchphrase guessing game that includes 76 catchphrase cards and asks players to simply say what they see. Show off how well you know the ins and outs of the popular films as you work to sold themed pictogram puzzles related to various characters and items from the franchise.

—description from the publisher

In this game you will be presented with a series of Star Wars themed puzzling pictograms. The first player to correctly solve the pictogram wins the card. The first player to collect 5 cards wins the game and the title of Say What you See: Star Wars champion!

—description from the back of the box

name: Monopoly: Littlest Pet Shop
description: It's Monopoly with the "Littlest Pet Shop" children's toy theme. Same as original Monopoly, with all of the board spaces, cards, tokens, etc. Includes 4 or 6 actual "Littlest Pet Shop" toys, depending on version.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mystify
description:
From the back of the box:

MYSTIFY is the exciting party game that has players racing against each other to solve over 1900 mystery words, names and numbers in five different card categories.

When the timer is turned, the fun begins: players start scribbling away in frantic pursuit of the elusive answer which is literally staring them in the face. A clue tells you if it's a Famous Actor, Popular Musical Figure, Place, Object, Date, etc. Who will be the first to say, "Aha, I've got it?" Anyone can blurt out a guess at any time - but with only one guess allowed, you had better get it right!

Ages 12 and up.

Contents:

1920 Scrambles
884 cards
Gameboard
Playing pieces and die
Notepad
30 second timer
1 page instruction guide.
categories: Deduction, Educational, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Asrus
description:
ASRUS is the first game from the new Korean game publisher Piece Craft Games.

It is a light filler where players play number cards to be the closest to the target number without being the same distance away as any other players. Points are awarded based on the difference between the winning card and the target card.

From the game box:

ASRUS is an acronym for Astro Ludus, which means 'Game of the Stars'. In the vast universe players make own way toward the star. To approach the star as close as possible, each player should predict other's strategy, make own strategy, and show each strategy at the same time. Just fall into the world of ASRUS there is the coexistence of the beauty of stars and the fierce psychological warfare! Simple rules, cute characters, and glass stones twinkling like stars will enhance the enjoyment of hte game. In addtion, the skill of calculation and memory can be developed. Strategy, prediction, and chance will lead you to a victory.

Contents:
77 cards
100 glass stones in 3 colors
1 portable pouch
1 rule booklet in English
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Number, Party Game

name: Traffic Lights
description:
Many variants on the concept of noughts and crosses exist. This version was created by Alan Parr. It is played on a 3x3 or 3x4 board with a supply of red, yellow, and green markers. The object is to get a line of three of the same color.

On each turn, you may do ONE of the following:

(1) Put a red counter in an empty square.
(2) Replace a red counter with a yellow one.
(3) Replace a yellow counter with a green one.

So ultimately the board will fill with green counters.

According to the book "What's your Game" by Michael Cornelius & Alan Parr, the game is a first player win with perfect play.
publishers: Fiendish Board Games, LuduScience, World Game Review

name: Röda Tråden
description: Röda Tråden is a quizgame. The game comes with 80 cards with two subjects on each card. Every subject have 10 clues. One of the players reads a card and knows the answer, tells the other players the subject, and then, one by one, going thru the clues. The players can try to answer on high levels and get a higher score, or wait to answer and get lower score. Every player starts each subject with 10 points, and loses one for each new clue. The winner is the player with most points at the end of the game.

name: Lost in Space
description:
The game consists of a 16x16" full color board and various pieces. In this game of luck, players must travel over the wild and hazardous LOST IN SPACE unknown planet. The spinner tells them in what direction they must move each turn. They may be forced to move off the path or even into the monster pit which will send them back to start...
Winner is the player who lands on his finish circle first.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley, Remoundo

name: Killer Bunnies and the Journey to Jupiter: Violet, Orange and Green Booster Combo Deck
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Journey to Jupiter returns to a solar system near you with the Killer Bunnies and the Journey to Jupiter: Violet, Orange and Green Booster Combo Deck. With "Floating Muffin Tops", powerful Specialty Ships, and 9 additional sectors of space for your bunnies to explore.

Using Specialty bunnies makes forming a Triplet a breeze, while "Reversal Of Orbit" changes planetary motion with ease. The "Ion Cloud" may hold your ships back while the "Temporal Hiccup" will cut you some slack.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Wheeler Dealer
description:
Wheeler-Dealer is a monopoly-style game (but not Monopoly) that was marketed in local areas and personalized for that area with the names of local businesses and retailers. The game includes a locally personalized Wheeler-Dealer Game Board, 6 playing tokens, 30 property title cards, 50 wheeler-dealer cards, 1 pair of d6, a set of instructions, a calculator card, and over 2.5 mil in play money.

The game does not involve building houses, but investing in a commodity futures exchange. This is the key difference from Monopoly. In the exchange, one invests money for a commodity. Dice is used to determine if profits are made or lost. Other aspects (rent, movement, bonuses for all in a color group) are similar to Monopoly.


Wheeler Dealer is notable for its customized editions. Most of the editions (but not all) were editions themed after small US cities and usually sponsored by the local Rotary Club, Business Association, or other local organization.

Although the components changed over time, Wheeler Dealer editions produced at the same time often had exactly the same cards, rules, paper money, player aids, etc. Only the board would vary. So a card might reference space B2, but the player would have to look at the board to determine if space B2 was Bob's Plumbing in Metropolis or Main Street Deli in Townsville.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Michael Glenn Productions, Our Town Trivia, Yakima Jaycees

name: Tornaloco
description:
Tornaloco is a totally CRAZY game!

Place all your cards down as fast as you can - but make sure the order and direction are correct!

name: Galactix
description: Game includes: a board representing a star system, 70+ standup pieces representing 4 races, a sheet of gold stickers to attach to the game pieces, and a small fold-up rules pamphlet. Plays like Stratego in space. Units have hi-tech names like "Sabotage Units", "Germ Capsule", "Space Armada", etc.

name: Bent Outta Shape
description: Players spin and move around the board trying not to get bent out of shape. Includes a body bender marker to make this easier. Ages 6 and up

name: Seebär und Landratte
description:
From the manual:

You can see Wild Will’s house on the board. Setting off from the pier, Will and Frank head for the island in search of the sea monster’s treasure. Spinning the pointer will show you how far you may sail during your turn. On the voyage, you collect things that Will and Frank need for their adventure. They need binoculars to see the island a club for fighting off the sea monster, and the treasure map. Once you have collected all the necessary items and land on the island, you may search for the treasure. Watch out for the sea monster, especially for his long tentacles. If he tries to grab you then you have to go all the way back to the starting point.

name: Nickelodeon Double Dare
description: Double Dare is a game show game for kids. Answer questions in a series of rounds. If you do not know the answer you can dare the other team. If they do not know the answer then that team in turn can double dare and if once again the answer is not obtained then they can take a physical challenge, which consist of different stunts or obstacle courses. The game ends with an elaborate obstacle course in which both teams compete for the best time.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: UNO: Hanna-Barbera
description:
Another Uno Variation. The Hanna-Barbera Edition. This edition includes classic Hanna-Barbera cartoon characters, including Huckleberry Hound, Wally Gator, Atom Ant, Quick Draw McGraw, Top Cat, Hong Kong Phooey, Pixey and Dixie, Magilla Gorilla, Yogi Bear and even Boo Boo!

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Yogi Bear "Pic-a-nic" card --
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: TransSolar
description: Players control their spaceships and travel in the Solar System. They accomplish tasks and earn cash. TransSolar contains an unconventional moving system.
categories: Economic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Transportation
mechanics: Contracts, Player Elimination, Race, Resource to Move, Roll / Spin and Move, Sudden Death Ending

name: Black & White
description:
Move and jump to make a 5 in-a-row or capture all the opponents pieces in this 2-player abstract game.

Equipment:


a 5x5 board
10 reversible pieces (like in Reversi/Othello)


Each player starts with 5 pieces - one plays white the other black. The game begins with each player dropping one piece per turn on an empty cell. After that, on each turn, each player must do one of the following two actions:

Use a friendly stone to jump (orthogonally or diagonally) over an enemy piece landing on the immediate empty cell and flipping the color of the jumped piece (black turns white, and vice versa). Jumps may be multiple - i.e. a series of jumps over one enemy piece each.
Move a friendly stone to an (orthogonal or diagonal) adjacent empty cell.


The player that either makes an (orthogonal or diagonal) 5 in-a-row or captures all the opponents pieces wins.

In the online version captures (potentially multiple) are forced, and the win is by 5 in-a-row or by forcing the opponent into a stalemate. The forced moves and stalemate is not mentioned in the original rather brief rules, while the win by complete capture is not mentioned in the online version.

name: Balaton Rt.
description:
In this game with a somewhat Monopoly-like board, the properties are villages around the Lake Balaton. The rules include instructions for eight different games (some quite different from Monopoly) to be played with subsets of the components.

Lake Balaton is a freshwater lake in the Transdanubian region of Hungary.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scorpio
description: A Trivia game: People answering trivia and move forward toward the goal. The main difference between this and a standard quiz game is that there is a timer and the players have a combined total time to answer all questions

name: Conquest
description: Use your armies wisely and conquer the world!. A dice rolling combat based wargame, in which you place your armies in different places of the world map and fight the other players over total domination. In essence, a risk clone.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Acts of Insanity
description:
The crazy party game for crazy people, Acts Of Insanity is charades on over-drive where the subjects are unimaginably wild and the opposing team holds your destiny in their hands! Drawing 5 Character, Action, Location or Object cards at random then selecting just one, you have just 2 minutes to act it out for your team.

—description from the publisher

name: Entre Juegos
description:
Entrejuegos is a game made to promote a board game store in Santiago.

It's a 2 player game, in the vein of Blink were you try to play all your cards as fast as you can. However, there are two main differences:

Speed is important, but most important is observation, because if, at any time a player plays a card that make an "Entrejuegos" you can call it and stop the game. An "Entrejuegos" (translation: "between-games") is a set of three cards, the first one of a type, the second of a different type, and the third must be the same as the first. So, for example, the last three cards are a Wargame, a Party Game and again a Wargame, you can call it.
The second difference is that the game has some scoring: 4 points for being the first one to throw all your cards, and 1 point for each Entrejuegos set.


—description from the designer

name: Demigods
description:
Each round in Demigods, each player trains a hero by taking a demigod card and artifact card at random from the center of the table and pairing them together. The demigod cards feature a strength value and possibly symbols, while the artifact cards (possibly) modify the value of the paired demigod card in some way, with the maximum value for any combination being 30.

A starting pot of 1 Aischune (meaning "dishonor") is created, then in turn players take one of three actions:


Adding more Aischune to the pot up to a maximum of 10.
Knocking on the table to stay in without raising.
Discarding their cards to fold the hand, with the first folder gaining 3 Aischune and each other folder gaining 2 Aischune.


Once the maximum pot has been reached or all players have passed, players reveal their totals, with the weakest player "winning" the pot. In ties, the pot is split between those with the lowest score.

Continue playing rounds until someone has collected at least 30 Aischune at which time the game ends and whoever has the fewest Aischune wins. In the event of a tie, keep playing rounds until one player has the lowest score.

name: Make 10 and 20
description: Invented by a Korean dad who wanted to help his kids learn how to master and conquer math. Throughout the game, you simply add up 3 tiles to make a sum of "10," 3 and 4 tiles to make a sum of "20." Each color is played separately and the black tiles are joker tiles. The goal of the game is to get rid of your tiles first!

name: Puerto Rico 1897: Special Edition
description:
One of the best classic board games is coming back in a unique Special Edition. Awaken Realms and Ravensburger are teaming up again to craft an exquisite experience that will elevate Puerto Rico to the highest standards!

Puerto Rico is one of the most iconic strategy games in the world. In this 2-5 player classic, you take different roles, including industrious builder, clever trader, stalwart captain, opportunistic prospector, and more. Bolster your wealth and reputation by carefully building your city, harvesting goods, and strategically governing the island of Puerto Rico. The player with the most prosperous island wins! A genre-defining strategy game and winner of multiple international awards is coming back with an extremely polished, high-end special edition resulting from a collaboration between Ravensburger and Awaken Realms.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Follow, Hidden Victory Points, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Phase Order

name: Streng Geheim
description:
A new secret formula has been discovered! Only those in possession of this formula can properly prepare the super-secret Truth Serum which, while tasting like (gerstensaft),
persuades people to talk freely and reveal their secrets more effectively than any interrogation.

It isn’t exactly shocking that all of the Secret Agencies are all interested in this formula. Discreet offers have already been made at each one by parties purporting to peddle the real deal, but whether any of them are actually genuine is still to be determined.

As a Top Agent in your country’s Secret Service, your Chief has given you the assignment of obtaining the real formula and bringing it home – a difficult task, since
various Agents from rival countries are trying to accomplish the same thing. The identities and cover names of these rival agents are, by the way, also of interest to the Chief. To succeed in your mission, you’ll have to pull out all the stops: Search hotels for secret information, obtain entry into Embassies and Research Laboratories, install bugs and use informants.
mechanics: Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Turmoil
description:
Selection #7 of The Games Collection by Pin International.

Goal is to earn a set of tokens by successively controlling discs of each three colors.

At the beginning each player's pegs fill the discs in two opposite corners. Players take turns moving their pegs, trying to move three of them onto a new disc of their choice to control it and thereby earn a corresponding token. A peg can move along any line printed on the board, or to an adjacent hole in a disc, or by the rotation of a disc by a quarter turn.

After moving a peg, the player sets, or resets 2 obstacles for the next player: One of his pegs locks a disc to prevent its turning, and a special marker blocks a line of movement.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Lucca
description:
The 4th "Bonsai Game" from daVinci, a line of games on a single card, playable only with "common" things, like coins, keys, etc.

It's a tour around the city of Lucca using many vehicles with the goal of visiting "Expositions", by collecting the corresponding markers.
The selection of the vehicle is simultaneous, and every vehicle has a different move and a different game order.

This game has been released and freely distributed during the 2004 edition of the "Lucca Comics & Games" event.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Transportation, Travel

name: Golf Board Challenge
description: A board game based on golf. Choose your iron, aim for the flag, hit the ball, put down a marker and so on. But be careful you might hit the woods the bunker and so on. You can play any type of game you would like from regular to foursome and skins game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Golf In A Box Ltd., NoDiceBoardGames Ltd.

name: Dragon and Bandits
description:
Dragon and Bandits is a fantasy-themed game in which the players are bandits who sneak around a sleeping dragon, trying to acquire treasure.

Cards accumulated can either be treasure, movement, or dragon movement cards. The treasure cards are saved until the end of the game and added up for points. The movement cards allow the character to move, but at the cost of making noise. As more noise is made, counters are removed from the dragon; if all the counters are removed, the dragon awakes, and every player in the dragon's line of sight must discard all treasure. Players can affect the dragon's line of sight by playing dragon movement cards.

The game ends when the deck of sixty cards is empty, and whoever has the most accumulated treasure wins.

name: Desktop Curling
description:
Challenge your friends and family to a game of patience and skill with this portable, miniature version of curling. This kit includes:
12" extendable curling lane, with two platform inserts.
8 curling stones (4 red and 4 blue)
2 mini brooms
32-page illustrated mini book with the rules and history to this unique winter sport

name: Raubbau
description:
Raubbau (German for overexploitation) is thematically a dungeon crawler, mechanically it is a deduction and bluffing game, which provides significantly more depth than Skull or Liar's Dice / Perudo. Special attention was paid to easy rules and intensive player interaction.

In Raubbau, each player only knows the treasures in his part of the ever-growing mine. If the treasures do not seem sufficiently precious, one can try to get an unknown treasure of another player by skillful deduction. The other players have the chance to react - but they are not forced to. If the other players react, one has to tax their reaction: Are they trying to trick you into awakening the dragon or is there a treasure hidden underneath their tile? A suspenseful atmosphere evolves while players try to trick each other.

Everybody wants to leave the mine, but nobody dares to, because another player might have more treasures. The player who assesses the other players and the situation in the mine best, will win the game.

—description from the designer

name: Kommissar X
description: The Police Commissioner is on the hunt for escaped criminals. Players build a deck of cards showing the escape route taken by the criminals. The cards are double sided, and when the deck is completed, it's turned over and players must predict the next move in the escape. Get it wrong and move your hunch marker down. Find a suitcase left by the criminals, and gain a commendation. First to get 4 medals wins.

name: The Storybook Game
description:
The Storybook Game includes 54 cards with a word on them. Players take turns drawing cards and telling a story with the cards, but with a slight twist -- the first player begins the story with the first card drawn, and then places the card face-down on the top of the deck. He then passes the deck to the next player, who must re-tell that portion of the story from memory, showing the card as he does so. He then draws the next card, and adds to the story using the word on that card. He places these two cards face-down on the top of the deck and passes the deck to the next player. This procedure continues from player to player, so that the further along the game goes, the more difficult it is to remember the order of the story.

Players who cannot remember the order of the cards -- and the story -- are out of the game, and the last player left in the game is the winner.

name: Calamityville
description:
The game is set under the gold rush boom and bust. Players build up the town during the boom and the town goes broke under the bust.
Much of the action is centered on the donkey in the middle of the board. When a player draws a "Donkey Goes Wild!" card, it bucks its legs to knock down players' buildings. The player with the most assets when the "Gold Runs Out" card is drawn wins.

Game includes 4 characters, 13 buildings, 1 bucking donkey, property deeds, newspaper cards, money, gold nuggets, 2 dice, game board and instructions.
categories: American West, City Building, Economic, Humor

name: Trivial Pursuit Mini Pack: Flicks
description: This Mini or Pocket Pack was made for use with the Trivial Pursuit Pocket Player Set Game but also featured color coded questions for use with the regular Trivial Pursuit games. This set contains 120 questions about films and cinema.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
publishers: Horn Abbot Ltd., Parker Brothers, Selchow & Righter

name: Monopoly: Dale Earnhardt
description: Monopoly honors its first individual with a tribute to The Intimidator. In this edition, Earnhardt's storied racecars are up for sale. As you roar around the game board, collect #30 Malibu '76, #3 Monte Carlo '95, #3 Japan Race '98 and more. Includes 8 custom Earnhardt-themed pewter tokens, custom dice, and autographed game board.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Napoleon in Spain
description:
A brigade-division level simulation of Napoleon's 1808-09 campaigns in Spain and Portugal featuring extensive rules covering movement, combat, supply, attrition, limited intelligence, scouting, guerrilas, and morale during the Napoleonic era.

One turn = one week
One hex = 16 miles
One Strength point = 1000 infantry, 500 cavalry or one artillery battery

Scenarios included cover various portions of Napoleon's 1808 campaing or his entire June, 1808 to January 1809 involvement in this war.

Game contents : 17"*22" color map of Spain/Portugal
400 counters
Rules
4 Army organization sheets
Charts & Tables

name: Farb-Karussell
description: The game consists of four circular boards, one for each player, each with ten colorful items pictured in the center and 10 positions for discs around the edge. Each position, and each of the 40 items are made up of only two of five colors. Each of the 40 items is also represented on one of 40 discs. There is an additional disk with a picture of a crown and a pair of colored dice. Players roll and get an item and match it to a position on their board.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wine Wars
description: Wine Wars -- This fun and fascinating trivia game tests your knowledge of the fruit of the vine. Let the battle begin as players answer questions in categories such as Vine to Vino (growing grapes, making wine, and world production), Wine Cellar (selecting, storing, and tasting wine), and Cork Culture (wine people, business, arts and science, and trivia). Perfect for those new to the world of wine, but challenging enough for the devoted oenophile, Wine Wars will have you swirling, sniffing, and sipping your way to vinicultural victory.

name: Advertentiespel
description:
This is a very simple game where you make fun with strange advertisements. The game consists of 3 decks of cards, one for each line of a 3 line advertisement. The current player picks up one card from each of the decks and reads them out loud. Because the lines usually do not make any sense together, this will hopefully make everyone laugh. And now the next player can draw and read. So there is no competition in this game, making it hardly a game at all.

Here are some examples of advertisements (drawing them as I write):

Tomorrow big sale: very good flycatcher, with use of bathroom.
Gentlemen searches: A nurse, extremely sticky.
Who helps me with: A tasty sausage, in a nickel cage.


This game has been quite popular in the fifties in the Netherlands.
publishers: (Unknown), Jos. Scholz, Jumbo, Klee, Papita, Sio, Spear's Games

name: Charades for Dummies Game
description: Have you ever played charades and been the unlucky one to have to act out the 10-word title of a book you've never even heard of? Or spent way too much time looking at a movie title over and over again knowing you'll never get anyone to guess it? Well, that was then but now it's time to play charades the dummies way.

name: The Wedding Planner Game
description:
The Game of Life reworked into a party game for brides-to-be.

Players select and buy various wedding items (rings, cake, honeymoon package), while recording happiness points resulting from events leading up to the big day.

name: Crazy Dice Math
description:
A learning Math game from CB Publishing.

Includes:
2 Glow in the Dark 6 sided dice
1 Glow in the Dark 12 sided dice (special sides)
1 Instruction Book.

The book contains 10 games for 2 or more players. Each game is a simple dice game to help with math skills.

Ages 7 and up.

name: Word for Word
description:
The game consists of a deck of 54 cards, each with a single letter and point value on it, as well as several 'Free' cards that can be used as any letter. The entire deck is dealt out to all players face down. Players may not look at their deck, but on their turn, flip over the top card and add it to the center of the table. If they can make a word from the cards in the middle, they take it and score the points on those letters. Play continues until all cards are used, and the player with the highest score wins.

—user summary

name: Cars 2: World Grand Prix Board Game
description:
Dice rolling game where the goal is to move around a racing track for three laps. Each player's gearbox tells how many dice to roll.

There are oil slicks on the track and the cars can bump into each other, which make them lose wheels and speed. When a player has no wheels left, it must pit-stop.

This game should not be confused with the similarly titled Cars 2 World Grand Prix Board Game by Crown & Andrews Ltd.

name: Passtimes
description:
Passtimes: The Game of History challenges players to answer questions about events in our past. The game is played among groups or individuals, who are given pairs of tokens to move on the board.

When a player takes his or her turn, a card is drawn for them. The player must answer a set of questions printed on that card. If they answer a question correctly, they roll a die and move one of their tokens by the die's result. An incorrect answer ends his or her turn and starts the next player's. If a Time Warp card was drawn, the player switches one of his or her token with the token closes to the ending square.

The first player to move both of his or her tokens to the ending square wins and ends the game.

name: Army Group North 1944
description:
Covers the Soviet offensive in the Baltic and their drive towards Riga.

Contains 300 counters, 2 maps and 2 scenarios (Strike for Riga and Operation Doppelkopf). Regiment & division scale, 6 mile hexes and 2days/turn. Uses an innovative movement system where proximity to an HQ determines how far subordinate units can move.

name: Montecitopoli
description:
Parody of Italian politics in the '80s.
Each player leads a party: one is the only honest party (never gets money, but can denounce the politics of the other players; he wins if at least 12 are arrested), one is a party that doesn't care any more about shame, corruption, etc. (he wins if no other player wins within 12 turns) and each other party is "normal" (can do favors, get money from illicit sources, etc. but gains point on the "shame-meter": higher the shame and more likely is that the voters will vote for another player during the next elections; besides if the shame becomes too high the player is eliminated. They win gaining enough votes OR enough money).
During each turn the players draw 2 cards each (cards can give money, give votes, move a party on the "shame-meter": scandals give points, distractions, e.g. the Soccer World Cup is held in Italy, reduce the shame, etc.), then players vote to elect the President, receive money, face scandals, etc.
During all the game negotiations can be done and they're never binding (sometimes you can be VERY mean, if you want to).
Actions are resolved by either voting (each player has an importance based on the number of electors he represents, of course) or with dice rolling.

name: Quatro gammon
description:
"The Revolutionary Circular Backgammon"

This is a backgammon variant played on a circular board for 2-4 players with each quarter-circle containing nine points.

Different initial setups are provided for of 2, 3 and 4 players. Longer and shorter games can be played by varying setups.

CONTENTS

High quality long-lasting games board
Doubling cube
Sixty counters (fifteen each of black, blue, red and yellow)
Eight dice (two each of black, blue, red and yellow)
Easy to follow rule book

name: Monopoly: Roppongi Hills
description:
Roppongi Hills is a huge residential/business area in Tokyo that was opened in 2003. It includes a television station, galleries and museums, and very tall office towers. Instead of houses there are kiosks, and hotels are bigger retail shops ... and if you build enough shops, you get to build a Mori Tower.

(Mori was the businessman who spent billions buying up the land over a couple of decades - including the Australian Embassy, which was in a historic building which had an even more historic and beautiful garden.)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
